comment: Lectures are not mandatory and kind of boring. However, he'll occasionally drop the most jaw-dropping and practical advice or insight into the film and media industry. There's an online textbook that is the most important thing. Read the textbook and watch the video playlist. Tests have a massive curve, a natural 70% usually became around a 95%

He is a very odd guy and mildly inappropriate. He knows a lot about what he is talking about, but his lectures make no sense and are hard to follow. I have failed every test even after studying. It's too much information to know. Most of my friends dropped this class. He curves every test sense most of the class fails which is nice.

Korpi is very well-educated but his teaching style was very hard to adjust to and successfully learn from. He skips through lectures (with lots of information that is ALL VIABLE to be on exams) very quickly and doesn't elaborate on some of the more confusing topics. Hundreds of questions in the textbook but no other assignments, just LONG exams.

His lectures are very monotonous, so if you are not a morning person, you might struggle with staying up in his early lectures. He does switch it up once in a while though and plays videos and movies. Grading criteria is clear. Mostly Packbacks, attendance, midterm and final. Exams are hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Korpi is brilliant. I'm not a mass com major and so the lectures were not my favorite. You can tell he knows a ton about what he's talking about, but its just not super interesting to me. As a teacher though I think he does a good job of being engaging as much as he can be with a class of 300+. Also the tests are super chill because of the curve.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Test is 146 questions in 90 minutes. In the textbook there are question you have to answer. A total of 896 for the first 8 chapters.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: You can tell Korpi is smart because he explains things in ways that are hard to understand bc he uses terms that we've never learned. His lectures are kind of pointless because he just shows videos and examples of concepts without explaining them. I paid a lot for this class to LEARN something. I bet he's a great person, just not my fave teacher.

Korpi is awesome! His tests aren't really based on his lectures in class, so you really do have to read the book. But taking him is worth it because he is hilarious and his class is super easy. If you do the online homework and go over each chapter before the test you should get an A.

Class is insanely easy, regardless of whether you're a film major or not. Lots of online quizzes but you can re-take them as many times as you want & all the answers are on Quizlet, the very few papers, projects & tests are super simple. He's slow with putting in make-up grades though. Class itself mainly consists of watching videos. Should take.
I loved being in his class. He is legitimately one of the coolest people I've ever met. You get what you take out of this class. If you don't respect him he wont respect you. He's pretty brilliant.

Dr. Korpi is a great teacher! He seems intense at first but you'll realize he knows a lot about what he teaches and his tests are straight out of the book.  You watch a lot of video clips in class and he gives a ton of extra credit opportunities.
Awesome teacher! Sight sound motion is a must take for film majors. Also, his tests are all on the book but not too hard and he offers tons of extra cred(:

Korpi's class is absolutely awesome! Granted, what he lectures is not usually on his tests, but all you have to do is  read the book and your set. You don't miss info for the test if you skip his class, but you should go just because he is so interesting and funny! Everyday before class he plays music, and he gives TONS of EC opportunities!!!

If you can get another teacher for this course don't think about it just get another teacher. Korpi teaches you NOTHING that are on his tests, and from what i've heard about the other mass comm. class korpi's tests are harder. Also extra credit is only 60 points of 1000 which doesnt do much, if his TA ever gets around to adding it to your grade.

Didn't like his class to much. If I go to class, I want to LEARN something. Nothing in his classes pertained to his tests. Instead, study the class book and take all the extra credit; that should get you an A.
Awesome professor, but the tests are hella hard. Teach yourself the material!

This guy is the bomb! He's really interesting and extremely funny. Make sure you study from the book religiously for his exams. Korpi is really a teenager at heart and his classes are really good. Do all of the extra credit films and you'll get an A.

Intro communications in a large room. I took this in the fall of 2001 and now have two thoughts from this time. One of the most memorable life experiences watching the second tower fall on 9/11 on the big screen. First saw the utility of pointless distractions within lectures. I teach now and have diversions similar to random commercials.

The class can be kind of boring but he is generally an interesting and funny teacher. He spends a lot of time playing Youtube videos and clips out of movies, none of which pertain to the tests. Half of the test will be easy, the other will be kind of hard. I never spent any time studying for them. He gives you chances for extra credit which is good
Professor Korpi's class is my favorite. All week I look forward to going to this class and I'm always sad when its over. I want to take every class he offers.

Dr. Korpi was the first professor I ever had at Baylor and I hope my future professors will be as awesome as him.  He's lectures are usually interesting because he really knows he's stuff.  Test are hard but if you read the chapters before class and the summaries before the test you'll do fine.  Give extra credit for watching movie too. Great guy!!

Definitely the coolest class I've ever taken.  The material is stuff you've known all your life, and Korpi teaches in way that is fun and interesting; sometimes he'll show us movies or let us play video games to help with the lectures.  You do have to read everything to do well on the test, but for the most part the text book is interesting.

this class is very entertaining and you can really relate to the material because it's up to date. i recommend doing all of the 15 pt. essays and the tests are 90% material from the book so i wouldn't waste a whole lot of time studying the powerpoints. but this class is really fun!

this man is extremely awesome, and i really love his class.  He definately knows his material, and i believe that everyone should take his class, even if you have no interest in becoming a communicationist, you will still enjoy it.
No Comments
No Comments
very interesting and fun
VERY interesting class...amazingly interesting guy! He'll really help you get into it!

His class is great! The tests are difficult at times but the class is very informative so you learn a lot.  I wish he taught other classes I could take other than mass comm.  I would suggest to anyone who likes the media and wants to know how it works and why it works the way it does!
He is an awesome professor and his class is worth taking. If you read the tests will be easy and actually doing the writing assignments will help your grade.

Great Class, amazing guy!  It was my favorite class and I wish I had to take it again.  He is clear, extremely informed (still neck deep in the industry).  Many of his students are icons in media. If you want to learn and make it, he will make it possible
Incredibly boring. How many times did I have to hear that he loved auto racing and watch films he'd made about auto racing? Very dull.
this guy is arrogant. the tests are confusing, but if you guess, chances are youll make a B
There is nothing bad to say about this man, professionally and personally.

Dr. Korpi is a brilliant fellow.  His lectures are so concise, coherent, and purposeful that his class is my favorite (even though I'm not a media major).  It's a mind-broadening class.  Also, he respects our intelligence.

If nothing else, Dr. Korpi made my entire semester at Baylor worthwhile. He makes classes interesting, using video, etc. He even takes one class just to talk about sex, and he's really funny. Tests aren't too bad - huge curve. TAKE THIS CLASS!!

Yes, class was fun; however, the tests were ridiculous! Class time was spent watching video clips and then we were tested over stuff never covered in class. For being a class for non majors, I found it very hard even after studying for hours.
The class was interesting, the chapters covered alot of new material that was never really specified in class, and was hard to understand if you've never done anything with films before.

He was a fun prof. I really enjoyed the class, but i expected it to be easier. You have to read to do well on the tests. And DONT FORGET to do the writing assignments. They are worth MAJOR points and so easy but its easy to forget all about them.
Cool guy. The class is fun. The tests are easy if you read. If not...well it won't be good.

Very easy class! His tests are kinda hard but he curves them a lot! Essays are a BIG part of your grade and they are SO easy, just make sure you turn them in on time! You also get points just for going to class! He is a great professor and is halarious!!

Tests were pretty hard but had a good curve.  A very interesting lecture about Freudian cinematography (not from the textbook) at one point during the course.  Overall a very fun professor (though some lectures due to the material can be somewhat boring).

Dr. Korpi was by far my favorite teacher of my first semester at Baylor University.  There was almost never a dull moment in his classes.  Even though this class was not in my major, it made me consider changing.

The homework assignments are really unfair.  The grading is completely subjective as the homework is not founded on any facts presented in class or in the books, thus making it rather difficult to know exactly how to get full credit.
He is very good and i loved the class. it has been my most favorite class i have taken here at baylor.
the best prof at baylor hand's down...i wish i could take this class again, and again, and again...

It's pretty obvious that Dr. Korpi loves what he teaches.  He's very enthusiastic and interesting.  Classes seem to drag near the end (but all Tuesday/Thursday classes do).  Beneficial but not required to attend classes.  Writing assignments are helpful.

I enjoyed the class for the most part.  Some of the lectures could not help but to be boring, but I learned a lot.  It was a good thing that he curved on tests, because even though I am an A student, I would have made low B's and high C's on his tests. Th

Very kool professor. The class is super easy if you just do a bit of the reading. Make sure to know when the assignments are to be due and you will be ok. Very hard to fail this class, he curves a big one on the tests. Great class to take. Korpi rules~!

A good and helpful teacher that is interested in getting the students interested in the material.  He is very well experienced in his area and has some interesting stories if you stay awake to hear them.  Highly suggested.
It would help if Dr. Korpi reminded people when writing assignments were due. Other than that the class is absolutely awesome.
Good teacher that makes the class interesting. If you read, you'll understand everything in the class, and Dr. Korpi only augments the learning.
Funny guy.  Videos to watch, simple stuff to turn in, and the curves on tests really make it worthwile.  You've got nothing to lose.

Very good teacher. His style of presenting the material is very effective. He intrigues us students to want to know how things work in the real world, and then explains just that. He is also very knowledgable person in his field of study.

Dr.Korpi is not only up to date and on the cutting edge of the subjects he teaches, he is actually deeply involved in the industry.  I wish I could take this class again.  It truly is the best class at BU.

Reading is a must in order to pass the tests, but Dr. Korpi's lectures really helped me.  The tests required a lot of concentration and effort.  My only problem Was that the lecture on advertising that I Was really interested in got cut at the very end.

Dr. Korpi's class was very interesting and fun!  He definitely knows what he is talking about and seems to be a great way to network into the communications world.  The tests are alright if you put time and effort into studying.
Class was FUN; however, not very helpful for tests.  The tests could have been alot easier.  Other than that it was very interesting and I learned a lot!
He loves his job and he does make the content interesting. The tests are more on the text,which can be kind of hard but with some studying and the nice curve(!), grades can be acceptable.
Have the test based more on the lecture notes.  On our online assignments tell us why you marked points off

The class was interesting, he shows lots of movies, but sometimes when the lights dimmed I dozed off!  The tests are extremely difficult - but if you study hard, you'll make a decent grade with the nice curve you get.  Great teacher with lots of intellet!
HE loves what he does.  His test can be kind of hard.  But, I think he's a wonderful teacher.  He loves people.

I liked his class, but his tests we really difficult and some of the extra credit was really hard (comic book assingment). All in all I would suggest him as a wealth of knowledge! He is also very interesting.

Dr. Korpi is great! He is very knowledgeable, interesting, and just an overall awesome professor! He is helpful and fair, but challenging at the same time! His class is very informative and a blast to sit through! I highly recommend Dr. Korpi!

He is a great professor who is very honest and down to earth. He cares that students learn the material and makes practical applications to everyday life in his lessons. Tests are tough, but if you do the reading you can easily pass.
Spend a little time studying for exams and will do fine in class.  Does not have Mickey Mouse-type quizzes each hour to see if you're reading like many professors at Baylor.

Fun class and the alumni checks are great, very helpful. Second test was really difficult and I am unsure what to study for the final. It is a good thing the final is not everything. Maybe add some more recent music videos instead of all 70's and 80's.
SO COOL, MY FAVORITE TEACHER AT BU YET
Korpi is a badass.

The writing assignments seem to be futile and a time waste for me.  I would prefer someone who taught and made the test from the lectures instead of mainly from the book.  The tests were too hard, even studying for hours I was lucky to get a b.

The class was very interesting, although the tests were very difficult. However, he curves the tests very fairly. As long as you read and pay attention in class and do the extra credit, you should get the grade you want. I enjoyed the class very much!

The tests seemed fairly easy if you read all the material.  The Zettl book drags on, and the principles in it were not always covered in class.  The Honors project was fun and pretty easy.  Lecutres were entertaining, and the music videos were great!
He was a good teacher who kept class interesting and understood that we have other classes to worry about, and that we are not just taking his class.
I enjoyed all the media examples he used and the outside speakers/alumni.  The lectures did not prepare you for any of the tests, that was all on your own time.   gave Attendance points.

I thought Dr. Korpi's class was very interesting. He uses countless media examples and has a great sense of humor. I would have liked to explore some aspects of the media more thouroughly. Overall, it was my favorite class this semester.
Dr. Korpi is an excellent teacher who brings the art of Mass Communications to life.  Yes, his tests are difficult, but they can be mastered if one is willing to put in the extra study time.
The class is somewhat difficult. I found it kind of boring and did other homework a lot. The tests are not over anything he teaches

The time spent in class made it seem easy, but when test time came, a lot of outside preparation was needed. The good thing was that I never had to prepare for class unless it was a test day, so I never felt stressed out about this class. Overall good.

The class was interesting and I learned a lot.  My advisor suggested I take this class, because it would be easy, but it was far from easy.  The test are very hard.  Also, he was not very helpful when I had problems with one of the writing assignments.

Korpi is a great professor. He makes the lectures interesting and was actually able to keep my attention focused on the topics of discussion. I don't recall a single time where I was thinking about another class while he was teaching.

Very fun class and i enjoyed taking it very much. A study sheet would have been helpful to better be prepared for the tests, but you can still get the grade you want if you study and you shoulndt have to study that much if you read and listen in class.

Interesting class...but the tests are harder than people say they are. He used to give handouts for the tests, and I really wish he had this semester. The material is so much and a study guide would have helped. Very fun class! Everyone should take it.

Take Korpi! It's easy but you learn a lot. He knows what he is talking about and does a good job teaching it. He is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He doesn't care if you come. He just takes off a few points which really doesn't hurt you.
Tests are over the book, which he doesn't lecture about.  That would be nice but he takes off points when you skip class.

This class confirmed my decision to become a Telecom. Major.  Dr. Korpi is a great professor.  His lectures are very applicable to the real world and the media.  It is interesting and teaches you a lot.  I enjoyed hearing about all of the Baylor Alumni.

The class is interesting, but a little over my head in areas. It's very well directed at those who aspire to be in the communications field. The speakers and movie (visuals) were interesting and effective ways to explain the text.

He knows what he is talking about, that's for sure. He uses a ton of examples, which makes for a not so boring class. I would recommend taking the course, but it isn't all that easy. The tests are hard, but you can get at least a C  on them.
the course is presented in a fun and interesting way, that allows for easy comprenhension of the material.

Dr. Korpi's class is great.  you learn a lot of usefull stuff if you plan on going into anything with communications or tv or film, and if youre just taking the class for fun, its great.  you get to watch a lot of videos and other stuff, the tests alright
Intro to mass comm with korpi is a great class-half the class time is spent watching film clips or music videos-the work is all easy completion essays-and the tests are multiple choice.
This was a very interesting and fun class.  I actually looked forward to coming to class. Korpi is a good teacher and has a lot to share with the students.

This class has been my favorite at Baylor so far. He is the man who is inspiring me to look into Telecom. He is just passionate about all things media savy & I loved it! Who wouldn't take this class, is a more appropriate question than Why take it.

He is a great teacher who loves what he does, i mean we watch movies and music videos in class, our homework, other than the weekly papers, we have to watch tv, i mean hard stuff! i really enjoyed class, and if you do get bored, Sleep, really comfy seats!
He is a very good teacher and I really enjoyed the course.  However,  I dont feel like the tests were fair enough.  THey could be a little easier.

Korpi's class can be very easy if you keep up with the reading, otherwise, you will have a good 200 pages of text to read the night before the test.  His lectures are interesting and he always tries to make class fun.  Good job Korpi.
Great class to lean a lot and not do a ton of busy work. Class is interesting and doesn't lecture too long without breaking it up with some example.
The Best Social Revolutionary I've ever had the pleasure of learning from. Keep up the good work Dr. Korpi.

I enjoyed the class, but i'm a journalism dork so maybe that explains it.  Anyways, I actually liked the reading and doing the commercial analysis and the essays.  Some of the essays were so brainless that they were a waste of time, but easy pts!!

Dr. Krpi was very helpful as far as being a professor goes. The information learned, especially in the TV and radio lessons, is very interesting, an you would be surprised at the amount of detailed lighting and vector useage brings. I give Korpi an A+!
the Freud lecture rules; interesting, lots of videos; tests are hard, but lots of extra credit chances
Some classes you are really interested, but most sleep just seems like a good idea.  Keep up with the reading or you'll pay for it the night before the test!
Class was a bore, the seats were real comfy for sleep:)  Study for the exams, lecture and book.

Lots of info on the test.  Don't wait till the night b4 to start studying.  Read the text ALOT, and don't forget to do your hw it will help your grade in the end.  Go to class though, he has some really interesting things to say.
He didn't take attendance. It looked like he did, but he didn't. So i stopped showing up after the second test, and got an A
No Comments
do nothing in class, tests are hard
Do nothing in class -- but have to study for tests
Lots of information you need to know for the tests
Dr. Talbert is an inspiration. He is definitely the best professor I have ever had.

Dr. Talbert is absolutley brilliant.  He is incredibly intelligent in all aspects of life, and he is a master in his content. Dr. Talbert cares deeply for his students and would do anything to help them. He will definitely challenge you and make you think, but it is so worth it. If you aspire to be an amazing educator, make sure that you take him.

Dr. Talbert is a content expert in his field. He is extremely knowledgeable and always willing to go the extra mile in helping his students. He makes class engaging and pushes students to continually improve. I felt that my knowledge in the area of qualitative research improved greatly over the course of the semester. He is also very humorous.
Oustanding professor.  I learned a lot in this class.  Look forward to taking another class with Dr. Talbert. Always has time for students!
funny and patient. really makes you think. challenges without being judgmental or rude.
Great professor in an engaging class.  So glad I took it!
Amazing professor! There is absolutely no downside to this class or his teaching methods.
I loved this class! I learned so much about the world and myself.

I had Dr. Talbert for Social Issues in Education and he was absolutely amazing! I'll put it like this, I usually don't rate professors, but because he was soo awesome, I don't mind taking out the extra time! Incredible guy! I wouldn't mind taking his class over and over again! He's absolutely interested in the subject and you as a student! Awesome!
Dr. Talbert is an amazing professor! He made our class so much fun. We didn't have a class alot which was sometimes sad, that's how much I enjoyed his class. DEFINITELY get him if you can.
This professor really made the topics discussed in class fun and interesting!
Loved the class annnnnd Dr. Talbert made it interesting/simple/fun!

Dr.T is fantastic! I have never seen a professor who cares so much for his students and for the subject matter he teaches. He is always avaliable whenever you need him and he is a wonderful resource. If you have an opportunity to take Dr.Talbert, do it! Great professor, guy and friend (:
TAKE HIM!! Dr. Talbert is the best professor I have ever haad.  This class stimulated my thinking so much and the discussion was excellent.  You will not regret it!

Dr. Talbert is very positive and encouraging. Class time flies with great discussion and interaction. His passion for the topic is evident. He is thoroughly prepared with so many resources that we can't possibly get to them all. My only wish is that he would give more constructive feedback. He makes you feel good about yourself! Possibly too good!
Definitely my kind of professor.  Has an easy-going personality that few other professors have.  Made my introduction into qualitative research a delight.
Made class interesting, extremely helpful in times of need!!! Pretty good teacher in my book, Lots of fun!
wonderful... THIS CLASS WILL MAKE YOU A BETTER PERSON.
Literally my favorite prof I've ever had!
Awesome teacher! He cares about the students and always was able to reference what we were learning to something I could relate to! Great class and amazing teacher!
My favorite teacher at Baylor.  Really cares about his students and is extremely helpful.  What's up Corinne!
By far the best teacher I have had at Baylor! Very understanding and respectful and really wants you to learn from this class in exciting ways.
I loved professor talbert and I gained confidence in his class that will prepare me for my future as a teacher. We always had thought provoking conversation which I really enjoyed

Dr. Talbert is an awesome prof! I would recommend him to anyone taking Social Issues. He is really laid back and if you don't do some of the reading it's really easy to pick up on during the discussion.

Dr. Talbert's class was extremely helpful for my long term educational goals.  He is witty and creative in his approach to teaching.  I also appreciated his flexibility.  Assignments were not the focus--learning was!
Excellent class discussions and lectures in order to make material interesting and useful.

Very enthusiastic and knowledgable about subject area. Very good at leading discussions and making connections to class topics. Sometimes too flexible about assignments resulting in little clarity over what is expected.

A truly wonderful educator who I would highly recommend.  He not only made the dense information presentable and relatable, but did so in a thought-provoking way.  His priority is to actually have you learn and be able to analyze differing perspectives, sadly unlike some other professors.  His class is entertaining, challenging, and insightful.

There was a LOT of reading for this class--most of the students didn't do much of it and probably did fine. I did the readings and got a lot out of them. Dr. Talbert is an excellent teacher, a true encourager, philosopher, and respector of all persons. He is passionate about his field, and he gets his students excited. He's hilarious-love him!
Energetic, entertaining and thought provoking!
Great class.  You will think about several education issues in great depth.

Talbert is great. Best professor I've had in college.  He is understanding and down to earth. He will challenge you, but in a way that is not overwhelming and meaningless. I learned a whole lot from him.

TAKE THIS CLASS!! Dr. T was absolutely amazing! He did a great job of broadening your point of view and really making you consider your own beliefs both in the classroom and in general.  He is the best teacher I have ever had at Baylor and one of the best I have ever had.
He is down-to-earth.  Very understanding and gives great insights.  Awesome guy, good class... a must take!
Tony T is great.  Keeps you open minded and always thinking.  Register for this guy if you want a different college classroom experience.
Dr. T is amazing! I loved coming to his class. He teaches Social Issues in a very welcoming atmosphere and encourages us to voice our real opinion!

Dr. T made Qualitative Research fun...CAN YOU BELIEVE THIS?! To do that you HAVE to be a freaking great professor. He really got me interested in research in general and In can't wait to take another research class with him
Dr. Talbert is one of the best professors I have had in my entire college career.
Talbert is awesome! Any chance you get to take one of his classes, do it! He is more concerned with you getting something meaningful from the class than a grade. GREAT example for future teachers!
Dr. T is fun, energetic and really inspiring!

Dr. Talbert was a great professor.  He was very interested in the material, and he presented it in an interesting way.  The class was 3 hours long but usually lasted for only an hour and a half.  I would definitely recommend him!

I loved this class, I had no desire to learn anything about social issues prior to this class and now i think that I may be looking into studying social policy at grad school. He is very interesting and keeps your focus and as long as you complete the quizzes and do the writing assignments you will do well!
He is a great teacher. He makes the class not boring. The class was supposed to be from 2-445 and he never kept you the full time. I would recommend others to take him!

Talbert is really nice. I enjoyed being in his class this semester. He definitely makes the class fun and interesting. I learned a lot from his class. You should take him. You only have 3 essays in the class and quizes are take home. There are not exams or anything.
Great teacher.

Dr. Talbert is an amazing professor! No question is stupid, and he views everyone's opinon as important.  He is by far one of the most encouraging professors I've had a Baylor. This class opened my eyes to so many valuable issues, and I feel that I am truly a changed person because of this class.  I learned to listen to others & solidify my beliefs
Genius!! Simply put, Dr. Talbert is a work of art. You are doing yourself a favor by taking this professor in any class he teaches.
Rockin' dude!!
amazing...absolutely amazing
He is so enthusiastic and excited. It was fun class.He was our favorite!

Being a 5th year senior I have had many different professors at Baylor and Dr. T is by far the BEST professor I have had.  He is a true teacher and educator, I have learned far more from him in 1 semester than I have in 4 years of education classes.  He is very personable and laid back; although Baylor has a strict attendance policy Dr. Talbert was
Talbert is a great teacher. He is extremely helpful and everything you do in class is applicable to your life as a future teacher. TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

Talbert is awesome! I was not looking forward to this class at all but he made it fun and interesting. After an entire day of student teaching, the last think you want to do is go sit in class for 3 hours but he made it worth the while. Very fair and funny. The syllabus looks scary but he is more interested in our learning than paper work.
Great at communicating new ways to approach teaching.  Has an arsenal of skills to enhance the learning experience.
inspired and provoked critical thinking through questions. Always in high spirits making everybody in class at ease - no tension. Great class, had fun
The class was wonderful!  I thoroughly enjoyed our discussions.
He is amazing as a professor!  The ideas in the course were very challenging, but we gained a deeper understanding and actually reached a dialectic!  You'll enjoy taking his course!

Great class. Challenging, but without ridiculous or extraneous work piled on. The most engaging, conversational, and both philosophically and pragmatically paradigm shifting. I highly reccommend taking a class with Dr. Talbert!
He is a good teacher and makes you think...sometimes in circles, but you still feel more informed and a little more ready to face a classroom when you leave.
Excellant instructor---engaging.
Very approachable, engaging and individualized instructional style very much appreciated, especially as a grad student.

I wish Dr. Talbert could teach all of my classes! He is not one of those professors that is unapproachable and egotistical. He is willing to do whatever it takes for you to do your best in the class. He repects his students and is HYSTERICAL!! I'm serious...this guy is funnny. If you get the chance, TAKE HIM! He is very understanding about his stud
Great class!  Time was used for answering questions and guiding personal philosophical development, not a regurgitation of printed text.  I hope to take many more classes with this professor.
As a doctoral student I found Dr. Talbert's class to be just what I needed to prepare for my comps and dissertation. He finds out what each student needs to know and pushes them to their limit.
If you want to learn about qualitative research he's the one.

Dr. Talbert,  Is not only the finest professor that BU has to offer, but also is a personal mentor of mine.  Dr. Talbertâ€™s has (in my mind) a reputation as an outstanding educator and an innovative leader in the School of Education at Baylor University.  Dr. T is a man that has and continues to cultivate curriculum and instruction for the School o

Dr. Talbert is an outstanding professor.  His style and empathy for students are just a few reasons to take his class.  He is not just "available" to students; he is always inviting.  His questions are planned, innovative, and soul-searching.  His constructivist mindset gives his classes the edge, making them the best classes I've taken at Baylor.
The dude is freakin' awesome!
I love this guy! He is the best professor that I've ever had at Baylor. Dr. Talbert knows his stuff and always said, "You've got to think outside the box and challenge the status quo."

I was terrified after reading what I had. HOWEVER, I did the homework, read the textbook and went to every lecture, and nearly aced all of his tests. I went to office hours and he was actually surprised because how few people come. He was the most influential professor I had, and absolutely hilarious. I visited him regularly until I left Baylor.

Dr. WIlde is an abrasive person who appears cold & as though he doesn't care. However I took his class over the summer and continuously throughout the fall semester I would run into him and he was always engaging with me. He helped me and tutored me for my calculus class I was taking with a different professor. He genuinely cares about the student
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Terrible. As someone who normally excels at math, do not take him.

While he seems nice and funny on the surface, first impressions aren't everything. His tests are annoyingly difficult and he grades needlessly tough (I got eight points sliced off for SWAPPING PLOT COORDINATES). He is no help in office hours on top of that. As someone who had to drop this course despite getting easy As and Bs in Cal 1 and 2, AVOID.
DO NOT TAKE

don't like to help students. you get the wrong answers in quizzes and exams, you get zeros, even if you get right in all previous steps. last semester I went to his office hour for several questions and, after that I decided not to talk to him anymore.
He is a really harsh grader. He isn't helpful not willing to help.

Although he has harsh reviews, I loved Wilde! If you don't miss class and make sure to do the homework and go to office hours then you'll be fine. He is a hilarious guy and his tests really aren't too tough he's just kind of a harsh grader.

He does not give any explaination on why you get a certain amount of points on a question on an exam. I high recommend not taking him. He isn't helpful nor willing to help. I warn you if you take him you will regret it. His quizzes sometimes does not reflect on what to expect on exams. His exams are challenging.

Expect homework every class day. Also, you need to expect quizzes every class day except on days of exams and days after exams. I'm warning you he is a horrible professor! He does not explain material well and his examples are as fast as a cheetah. Worst decision I ever made by taking him because this was the first class I did not pass.

Beware he is not a good professor! He is not helpful nor willing to help me whenever I needed help. He does not explain why you get a certain amount of points on a question on an exam or a quiz. He is not good at explaining the material. His exams are tough. Like I said, stay away from him!

No! No! Turn back and take someone else because he is the worst math professor I ever had! His exams are tough and challenging. He's not helpful nor willing to help me. He does not explain the material that good. Like I said, stay away from him! Do not take him for any math classes if you can!

This was the worst decision I had made in my life by taking this professor because I received below a C in this class. He does not explain the material really good. His exams are challenging at times. He definitely was not helpful nor willing to help me on any questions I had.  Like I said, stay away from this professor!

he is not a good professor. Stay away as much as you can! He doesn't clarify why he gives certain amount of points on a particular question. There are quizzes every class day except on exam days and day after an exam. I was good in math until I took him. This was the worst decision I ever made by taking him! He is not willing to help nor helpful.

He is not that great of a professor. In fact, he was a bad professor. He isn't helpful nor willing to help. My cousin asked me who to take math classes at Baylor, I said to my cousin do not take this professor. His tests are hard and very unpredictable.

I found he was not that helpful nor willing to help. He seems to have anger whenever I asked for his help. He was not that good of a professor. My friends asked me who to take for Cal 3, I responded with not this professor. I haven't made below a C in any class in my life. Like I said, he isn't the best professor to have.

He doesn't give any feedback or explainationreason on why you got a certain amount of points. He is very horrible professor and person! Expect a ton of homework everyday. If I had to tell my friends who to take for Cal 3, I would say do not take this guy!!
He is absolutely worst and most intimidating professor I ever had! Stay away from him and do not take any class that he teaches!

Though he does not give many tests, his tests are hard. He does not clearly explain the material well not willing to help you understand. He is the worst professor and most intimidating professor I ever had. I have not made below a C in any class until now. Like I said, stay away from him as much as possible!

He is absolutely horrible and terrible. He is not very helpful nor willing to assist me. Stay away from him because he is horrible!!! His tests are challenging. His quizzes can cover anything from what you did on the homework.

Do not take him! He is one of the worst math professors at Baylor! His tests are very challenging. He does not explain the material extradionarily great nor willing to help. If there's one thing I learned, stay away from him!

He does not give any feedback why he gives the amount if points right on a question. His tests are challenging. He does not explain the material well. I highly suggest staying away from as much as possible! He is one of the worst professors I ever had. I do not like sarcasm and favoritism to his students.

He does not give any feedback why he gives the amount if points right on a question. His tests are challenging. He does not explain the material well. I highly suggest staying away from as much as possible!

Do not take him! He is the worst math professor I ever had! He does not explain material that clearly.  He was not helpful nor willing to help so I recommend staying away from him as much as possible!!! His quizzes are so all over the place. There will be a ton of homework assigned to prepare a quiz.

Do not take him! He is the worst math professor I ever had! He does not explain material that clearly.  He was not helpful nor willing to help so I recommend staying away from him as much as possible!!! I am used to making A's and B's in math courses, but he was so bad and did not receive a C in the class

Do not take him! He is the worst math professor I ever had! He does not explain material that clearly.  He was not helpful nor willing to help so I recommend staying away from him as much as possible!!!

Don't take him, he is such a horrible professor! He does not explain the material that well! He was not very helpful nor willing to help me. I have not made below a C in any class until now. Like I said he is a horrible professor! I insist staying away from him!
Don't take him! He isn't the best at explaining the material. I recommend stay away! I tried to get help from him, but he was so mean.  By far one of the worst professors I ever had!!
Don't take him! Stay away! He does not explain the material clearly enough. In fact, my classmates and tutors are more helpful than him!
He can be so mean when you try to get help. His attitude is so bad. He's one of the worst professor I ever had!! Don't take him!!!!!!!!
He's not too helpful and can be rude if students don't know the material. His tests can be challenging but it can be worse. Do not take him!
Stay away! Don't take him he's the worst professor ever!
Don't take him! He is the worst professor I ever had! He doesn't explain the material clearly and slowly. In fact, his examples are as fast as a cheetah runs.

He's better than my calculus 2 professor from last semester but that's not saying much. Sometimes he does not explain the material that well. Don't expect his class to be easy.  I would not take him again. In fact, I suggest staying away from him at all costs!
He did not teach and gave me the wrong grade.

Calculus II is the hardest class I have ever taken. I was a straight-A student all through high school, and this is the first class that I will ever fail. Your only grades in this class come from one-problem daily quizzes and the tests, so if you bomb one, you're basically screwed. Great guy, but awful class.

I took this guy at UTA and I hated him.  I did not like his sarcasm or the way he taught his class.  I also felt like I was good at math till now, his stupid daily quizzes screwed up my grade.  He will always pick the hardest possible problems on his daily quizzes.  Do not take this guy.

I was looking forward to Cal when I took this class. He is by far the worst professor I have ever had. I had a very high GPA but couldnt pull off an A or B in this class because it is so fast paced with no grades on ALL the homework you do because he doesnt want to grade papers. The grades come from 4 tests and a 5 minute daily quiz in the morning.
Sarcastic and Inconsiderate!
No No No No No! Stay away!!!

DO NOT GET HIM!!!! He speed through problems faster than a drill Sargent on cocaine! I'd rather have anyone but him. He is very inconsiderate and sarcastic. Stay out of his way and just let him mark up that board! Don't ask for explanation unless you want to get publicly embarrased

I wouldn't recommend this man. He doesn't do a great job at clarifying problems. His sarcasm gets annoying and he expects you to understand things really fast. He does know what he is talking about, but if you're not already used to fast paced courses, I wouldn't take him. I did great in math until I had him. Worst decision i made to take him.
Nice guy.
one of the best math teachers i've ever had
He is a decent teacher, but very impatient and seems to have a anger issue. I made A's in all of my math classes but his. He's not the worst, but far from the best.

He's a very cool guy. I have him at 8 in the morning and he manages to keep me awake. He likes making jokes and being sarcastic. Homework isn't graded but at the beginning of every class expect a quiz, usually just one question, you know it or you don't. His tests are pretty straight forward, not tricky,but challenging. I'd definitely recommend him

Mr Wilde is amazing. i am possibly the worst math student ever yet somehow pre-calc was my highest grade!! he is funny and he cares. we called his cell phone at like 3am for help on problems the night before a test. all test questions come RIGHT out of homework. literally. LOVED IT!!
He's a really cool guy. Always making jokes and really sarcastic. He talks loud so you can't fall asleep and is really helpful about making sure you understand. Great guy!
Mr. Wilde is def. cool! He cracks jokes in class and always makes sure that everyone understands what is going on!
I took him at UTA, amazing professor, american which means you can understand him.  Makes jokes and dont come into class late or he will make fun of you.  Awesome teacher that cares a lot
Definately a cool teacher, laid back.  No quizes, just tests.  Homework is for a completion grade only.  If you need any help he'll be glad to help.
No Comments

Professor Cates could care less about his students. I tried going to him several times for help and never got more than just a short condescending reply. The homework is completely unrelated to the tests, so you'll have to watch one of the three, fifteen-minute videos he posts for each chapter section to study. There is no form of summarized review

Professor Cates is extremely tough. When you get a question wrong on a test, he will just put an X on it and call it a day. He's super rude and condescending and acts like we're supposed to know the material already on the first day of class. Please don't take him unless you absolutely have to.

Professor Cates is a great professor, and i do not know why he has so many bad reviews. He explains the concepts in a clear manner and helps outside of class. The tests are literally just notes questions, so if you study the notes the tests are easy. He is willing to help if you don't understand. He is also a great and down to earth guy.
Don't recommend
Highly don't recommend

I've never had such a negative experience with any professor until I've taken this class. He has poor teaching skills and is rude. He has a poor attitude and is the complete opposite of how a true professor should act towards his students. He doesn't feel any remorse towards students that genuinely care about their grades and the class.
DO NOT RECOMEND for pre cal!! Half of my class dropped. He is very condescending and rude if you ask questions.

Cates grades absurdly and even if you get every question right on the test he will rip you apart and shame you for not doing it his way. He teaches dated forms of calculus and hates it when you have taken it before. He will not accept any shortcuts in your work and if you miss showing a simple 2+2 on your test its four points off. Avoid him.

He makes students feel like they are stupid when they ask questions. Took off points for everything. Only taught using examples from the book. Would either respond very quickly to emails or never. HORRIBLE puns everyday.

As a person: Nice, humorous, and caring. Teaching style: Very fast. Ask questions, because clarification is mediocre. Homework videos convey material far better than lectures. Use these videos and your homework to study. Beware of multi-part questions. Always assume your grade on a test will be lower than you expect. Study accordingly.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This dude gives video lessons every class period. He has 3 different videos per day, but theyre not that long and easy enough to follow. However, the homework is usually nothing like what he teaches and has several types of problems that we have not covered. Youre gonna NEED tutoring with this guy as your teacher. 2/10
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I took Dr. Cates after withdrawing from pre-cal. He does a great job at touching up on algebra and will have you well prepared for pre-cal. He wants all his students to pass and is very helpful when it comes to explaining concepts. Gives very helpful study guides and makes tons of material available for you. You'll get an A if you put the effort in
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I am very bad at math, so I struggled with this class, but he was always there whenever I needed to drop by, and he was so willing to help. He really cares about his students. If you don't do the optional homework, you will probably have a hard time in class. Just pay attention and do the homework.
Just pay attention and do the homework and you'll be okay .

Cates is a cool guy and is genuinely sweet, he just carries a lot of sass. The only thing that goes toward your grade in his class is your exams, so if you're not a good test taker, his class is not for you. His teaching style doesn't go outside of you watching him sole problems the whole class and he goes fast without checking comprehension.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Mr. Cates is a very nice professor, but be ready for pop quizzes. He is not rude at all, but I do not like that doctor's notes when someone is too sick to get out of bed are not accepted as excuses for not attending class. Basically, if you do your homework correctly, you get an A on quizzes. I had to drop because of a heavy courseload.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Professor Cates is a terrible teacher. He is rude, sassy and can not convey his math knowledge onto his students effectively. This man literally finds his purpose for getting up in the morning by taking off unnecessary points on tests.  Do not take this class unless  you want to deal with unneeded sass and undeserved bad grades.
Super confusing, goes really fast.
Absolutely amazing teacher. I struggled through math my whole life but he was able to make it easy and enjoyable. And his tests are often identicle to the problems on the homework
Awesome teacher. Math was actually easy

I wouldn't recommend him. His lectures are hard to understand, the only way you can get help is going to office hours. Only grades are tests and quizes over homework, if you want an A you must attend EVERY SINGLE CLASS PERIOD

I went to his office a lot for help and he was always there and stayed for as long as it took. He wants you to understand the methods. Gives extra bonus points for a 70% or high on exams. Must show ALL WORK no matter how easy the problem. Very nice and kind. Highly recommend him!

He really is super easy. I can't tell if he's being condescending or not, idk. He gives extra points if you pass the exams. Make sure you round right though. I learned the hard way and bombed a test horribly because my answer was off by a hundredth of a point on several problems. Nice guy though.

Do NOT take him. He is horrible! i checked on here before i registered for his class and looked at his ratings, they all seemed like good reviews. Well, he is not a great professor at all. He is so condescending and it feels like you are back in high school. The only grades in the class are the tests. and you HAVE to go to EVERY class. dont take hi

Has a strange voice, kind of like Mr. Garrison from South Park, but you get use to it farely fast. Very good teacher, goes fast, but always willing to clearify if you need it and very nice. Can always go to office hours to check answers or get extra help.
Great teacher! HIGHLY recommend him, especially if you're not a math person.

He's a very sweet teacher and will explain anything any number of times. Can go fast but will slow down if asked. Very helpful and a super easy class. I breezed through it. Study a little before the tests and your made! Gives bonus points for simple things. I highly recommend him if you aren't a good math person like me!
He is very helpful and is always available during office hours. His tests are straight-forward and his quizzes are homework questions. I would recommend him.

Extremely easy class. I made an A. His final also replaces your lowest test grade. He adds extra points to your test if you improved from the last one. Homework is not required. TAKE CATES IF YOU CAN! He is straightforward with his teaching and is very helpful if you don't understand.

Mr. Cates will explain something until everyone gets it even if he has to repeat it several times. Quizzes are numerous but easy as they come straight from your homework. Homework is normally pretty simple. Will find the most random things to take a point or two away from a test question.
nice guy and explains everything thoroughly...almost too much! his tests are very easy and he makes sure that everyone understands. nice guy.
goes very fast, sometimes hard to keep up and understand whats going on but he always keeps his door open to people with questions
This was the biggest blow off class ever! Do your assignments, study abit for tests and you will be fine! I learned all this stuff in tenth grade--im horrible @ math and even got an A!
I would have done better in his class if I had applied myself more. I re-took the course, then found out what a good prof he really was!!
Very helpful, I was in his office all the time, and that really helped me on tests. Do the homework assignments and you've got it made.
Take Cates!  Freshman year, my roommate and I both took ideas in math.  She had another teacher and had to drop the class because the teacher was so bad, but I got an A in Cates' class.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Tatum was never clear and always went off topic and often caused the class to get really controversial so students would start arguing. Lots of students asked what the exams would be like and he always left us in the dark. One thing I did like is that I was absent one day and he sent me an email asking if everything was okay.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He is one of my fave teachers ever
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: If you have an opinion do not take this teacher. If you aren't a bible thumping baptist do not take this professor. He is awful! Extremely racist, tells you lies in class and then when you try to quote it on the test essay you get half off because you wrote something incorrect even though he has said it verbatim in class. Avoid at all costs

Mr. Tatum rarely teaches what the bible actually says which was a shock coming into a baptist university but I was told that is fairly normal for Baylor.   Lots of reading, test are difficult, and loads of quizzes that are not always easy.  The reading is interesting until it starts saying we don't know if Jesus existed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Tatum was one of the best professors I have ever had. i grew up in a non-religious family, so i was nervous when it came to the Christian Scriptures class, but he made it very enjoyable and fun to learn about. You do have to do a lot of reading and notes, but I feel it prepared me for tests. I ended up taking him for heritage as well.

Lots of reading with summaries over each of them. You never really know what's on the exam because he is so vague about it. Exams consist of 50 MC questions with 2 essays. Essays are difficult since they are over lecture topics but he never explains the concept entirely for you to write an essay on it.

Professor Tatum was also helpful to me when I became sick and made sure that I did not get behind in my classes.  He was a God send and I truly appreciate his wisdom and support of me.  He is a great asset to Baylor University.
Great professor and really cares about students.  He helped me when I got really sick.  He made sure that I was able to transition back into classes.  He is a really supportive and helpful professor.

Dr. Tatum has an amazing knowledge of the Middle East (which was the Cultures V class that I took with him). It was one of my very favorite BIC classes because I learned so much. And he's really funny. Take him!
3 major test and multiple pop quizzes over the assigned readings. Heavy load of reading summaries. Great lecturer, but TA seems to do most of the grading.

I really loved Dr. Tatum's class. I wasn't sure what to expect going into Christian Scriptures, but he makes it interesting, and I have really enjoyed the class. The biggest thing is to stay on top of the reading. It's not overwhelming. I highly recommend this class!
don't take him if you are easily offended or don't know how to defend your Faith

Very interesting lectures and a bunch of reading assignments. Teaches extremely well and if you take good notes and read you will learn a great deal and pass easily. Watch out for quizzes-- about 5/semester. Tests are mostly over general info but there will be very specific questions sometimes: essays always over controversies/lecture-only topics.
Very interersting lectures. Assigns a lot of reading and you have to do summaries for each one but it's not difficult. You can do well on the tests if you do the readings.
I had no idea this class could actually be fun. He is so enthusiastic about everything that he makes the lectures so much fun to attend even the early morning class! Incredible teacher.

It's been 11 years since graduation and I still think of this class and Dr. Tatum.  Dr. Tatum forced us to think and decide for ourselves what the scripture was saying.  Many times he would pose a dilemma and leave you in suspense for weeks; which caused me to search for the answer on my own.  His teaching will be with me for life.

Dr. Tatum is revolutionary. I did not know how much I would enjoy taking an intro religion class, but he makes it so great. If you get a chance, take a class from Tatum. His lectures are so interesting.

Dr. Tatum knows his stuff and knows it well. Easy quizzes and tests. He takes a somewhat boring subject and makes it really interesting. My fav class. Makes you form your own opinions. Sometimes will bring up controversial issues and just the class debate for the whole period. Awesome prof, get him if you can.

Wasn't looking forward to religion at all...now is my favorite class to at least attend. Tatum very interesting, knowleagable guy with lots to say. Make sure to read and attendance is kinda a must for him. Overall: bomb
As long as you show up, do your homework, and pay attention, you'll be good to go. He's extremely interesting, so it's really a great class. Try to get him if you can!
Lectures are interesting.  Tests and quizzes are very involved, so make sure to know the info well.

i took him during the summer and for the most part i learned a lot.  i didnt like how we always went into roll play and some students could not get some of the concepts.  He is very outspoken and keeps your attention most of the times.  Quizzes a lot so you do have to read but it is easy reading.  all you need is your bible and the textbook that is required.
No Comments
Makes you think.  Not sure what his real opinions are- he's that objective.  Sometimes he "slips" into Hebrew or Greek or Arabic on the board! :)  Very engaging and knowledgable.

Amazing professor! He makes the class very interesting and is very lively in his lectures. He is very liberal and does push the envelope, but he warns you ahead of time and says that he doesn't care if you believe what he says or not. Very nice man and extremely intelligent.
He had a great way of illustrating how the people of the old testament were - he related beliefs of the time to things we actually use today - that made the people of the Bible more 3D for me

He's pretty liberal in doctrine/theology but knows his stuff historically. He'll challenge your beliefs and is borderline blasphemous, so it's sad to see some people become disillusioned and confused by his constant pushing of the envelope.
Nice prof, but is a inclined to the liberal side.

GREAT TEACHER!  Easy tests and quizzes....all you need to do is read and keep up with your summaries.  He tends to give the answers to his tests in his lectures.  No surprises....none!  Very sweet man.
No Comments
The door kicking trick is pretty impressive. very good lecturer.
He is awesome.  Great teacher.
highly engaging and enjoyable to listen to
Absolutely my favorite professor at Baylor! he's Awesome!
Good teacher, very interesting
No Comments
One of the best professors at Baylor

Prof Holleyman was my favorite teacher this year!! There's about 3 short essays (mostly over your opinion) and one extra credit essay that adds 10 points to overall grade. The tests are fairly easy as long as you go over PowerPoints and pay attention. Two online quizzes weekly, but very easy! I definitely wish he taught New Testament.

Dr. Holley man is a great professor and really cares about what he is teaching. Some of the tests were a bit hard, but there is a lot of opportunities to get information to study. There is a bit of reading though, but not the worst of my classes.
He is amazing, love his class, he really cares about what he's teaching and his lectures are incredible
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Professor Holleyman is the most passionate and understanding professor I have ever had. He gives two essays and grades them pretty easily and makes the class interesting to learn because he cares so much about what he's teaching.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Best professor ever!! Really nice and funny. You have to study really hard for tests but SI is usually provided. Go to SI, DO NOT SKIP it will help your grade a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This is for all people taking online classes. Mr. Holleyman is super nice, but his lecture videos are kind of tough to listen to. It sounds like he doesn't use a mic on his computer and the sound of his computer fan muffles what he's saying so sometimes I won't be able to hear anything he says from a slide lol. Outside of that, he's extremely nice.
Dr. Holleyman clearly cares about the course material and his students, and comes in every day with that passion on his sleeve. Great man, great professor, great class.

In all honesty, I had never picked up a bible before this class. You don't need to know all about about Christianity before you come to this course. Holleyman is absolutely amazing and very honest when it comes to the material. Would not have traded him for the world. Quizzes each class over reading material. Tests are based off lectures.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: Man, throwback city. I had Holleyman back in Fall '13, as a freshman, and he's pretty great. The daily quizzes are ten questions, multiple choice, and they're pretty reasonable. If you put half an hour into the assigned reading before each class, you'll be fine for the quizzes. Most of his test material came from either the quizzes or his lectures.
BEST PROFESSOR AT BAYLOR UNIVERSITY. you have to work to make an A in his class but its totally doable. I CANNOT EMPHASIZE THIS ENOUGH !!!TAKE HOLLEYMAN!!!

Dr. Holleyman really keeps a lot of students attention because he is very passionate when it comes to teaching Christian Scriptures. He makes it clear to understand and follow. There are daily quizzes but they are easy as long as you do the reading prior to taking it and have notes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Awesome class. I was in a 200 person class and it kept me engaged more than some of my 10 person classes. Plus I had an SI and Hollyman and her worked well together, which made the class very easy to do well in if you put the effort. The class is really just about effort, and as long as you care you will do great.
Professor Holleyman is a great teacher. I am so glad I got to take him for Christian Heritage. I would definitely recommend!

Dr. Holleyman is one of my favorite professors at Baylor. Not only is he well-respected within the Baylor community, but he treats every student with the same respect. Don't take this class unless you plan on going into some kind of ministry though, because it is built around an internship that you have with a local minister. Overall, he's awesome!
Take Him! He is an awesome teacher. He doesn't assign long readings and the quizzes for those readings are easy. His test aren't hard especially if you go to SI.
One of, if not the best professor at Baylor. Love the guy to death an he's a absolute genius. Go to class, get to know him, GO TO SI, and you'll ace it!

This teacher is the bomb. Every time i go into his office hours I spend at least 30 minutes in there. He is very helpful. You need to study for his tests because they are challenging. However, he has a great SI and his lectures are interesting.
This professor is awesome! He has so much enthusiasm and you can tell he really loves teaching. Study hard though, his tests are difficult
Very good teacher - looks and sounds a lot like Matthew McConoughey. Tough tests! Extremely nice guy though. You can have a conversation with him for hours.
Good lecturer! Pay attention in class and go yo SI and you'd be good! He makes it interesting!
I appreciate and understand the Bible because of this guy; he is amazing!

He doesn't try to push his views on you, which is a good thing.He's very helpful and there are a good amount of extra credit opportunities.  He had SI as well but I never went and still got an A in the class and I've never been into religion.He gives 20 quizzes, but takes best 15 grades and they're very easy(6 questions)..use your book. Highly Rec.

He is such a good teacher. He keeps things interesting even when it isn't a very interesting subject. Tests are pretty easy just go to the extra study sessions he offers. Quiz everyday online but they are always really easy and you can use your book. I would recommend taking his class!!! He is just a really nice guy.
Great professor. Able to teach Christianity without annoying or patronizing non-religious students.

He is a great teacher. He is passionate about the scriptures and is very helpful. I disagree with one of the previous posters; his study guide should help you with nearly every question on the tests. Although he can get boring at times, if you put in effort, you should get an A.

I love this class!! Dr. Holleyman is an awesome teacher!! he really gets into the subject and teaches in a way that keeps you interested! i hardly ever get bored in this class and it is an hour and a half long. He is a great guy and teacher!! take him if you have the chance!!!!

What I really love about Eric is that he helps be struggle with what it means to be a good christian. I really think that the only way to get to heaven is to listen to what they tell you, and eric will help tell you those things.
Easy!  Just pay attention in class, read the assingned reading, and take notes, and you will do just fine.  He's not boring to listen to, and he offers extra credit!
Really knows his stuff

Dr. Holleyman does not clearly indicate what is to be on tests.  He offers a study guide, yet not everything on the test was covered on the study guide, and only 10% of the study guide makes the test.  Very well versed, yet far too vague.

i really liked him!  dr. holleyman definitely knows what he's talking about and truly enjoys what he does.  he also loves to help his students.  you'll need to study for the tests, but it's not too hard to make an A.  classes are all lecture.
If you can take him, you find another teacher out there that enjoys his profession and has so much passion for what he is doing!
Awesome professor, gives extra credit opportunities, sermon-like lectures, but he's very nice, I would take him if he taught 1350.
I had him for NT.  He does tend to preach (since he is a former pastor), so his lectures get long winded, but his tests and quizzes are curved well and pretty straight forward
No Comments

I have had him for OT and NT and he is really nice and a good lecturer. I enjoy his passion. BEing a former pastor, he tends to almost preach on his friday lectures. Take him and you won't be disappointed.
It was nice that you did not have to buy a text book but the errors in his self written book were distracting and it was hard to read.  It is nice that you get points for not missing class though.
Be prepared to do a lot of work. It's hard to stay awake in the class, but you can really learn a lot from Chonko.
Super hard!! Lectures are almost impossible to stay awake in but its pretty obvious that Chonko knows what's up

Chonko is the difference maker for freshman business students,  If you don't want to work at all stay away and try to transfer a course that will replace it (good luck).  If you want to be a successful businessperson, this is the first step.  Chonko is a top notch Prof. who cares deeply for his students and knows a lot.  do understand that this is a weed out course for the business school, but also understand that this material is very valuable, and it does not come in a much better package.  Thanks Chonko!
No Comments
better take it at your comm coll. your kill yourself if you dont

He is a fair teacher and will help you on anything he can.  His T.A.'s are usually hot too and so you get to sit there and stare at them.  Chonko is not as bad as people make him out to be, hes a good teacher.
Smart guy! Let's you know what to expect. Treats you like you are in college; not grade school. You will have to work but learn a lot. Read the WSJ for quizzes.
He makes it clear what he expects from the start. Not nearly as bad as people make it out to be. I took it during pledgeship and did ok.

He makes you work for a change so stop complaining!!!None of the stuff is very hard, just takes time and effort. He knows his stuff and has plenty of interesting guest speakers who also know their stuff(professors who were successful in the business world)Better prepares you for the business world.

Phenomenal teacher! I learned so much from his class. He definitely makes you work for your grade. After taking the class, I feel extremely well prepared for future business classes. He communicates his expectations well. He is a really funny and nice guy outside of class.

He lets you know from the beginning what to expect. I was scared to death after hearing all the negative comments, but I ended up learning a lot in his class and liked it. He pulls no punches; no surprises.
No Comments
I LOVE LARRY!! All ya'll who don't like him don't know how to appriciate a hard but good professor. He rocks!
He's a great professor and a great man.  I've decided not to do business after all, but I've learned so much about myself in his class.  Very helpful, and very inspiring.
all i can say is run...fast
Take notes in class on teh slides you can print off Blackboard. When studying for the exams the two texts are essential, atleast on his essay tests.
No Comments
have fun hes the only teacher
Anyone who complains about this class won't cut it in the business world.  He tells it like it is and is fair.  Most BU students complain about him because they actually have to work for a grade.
No Comments
Very easy class if you understand the basic concepts.  Chonko is very helpful if you just ask.

By far the best professor I've ever had. Most teachers would care less how the students feel. He gets everyone copies of WSJ, plays music, tells jokes, tells amazing business stories. A lot of Baylor business students are just spoiled.
have to take it but he's boring, dull, and looks like mario from super mario brothers.
The class is boring, and the project is extremely hard and time-consuming.  Very difficult tests, but there's usually a curve, not that it helps much
Funny guy, but has hard tests. He likes to talk about drinking beer and playing pinball. You have to take so have fun.
Very hard; plays Star Wars doom music when taking a quiz; he is out to fail!  I made a D and studied alot!
You have to take it and is sucks ass. Hope you live through it.
Self-important, patronizing. Beware the group project. Plan on making a B.
No Comments
I learned a lot from the project.
he sucks, and he will be teaching MKT next year!
I learned alot from the business project
The only thing I learned was how to shake hands correctly.  He should hang it up

This professor was absolutely HORRIBLE. DO NOT take this teacher even if you have to! He literally does not care about who is in his class and has no interaction with any of the students. Darden's tests are almost impossible to study for because there is so much information he covers in one unit. Worst experience of my life.

I had Darden for JOU 1303, and his class was super lecture heavy, but I really enjoyed it! He was engaging and well-spoken. I liked him so much that I took him again for JOU 2303. Schedule office hours with him, and he'll help you out. You can't skip his class, though, it makes it really hard.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Prof. Darden's Film 1303 class in 2010, as a required elective. I attended his class faithfully, I worked diligently, and I earned an A. At the end of the course, Prof. Darden stated that he wanted to shake the hands of each student. After waiting in line, when I arrived to shake his hand, he refused to shake my hand in front of the class.
a professor seems unsure about the material, a professor presents the material in a confused way, and a professor rarely involves the students
its either his way or no way, critical thinking is being punished in his class. do not express your own ideas and opinions then it will be the easiest class to get an A on

I thoroughly enjoyed the class I had with professor Darden, he's funny and has a true passion for teaching and his other work. I make a point to go to his class because not only do I actually learn interesting stuff from his lectures, I also care about what he has to say about the topics discussed in class. I would love to take another class of his
Love this guy. His lectures are all very interesting and he is extremely well-versed in the subject material. Lectures are everything so pay attention and take good notes and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: no very knowledgeable on the subject matter but a blowhard, lower than average Baylor tenured professor,
Disappointed. He seems not to care about his students. Limited office hour.

comment: he never interacts with students. just plain lecture.

comment: this class requires significantly more time than most classes at Baylor that fulfill the general education requirement. it is not worth it unless you have an interested in animation. definitely not a journalism class whatsoever

comment: limited office hours with no flexibility. relatively unaccessible
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I feel that he takes himself too serious. I felt un-welcomed every time I was in his office asking questions.

lectures are mostly common sense; however, exam questions are different from lectures; I barely passed his exam by reviewing his lectures five times; I also tried to get help from him, but he was always "busy" according to him. Thank God for the extra credit despite there are few.

I think the class has nothing to do with journalism but common sense and maybe humanity. This would be an ok class if it is categorized and described correctly. It wasted my time and ruined my passion for journalism. There are a few professors teaching the same class. I would try a different professor.
his exams are unrelated to his lectures, extremely hard to prepare even if you listen to every word he say

he has lots of knowledge of instruments and animations instead of journalism/communication. the name of the class misled me. i was hoping to learn something about mass communication and journalism. therefore, i regret taking this class. i hope the department will change the name and description so it will not mislead other students.
the attendance policy is extremely strict unlike any other professor at baylor not available outside of class. hard to communicate with
Would not take question or comment. Limited office hour with no flexibility. Lectures and tests rarely match.

comment: attendance matters, so be mindful while choosing this class. at the end of this class, I learned nothing I did not know before.
Lack of logos and ethos. too much pathos in his lectures, to a point which diminishes the quality and reliability of the material.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures are superficial and common sense. No discussion. No interaction.

get ready to watch cartoons

comment: not willing to help

comment: I loved Professor Darden's class. He is by far the best professor I had during my time at Baylor. He is extremely knowledgeable about the subject matter and gives absolutely enthralling lectures. But all of these things pale in comparison to what makes Darden great - he is a man of great character, and it shows day in and day out.  Take this class.

Professor Darden is arguably the most intelligent, interesting person in the world. He tells AMAZING stories and introduces you to the best of the best with music, film, and books. It was an honor just to be his student. His Intro to Mass Comm. was INCREDIBLE! And not all too hard; just TAKE NOTES.

Prof. Darden was passionate, but he definitely had a bad sides. First, there are not many grades AT ALL. Don't screw up on ONE thing, or you can say goodbye to your A in the class. Too outspokenly liberal, and it characterized how he taught the subject, which is not ethical. And pretty annoying at times. Overall, decent.
Fantastic and engaging! My favorite class. He was killed off by students who went on to be screenwriters/etc. in the movies Wanted, 2 Fast 2 Furious, and GTA.

DO NOT TAKE IF YOU DO NOT HAVE TO!!!!!!!!!!! I studied SO hard for his tests and only did well on one of them (and I did okay on the final).  The things he goes over in class for the first two tests had nothing to do with what material was actually ON the test. He's a really nice guy, but he only gives tests for grades. NOTHING ELSE AT ALL.

Mr. Darden really is a nice and understanding person. He doesn't expect much of you at all. The only thing that I hate about this class is he doesn't really clarify what is going to be on the test. He lectures and puts material from the textbook. The chapters are 50 pages long. I spent 5 hours studying and still made a F on the test. I would sugges
Darden is one of the better, more realistic professors at Baylor. And he cares. He's one of the reasons why I have the job I do today.
Very laid back and understands that you don't have time for nonsense.  A great professor - very nice and understanding.
as a optometry grad student, I look back and think how great Dr. Eldridge prepared me for future healthcare education.  Take his class!

Ok... so he is a nice person and tries to be funny so I will give him that as a credit.... however.. his lectures are not organized, it is soo hard to take notes or sometimes understand cause sometimes he blurbs stuff... plus quizzes are kinda ridiculous... Exams.. He is a nice person.. but a terrible teacher!!!!
His class is nothing but a LIVING HELL.. I can't stand going to it at all. I hate it with a passion. The CLASS AVERAGE for our last test was a 60%... AND WE HAVE 200 PEOPLE IN MY CLASS
he is an awful teacher. i loved biology before taking his class... now i loathe it!
