He will purposely fail you to weed you out. And he makes you buy his published notes on the side for $40 to make quite a large profit from a 200+ student class.
He's gonna make you work, but you'll learn a ton!

Dr. Eldridge is one of the best professors I've ever had.  He's tough, but he's very nice outside of class if you make an HONEST effort in the class.  There is no textbook,just a notes package.  He doesn't follow them in order.  I used to take out the pages he covered every class, and build my notes that way (use your creativity!).  Study a lot.
Teaching style is crap. not very organized. Notes are always all over the place.

Oh my goodness, this guy prevented me from graduating in August and now I have to wait till December.  Yea I should have done better on the final, but I don't think you should punish someone who attended every lecture and for most of the semester maintained a C avg. by making them pay for another semester. Really ticked!!!!
A tough prof, but one of the nicest outside of class.  He claims that it's not a weed-you-out class, but I think it serves that purpose quite nicely.  Prepare to write. And study.
My first class at Baylor. Gotta love the ridiculous number of pooh ties he owns. The class in challenging, but if you work hard, you'll do well. Very helpful

Dr. Eldridge is the man. He cares about his students and will teach you a lot. His class can be pretty hard but if you study and keep up with the material you will do fine. I recommend you go to SI - those are very helpful. I am definitely taking Dr. Eldridge again when I get the chance.

Everyone says to avoid the "ridges" meaning Eldridge and Baldridge... but really Eldridge is a really good professor. He's very clear during his lectures and he constantly makes jokes. Not to mention the man has a different winnie the pooh tie for EACH day of the year I'm thinking!!
He's a nice professor.  The class is difficult though.  I would recommend this professor.
he's an awsome teacher and funny too, but just remeber to study for every class cause he has "pop tests" every day usually 13-15 ?s
I wish I had studied harder and made it to class more often!
He's a great teacher, and really knows what he's doing. quizzes every class and the tests are hard, but he makes you learn the material. he's so much fun outside of class though!
Very good teacher and overall person.  Oh, and don't bother trying to spot a second wearing of a pooh tie.
RUN FAST!! THIS IS THE HARDEST CLASS I'VE EVER TAKEN! PREPARE TO TAKE A QUIZ EVERY SINGLE CLASS! HE'S PRETTY FUNNY THOUGH.

He's a tough guy, he gives you quizzes over a chapter every class lecture, and they count as two exam grades, but it's good, because it makes you keep up on your reading.  Take him if you're willing to keep up with the work.
great guy, hard class
He is funny and nice, but difficult
can one be mildly hilarious? what happened to "don't take the 'ridge's"?
Truly an asset to Baylor.  It's hard because it's a college class AND a weed out course.  If you want the grade, do the work!

As an alumnus (4th year MD/PhD student @ UT), I'm to say that Dr. Eldrige made a great impact on my life, both personally and professionaly.  Talk to him about all those insignias on his wall (he's a soccer freak).  Great for recommendation letters.
Quizzes everyday and tests are hard!
No Comments
Good teacher, hard tests
Great teacher
Very informative, and mildly hilarious
No Comments
Very Hard. Won't let you have a life.
took him second time for bio 1305 - lectures go with tests, i learned a lot
will cold call you and tests are very specific
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Terrible professor, doesn't teach at all, and everything in test has no relation with class material or quiz. Questions are all based on his opinion, and most of his opinion are extremely middle ages. However, he is the typical example of professors of general education course in Baylor, especially religion department.

Wonderful man who willingly engages with students and will learn your name within the class. 
This class is very much lecture heavy, meaning you will only succeed if you show up. 2 Points will be added to final grade if you have perfect attendance. A lot of reading and focus required as well as class participation!
Weekly quizzes and 4 exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I went into his class completely blind but he is the best! His test come straight from his lectures so have good notes to review. He always teaches you about life in the lectures, so I am walking away with more than I thought I would. I went to SI, so I didn't have study much. He knows all of his students by name, and truly cares for everyone.

I really enjoyed being one of Dr. Moseman's students! At first, he intimidated me a bit, but he really makes an effort to get to know every single one of his students. He is genuinely a caring person. The quizzes account for most of your grade, and he drops 3 at the end of the semester, but DO NOT skip ANY quizzes! They are so important!

. More time influencing his own opinions than focusing on the text. Tests were tricky and wordy, and he often asked "according to Dr. Moseman" questions rather than about the material itself. Overall, a terrible class. Would not take his class again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Unhelpful and includes a MASSIVE workload. He does not teach nor does he care for the students and the workload is insane. If you are taking 15 or more credits stay away from this classwork. There are a total of 8 tests, 28 quizzes during the class, and about 30 pages of reading (every day not for each class so 150 pages a week). Save yourself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Moseman's Christian Scriptures class is by far the most enjoyable class that I've ever taken. This is not an easy class and will require in-depth analysis of the contents of the bible but Dr. Moseman is a professor who you will want to do good work for. He deeply cares about every one of his students.

Go to bubooks for a more accurate rating, but Dr. Moseman is an amazing professor. It is a lot of work. There is an exam about every 3 weeks and a quiz on the reading he assigns before his lectures (they are open note and online). He drops 3 of your quiz grades. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he only tests on what he lectures about so go to class!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: A God amongst Men
He's very nice, and sweet, and loves what he teach! However, his class is kind of difficult. He will give you a load of information that you need to remember. I would recommend a different professor.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's a great guy and an amazing teacher who knows what he's talking about. He's really hard but he'll help you whatever way he can. I'd take him again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Moseman is undoubtedly the best professor I've ever had. He is not only an incredible teacher, but he is an incredible person as well. He genuinely cares about his students & seeks to show them love & compassion at all times. Sure, his class can be difficult, but if you pay attention in class, take good notes, & do the reading, you'll be fine.

Dr. Moseman is my favorite professor at Baylor. Hands down the most passionate man as well as adorable. His exams are very tricky so study in advance! His reading assignments are pretty lengthy so start them as soon as you can. Basically he is AMAZING! He says a prayer before every test too, which is like so heartwarming.

Dr. Moseman is such a great professor. The last day of class, the whole class lined up to hug him. It makes me sad to know I won't have him again. He is so inspirational and passionate about Christianity and I've learned so much from him! He doesn't just lecture, he actually teaches us about life. The class does require studying though!

Dr moseman is an unbelievable professor. He is amazing. He is totally a christian and really helps a lot. As a non-christian, who never read bible before, I become familiar with bible during this semester, with his help. I am not sure if i can pass Religion if I have another professor. But with his help, I hold my faith, trying my best, and pass it

AMAZING PROFESSOR! His classes are so interesting and engaging. There is, however, a lot of reading to do and there are usually 2 reading quizzes a week, but that's pretty normal for any Religion class at Baylor. The tests are easy as long as you take notes over what he SAYS, not just the power point. He's inspired me to minor in Religion!
If you aren't that into religion, you wont like him. His tests are hard and tricky, especially if you didn't read the bible before coming here

The 1st semester (1301) is really hard. You have homework you HAVE to do, every night. Time consuming, but because I did so much work the first semester, the second semester (1302) was actually easy, because you already knew everything and were reading the  Hebrew bible, which was cool! Lots of grades is good, covers less & evens out if you bomb

Dr. Moseman's one of the best profs I've had.  His tests are difficult, but you'll be fine if you study. He encourages students to participate in engaging class discussion.  If someone fell asleep in his class, it's b/c they chose not to be involved. Don't be shocked if you have to show up to class and do the reading.  This is college, people.
His class was pretty hard. Everything on the tests comes from the notes, but there were always so many dates to memorize!! He is really helpful and friendly though!

He will make sure you know every single thing there is to know about this subject. He is very passionate about this subject which at times is good and others bad. He makes you know all of the dates, so make sure you know them by heart. The final wasn't comprehensive so it was easier then I thought.

Great Teacher! Loved each of his classes; if you fell asleep it was because you weren't listening. Didn't think tests where to bad (got an B+ in his class because I didn't study for two of them). If you take notes and study them you should be fine. Again, thought he was an exciting, passionate teacher.
Hard as heck.  Cries during crucifixion story guaranteed.

pretty hard... but like people said he is really passionate about his class.. i dont really recommend him as a prof bc his class was pretty boring and i fell asleep in there countless times... but he does help out his students and they meet with him outside of class
hard prof. he is a great teacher but his tests are very hard, you have to go to class and talk to him outside of class if you are having trouble he will help you

Very fun class! You need to make sure you read what is assigned, take notes over the important stuff, take notes over what he discusses in class, and you should do really good! he really enjoys his job, you can tell, and he is very passionate about what he is doing. i recommend him as a teacher!

So hard! i had him for 1310 and am a very good student and made a C+, however 1350 was so much harder. you HAVE to go to class everyday... im a religion major and the class was still boring. He has almost daily pop quizzes that are very hard, you HAVE to do the reading, no matter what and his tests are very difficult... my roommate took this class
Dr. Moseman is a great teacher and is really passionate about the scriptures class! Wish I could take him again!!!!

Great Professor. 1350 is much more history based than 1310, so make sure and take very detailed notes. Doesn't know as much about history, but he puts forth effort to learn and know as much as he possibly can about the subjects. Make sure to compare notes, it is very easy to miss something.

Wonderful professor. Knows what he is talking about, scripture-wise. Tests are difficult if you don't take notes. Study in a group and compare notes to do well. Interesting and humorous, he is also not afraid to push classwork aside and get to the deeper meanings inside us all.
Great teacher, you have to go to class... he gives pop quizzes and takes attendance. He is very intresting and really knows his stuff. he is also very willing to help out his students

Random quizs. supper hard test but they are multiple choice. You NEED to show up every day to take notes unless you have a friend you can trust. Over all not fun.Plus I didn't have a seat. He said he would get me one but never did. On test days I had use seat from someone that wsas absent.
He is amazing. The class is tough but he makes it fun to learn.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Park has an amazing way of keeping the students focused in class and eager to learn more. No class is the same. Although the tests were a little difficult, he prepares you. He makes himself available to students if they have any questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Park is great. He cares about the material and explains things well. I enjoyed the class and he made getting an A very doable.
Park is such an amazing professor!!!! My favorite class all semester. Im a freshman so was alittle overwhelmed at first but the class is very doable. He offers up to 7% extra credit too!

Professor Park is super helpful and understanding. If you're struggling or need extra time for something, he'll definitely work with you. At first glance of the syllabus, it seems like there's a ton of work. It really isn't though. It's doable. Only thing, he's super artistic so he makes you memorize a lot of poems and songs. He's fun, I'd take him

Dr. Park is a wonderful professor. He's fun and interactive and understands that Spanish probably isn't your native language. He helps you when you need it and doesn't make you feel like an idiot. You have to learn quite a few songs in Spanish but its not bad. The exams are fair and he reviews the material the day before the exam. 10/10 would take
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: A lot of memorizing of poems. He expects you to know all of the grammar for the class so he doesn't review any. Some tests that are quote identifications from the readings you do which is really unnecessary. Overall, the class is okay, you can get an A but you definitely have to put in work, and honestly you really do not learn much. EC offered.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Park is a great option for those that do not want to take test after test over grammar or write lengthy essays in spanish for an exam grade. However, get ready to memorize a lot of songs and poems (sounds easy, yes, but time consuming) and take four exams in the last two weeks of class. He gives a ton of extra credit and is helpful. Would recc.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Park is incredible! His class was always a positive way to start the day and he really cares about the content, which makes it fun to learn. I often needed more time out of class for homework than I expected, but little actual studying is needed other than the song memorization. His personal experiences also add to the class in a unique way.

Professor Park is an excellent professor who cares deeply for what he is teaching and most of all who he his teaching. He shows compassion and dedication to his students like very few others in the language department. I highly recommend Professor Park.
Fun interesting way to learn Spanish and a great guy. 10/10 would recommend

He's a great professor and a great guy! He made a difficult subject more enjoyable with music and discussion. He was understanding that every student was at a different level of Spanish and made it possible for everyone to learn.
Make sure to read the material, the exams are over each poem and song given in class. Best way to make an A. Also a fair amount of extra credit is given so take advantage if you want a good grade.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Parks is one of the funniest professors I have ever had! He makes learning the material fun!

Dr. Park is a great professor--I genuinely enjoyed being in his class because he is so funny and makes the material more relatable to his students. His tests are just memorization of songs and recognizing poems with a few grammar sections. The class does require a lot of outside work that can get time-consuming but it is Spanish 4 after all.

Dr. Park is extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject. He cares about his students and wants people to learn the language. The class was less focused on actually learning Spanish and more focused on literature. Tests were literally just memorizing poems and songs. The class was still interesting bc he made it fun.

Senor Park is the best professor I've had. The course is hard, and you have to put in your side of the effort, but he makes it easy because he inspires students to learn. It is also obvious that he puts in a lot of work himself into making sure students learn. He teaches with enthusiasm and passion and you'll learn a lot and have a little fun too

Very good teacher! Spanish Literature is not a subject I would see myself enjoying, but I genuinely enjoyed it. He is creative in the way he explains/analyzes poems and he draws the scenario out which is very interesting and keeps the class attentive. You have to memorize many songs and be very familiar with MANY poems but he keeps it reasonable.

Professor Park made me enjoy Spanish culture while learning the language. Through memorizing songs in Spanish, I picked up a lot more vocabulary I wouldn't have learned through studying a textbook. If you believe literary arts such as songs, poetry, and stories are important to a language and culture, you'll love this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Park infuses his humor into lectures in order to help students remember the content better. He is eager and helpful when students attempt Spanish, which is immensely encouraging when trying to speak a language that is not your own. He is fair in grading tests, he sincerely wants to help, and each assignment has a designated purpose. Take him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Great instructor that strives to give good feedback and criticism with work. Takes extra care to work with students having trouble.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Park is incredible. His lectures are fun & entertaining, hes an excellent communicator, & his course is very straightforward. His assignments/exams are a good measure of your knowledge. Make an effort and youll be fine. He cares about his students & their understanding of the material & I loved having him as a professor. DEFINITELY TAKE HIM!!

Dr. Park is absolutely amazing!! He is the best professor I've ever had at Baylor University. He makes the lectures entertaining, and clearly explains the material. He is truly fantastic!! Take his class if you ever get the chance to!!

You know what to expect on each test, so it makes preparation very nice. Lots of online homework, but that's the same for every class, and he curves the grade at the end. Great guy and professor, has great lectures and in class activities which help prepare for the tests.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Great teacher who has a real passion for teaching. He was extremely respectful and truly cares about his students. There is a lot of work for this class and there is essentially 4 final tests at the end of the semester which is too much work for a "4-part" final.

I really liked Profesor Park. He is extremely passionate about his work and cares about literature. He lectures most of the time, but I really enjoyed his comments and opinions regarding literature. He helped me look at literature in a new light.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you read before class and pay attention to his lecture you will probably do well. He makes the topics interesting, and explains them well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Park is a really good professor. He is always willing to help and he speaks in Spanish all the time, which really helps with comprehension of the language. There is light reading every night and an occasional quiz, but nothing too difficult if you study.  I would definitely take him again.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The class lectures weren't extremely helpful for me but I enjoyed the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I really enjoyed Professor Park's Intro to Hispanic Literature class. He helps us understand the readings since none of us are bilingual and it can be difficult to understand poetry, nonetheless poetry in another language. He does weird voices and crazy drawings and is overall a great teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: A lot of online homework, it will take up quite some time if you want a good grade. Really great guy with an awesome personality but a real stickler for rules and a harsh grader. LEARN accent marks, spelling, & conjugations and you will pass!
senor park is muy guapo.  he plays the guitar and sings a lot in class.  speaks too much spanish sometimes.  tests were easy but online workbook is horrible.  he assigned too much homework.
I enjoyed both the readings and the lectures. The lectures did a great job of stimulating class discussion which is a huge part of a Hispanic literature class
Adair is very hard. You better study or get the heck out, not worth the time and money at Baylor.

If you can take this class with any other professor, you better do that. She was absolutely awful. Worst instructor I've ever experienced at Baylor. I've never studied so hard in my life (4.0 AP student in high school) and still made D's on every exam. DO NOT TAKE HER. GET OUT WHILE YOU CAN. SAVE YOURSELF.
Hard Test
Good teacher. Not very hard if you keep up. She doesn't give tons of homework and you can do well on the tests if you read the chapters.
I had Bio II with Adair. I felt that she covered genetics really well, but she's not my favorite teacher by far. I learn all that much, but for an easy A...
Tends to be a little qwerky, but very knowledgeable about biology.
This class was a piece of cake.  If you want an easy A with practically no work required... Take Adair!

Adair taught really well at the beginning; and then her lectures got worse and worse. You need to spend a lot of time reading before classes and writing your own notes, and sometimes you will even have to teach yourself. Her tests get harder each time.
teaching ability is about on par with her grammar...   infer what you will
No Comments
No Comments
Shes bad at explaining things but gives easy daily grades. The tests have NOTHING to do with what you do in class. Be prepared to read a lot.
No Comments
No Comments

I never paid attention in class, never watched thinkwell videos & still got an A on her class.  The only thing I did was to print the Thinkwell notes and study those in depth...because you will not learn much from her lecture.  Take her, read your thinkwells (don't bother w/t videos) & you'l be fine

I never paid any attention in class because it bored me to death.  Definately keep up with thinkwell's or you'll get behind like I did.  Go to SI sessions or study with a friend that knows their stuff because it's easy to get lost.
No Comments
Amazing Class.  I loved it
I had her for Bacteriology over the summer and I can say that she was a great teacher.  She made class fun and the material was not too hard either.  Easy teacher and great teacher.

Everyone says this class is easy, but it is definitely NOT! Don't be fooled into thinking this is a blow off class. Although she is probably one of the easiest professors for BIO if you have to take it...
The class is not bad; go to SI and study well for the exams.  The exams require a good understanding of the material, and could be tricky.  The best thing is the Thinkwell extra credit points.

People say she's EASY. if ur not PreMed, definately take Adair, because you'll get a decent grade.  If you ARE PreMed and dont care if you learn anything or not then take her.  But if you are PreMed and want to know just a little bit of Biology, dont take

She's not bad...worked with her long ago as a lab mate in Kearny's lab.  As far as diversity, she may not be the best candidate (She did graduate from Baylor Grad=poor choice, though if it's between her and Baldrige, take her!!!
No Comments
No Comments
Easy class, you get 10 points on your final grade, do thinkwell
Nice and helpful!
No Comments
Doesn't test from teaching - tests from Thinkwell
Great professor

Professor Reynolds is so amazing. He cares so deeply about every one of his students. This class is an awesome tour through the highlights of American Literature and also includes some very interesting history and background to the authors studied.

I'm a stem major, and would have never imagined enjoying this class as much as I did. The course is very structured and diverse, and Professor Reynolds demonstrates how much he cares about the lives of his students with every single class. I could not recommend this class enough! I didn't want it to end!

I took Dr. Reynolds for English 2310, and his course was truly life-changing. I am not an English major, but his class easily become my most favorite class. I truly looked forward to it. The class is structured to reward those who read and participate. It's not hard because Dr. Reynolds welcomes all opinions and is extremely kind.

Professor Reynolds is the best professor that I've ever had. He encourages his students to look within themselves and the world through the use of literature. His students are well cared for academically, because he creates a non-stressful environment. A typical class consists of a mini lecture followed by group discussion!

Professor Reynolds truly cares for his students and it is evident through the ways he fosters community inside the classroom. I am not one to typically raise my hand and participate in discussions, but he made the environment of the room encouraging and brought everyone in the class into conversation very easily! I am so grateful for him!!!!!!!!!!!

I enjoyed being part of Mr. Reynolds class this semester. A part from academics, Mr. Reynolds teaches in a way that pushes you pass just reading and writing. He wants to see the creative side of you through your essay, reading responses, and final presentation. This class is relatively on the easier side but that doesn't mean you don't learn.

Such an incredible professor! I learned so many important life lessons and grew as a person in his class. He truly cares for every single one of his students. He gives great feedback, is easily accessible, and prioritizes the growth and learning of his students. Taking one of his classes, you will learn so much more than you could ever expect!
Prof. Reynolds is the best!!! Laid back class and lots of group work, assignments are manageable!

One of the best professors I have ever had by far. Really cares about each and every one of his students and works hard to make lectures and class in general interesting and immersive. Would 100% recommend Dr. Reynolds!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: TAKE HIM! There is no better option than Professor Reynolds. I have never had a negative experience in class or ever wanted to leave class before. Pastor Reynolds cares so much about his students and is so personal with each one of his students and cares so much. Professor Reynolds is a professor I wish I can have for every single subject.

Best teacher ever. Easy and relaxing class, while promoting actual good personal thinking. Great life class in general. Everything is basically a participation grade as long as you try, do not take advantage of this, I recommend actually doing the stuff because it is helpful to you in the class and outside. Take him.

Professor Reynolds is an amazing professor who truly cares about what he is teaching. If you have to take American Literary Cultures, he should be your number one pick. He truly cares about his students and is an easy grader! He truly made an impact on me and he has that affect throughout the whole semester. You will not regret taking his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Accessible outside class

comment: Take Professor Reynolds!! Wonderful class. Commit to reading the books assigned and this class will change your life.

Professor Reynolds is the best professor I have ever had. He cares about his students and wants us to learn. He is a very wise man and his goal is to pass that wisdom onto his students and to teach us how to think for ourselves. I look forward to his class everyday.

One of the best English professors I have ever had in my life! It was an absolute privilege to be in the classroom with him. He is incredibly kind and passionate about teaching. Consists of a brief reading after every class, followed by a 200 word response in which he just wants to hear what you have to say. One semester essay and a group project.
The best ever

In all my life I have never met such a down to Earth person as Professor Reynolds. His class was not merely educational but just as inspirational. I looked forward every day to attending his class and being able to be a part of the wonderful and challenging discussions that his class offers. Hands down THE BEST PROFFESOR I HAVE EVER HAD!!
He is absolutely amazing!! Certainly, someone, you should get to know during your time at Baylor. He cares about his students immensely and is incredibly knowledgeable.

BEST TEACHER! He gave easy completion grade responses for homework. The main grades in class were 3 essays, and he lets you edit one for a higher grade. Mine went from a B to an A! He gave us donuts after every essay and gifted us special edition Frankenstein books! He is extremely caring, understanding, and is there to help with any questions.

Professor Reynolds is hands down the best teacher for ENG 1310, get him if you can!  There are 3 major essays, he will allow you to revise one for a higher grade. After completing every essay he brought in donuts for us. And anytime I emailed him he got back to me the same day with detailed thoughts on my writing for me to improve.

Professor Reynolds was by far one of my favorite professors at Baylor. I genuinely looked forward to going to his class, and you could tell that he cared for each of his students and was passionate about what he was teaching. This was one of the few classes I've taken that encouraged me to think about what I was being taught, even outside of class.

Prof. Reynolds is by far my favorite professor at Baylor! He is not only caring and understanding, but he is also extremely passionate about what he teaches which makes the class so much more enjoyable then others! As long as you do the reading, show up to class, and put effort into the reading responses and class discussion, you will do just fine
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: One of my absolute favorite classes I've taken at Baylor. Prof. Reynolds made this course so enjoyable. He truly cares for his students and his teaching extends far beyond the classroom. The prepared readings are manageable and enjoyable. Class time goes by so fast and is filled with engaging activities. Can't give enough praise to Prof. Reynolds!

Professor Reynolds is one of the most influential professors I have had at Baylor. His class isn't particularly hard conceptually, but he really challenges and encourages you to think for yourself. Besides teaching an appreciation for American literature, Professor Reynolds took a humanistic approach and provided lessons that apply to life at large

Professor Reynolds was genuinely one of the kindest people I've met since coming to Baylor. The material that we learned was actually helpful, and he truly cares about each of his students beyond just the classroom. We did have to do reading responses for each class, but they did help in the class discussions. Please take Professor Reynolds!!!

Professor Reynolds is truly an amazing professor. I thought the class was easy because all you really need to do is participate, put some effort into your reading responses/studying for the midterm/final exam and you should do really well in the class. Please take him for English 2310; you will learn so much!

Mr. Reynolds is a super nice man and a great teacher. As long as you read the assignments and take notes on his powerpoints you will do well in this class. I very much enjoyed this class and his style of teaching.

Let me just say that Professor Reynolds is absolutely the best man there is to teach English class. From meditation to movies to nature walks and so many open class discussions, his class was truly the best. You definitely have to participate to get a good grade but every discussion in class is up to the students. 10/10 would have him again ASAP!

Before taking this class, I loved English class. I have never struggled so much in a class. The material is not incredibly difficult, but it's as if he pulls his tests and quizzes out of nowhere. If you're good at dates and memorizing footnotes and maybe even reading his mind, take this class. Otherwise,RUN AWAY. Worst class at Baylor so far.

took 1302 and brit-lit. got a B in 1302 but because it was just like high school. i ended up dropping brit lit. he does ramble and tell bad jokes. felt grading was random. some papers made an A or B some well that's why i dropped. good guy inconsistent professor.i didn't do any reading or notes in either class so idk y my grades were so different

Dr. Araudi was one of the teachers whose insights and teaching still impact my life.  The organizational skills he instilled enabled me to write for other professors, for my corporate superiors (including VP's) in subsequent employment, and for my current vocation as a college educator.  Thank you, Dr. Arid ( Graduated 1983)
This guy is off the wall. He tells horrible jokes and doesn't really teach. He seems nice and tries. He expects a lot from papers... He can talk forever without saying anything. Don't take him

I love Dr. A! He seems a bit austere in class, but he loves to talk with students during his office hours. He loves being an educator, and he has good methodology. Most students don't seem to understand his humor. In his Brit lit class, I learned more than I ever had before about different themes and eras in literature.
Tends to talk a lot without saying much. Funny, but hard. Veeery picky on essays - make sure you at least triple check your work.

Airaudi is an excellent teacher. Explains everything with the utmost clarity and strives to help us all understand the concept. A lot of work, but it's obvious he does what he does to benefit us students, and he does a damn good job. His jokes are ridiculous, so much that we had to make a facebook group dedicated to them. hah.

He is hard to understand and grades very tough. He makes you write papers over ridiculous things when all the other english classes in 1302 had easy subjects to write about. Only about 2 people made a's out of about 20.

i cannot stand going to this class! its all i can do to make myself get up and go. I never understand what is going on or what is expected of me. he rambles on for an hour and a half and i feel like it is a waste of my time.
I took his class over 25 years ago and still cite his teaching in my work as a college.       Dr. Airaudi, thank you.

I HATE THIS CLASS! It takes more energy and will power to go to class and sit through his **** stick figures. He draws female stick figures with **** and then he turns around and says, "does anyone need to go to the nurse and discuss these matters?" ****! My class was nothing but girls. Who does that? Stay away from him. There is better.
I think this guy is a great teacher I would take him for other classes

What everyone is saying is not completely true. He is hard but he makes sure know why the heck you are reading the books you are. If you want to have an easy class with little work this class is not for you. In order to do well you got to get focused and stay interested. I am going to take him for world lit in the fall and Im getting a B in class

His work load and the time he wants you to dedicate to his class is very large and really unfair to those have better things to do than busy work. His lectures are so repetitive and boring and sometimes, he goes in and out of topics and by the end, you have not understood a thing. He grades extremely hard and picky. DONT TAKE HIM!

I can't believe I'm paying for this class! I hate going to this class. You practically just sit there and waste perfectly good sleeping time. Just work on the main review sheet that he gets his questions from in class. Hopefully, time will go by faster for you. Two more weeks....

This guy needs to just quit. It's an easy class but a waste of my time because he doesn't teach anything and just confuses everybody by getting off task. I dread going to this class twice a week, I've learned NOTHING!
This is the most insanely boring class. Dr. Airaudi makes absolutely no sense at all
a good lecturer with material that is hard to stay interested in
Lectures are way too repetative. Hard to keep up with class because he depends so much on Blackboard and not hands on at all. Oh, and he <i>thinks</i> he's funny.
No Comments

If you actually try to be interested in this class and ask questions and volunteer (no matter how idiotic you might feel), Airaudi will LOVE you.  I had a stupid question in the first week but he loved it just because someone was actually talking in class.  He's big on participation and really willing to help... he might come across as a little standoffish on the first meeting, but he really is a great professor if you make even the smallest attempt!

He wasa really straightforward. Basically, if you read the stories, you'll be fine. You discuss them in class and take a REEEAAALLLY EASY Midterm and Final. The paper is probably the hardest thing in the class, but you have all semester and he's really eas

teaches eng lit classes and then bases grades on stupid things like requiring us to finish an unfinished poem. if i'd wanted to be graded on my ability to write poetry i would have taken a creative writing class. that's not a fair thing to base a grade on in a lit ccourse
VERY HARD. I DON'T SUGGEST IT. BUT HE WAS FAIR AND NICE AND VERY HELPFUL. JUST TAKE THE DAMN CLASS! MUCH EASIER.
pretty easy, one midterm w/essay, one final w/essay, one research paper that is course required - he gives review sheets for the two tests, fill them out in class and you're golden.
Actually, even though he's kinda vague, he's pretty flexible & will sometimes let you get credit for cool projects like posting a web page or something.
Hard professor who makes you do weird things in class like draw pictures.  Very vague and hard to follow.  Stay away if possible there are easier ones out there.

People hate on Gipson because chemistry is a difficult subject, but it's likely going be difficult no matter the professor. The textbook readings are extremely time consuming so make sure you stay on top of it. Homework isn't too bad and you give several attempts per question. Tests are hard and average scores always in the 50's. Good luck!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I would never take Dr. Gipson again and I don't suggest him to anyone, especially for CHE 1301! Homework is out of the wazoo. So many assignments it will feel like this is all you're doing and it will eat into your other study time. His lectures were hit and miss. No extra credit. No curve. Our class average on tests was always around 50%. RUN AWAY
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Gipson is horrible. Absolutely horrendous. Don't listen to all the reviews saying he isn't that bad because they are WRONG. My time in his class was possibly the worst experience of my life. Gipson just reads the slides so his lectures are pointless, he gives out an insane amount of homework, and the tests are unnecessarily hard. :(
There is no extra credit, grades are only tests. Tests are vague and anything is fair game. Lectures are boring. He has no connection with students whatsoever. I would not recommend him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: ....... not inspirational, caring, or, sadly, hilarious. The opposite actually. What on earth did I just go through. Run from this man, take anyone else.
terrible :(
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: SO MUCH HOMEWORK! Gipson is a boring lecturer, and just basically reads his own powerpoint. Reading the book and chapters is more helpful sometimes. His exams are scantron so no partial credit. He posts the PowerPoints. Make sure you know the math portions well, and you should be ok. Whole grade is homework and exams, if you can, don't take him!

He had no connection with his students at all. After the snow storm, power was lost for over a week, yet he still did not extend the due date for an assignment (30% of our homework grade), impossible to complete with power fluctuating. The entire class emailed him yet he had no change of heart. His tests don't provide enough time. Do not take him.
Run. Run as fast as you can from this class.

Gipson is a good prof and very concise if you ask him pointed questions.  GO SEE HIM DURING OFFICE HOURS.  Don't expect curve-grading if you intend to goto medical school and get whipped by USMLE boards etc.  You guys whine about lack of curve-grading but I guarantee if asked you would consider yourself a top student, so why do you need the curve??

Wears the same sweater everyday, it is the source of his evilness.  Avoid at all costs.  Would not be so bad if the tests were not so ridiculously hard, "everything is fair game" and no partial credit.  Hard to make a good grade when you can miss no more than 3 problems.

Gipson is a good teacher if you like by the book teachers. He's not personable, or seem to have any connection with his students. His exams are difficult, too, and the class does demand a good amount of studying. He does not curve.

Go to his office! That is the only way he knows that you are actually trying. I'm pre-healthcare but chemistry always gets me. So with this professor there is still hope. The tests are basically examples from class and the ones in the textbook.
Oddly I had trouble in the labs and not on the tests.  He was helpful with the material, but didn't bother to explain why I struggled on the labs.  Good professor, bad structure of the course.

I thought Chemistry couldn't be this hard. Obviously I was wrong. His tests are absurdly hard, due to the fact that he is absolutely vague about what is on the test. When he says everything is fair game, he means it. Lecture, book, practice tests, example problems, everything. Except he's not SPECIFIC.
He is horrible,the students and TAs  afraid with him.He is not helpfull at all and thinks he is the only smart person in this planet.I recoomend Dr.Young for this class.
Gipson does not usually teach 1302 and it shows. His teaching style is way to advanced for a freshman level class and his tests are impossible

Easy to make a B but not an A.  TAKE HIM THOUGH.  You have plenty of room for error considering he drops your lowest test, lab, hw, and report. I hear other 1316 profs don't do that. Be METICULOUS with labs and study for tests.  Don't slack on the hw and reports.

No, Noo, Nooo.  What are you doing?!  Turn around now, while you still have the chance!!!  In the name of all things beautiful, drop this class and add another professor.  I don't know who you are, but I love you enough to write this warning.  He made me cry in Lab, (although the labs weren't the problem-he's just very condescending).
I have never had a professor who turned me off from a subject more.  He is not encouraging, he is not helpful and he always made me feel incapable when I asked a question.

I still have nightmares from taking his class. I think he enjoys failing students. I failed every test and A's on every lab, how does that work. He Does not help out, "what did you do wrong now?" The funny part is that the lab TA's feel the same as the students towards this guy.
He rules Chemistry with the Iron Fist and strikes fear in the hearts of all of his students. His dark reign shall forever cast a shadow over this ancient alchemy of man.
Indeed the dark lord himself
Exams are hard.  Labs are ok.
It's unfair, I got all A's on the labs and flunked all of the tests.  It's a lab course and should be graded as such.  DO NOT TAKE 1316 WITH HIM.  GET DR. YOUNG!

willing to help/answer questions whenever necessary. make sure you study and do the assigned problems for the tests and you will be fine. exams seem to be the major problem in this class, not the labs

Very good teacher! Loves the subject he is teaching, very nice and amusing, teaches very clearly and tells you exactly what you do & do not need to know for tests. Attendance is not mandatory at all, you can skip as much as you want. Must put out some effort & study but it's not hard to get a decent grade. Should take for science credit.

Dr. Greene loves teaching and is a great guy. He is very organized and has the class figured out. Pay attention in class and you are guaranteed a B. Read the textbook and the skies the limit. Likes to talk and get off subject.
Very friendly! He teaches directly from his powerpoints so it makes studying for tests fairly easy. He never takes attendance but does occasionally award extra credit for those who show up!
Quality professor. Attend class and ask questions. He is easily approachable and friendly. Meet with him after class for extra help if needed.
I always loved geography and this was one of my favorite electives. Took intro. to geology with him as well. Botj classes were large and based mostly on multiple choice exams.
Professor Greene is funny and I enjoyed his class (GEOG 1408) much more than I thought I would.

Pretty easy class as long as you study powerpoints. I took beginning geology. He made it somewhat intresting. Usually lets you out early and lots of skip days. Read to help clarify his lectures. Most quiz questions are from the old tests he gives you. USE THOSE!! About 10 questions from exams are taken from old tests. TAKE HIM.

I thought that he was really nice and kind and sweet, however, his tests I thought were difficult!! No matter if I studied all weekend, or just the night before, I made the EXACT same grade - 82. I didn't think it was TOO hard, but it should have been easier. Lots of videos in class and boring lectures. Don't take if you don't have to.
He is a really funny guy and is very interested in the subject. You really have to pay attention in class, and take as many notes as possible.
Easy Class. Read the book for tests and looks over the maps for quizzes. the lectures are boring, lots of movies. overall an easy A.
Class consisted of 4 exams, and a few quizzes. Took zero notes and read the book the night before the test and made it out with a B.  Sit back and take a nap because the lectures are quite boring.
Lectures are kind of lengthy, but provides good effictive information to each region.
Pretty easy. You can pass his test with 90's. Reminds me sometimes of Ned Flanders on the Simsons.
Easy

He is a very good teacher!! The class is very easy!  Yes at times it can be boring......but otherwise it is very interesting.  Print the slides off of blackboard....study for your tests and you will do great!
Great guy. Easy class. Do the work...get an A
The best professor at Baylor, made an easy A!! This guy should be president!!!
He is very easy.  The Greene Machine  Take him and get an easy A. (Old tests are at the library for you to view)
No Comments
Easy tests, bad teacher, babbles
Test information not covered in class; babbles
This guy is the coolest, no final
Super easy, slave to the govt.
rules, ask him about the weather and the government
Nice guy, easy course!!

I have had difficult professors before, but Charlotte Pisors was the most difficult. She was disrespectful towards students, very condescending, and didn't care for the class because of her tenure. No matter if you get everything right on tests, quizzes, or homework she will grade harshly for not writing it "her way". I would not recommend at all!
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Mrs. Pisors seems to be a wonderful woman, however an awful professor. I have taken many upper level classes, but my advisor put me in this class because it fit and was my last requirement. Her class notes, homework, and tests are all different. If you're absent, it is very difficult to make anything up. She is very rude & doesn't answer questions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Her teaching in class doesnt teach you how to do the homework. If you dont understand, shes not good at answering your questions or explaining differently. I had to look through the book and teach myself through trial and error. She is inconsiderate and nit-picky on unimportant details instead of caring about the curriculum. TRY TO AVOID HER.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Charlotte Pisors is one of the worst professors I have ever had. She treats you as though you are in high school and are still a teenager. She does not teach what you need to know for homework, then expects you to fully understand. Test grades are low since she does not tell you what you need to do. Places all blame on the students. Truly uncaring.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Listen, I have always been an AP math student. I consider myself to be very competent in Math. However, this teacher is quite possibly the worst teacher I've ever had. I hope she sees this!!! This woman is rude, biased, and unhelpful. She grades incredibly specific for the lack of knowledge that she has. DO NOT TAKE HER IT IS A WASTE OF TIME!!!!!!!

Unapologetically biased in her grading. The girls in the class consistently get 100+ on tests while the majority of the guys get heavily penalized for 'not doing the work the way she wanted', regardless of whether or not you get the question right or not. People drop he class on the regular, just so that they can have another teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Worst professor ever. She doesn't have a website that she puts anything on and on the first day of school I got a zero for not printing out something I didn't know how to print, along with half of my classmates. When you try to talk to her about something, she just smiles and says I cant help you with that. Drop the class as soon as you can.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: By far the worst professor I have ever had. She teaches every lesson as if it is a quick review, and never explains concepts except for in passing. Avoid this professor at all cost.

I feel that Mrs. Pisors could be an excellent teacher if she cared more about her students. Assignments are not too bad. Always do the homework because she gives "homework quizzes" that are literally writing down what you wrote on your homework. Her lectures aren't very helpful because she gives examples that aren't pertinent to the homework.
Mrs. Pisors is a great professor. She works the toughest homework problems, and gives you bonus points throughout the semester.
Do not take her unless you are a math genius. I wish I had dropped her sooner.  I made a 40 on my first test after studying for hours. RUN and take with another prof.
absolutely terrible.
She's very organized. To do well you need to put in the effort. She won't baby you. She prepares you very well for the final exam. People basically don't like her because she wont hand you an A.

Ok, the first test I studied like normally, I ended up making a 25 on my test! There was a test last week, my friend still in her class said that out of 20+ people, only 2 passed the test!!! If you happen to get her, don't make my mistake and RUN AWAY AS FAST AS YOU CAN!!! Just because she smiles doesn't mean anything, TERRIBLE!!! I tell you!!!!!!!

IF YOU GET INTO THIS CLASS, DROP IMMEDIATELY. She her notes are entirely unclear and she is very scattered. Sometimes she forgets to teach essential parts of the lesson, therefore prohibiting you from accurately completeling the homework. GET AWAY FROM HER AND GET INTO A DIFFERENT SECTION!

This woman is utterly nutty. She is horrible at explaining and always leaves things out of the class notes. She never finishes examples. She is really easily distracted, which does not make for a smooth class.

Friendly, but doesn't know anything beyond pre-cal. Takes a lot of points off in little mistakes from her easy tests (problems taken from the book), and makes lots of mistakes while explaining (erasing the whole problem). Expect to teach pre-cal yourself. Makes me wonder why somebody with her amount of knowledge lectures at a university...

I was so scared reading all the bad comments about her then actually got her in class. Dont be fooled, if you care enough to give her respect she will take care of you and work to make a hard subject easier. Her tests are tricky but she makes up for it dropping one and giving  an easy HW grade.

Worst teacher ever. I learned but the tests where the most absurd I had ever taken. If she disliked your answer, she could count up to 20+ points off per problem. Often times, more than the problem is worth. 70% of her class fail. She failed me, my random roommate the following year took her, and failed as well. RUN AWAY!!!
terrible. Very different teaching style from previous teacher, and not the least bit helpful.

She is  very nice woman, but she is extremely picky when it comes to quizzes and tests. She takes a lot of points off for small mistakes. I do feel as though I have learned, though. It is probably the hardest class I have ever taken.
DO NOT TAKE you will dread her class

Anyone will tell you this class is a waste of time! Pisors is the most unhelpful troll of a math teacher I've ever had. A lot of times she makes the material WAY harder than it should be. Workload's not bad, tests aren't bad....but it's the longest 50 minute class I've ever had to sit through in my life. Run away!
The class was a waste of my parents money- I couldn't learn anything because she doesn't know basic math- so why is she teaching on a college level????

While taking this class, I wanted to jump out of a window. She's terrible., and at times, I just wanted to get up and teach the class myself. Her tests aren't bad, but she takes off a lot of points for stupid stuff--i.e., it's not the way she wants it. DON'T TAKE ANY CLASS WITH THIS PROF.

TAKE HER! She can be pretty disorganized but she was my favorite teacher at Baylor. I took her Women in American Society course and learned so much! She's not very clear with her expectations and goes off topic constantly but if you just ask her for help she's more than happy to (give you an A).
Nice, fun-loving lady who knows EVERYTHING about sociology! Use the study guide she wrote for an easy A on the tests. Take her if possible!

She's a pretty crazy woman, but extremely passionate about sociology and her students.  She wrote the study guide and a lot of her test questions come directly from it.  I got a B without doing much of anything.

She is one crazy lady! Her first test is easy, the second and third ones are harder. Her final is OPTIONAL. She also has optional projects and lots of extra credit opportunities! (Definately try and do some of those.) She also gives extra credit for attendence so I would recommend going to every class (but I didn't.)

nice lady...tells interesting stories and gets involved in class. all you need to do is read powerpoint notes to do well on test. maybe skim over the chapters before a test. offers extra credit for vocabulary work and perfect attendence.  even gives extra credit if she gives you your test later then expected. tells interesting stories.
No Comments
She's one of my favorite teachers this year!
Can be crazy at times but for the most part she is extremly helpful.

She is amazing. I always thought her stories were fascinating. She was inspirational to me over my tenure at Baylor and really shows that she loves her students. I have had the pleasure of taking numerous classes with her and I enjoyed every one.

I loved her! She does brag, but she has done amazing things to get herself to where she is. I don't see it as bragging. I see it as maybe showing students what they might be capable of too! She was one of my 2 favorite profs at BU. She is great to go and t
i love this lady!!!!!! go bears go!!!

Kind of crazy, but a nice lady.  she likes to talk about Thailand all the time.  make sure to do all the extra credit, and attend class.  She gives points at the end of the semester for perfect attendence.  all in all, the class was not that hard, but make sure to at least skim chapters
Kinda crazy.  Has been known to sniff markers in class. Tells bizarre stories, and brings too much politics into the subject.
No Comments
Come on people.  She is dumb.  It's great to get an "A" but can we please try to learn something in sociology?  This is supposed to be a very important class.  NOT WITH HER.
Not very difficult, but she's a great lady.  Kinda out there and likes to toot her own horn, but whatever. It happens to waste a lot of class time.  Get her for intro to sociology
Wonderful professor. Does brag a little bit, but she worked HARD to get where she is.  She's always willing to help you and a great addition to your list of references.
Could she brag any more about being friends with some Asian royalty? No, I don't think so.  I personally don't care.  Plus she gave me the wrong grade on my report card and has yet to change it.  Boo

As long as you live, you will never have a chance to meet anyone as fascinating as Professor Mueller- she is a wonderful professor, mentor, listener, support system and she is PASSIONATE about what she does.  TAKE THIS CLASS!!!
No Comments
Such a sweet lady, and quite amusing to listen too.
No Comments
No Comments
pretty difficult prof, need to know stuff to do well
She's great! You know she cares and she is very understanding.

Be prepared that this will most likely be the hardest class you'll take at Baylor, but hard work truly pays off. You will have to really be on top of the material in order to not fall behind. Dr. Taylor is so amazing and caring. He truly cares and is super helpful during office hours!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Straight up awful teacher. Dream crusher. DO NOT RECOMMEND. TAKE CLASS ELSEWHERE. AVOID UNLESS YOU WANT EARLY GRAY HAIRS. Totally unnecessary how ridiculous this class is.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Taylor is super smart and for sure knows what he is talking about, but he goes pretty fast paced and it gets pretty hard to keep up if you don't work on it EVERY DAY. His class is pretty difficult, but it is the most i feel like I've ever learned. I would recommend
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Hes nice, but could be better.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Taylor's bio 2401 and 2402 classes are very challenging since they are anatomy&physiology. He cares about his students and works hard with all of his students outside of class to do his best to care for his students. Very challenging class, lots of work and reading but pays off in the end. Don't slack off and go to every class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I loved this teacher! I took him for Bio 2401. It was a very hard class, but he was always available outside of class and really cared for his students. I would say as a warning: keep up with your textbook and, unless you have a legitimate excuse, do NOT be late for class! Owe my gratitude to Dr. Taylor

Dr. Taylor is very caring and extremely nice and always available, but this class... I was an RN in the Air Force for 6 years and the stuff he teaches is honestly too in-depth and not useful when it comes to real world nursing. Theres so much work required, you don't really end up learning anything trying to finish it all. Do NOT take if full time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Taylor's class is a work of art. He loves what he teaches and really wants you to succeed. GO to his office hours, talk with him about the material. I'm sure he's heard every "stupid question" in the book during his 31 years of teaching. Work hard, ask for God to give you strength-you can do it.

This is the nicest man you will ever meet and the hardest teacher you will ever have. You will really have to push yourself but Dr. Taylor is very helpful and wants to help you succeed. He is hard on the nursing students because he knows how difficult our jobs will be later on. Definitely take this class if you want to be well prepared!

BE READY TO WORK YOUR BUTT OFF. The textbook will be your bible. You MUST study and UNDERSTAND the material, not just merely memorize it. Quizzes(plural) every class. Taylor has a quirky and dry sense of humor. It may seem like he wants to kill your dreams of being a nurse but he is very willing to help you succeed. This class takes 100% effort!

This course covers more material than any student is capable of retaining, regardless of intelligence. Even worse, you are quizzed almost every class over the ridiculus amount of reading homework. His on-the-spot examples and humor distract from what you are suppose to learn and just waste time. Outside sources must be used if you want to pass.

I'm convinced this class was designed after a MEDICAL school class. It is ridiculously and unnecessarily hard. He is evil hiding behind the mask of a nice, smiling man. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! This class will kill you on the inside.

This class is seriously THE HARDEST class I've ever taken. If you can avoid it, do. You learn A LOT of information, and you have to know little details, not just general concepts. My advice...STUDY STUDY STUDY all day every day.

This was the hardest class I have ever taken. Many people do not pass this class and have to retake it! Avoid this professor if you have trouble with testing!!! His tests are multiple choice but were so hard! I studied everyday for hours and read each chapter about 3 times each. He uses his own written book!

stay away if possible. even though he is very nice, he is SOOOO HARD.i studied non stop and i still did horrible. he is pretty boring in class and the lab is like 3 hours long. its a very time consuming class, and you need to keep up. the class avg. was like a 62 so brace yourself. many dont pass the first time.
Really difficult class, but I learned sooooo much. He is a great teacher, but has high expectations for his students. Wrote a great rec letter for me!
A mother of a class! Whoa buddy those were hard!

He's a good teacher, you learn a lot from his class, but it's really hard to make a good grade in this class unless you spend like 6-10 hours a week studying for it.  VERY time consuming class.  Most people have to take it twice or 3 times before making a decent grade.  Good Luck.
He is an evil Mr. Rogers
He's a disgrace to the profession of teaching!
He's extremely creative.  You can get an A in this class but beware that the tests are all comprehensive so stay caught up on the old material throughout the semester.

If you thought 2402 was gonna be like 2401, good luck. It's a LOT harder.  Just pay attention in class and study. That's all i can say. Love Dr. T, he's the nicest guy ever. He just likes to drown you :)
No Comments
Great teacher!  Very friendly and helpful.  You have to work in his classes, but he works with you too.

(HIS1300) One of the best professors I ever had. Tells history like a story so it's easy to take notes. Take good notes, they are vital for your midterms which are large chunk of your grade. Go to midterm reviews with your TA.

I have always struggled with English, but under the instruction of Dr. Smith my writing abilities increased ten fold. He is very likable, respectable, and articulate. He clearly states what is expected for every assignment and is lenient if issues arise. I enjoy conversational classes and he is a very conversational professor. I recommend highly!

Dr. Smith's FAS 1304 class was not very difficult. It's a class where you get the opportunity to speak and question. It is very conversational and he gives you the freedom to make an argument on readings, but make sure you read or the class itself will be very difficult and make sure to respond to discussion posts on Canvas in order to succeed.
Dr. Smith will make you fall in love with history. His lectures are incredible. He tells history like a story. Be prepared to take a ton of notes, but they are notes worth having.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: I am totally and completely in love with this guy... well his mind at least!! He is an amazing teacher and his lectures are very informational and a lot of fun! I would totally recommend him to anyone at Baylor University.

BEST TEACHER EVER. I'm not a history guru, but he makes me wish I was a history major. Every day is a blast and he really makes you eager to learn more. He tells history like a story and it's absolutely fabulous. TAKE ONE OF HIS CLASSES. Downside = no text book, all test material comes from his lectures so attending class is MANDATORY

this professor is one of the worst professors i have ever worked with. we are supposed to be doing a research paper. all it says on the syllabus is more info to come. it has been 10 weeks and no such information has been shared with the class

The absolute best professor i have ever had, not in just a history class,but overall. It is not an easy class though. You have to take notes on his lecture, he gives no notes or powerpoints or anything. Also no textbook. Take GOOD notes, go to class (a must!), and study all your notes for the tests. Tests are 100% Fill in the blank. 3 essays(easy).
He is so hot

This class was like having story time every day.  He makes history even more fascinating than it already is and really wants his students to do well.  He doesn't use the textbook, so lectures are the only way of getting information for the tests, but the tests are easy.  Go to class anyway! It's one of the only fun classes here!
Great lecturer...definitely go to class. There is no textbook, so his lectures are really important!!

If you can, take one of Dr. Smith's classes.  He is one Baylor's best professors, not only because he loves what he teaches, but because he also cares about his students.  Sitting through his class is like having story time.  He injects life and meaning into history, has a funny vocabulary, and he knows his stuff.  Great personality, too.
AWESOME teacher. Easy to talk to and a fun class!
An excellent lecturer. He made history exciting to learn about. His passion for history is contagious. The tests were easy and book reviews simple enough if you read. One of Baylor's finest.
hands down the best professor at BU
I hate history, but I looked forward to this (8 AM) class!!!  He is very animated and interesting.
He is so passionate about history.  He loves to teach and will help anyone in need.  Fair tests and not too much work.  Definatly get him!!!
he's the best history teacher at BU
He's amazingly kind and wonderfully witty. He's passionate and invested in the material, and always interested in his students' lives. Take him.
I don't have him for small group, but his large group lectures are exceptional.  He seems really interested in the material.
No Comments
No Comments
exceptional lectures, too many quizzes and reading material

Kirk WILL memorize the front three rows of the class and call on them for questions. If you are on your period don't tell him. Likes people to ask questions, very cool about it. A very busy man, don't waste his time. I never had a grandparent, if i could adopt one, i would take him in a heart-beat.

Dr. Kirk is a great guy, but the class itself is one of the toughest I've taken! Lectures can be helpful, but your grade really depends on reading the textbook. The class is also graded competitively, and your chances of an A or B are higher when you get a better TA. The only reason this class isn't graduate level is because of the memory jogger!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Horrific. While he's a sweet guy and I personally think he's great, the class was extremely hard. His lectures are hard to understand, and it's even harder to understand his handwriting. I learned nothing in his lecture, and the only gleam of hope is the lab professor. The class is hard for the sake of being hard.

It is true that Dr.Kirk's class is one of the hardest one you will ever have in statistics. That's because he knows "everything"! However in return, you will learn a lot more than from any class you've ever had. He is just a fabulous prof both academically and personally. Definitely recommend if you are prepared.

Dr. Kirk grades competetively, which means that 25% of the class will fail, even if they actually do have a passing grade. 40% of the students will have to retake the class. Who you get for your lab TA really makes the difference. Even if your TA does not require it, do extra problems from the book to help you understand the concepts.

Sweetest, funniest little guy in the world.  He would always turn around mid-lecture and say, "You don't care do you?  Oh well, I tried, but I failed."  However, his class was the absolute hardest class I had in all of Psych courses.  I had no business passing that class and somehow ended up with a C.  Plan your courses carefully around this class.

Wow. I learned NOTHING in lecture, but I have to give the man props-if you have a problem in his class, he will bend over backwards to help you if you go talk to him. Very sweet guy, but I can't tell you a single thing about statistics.

Dr. Kirk is a GREAT teacher.  I thought this class was gonna suck royally from all the negative things I had heard, but he made statistics enjoyable.  He is the funniest and sweetest old man.  You definitely need to read the book and put a lot of notes on your memory jogger, but as long as you pay attention and work you should make an A easily.

I don't think I learned ANYTHING from this class! I just took a stats course in grad school and finally learned it! The memory jogger is a great thing, but you don't learn anything from having it. I made an A in that class and couldn't tell you anything th
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Dr. Kirk is very sweet, but honestly, all I learned from him were ballroom dancing steps.
Good lord.  Get someone whose ADD to sit next to you.  They make it interesting.  He's a great guy, special individual, but very kind a patient.  If your TA is bad, get out and go to another session.
Oh man. Dr. Kirk is a special individual. Very kind but seriously, going to lecture is JUST for attendance points. Bring something else to do! Pray you have a great T.A. :)
The key is to teach youself or learn in through lab. Learn more of the concepts than the actual math. It's not as bad as everyone makes the class out to be. In other words, its hard for a psyc class.
Nice guy.  Very hard class.  You will learn everything in Lab.  Take stats somewhere else.
No sympathy for what you're going through, but he WILL try to make it worth your while.  Call him at home, he really doesn't mind!
Put page #'s on your memory jogger!!
Very nice man. Hard to understand. To smart to teach effectively. Hard class!!!!
stats is tough, but don't fall asleep in class or you'll miss his dance lessons
not an easy teacher, then again, who could make stats easy??
Stat is hard- but maybe he'll jump up and dance

I had Dr. SJ Murray for Great Texts 2301 (Intellectual Trad Ancient World), and the class was great.
Along with the TA Courtney, they provided good guidance and following through the heavy books we read.
As long as you have read the text for class, you will be fine.
Again, she's great, supportive, insightful, and helpful!

Dr. Murray is by far the best professor I have had. Instead of being like most professors who just try to cram everything from five chapters of reading into one lecture, she chooses specific passages that are important to understand and contribute to the overall reading. She is very much into participation so she can make sure we all understand.

Screenwriting course. Dr. Murray is an amazing prof. She even gave us an advance PDF copy of her new book because it wasn't released yet. She is a filmmaker and screenwriter, so she shares tips she uses in her own work. Story design blew my mind. Once we outlined carefully, we workshopped scenes and got TONS of written and verbal coaching.

This is an inspiring class. Dr Murray constantly motivated us. One day, she called us out when some of us had not done the reading. We promptly (and fairly) were presented with a test the next week and learned our lesson. She expects you to read closely and work hard. Her dog is an added bonus. She also is always willing to help students who ask.

I had Dr. Murray for USchol Great Texts and she made it so enjoyable! Every day she finds a way to connect what is happening in the books we are reading to our lives. She really wants us to succeed and become better people. She's not super hard, she let us redo our first paper if we didn't do as well as we wanted. And she brings her dog!
My mind was blown every class period. I've never had such an engaging professor. I was so excited to come to class every day!

Dr Murray is the best professor at Baylor. Without a doubt. Take her for anything you can. She will push you to think big and think specific, and encourage you to give your best and go out and do something with your life.

Dr. Murray is amazing. She even involves students in her research and gives them opportunities to publish with her. I am sad to hear she will be on sabbatical this fall. She never lectures, really involves students in the discussions. She's super hard and demanding, but it's worth it. I've taken her Great Texts course and French Art course. Great!!
Dr. Murray is hands down the most talented professor at Baylor. No question. One semester can change your life, your goals, and help you define your dreams.
Dr. Murray is awesome. She will make you work and it's worth it. One semester in her class, and you'll not only understand the difference between Being and Becoming, you'll live it.

SJM is AWESOME! Her class has quickly become a rite of passage for honors students--and I'm proud to have completed it. Seriously, this course is a lot of work. But, as everyone has said, it is really worth it. You'll gain a whole new perspective on life and on school, while learning more about medieval great texts than you could imagine.

Dr. Murray can TEACH! She will also assign more work than you ever DREAMED OF! (And you will love the class even more for it.) I came into the class (on King Arthur) hearing that her students loved her, and I thought they were a little crazy. But now I understand why. A class like this makes college worth it!

Professor Murray is truly an exceptional teacher.   I did NOT want to take Great Texts at all, but of course the honors department forces us to.  I have never learned more in my life.  She is incredibly excited about the material and will get you excited too.  You have to work hard, but your reading, writing, and thinking skills will improve.
Dr. Murray is great. Inspiring, attentive, knowledgeable. Demanding? Yes. But fair and challenging. If you came to Baylor to have your mind expanded, take her class.

One word describes my experience in this class: unbelievable. It was a life-changing experience. Never have I had so much fun and learned so much, and wanted to work so hard. Everyone gets to know each other and Dr. Murray. Even if it has nothing to do with your major, take her class! It's amazing.

Sarah-Jane is one of the best profs i've ever had. I didn't want to take great texts, but she made me like it.  She expects a lot, but makes you want to do it, and her discussions make you think and learn differently.  I will be forever changed by her class, and will always remember: participation!
Dr. Murray is a great woman. Shes an excellent teacher and will change your life. work hard and be respectful.

The best course (and also the hardest) course I've taken all year. Well, ever. Dr. Murray is a totally inspiring lady. She knows her stuff and wants you to learn it too. I will take every course she ever teaches during my time at Baylor.

This class is hard. And it's awesome. A paradox? Yes. Especially to me. But Prof. Murray's teaching style is infectious. I dare you to take this class and not like it. Prof. Murray will lead you out of the cave. I'm now going to minor in GTX.

Prof. Murray is awesome. HARD: she won't accept less than 100%; but awesome. If you're an honors student, you shouldn't leave Baylor without a course by her. It's only 4 weeks into the semester, and I'm already hooked.

Prof. Murray expects a lot from her students, so you'll have to work hard in her class. Soon you won't be worried about that, though: she somehow manages to make you interested in learning... more and more. Only Danger: you'll probably change your major.
Fantastic Courses!

I took Anthropology of Religion(ANT 4360) with Dr. Cook after seeing all of the good feedback on here. Worst mistake of my life!! he's an AWFUL lecturer STAY AWAY from this class if your not good at essays. His grading makes no sense and he grades extremely hard! get ready to read a lot in this course. Good luck!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I took a class with Dr. Cook each year I enjoyed learning from him so much. His religion, witchcraft, and magic class brought me some of my closest friends and changed my major to anthropology. If you have the chance to take him for any of his classes, it is well worth it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Cook was very informative, he would spit random knowledge or tell us about his odd experiences out doing field studies.
