As for the class it's self, It was basically self taught, if you kept up with your assigned readings the class was a no brainer because all we would really do was discuss the readings. The test came from the readings as well.

I literally wasted 3 college credit hours on this class. Dr. Cook may be a nice person, but he's an AWFUL lecturer. If you see Religion, Magic & Witchcraft in the course listing, STAY AWAY. It is the most boring, pointless waste of time you'll ever have.

Dr. Cook is a little bizarre and hard to follow at times, but he is incredibly intelligent and interested in his subject matter. His tests are all essay formatted, but he is lenient. As long as you do the readings and retain the information, you'll be fine. I don't suggest taking him for intro courses because he can be hard to handle.

I had Dr. Cook for some advance level Anthro courses and I really feel that I learned a lot.  He is extremely versed in the Mayan culture.  Great guy and mentor.  I could see how someone might get bored in an intro class.  If you can take him for a junior or senior level class, please do so.  Especially if you take a field study course.
Intro to An. This class was so easy. Professor Cook is a nice guy and a little quirky. He knows his stuff and only things talked about in class are on the test. Easy class. Take him.
Such a nice guy! Dry sense of humor. I wasn't interested in ANT but he made it more interesting than I initially found it. I would recommend him as a teacher.
Seemed to pick favorites.  Not very interesting, but to his credit its hard to talk evolution with someone badgering every 2 minutes about the bible.
good person, seems unorganized

If you can get past the surface, he's incredibly funny, though he is usually very dry.  Lectures can be tedious, but they're usually only once a week, so in the general scheme of things it's not that bad.
No Comments
Boring, horrible class. Cook's a nice guy, but if you're looking to take Anthropology at Baylor, find another professor ASAP. Staying with that class all semester was torture.
boring lecture. but nice guy.
not the most interesting person but he has his funny moments to wake the class up.  tests aren't really hard but be very specific on the essay questions.
get the hell out! BORING  BORING. and i made an A. how can somebody be so boring?

Okay so this class isn't that hard... if you can stay awake through the droning.  This guy is seriously one of the most boring people I have ever encountered. He goes to the clock everyday and never says anything. Take someone else!

Yawwwwwwn. No Offense, Dr. Cook, if you ever read this, but you need to do something about your style, bud. I tried so hard to keep my eyes open, especially sitting close to the front. I found myself staring into thin air and drooling most of the time!
Boring as HELL.  you can do better take someone else.
He expects more out of people than they are willing to give (including myself).  This is not a blow off class.
No Comments
No Comments

I once approached Dr. Olson at his office to inquire about a question relating to semantics: "If hydrolysis is the breaking of a bond, shouldn't analysis be the breakage of the anus?" Let's just say, he answered via nucleophilic backside attack. WOULD DEFINITELY RETAKE!! SO KNOWLEDGEABLE! BEST PROFESSOR AT BAYLOR. HE IS A MUST-TAKE!!!!
rating_tags: Inspirational--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: instructor expects you to be at college level chemistry and forget everything you know. Does not clearly teach material in class, goes over how to hypothetically do the problems then asks you to mathematically do them on the tests.
He teaches with his own book over the Tro book that everyone else in Chem 1301 learns.

If you can avoid this professor, AVOID HIM! He rambles on and on about the Law of Laziness and how his way is easier and therefore better. It is not and will not help you in any chemistry later on. His textbook (that he wrote) is 4 chapters and is finished by week 6. He repeats the entire lesson from the previous day as he forgets his spot. Avoid!!

Highly recommend increasing your level of caffeine before class. Olsen isn't very clear about what he's teaching and you have to figure it out on your own for the most part. He wants you to do Chemistry his way, so beware; he does tell you to forget all that you knew about Chem from beforehand so I guess it was expected...

Rambles on & moves w/ remarkable speed; there is no time to digest anything. Has created a method of doing every kind of problem that relates to what he calls The Law of Laziness, and each method shown is ridiculously & unacceptably confusing.  Scales down grading scale every year b/c nobody ever does well. I beg of you, avoid this professor.
Nice guy outside of class, but not a good teacher. Avoid if possible!!
absolutely zero textbook use

Dr. Olsen has his own style of teaching. I don't learn much in class; actually I zone out from boredom, but printing and reading the notes is helpful, and a sure way to pass the quizzes. Office hours are more beneficial than class.

Do not take this teacher, he wrote his own book and teaches from it but it is more confusing than it is helpful, all he does during lass is read over the notes that he makes you prin off, he dosnt do any of the math problems which makes it difficult to understand and it makes the class boring because all he does is stand in front and mumble
No Comments

Dr. Olson's class was difficult for me at first because I was not accustomed to programming a calculator.  I spent a lot of time in his office, and once I understood where he was coming from - he made Chemistry so easy!  Try to understand the broad strokes and comes into focus after that.  He's quirky and not at all eloquent - but he's brilliant!

He tries to teach from his own book which he claims is easier because he's lazy.  He even says this, everything goes back to how lazy he is.  Class is basically sitting in the desk, listening to him read the notes back to you until you're completely lost, bored to tears or both.
I am taking this guy right now, and I have yet to learn anything about Chemistry, and I even work for the Chemistry and BioChemistry Lab.  This guy is a joke.
his class sucks. and its hard to understand. in the middle of class he would give us a break so he could go outside and smoke a cigarette.
Worst teacher ever. He does nothing but read the transparencies and mumbles...it's just awful.
Awesome P-Chem class!  One of the best classes I ever took.
I have to take chemistry 1301 again because of this guy.  I don't think I learned anything...
TERRIBLE!!! He doesn't explain anything and is VERY UNCLEAR!!  DON'T TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN AVOID IT!!!!!
No Comments
No Comments
Physical Chemistry Sucks.

Dr. Pennington is the sweetest professor. I wouldn't recommend taking his class if you have little prior knowledge of chemistry. His lectures can be very confusing, but he is always willing to help you. Dr. P allows you to retake all quizzes and tests for a maximum of an 80. If you are good at chemistry, I would highly recommend him.

In my opinion, Dr. Pennington relied too heavily on various abbreviations/symbols that students did not know, making it difficult to follow lectures. You MUST study, and study hard. I never went to the SI sessions, and made a B+ in his class. He is extremely helpful and allows you to re-take tests for partial credit. You'll definitely learn a lot!

This guy may be great in the classroom, but his approach to online classes is awful. I can't decide if it's because he doesn't know what he's doing or he doesn't care. He gives confusing, often incorrect directions that he has to correct later. The curriculum (which has typos) and approach to the subject leave a lot to be desired.
This class if fine if you study the old tests that he gives you, and you MUST go to his help sessions every week!

Dr. Pennington is a great teacher, a person would be lucky to get him over any other chem profs. Yeah he is hard, but he explains himself in everyway possible, and yes you need to attend an SI session once a week, if you can't make that then get out of his class.
Dr Pennington is an awesome and funny teacher but OMG he is hard. Especially for all you pre-med students because he is also is the Pre-Med Advisor at BU!  Good Luck!!
This guy was amazing. If all professors were as good as he was, I would never dread going to class.
He absolutely rocks!
good teacher go to his help sessions before the weekly quizes and exams
Very hard teacher, terrible at explaining things, assume you remember everything you learned in high school chem.  Jokes are NOT funny.  Required to attend SI one night a week at his convenience.
Very difficult prof...expects a lot from those who may not have had chem since sophomore year of high school.  If you cannot attend the SI meetings, he tends to think you do not care enough.
Great teacher, he'll bend over backwards to help you out. Take him if it's possible. He is pretty tough though, great joke-teller
Difficult prof/class, but he is well versed on the material.  Go to SI meetings.
He is a great professor.  Keep up with the HW and the class will flow better.
Great Teacher, Very Helpful. Take him if you can!
i've have never had him as a professor, but he is a good pre-med advisor
he is a good teacher and very funny i learned alot from him
lots of memorization and studying for the tests and quizzes
he is a great teacher!!!   he makes chemistry interesting anf fun!
Very demanding prof. you will learn everyting you wanted, bit tough
Too much technicality to be of use.

The worst teacher you will have at Baylor.  He doesn't know anything about speaking.  It's like he gets up there and makes up stuff for an hour.  Everyone is on their phones or asleep.  He gives 2 tests that are all free response and answers must be word for word.  It is the worst hour lecture you will ever sit through.  DO NOT TAKE HIM EVER!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. English is not the most pleasant man to deal with if you ever have to personally speak to him, which you typically don't. Most all your work is done with your individual TA, all of which do the work for Dr. English. He's a pretty snide guy who talks the whole period and expects verbatim definitions and answers from his lectures.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class was terrible. Don't take it unless it is a last resort because he is a terrible lecturer and his lectures are so incredibly long. I would constantly look at the clock trying to will the time to go faster.
Go to class, extra credit points given for attendance. Hardest test of my life, all open response.

No class on Friday! Grading is left pretty much up to you- Must make 5 graded speeches with a small group and you must take 2 exams, a third if you want to. There's an attendance incentive policy which you can opt-in to, which can help your grade. The tests are VERY hard, as in, you must quote his lectures VERBATIM to receive full credit.

took his class twice. failed both times due to attendace. completly went against the america disabilities act when i came to him with drs notes about my attendance and for my dyslexia and made it very hard for me to take my tests on test days, most the time his ta was late handing out my test so i didnt get enough time to work on it...

I thought he was hilarious. Easy teacher. Tests are open ended but they are straight from the review and if you take notes during the lecture you will get a 100. And his lectures basically consist of him telling funny stories. This class will be an EASY A as long as you get the right speaking group instructor.

Arrogant, boring, long-winded man. Easy class if you get a good TA to for your speaking group, but it's always a risk you take. Not a hard class but his lectures are so boring and dry it makes you want to cry being forced to listen to it.
He was very easy to understand and very good at communicating!  I loved his class!

Going to his class was so boring! And if you were on time you were probably late.  It was nice we didn't have to go to class on Friday's, but we had to meet an extra day in the week to give our speeches and they ask way too much out of for for the extremely short time frame you have to do it in.

Very good lecturer, but not someone I'd want to approach outside of class (arrogant.) His tests are not straight from the study guide, but you have to know that study guide verbatim--no improvising. Doesn't lecture on Fridays, but you have to meet once every other week with a TA and a group of 10 to give a speech. I recommend him.
AWFUL!!!!  Very boring and you have to meet outside of class to give speeches.
BORING and a lot of busy work
No Comments
i could NOT STAND him!

Unless its for Pub Speaking do not take him. His Persuasion Class was awful. He's very hard headed, unapproachable, and confusing. His test arent that easy but mostly the day to day class is awful. The semester project also takes forever to do especially if you already have a busy semester!
Depends on the TA you get to grade the speeches whether or not you will get a good grade. Not that easy of a class
very easy speech teacher
This guy is rude and late to class. He has to have his smoking break. Then, he comes into class, stinking the whole place. He also likes to get good profs fired. He stinks, literally and otherwise.
He's not the most interesting guy to listen to.  He tells the same stories over and over again, but it's an easy class.
No Comments
Expects too muuch really

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Unfortunately, this class is mandatory and she's the only one that teaches it. She gives an obscene amount of assignments and homework on a weekly basis and will grade the work very harshly. Exams are weighted very heavily and are extremely hard. She is also guilty of giving incorrect/incomplete lectures
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Unnecessarily strict grading for a course that is irrelevant to 95% of its students. She is an extremely harsh grader, yet fails to give in-depth explanations in class. What I mean by this is that she expects very details responses on exams but if you ask her to answer it, she will give you a 1-2 sentence response. Lectures are useless.

Practicums are very hard. Tests are very hard. She will deduct serious points for inefficient code, so watch out. Does not give good feedback. Scatterbrained lectures. Unfortunately she is the only prof who teaches this course and it is mandatory.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is you typical engineer. Terrible organization... Is notorious for losing tests, which she then blames her students for and gives them zeros even though it is her fault. Be prepared to spend at least 3 hours a week in her office hours going over programs so that she will actually pass you on them. Worst grader I have ever had.

Tests are pretty hard, practicums can be confusing and difficult. She ruins everyone's GPA. You really have to read the textbook and practice practice practice the programming assignments. She is also a terribly harsh grader.

As a person she is lovely person. As a professor her grading style is horrendous and absurd. I was not a big fan of her as a professor but would love to talk to her outside of class with things that did not involve class work.

Wonderful person, all smiles, great personality. But a horrible teacher. Class consists of her writing examples and either answering questions with extrememly obscure answers or telling us no to ask questions. She's unorganized and has always fallen behind schedule in the three classes I've taken with her.
She's a wonderful teacher. One of the better teachers i've ever had.
Fun teacher and a unique personality. I wish I would've tried harder, since she really wanted me to succeed.
Great stuff.  Her first semester teaching m68k assembly, so I forgive the technical mistakes.
she is a very fun teacher that truly teaches well, and she gives you all the slides from class so notes are nice. and extremely helpful.
Wonderful person, Excellent teacher, Non-stop laughs!!!
the posters below are stupid, she's by far the best teacher in the department.  i wish she taught some of the tougher classes
NICE BUT HARD ...she will be your best friend if you want but you won't get a great grade...even if you try.
Really good teacher and presents material in a helpful, understandable way.
Tough classes, but she gives a clear presentation of the material and is very helpful outside of class.
Excellent teacher, very informative
No Comments
No Comments
He wouldn't really take questions during or after class, and would usually point you towards SI or tutoring center rather than help you himself.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Not a helpful professor at all. Would not recommend him at all for at least his online class. He grades tests in a way I have never seen before. If you do something a slightly different way than how he taught it, he will certainly fail you, even if you got the correct answers.
He wouldn't offer help if you failed something. He just told you to contact other baylor people for help instead. He didn't even teach :(

Tests are tough but that's because there is a guide he needs to follow since the final is a departmental final. Sweet guy, really cares about his students. His passion for math makes lectures easier to understand.

Dr. Bryan is the best! He takes time to make sure we understand exactly what we need to know for the departmental final. He says that his students do better than most of the Calc 1 students on the final, which is encouraging. If you do your homework and take the practice exams, you will ace the quizzes and tests. He is also very available!

This professor did an outstanding job of teaching calculus. His lectures are on point and he explains things thoroughly. That being said, this is a difficult class, you have to keep up with the homework (his quizzes are just recopying your homework answers). I would recommend him.

I have never passed a math course once I got to advanced algebra. I had to retake precal bc I had failed it the first try. Next semester, I go in just trying to pass and bc of this teacher, the way he teachers... It's incredible. I got an A! I nominated this teacher, he is that great. Choose him everytime.
Hated math, but loved his class. He made it understandable, even if the tests were tough!
Prof. Bryan is a great Professor! He gives easy quiz grades and tells you exactly what will be on the exam. Very helpful.

Great teacher! never had need for the textbook, except do to homework. Test were a little difficult, but the homework quizzes really helped. Attend lectures and do homework and you'll pass. Loved his country accent! "Who would have thunk it?"
Not very easily understood.
one of the absolute best professors at Baylor
He's a good teacher if you willing to do the work... You either love him or hate him, I personally thought he was a pretty good teacher, and is approachable for help and actually helps you learn.
No Comments
Class is random, he goes off on a tangent talking about things completely unrelated to math... impossible to pass
Very helpful and really cares about what he does. Great!
Nice guy but wasnt very helpful.  He doesnt cover the entire subject.  Basically skims over each chapter.  I dont recommend this professor.
Great professor.  As long as you study and work the assigned problems, the class is not too hard.  He brings a different perspective to Calculus, and I would definitely recommend him.  :)
I HATED HIM
one of the absolute BEST profs, unique teaching style, fun  & you learn a lot!!!
A lot of people love her and a lot of people don't. Personally, even if her teaching style had worked with my learning style, I found her harsh and rude and I'm going to try not to take her again.

Please be prepared to teach yourself the material!!! and attend all SI!! SI is the only way you could possibly make a B or higher in this course. Her lectures are attendance required however they are just pictures she over explains and complicates. Her office hours are useless unless you have very specific questions to ask.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Terrible professor in virtually every aspect of teaching. Makes attendance mandatory just to show you lectures full of pictures and little to no context whatsoever. Graded on 4 exams (lowest dropped) and final exam. An absolute embarrassment to Baylor University considering how expensive it is to attend here. Get ready to teach yourself everything!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Doesnt really teach during lectures so do notes before. We have LA's that do reviews every friday and provide practice tests with explanations. Our SI has been amazing with providing videos on canvas and great sessions and just a great help. Only grades are tests with occasional extra credit that we voted to go toward our final, takes attendance

Difficult course material, but Dr. Luna is AMAZING! She is caring and hilarious, makes biology enjoyable! Would definitely take again! She does have a very thick accent, and moves through material quickly, but was very good!
Heavy accent
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Explains content really well in class, exams are over a lot of material so start studying early. Her lectures can be boring at times, but she tries to make it interesting. Exams are 40 questions long, so be prepared for specificity on certain topics. All PowerPoints are posted, just not everything in lecture is same. READ THE BOOK it helps so much!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I loved Dr. Fernandez-Luna! I took her for two semesters BIO 1305 and 1306. She is a very caring person and if you can get past her accent, she is a great lecturer and you can tell she is very passionate about biology. She doesn't give homework; I struggled with having to study on my own. Grades are only test-based. Definitely go to SI!
She reads from PowerPoint. Does not cover information on test. Be prepared to teach yourself. Not at all accessible. Don't take her.
This class is awful she makes the whole grade based on four extremely hard tests, her lectures are useless and she does not teach what is on the tests. I hate her class more than any other.

Dr. Luna is not encouraging or welcoming, in fact she encouraged us to change our majors because her test average was a 50 something. You're only graded on tests that don't match the lecture. She doesn't answer emails. Her lectures are her just speeding through powerpoints. Don't take her if you can help. Probably the worst experience I've had.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: All she did was run slide by slide with barely any time on each one making notes terrible. Only grades are exams outside a couple of extra point opportunities and the exams have some questions not covered at all (The thick accent does not help).
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She didn't know what she was talking about

I took her in the Fall of 2017. I wish I would have dropped. We had so many issues with the online component of Pearson that we wound up NOT using it! Even though it was purchased with the book. Attendance is taken via a quiz with the clicker. Powerpoints were very heavy, test were difficult. I changed my major�� good luck

Horrible. Extremely heavy accent, very dependent on powerpoints and just reads off them. She posts the powerpoints online but they are pretty much useless. There are only 4 assignments all year, all of them tests, so if you do poorly on one youre screwed. Highly highly recommend changing a professor if at all possible

She's nice but doesn't provide resources other than SI. The only grades are 3 tests and the final so if you do bad on one you're screwed. She talks fast and has a heavy accent, making her hard to understand 90% of the time. Her slides don't cover most of the material on the test. Has an unnatural obsession with the croods. 10/10 would not recommend
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Luna is awesome! I learned a ton! She is always available for every student that wants to understand Biology.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: This is the best professor I had at Baylor. Exams are fair. She is kind, although you have to work. She expects a lot from the students but she is fully available to help.

Dr. Luna is the least inspiring professor Ive ever had. Every class she reads from PowerPoint presentations. She posts the presentations online but they are completely useless as they only contain half of the information. She came to class unprepared many times, and even showed up to the final without printing the whole test, forcing us to wait.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Her exams are preposterous, they are highly specific and ask inferrence questions about many things that were never covered in class. If you take this class with no prior knowledge, your grade will in no way reflect your knowledge of the subject.
BIO 1. Assignments are online, not bad, just time consuming. You can tell she is passionate about science but she expects everyone to automatically understand yet is bad at explaining
This class was just straight up dificult. I would not recoment this teacher

I graduated from Baylor in 1979 BSED Comm/Engl. I now hold two Master's degrees. Dr.Hanks is STILL my favorite professor of all time. He was so interesting and fun. I didn't even take notes because I remembered every word he said and could recall the information when testing. I took every class he taught at that time. LOVE HIM!

If you want a class that's challenging and makes you think, Hanks is the prof to take. But don't think you're going to get away with slacking; there's no "hiding" in class. Hanks will call students out randomly to answer, so if you haven't done your reading...good luck. He can be rather full of himself, but he certainly knows his stuff.

What a great professor!  He is very engaging, and although he requires a lot, he respects his students and is always more than willing to help anyone.  He also takes a genuine interest in his students on an academic and a personal level, so he is a good person to speak with about post-graduation options.  Take one of his classes!!!
No Comments

He was extremely knowledgable and knew how to ask the kind of questions that got all the students involved in class.  He had high expectations for his students, but didn't play favorites based on school performance.  We kept in touch all 4 years I was at Baylor even though I wasn't the best student.

Dr. Hanks was a wonderful professor....I'm nearly 5 years removed from my last class with him, but I still look back at notes and the texts and think of how he shaped my studies.  He expects a lot, he demands a lot, and he requires a lot, but you will get a lot from his courses.  I specialized in medieval lit thanks to him and am now working on becoming a special collections librarian thanks to his Chaucer course.....gives you an appreciation for early manuscripts.
Incredible teacher and friendly person....gets to know students and treats them as equals.....very knowledgable and kind
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Hanks is the department's best professor, pushing undergrads and grads alike to higher levels of ability and professionalism.  Moreover, his discussions on pedagogy are far superior to those offered by most education professors.  Do yourself a favor and take every class he offers.  CHG 93, 96

There's a reason he's called the "smiling assassin."  If you do whatever he tells you in class, it's great.  Don't try to think for yourself or become interested in something he doesn't understand.  That does not sit well with him--no matter what he says to your face.
My husband and I met in Dr. Hanks' class...plus, he's an amazing professor!
Known by those who take his courses as "The Smiling Assassin."  A beautifully friendly man with a hard edge of expectations.  The very best!
The only actual, bona fide SCHOLAR I've ever met that was accessible and willing to learn as much as he was willing to teach.  The finest kind.
AWESOME
Hanks is a good prof, but he plays favorites in discussion and grading.
the very best prof at baylor
No Comments
Dr. Hanks is the best professor at Baylor -- but he is very demanding as well

Decent professor, boring class. He talks fast and goes off on tangents often, but you NEED the notes for the tests. 2 tests throughout the semester, 2 essays and then the final so you have to do good on everything to succeed in the class. Essays are all writing - 4 "definitions and 2 full essays. You also have to read 6 books during the semester.

BORING CLASS. Lecture the entire class every class. I wanted to run out of there every day. The tests aren't too hard though, they're all writing (essays and short answers), but you MUST take notes from his lecture. Write fast, and good luck. He is nice and helpful though.

For History Majors he is a great professor. If you don't like History I could see why you might get bored. Regardless he is very professional, good sense of humor (very dry), and extremely knowledgable. If you want to learn something about history he is the man to ask.

hypo-stereotypical prof. Tweed jacket, leather elbow patches, gray beard, and neat and tidy combed hair.... oh and not to mention the bow ties. He is incredibly intelligent, organized, and fair. Classes are rather deep and cover enormous amounts of information. Not easy, but you actually retain the information you need.

Incredible brain with perfectly dry sense of humor.  Incredible personal political history in late 1960s, but Conservatives like me love him anyway. Awesome lecture style.  Had him for French-Rev/Napoleon his first semester at Baylor.  His lecture methods promoted superb retention. Could ask him things about history not in his field: He knew all.

Torture. Least favorite class ever. 1 day he kicked half the class out bc they werent ready for book discussion. U have 2 make your own combined maps of the 10 he tells u to study from an atlas & text book, takes me 6hrs to study for a freaking map QUIZ. avoid at all costs. trust me on this one, it's just not worth the time and stress, take another

Not hard as long as you do the papers on time and go to class.   He talks REALLY fast though, so it's hard sometimes to take notes.  His class really is not difficult though, just have to keep up with it.
Great professor. Relatively difficult class to keep up with, but if you take good notes in class and read the novels, you should be fine. Longfellow is long-winded, but interesting and helpful.

Very hard grader, almost impossible to get an A. I learned a lot in his class, but it is very hard. Tons of reading (total of 6 novels over the sem.)including these stupid Map Quizzes! I would suggest trying to get another professor before him. oh yeah, and he talks way too fast during lecture!!

He wears me out.  The only way to survive in his class is to go talk to him but realize that he will not come down to your level.  He has this ego thing and so just listen.  suck it up and listen because you can learn but you will probably not get a good grade.
Dull, monotonous lectures.  Tests do not come from lectures nor text!
very sarcastic dry wit, very intelligent, very serious academically, youll get the education your paying for out of him, if you put in the effort he asks

I was in his class for 1 day. He scared the begeesies out of me & I've heard horror stories from people who stayed in his class. He talks faster than you can think. One girl got a D & took another class with him just to prove to him she could get a C.
Excellent and well-informed.  I loved his class and I plan to take him again.  Show-up for class and do all your assignments and you will most likely make an A or B.
very dedicated, but at times to sarcastic, fun but diffucult class
Nice guy, very informative, hard grader
If you like a teacher who just rattles off info. as fast as you can make notes..
If you do the papers and listen in class, you should be fine.
No Comments
Longfellow is my all-time fav prof.  Interesting classes, but prepare to read!
Booth is a tough class but you will know Comp-Sci by the time you're done. If you go to office hours, work ahead, and think logically you should be fine. Train for his Final Practicums though.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This is not a class for you if you are just getting into comp sci. He is extremely tough and gives no room for makeups or lee-way. I do not recommend this class for beginners, at all.
Just a horrible teacher overall. His proctored exams don't match his assigned readings. If you are new to computer science, you will not pass his class. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!

Definitely a pretty strict and severe guy. However, he is extremely helpful during his office hours and you HAVE to go to them if you want to do well. He has clear grading criteria on his website and you also HAVE to follow it to the dot or he will fail you. The class will be very easy for you as long as you keep up with zybooks and your readings.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I would not recommend taking him if you have no computer science experience. Many people fail this class the first time they take it and are forced to retake it. You really have to attend all classes and take notes even if you don't think you need to. The tests are hard to study for so the best way is to go to look at his old tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT take his intro course if you do not have any coding experience. Although they advertise that beginners can take the course, Booth's lectures can only be understood by an experienced programmer. He is an extremely hard grader. His lectures are a tremendous snooze fest. I relied on help from upperclassmen tutors to get by. Also unfriendly.

Booth will give you a great introduction to programming if you are looking to learn, but it will not be an easy grade to earn. The common grades are 0, 50, and 100. Make one mistake and a lot of points will be counted off, which on tests, I sometimes thought his deductions were unreasonable for intro level, but I do understand why. I enjoyed this.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Booth is a good teacher but he is of no help whatsoever outside of the class. If you have no experience with coding, I would not recommend taking his class. Too difficult for an INTRO course.
A smart man with humorous lectures. This class will be easy for those who are interested in Computer Science, but those who aren't may find themselves struggling a bit.

Dr. Booth is a GREAT lecturer and very helpful on programs but the HARDEST grader. He gives NO LEEWAY when it comes to grades. My TA would tell me to do one thing in lab and I'd get counted off and Booth would say "that's not my problem"  The things you work the HARDEST and LONGEST on, barely count for any points. I would never take him again.
Great lecturer, generally helpful during his office hours. This man knows how to teach beginners. Pay close attention to his directions or you will do poorly in the class.

Humorous lectures. Doesn't get to know the class well.  Very strict on details when grading.  Overall if you listen to the lectures and keep his notes there is no need for a textbook. Easy tests and programs.
Good teacher, but wasn't much help out of class.
easy class just pay attention during class and the weekly programs will be easy

Booth is pretty much the easiest teacher I've ever had.  And yet, surprisingly enough, I learned everything the course required.  He told you how to do everything, wrote the code on the board in class, and told you what the practicum was beforehand.  I can't believe how easy and good this class was.
Unbelievable teacher.  All you have to do is listen well to every single lecture and write quickly when he goes over the programming assignment, but don't worry, it's easy.
Great teacher, best choice for CSI 1430 and 1440.  Explains material well, willing to help outside of class, and gives reasonable amount of work.
Dry sense of humor, but very friendly and helpful.  Do the programs and pay attention in class and you should be fine
If u learn through lectures then u'll definately learn here...  He's a good prof, just do ur programs and u'll most likely get an A. (atleast a B...)
Teaches well.

Dr. Lehr is a great man and invests in the lives of his students if you'll let him. He tends to get off topic and distracted easily during lectures but his tests are such a cakewalk you really aren't put at a disadvantage from it.

Larry Lehr is an awesome man! He can get rather long winded in class and can be hard to pay attention. After leaving his class and Baylor, he is one professor I would love to have again. His passion for Environmental Science made such an impact on me! DO THE EXTRA CREDIT!! You could make a 60 in the class and still get an "A" because of the EC.
Easy A. He gives so much extra credit, it's a shame if you don't make an A. I made B's on every single test and still finished the class with a 114% because of extra credit.

Dr. Lehr is a reasonable grader. He gives so much extra credit you could pass the class on it alone. He repeats his stories but who cares because it helps you remember the material. He genuinely cares about his students & is passionate about educating the next generation to inherit the earth. He is laid back, funny, & approachable. Take his class!!

He is awesome. He doesn't teach from the book at all though, which I admit irritated me at the beginning of the semester. Go to the classes though, because he does pull the test questions from his lectures and quizzes that are over what he lectured over last time. Otherwise, he is really helpful and will honestly try to help you get an A. Awesome
Great guy, fun to listen to. Difficult tests.
Very easy!
Hilarious and very easy...he'll write some good letters of recommendation too.

im normally a C student.hes redundant and cant be hard even if he tried.the quizes were about stuff he talked about the day before, i made the mistake of reading once just go to class he'll even show you some test qestions/answers final too which is all essay (igot an A on it without even studying).Lots ofextra credit which i did none of and got B

he's a very nice guy, but tends to tell his stories over and over again...his tests are fairly easy but the final is all essay, which stinks. but he's willing to help you in every way he can and offers a lot of extra credit. i recommend taking him!
Awesome prof and one of the nicest I've had at Baylor
Truly the most genuinly nice prof I've ever had. So willing to help and do anything you need him to. Great guy.
Makes it fun
Very involved and interested in subject, Great personality, Interesting, Gives lots of examples, Disorganized but gets the point across
No Comments
Larry is so nice, he loves the environment and was definatly a **** when he was in college!  its halarious.  Take him!
No Comments
If you get the chance go to Belize, save his life, receive eternal gratitude
Big Class; Fun Class; Expectations clear

Dr. DeG is amazing! I took her History in Global Perspective course and found it interesting. She wants you  to think critically about history. She does require a lot of reading but it all is covered in her lectures. The PSA assignments also help you in class as well as the reflection assignments. Overall great teacher that wants you to do well.
Great class. Tests are hard and she grades them hard as well. Very picky but she is helpful overall would not recommend her to other students.
Dr. DeG is hilarious. I loved taking her purely for her lectures. Her tests are HARD and she is probably the hardest grader in the history department. Definitely worth it.
She's really nice and can be funny. I really enjoyed her class, but her tests were definitely on the difficult side. Make sure to take very thorough notes!
She's great!
good teacher

Great class. I learned so much and now see how the world is so interconnected and understand the why of its current struggles. Awesome professor, very engaging. Lots of notes, take good notes and study. No textbook required but we read various novels that related to the area of the world we were studying at the time. Very insightful class.

Probably one of the nicest profs I've ever had. Really interesting lectures. Tests are not that hard; there was no book for that particular class, so studing was more demanding - good lecture notes were essential!!

This professor is amazing! Take her if you can because she is just so animated and cute. We had a lot of writing assignments, but little reading from the textbook. Her tests are mainly essays with like 5 id's. But she doesn't give you like 50 ids to study and only pick 5. She gives about 15 ids to look over. Again, take her if at all possible.
She's so nice and funny.  Great, interesting discussions and she's very helpful.
greatest professor ever.  fun, educational, wonderful experience.

Good teacher overall.  Tests are VERY long, but if you do the essays first when taking the test and actually study before the test, you will pass.  Also lecture stlye is entertaining.  Uses turnitin.com  I would recommend her class.
she's so cute and funny. lectures are interesting.  lots of reading and tests are hard but it's worth it.

This was the best prof I had in 4 years.  Every lecture was hilarious; the class was demanding but I hardly noticed.  (I don't think she's at Baylor anymore, but I thought I'd leave a tribute anyway.)

Great teacher!  Very entertaining.  Be prepared for reading quizzes.  Tests are easy if you study the material.  Study guides are given at least a week before the test.  Very helpful.  Take any class of hers that you can
Great Teacher!  Makes a mandatory class for BA students extremely fun!  Take any of her classes!  She is that good.

Her tests are pretty hard, and her class involves a lot of effort in order to get an A.   Besides that, she makes it very clear as to what you need to study for the tests.  She has a unique way of lecturing.
Probably the best teacher I've had at Baylor thus far.  Worth taking - but hard work is involved.
Great lady. Hard tests even when she gives you a review sheet.

FRE 1301 is supposed to be a beginner's French course, but Dr. Uber expects all students to be advanced. If you've never taken French before, you're basically screwed. He's very rude and always speaks his mind. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: The sweetest French professor I ever had! He was very helpful in terms of feedback and really wanted us to succeed. Would definitely take him again, but he will be retiring after the spring semester :(

-Very scatter brained and says extremely rude comments to students. He interrupts them when speaking and instead of giving feedback to each student personally he does it in front of the class. He literally counts off for questions that are correct!!! and when you point it out, he denies it! Literally no point to his class. Useless

Doesn't let you take notes in class and isn't corrective when a student is wrong, simply tells them what they did is wrong and shames them for it. The positive was all homework was not for credit, so as long as you knew the material you didn't have to do it.

Very difficult to talk to. Cannot stay on topic when you ask questions after class. Very hard grader. Doesnt give back finals. Marks correct answers wrong. Argues with you when you point out his mistakes. Rude and condescending. Makes me want to quit french. 0/10.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Actively shames students for getting answers wrong instead of working with students. Even if a student demonstrates active participation and has good grades in tests and quizzes, beware if you get called on and get an answer wrong. Sorry we don't think France is the greatest thing since sliced bread.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: DO NOT TAKE HIM IF AT ALL POSSIBLE! Dr. Uber is the hardest professor to understand to date. His grading criteria is completely subjective to how much he likes you and sees you "participating." He does not teach to prepare you for the test and doesn't tell you whats on the test until the day or 2 before. He also grades every test differently.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Really disappointed. Prof. Uber mentioned Baylor in Paris about 100 times, but never seemed to help us grasp the concepts. He gets distracted easily, loves making boring jokes, and heavily uses the textbook. Makes us repeat things over and over, without much context or explanation.
Eh
Ha!  The tie joke does get a little old!  He was super easy cause we never had to say anything.  He likes to talk!
hes not a good teacher. i thought his class was one of my hardest.
No Comments
No Comments
He was the teacher that made me cry my first week of classes.  The tie joke gets stupid after the 400th time.  He teaches you a good deal.  Alright, but not my favorite.

Good teacher.  Easy to approach. His French is good.  More of a Parisian style French.  Listen to his lectures and read the book and you should be able to pass.  He does try to incorporate humor into the class although it is corny and not very funny.
Expects you to know everything already, and humiliates you if you don't.
I had him in the summer, but I did very well in his class. He is very easy to approach and to talk to. He is very intelligent and has lots of stories about life and about French.
Can't say too much. I just hate French, but I got a B with minimal effort so you shouldn't fail. He's pretty animated and entertaining during class too.

Lectures are great, he really knows his stuff. Tests are also not that bad if you keep up with the assignments. Does have a tendency to give assignments and then decide not to take them up later. Also, slow grader.

This class was so easy, all of the tests are replicas of the lectures! Dodson was so funny and kind and gave a lot of extra credit! I highly 100% recommended his class, i took him for both scriptures and heritage and it was the easiest A. Never studied more than a day in advance for the exams and got all As. love him! Never took attendance

i LOVE derek dodson so much he is my favorite professor please take him if you ever get the opportunity. he is genuinely so amazing and only wants the best for you and his lectures are always interesting, he truly does keep you engaged. assignments are an absolute breeze it will be like four to five questions and a 10 question quiz. please take him

Dr. Dodson is a great professor. He is knowledgeable and loves what he teaches. This course is pretty easy. Light reading. The chapters are fairly short. He gives examples for the interpretive assignments and the exams are easy if you do the reading. Quizzes are very simple. He is overall a great professor and I would definitely recommend him.
I loved him! Super nice guy and really loves what he does.

I took this class online summer '20, so it was a bit more fast paced. If you do not read, you will fail. However, if you read, the quizzes and tests are pretty straight-forward. I would think the course would be a bit more difficult over the summer, but it is still obvious that Dr. Dodson is very interested and knowlegable in the content he teaches
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The hardest part of class was trying to NOT fall asleep. He means well and you do learn some pretty cool things, but the after lunch block is boring. LOTS OF READING. NOT READING WILL DESTROY YOUR GRADE

Dr. Dodson was easily my favorite professor 1st semester. Very funny, super nice, and very knowledgable (he was a pastor before he was a teacher.) He made the class enjoyable, and the tests were very straightforward and from his notes (my lowest test grade was a 96). He does assign reading/reading questions every class, and has an online quiz every other class or so, but the quizzes are very easy if you read. All in all, my favorite teacher so far. Highly recommend taking him (for scriptures)

Dr. Dodson is a great professor. The tests come soley from class lecture and he puts the notes online in a fill in the blank format. There are 3 review essays you have to write, but they aren't very difficult. Dodson is definitely one of the easier Scriptures professors here at Baylor. Highly recommended.

Based on summer session: covers a lot of material quickly (due to summer time limits). Take notes in class. Ask questions and meet with him after class if you need help. Actually cares about students.
I love Dr. Dodson, he is VERY fun and makes the class awesome!
He made it a very fun and interesting class!
required to reading every day; cannot make up quizes, however, the pop quizes are not very difficult

Dr. Dodson is an interesting guy who engages the class. He is actually one of my favorite professors. While there is reading homework and questions almost every night, the work is not hard, and the tests are fairly simple if you review the lecture notes.
I didn't learn anything from this class.  It was pointless.  Teacher was average... nothing special... I would definitely take someone else.

Dodson was a really nice guy that understands & lectures for christian scrips. He had pop quizzes throughout the semester; he became less uptight with those the last month of class. The tests were REALLY really hard & he graded kind of hard on his reflection papers too. He has reading homework every night & reading questions. Good Luck! I made a D.
he is the best teacher he makes this class fun considering u have to take it
He is interesting and very animated...makes it is easier to remember what he says so that you have to study less!
No Comments
Pretty upfront teacher. Always lets u know whats goin on next and is leniant on test. I reccommend him.

AVOID his class... his lectures are interesting, and yes he can be funny, and entertaining to listen to but don't be fooled by the "Easter eggs" he gives for quizzes.. they don't mean ANYTHING and do not help. His quizzes and exams include material NOT DISCUSSED in class or in the lectures/PowerPoint and all he tells you to do is extra credit.
this class is unnecessarily hard.

Covers lots of material, but is an engaging professor. Always willing to talk with students and had my name learned by the end of the 2nd week. If you need a GPA boos, he offers copious amounts of extra credit and is willing to work with students. Lectures are amazing, most pictures included are from his own travels. Can't wait to have him again.

He is a very caring teacher and will learn your name and about you even in a 200 person lecture. The issue is the quizzes and tests, they are HARD and on a lockdown browser and clearly not open note.While extra credit is offered (it boosted my grade a letter grade), you end up doing a lot of work (especially when this doesn't impact your major).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor. Tests are detailed, so study. He offers copious amounts of extra credit and has amazing lectures with pictures he's taken. Always friendly and willing to work with students. Gave me really good advice regarding my degree and what to take. Looking forward to taking upper level classes from him in the future.

His content is dated and from an oil company perspective. He seems to ignore the climate change and does not see the link to petroleum geology. He appears to be climate change denier and offers a biased view of the discipline. He tends to attract highly conservative students that happily drink his coolaid.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I would 100% take Dr. Atchley again even though I am not a geology major. I took Geo 1306 with him and he was great. He interacted with the students and tried to remember everyone's names. He gives PLENTY of extra credit that can bump you up a whole letter grade. His tests and quizzes are all online using lockdown browser, but were easy.

He is a very rigid prof. with answers accepted only in a specific format and use of words. He sees stratigraphy only through his eyes and known others. His approach is very dated and through the end of core barrel. He teaches from an Exxon mold. I would avoid this class if you are free thinker and want to learn from dialog, rather than dogma.

Dr. Atchley is one of the best professors I've ever had. Not easy, but he made sure we had truly grasped one concept before moving on to the next. His tests are also the fairest I have ever taken.  He teaches exactly what he wants you to know. It is a LOT to learn. But if you take strat with him, you will understand it for life. Highly recommended.
Best professor I've EVER HAD!

Cool guy, interesting lectures, very personable and friendly. He explains all the concepts very well, and definitely knows his stuff. Plus, he captured my attention well enough that I never fell asleep in his class- something that can't be said for most of my classes. Quizzes and tests can be tough though.
Loved the class - tests are unbelievably difficult.  Personable
Good prof... tough prof.   Do what he asks and you have no problems.

He is a great lecturer and knows the material well. However, the tests are ridiculously hard, requiring you to memorize every detail in a time period spanning millions of years. He is also incredibly biased, but what can you expect from a Baylor prof...?
he's quite the professor, not to mention pretty funny...he makes the material easy to understand and knows a lot about geology...which is very attractive.

Sure, he's outwardly personable and tows the Baylor party line, so the freshmen are fooled.  However, the flip side to him is that he is extremely ambitious and lets nothing get in the way of his glory.  He is arrogant beyond human comprehension. AVOID!
Great class!  Makes his class very enjoyable.  He's hot to boot!  :)
wonderful man!

He doesn't seem interested in helping students much. Could not attend any of his lectures and still pass, just need to read the book (down to the little details). You have to read and study hard if you want to make a good grade-only have 3 tests which make up your entire grade.
Study what he teaches you in class and you're good.. Tests aren't a breeze and there's only 2 per semester and a final which can offset one of those tests.
If you bring PowerPoint notes posted on Dr. Duhrkopf's web page to class and follow the lecture, you will do great.  His test is very reasonable and he grades fair. Great professor :)

Wow, yeah he talks very quickly, takes few questions and answers those he does take very concisely.  He grades on a system depending on how the class does on the test, thus making it impossible to know how you're actually doing in it.  Very rude, very impatient.
wtf times 20
wtf
Dr. Duhrkopf's tests are hard, no doubt, but take a laptop to class, get his outlines off of his website to follow along, and read the chapters before you come to class and you'll be fine.
I found his meanness funny.  Don't take him too seriously.

His class is very hard and he does not help at all. There are only tests and no other work to help your grade. His tests are almost impossible and I do not know anyone in the class that is doing well.
It's hard to get an "A" in his class.  Get on his good side.  Test ?s are tricky.  Try to take Vodopich instead.
A lot easier in genetics than in freshman bio. He's still a meanieface, but easier.
Everyone thinks he's so hard but you don't even need to buy the book for bio 1 and 2. Just go to every class and memorize the notes.
passionate about his subject just very cold/straight-faced.  need to study for tests. class is all lecture - print out the outlines to help you with note-taking/studying!

This was a challenging course that was made more difficult by an unhelpful and cynical professor.  Intentionally makes students feel stupid. Made me feel like I would fail on the first day. I got a B, but thought I was getting an F due to his attitude.
Easy Tests, lectures are boring but it's easy overall
Worst prof ever.  Had no idea what I was going to make in his class.  Very stressful and hard to reach.
He's not good at all. Avoid him like you would avoid the plague. He's not friendly, he doesn't care about the student. It's a horrible experiance.
The worst professor I have ever had!

Comes off abrasive and rude at first. Clearly very opinionated politically and not afraid to announce it to the class. He is a good prof however. He will work with students - offered a review session before the final and an extra credit opportunity for those willing to take it. He is very knowledgeable and good at passing on that knowledge to us.

First impression: A little obnoxious and rude. But it got better. He's very opinionated and blunt. When you get used to him, he's cool. As a person, he's great. Has a nice office. Don't call him Mr. Offit. Not for the faint of heart. Second section (physical anthro, e.g. buckets of evolution) is hardest.
One of my favorite profs at Baylor. He is funny and makes class interesting. An enjoyable class and you will learn some interesting stuff too. Not very hard. I highly recommend taking him.

he's probably one of the funniest teachers ive ever had! his sense of humor and wit make coming to class actually worth while.   and....he gives review sheets for all of his tests. which is excellent.

This class is awesome! Dr. Offit is an excellent teacher, makes the material easy to understand, and makes me want to come to class. We have the most interesting discussions in class and I love how he gets everyone in the class involved. I highly recommend taking ANY of his classes!

this class is amazing. tom makes the class fun and easy to learn. you will want to go to class everytime. he's so funny and he's very easy to approach with questions. he challenges his students and loves what he does.
Passionate about his subject. Classes never seem long enough to go over subject matter. Easy to understand, and is open to suggestions.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Greatest prof I've had, very good at teaching, interesting, laid back, and hilarious at times.
This is the best class ever, but Dr. Offit makes it that way!  You will want to go to this class!!!

He guest lectured in our Race, Class, and Gender course a couple of times, so I don't know what his actual class is like, but from my experience, he is an amazing teacher who loves what he is teaching and challenges the students' assumptions.

Offit is the man. I loved his class. I am really excited about taking his "Science Society and Culture" class this semester. He is so laid back and yet you really take him seriously. Gives great study guides. Put in a little effort and you can m
I had Tom Spring 2003, and I loved his class. He is very animated and keeps you interested in the subject.

Easy to make at least a B if you go to class and take notes.  Attendance taken 5 times a semester.  Gives review for tests.  Also gives extra credit, up to 6 pts on final semester grade.  Definitely take if you need to get a social science class done.
Good teacher, pretty easy.  Fun course to take.
Very fun class... totally laid back, you dont even mind learning!

One of the best math professors I've had. Gives homework grades and quiz grades which makes it easy to do well in the course. Always super cheerful and happy to teach. Makes you like math even if you hate it to begin with. Great at teaching too, she explains the concepts super well and helps you understand it before the exams. 100% would take again

For 1315, as long as you do the work you will get an A. For homework, unlimited tries were available and for quizzes there was still three tries given. Classwork is just graded for competition, she doesn't even check it. Such a kind and fun teacher to have, would take her even if the class wasn't an easy A.
Real easy class. She drops low grades. If you don't skip you should make an easy A.
she's hilarious and entertaining. she's so nice and willing to help. take her if you can!
She's so goofy!  Class is difficult, though, so make sure to know the info well.  Don't miss class- she covers so much.
she's so funny; kept me awake even after lunch.
LOVED her! she was so nice and helpful!!!
She makes a boring class fun

She is an awesome teacher and is very amusing.  She makes it fun yet it is still difficult!  She likes to use EVERY MINUTE of class time, even if she is done.  Then she will just start on the next lesson even if all we get to write down is the stupid title!  But she is still awesome!
She's hilarious! Really good teacher and the class is pretty easy if you study and keep up with your work. Don't miss class or you will be behind.
She was a great teacher.  You must attend every class or you will be confused.  She talks at a fast pace, but she is easy to understand.  Not difficult to get an A.

She is one of my favorite professors at Baylor.  She is always happy and upbeat and she explains things so well.  I'm HORRIBLE at math, and I still made a B.  And I understood it!  And my grandfather was in the hospital and she was very understanding!
Greatest teacher ever. Makes calc easy, fun, everything you would want it to be, while still learning all the stuff you should know. I love her teaching!
Best. Teacher. Ever.  Seriously, I loved her class.  Great teacher- actually manages to make math class fun, and she explains things very clearly.
Highly recommend her. I'm taking her for my next math too. Breaks down the info well and makes it fun too! She'll crack you up.
Jokes and tries to make math interesting - really wants the students to learn.
She is AWESOME! My favorite teacher so far here at Baylor. Take her class.
Very nice and very funny.  She must have about 10 coffees before class each day.
Awful teacher
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Has no layout for his classes, so confusing, jumps around, no schedule and gives an awful amount of homework. What he teaches is completely irrelevant towards most majors.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I took a Bracy Hill summer course and I have had to do way more work this summer-semester with this one class as opposed to the combined work of the two classes I took last summer-semester. I deeply regret not dropping the class before I would have received a W so I'm trying to stick it through but the workload is manic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This is a graduate level seminar under the guise of an early undergraduate, required course.  Unless his area of expertise is in your field of study and/or planned career application, I would not recommend the course.  It is an immense amount of very high level reading, interpretation and assimilation without any direction as to what is important.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: It is very hard to earn the grade you may deserve in this class. The way the quizzes (most of your grade) are structured is mostly random and mostly impossible to study for even if you do all of the readings/take good notes during lecture. His attitude can be frustrating as well. Do not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr.Hill is the most anal professor I have ever had, he is one of the harshest graders ever and defiantly seems to be on a power trip. He seems annoyed that he has to teach a 1000-level course and is going to make it everyone else's problem. Be prepared to do tremendous amounts of reading from multiple books every week before the quizzes
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Bracy Hill is one of the most frustrating professors I have every had in my career. He assigns an extraordinary amount of reading per week. Your entire grade is based off of weekly quizzes worth 25 points. The questions come from the readings, his in class lectures, and student suggested questions. It i nearly impossible to study for his quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Cool guy but his teaching style and quizzes were not rewarding enough.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This class if full of hours a reading per night. It is very difficult to keep up with it. If you miss class you will fail the quizzes. If you don't read you will fail the quizzes. If you go to class and read you will probably still fail the quizzes :)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Doesnt assign any homework, only tests. Very hard to succeed in this class if you are a hands-on learner.
So much reading
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: There was a LOT of reading. There was only two test and a final so there is not a lot of points to earn... Dr. Hill is a super nice guy and very approachable if you need help. If you can read fast I recommend him.

Dr. Hill is incredible. If you're looking for a brilliant professor -it's him. While he may require a lot of reading from his students, he makes sure they apply to the lectures and doing well in his class. I highly recommend him - this has remained one of my favorite courses solely because of his teaching.

He's great! The class is exciting but really fast-paced, so you have to keep up. If you're easily offended, you should pick another teacher, but if you're willing to learn some new and different views and actually do the work required, he's #1. (And yeah, he is definitely hot, but married, so chill out ladies. ;)

He's very knowledgeable of all the subjects covered. He's truly passionate about what's he's teaching, unlike the rest of my professors. He cares about students and their grades, especially if they truly try. Not to mention, he's pretty easy on the eyes.
He is very sexy! A little hard though-he expects a lot.

He's very dynamic and a lot of fun to watch. His tests really aren't that hard, so if you read the book and pay attention in class, you'll get an A or a B. He also gives a lot of opprotunities for extra credit, and did I mention...he's hot!
He's very well-education and interested in the subject matter. He's friendly and very approachable while being respectful of students. He likes participation in class.

Cute old man, seriously such a sweetheart. Don't you dare disrespect him, he is really strict on respect. Tests super easy, daily quizzes in class, long homework. If you do the homework you should be fine on the test. If you've already taken chemistry in high school this class is a breeze.

His daily quizzes are next to impossible. He expects you to know stuff even Chem II students would not know. These quizzes every day add up and count for 1 test grade. This test grade pretty much is an automatic failure unless you read the whole chapter every day before class. No way you can do extra curricular or work while taking his class..
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: He's a very nice guy, but expects you to know everything he is talking about. Definitely don't take him if you already have a tendency to struggle in your Science. Daily grade/attendance is 2 questions at the beginning of every lecture over the chapter he will talk about in class(def have to read book). No notes on tests.

Dr. Hassell's teaching style is less than optimal. His lectures can be quite boring, and you don't really need to pay any kind of attention to pass. He's an old school teacher, doesn't post anything on Blackboard, and only gives four tests. Basically if you do the Mastering Chemistry online homework and read his old exams on ER you'll pass.
He's a very good teacher if you can study from example problems. His lectures can be boring at times.

Hassel is a boring lecturer but a very sweet guy. Tests, Mastering Chem, and the daily quizzes are equally weighted (he averages quiz grades). You have 4 tests, and the final. Just print out his old tests from reserves on the library site and work those you'll do fine! Tests are 17 questions, but he only counts 15 so you get points for showing up!
Very nice guy, his hand writing is kind of hard to read and does not use blackboard. he is an old school teacher. he will help if you ask and fairly easy and notes are allowed on test!

He's a very nice guy, always explains things well. His tests are very straight forward and easy if you studied. Typically tests are about 17 questions long and there are old tests from him in the online course reserves.

Easy class w/ some interesting topics. He likes what he does & he cares about his students.  Daily "quiz" that is 1 question over the reading from the night before.  2 open-note tests and open-note final (write lecture notes but most of the ?'s are taken from the chap. summaries).  1 easy paper & 1 easy book report. Drops lowest grade.
Seemed like a nice guy but not a great professor. Poorly organized and does a poor job of explaining most things. Very dry and boring in class. Could be better...could be worse.
awesome prof who has an awesome prof wife!
No Comments

I took his Chemistry and Society class, which was great because he does not teach it like a pre-med class, and he gives open notes tests.  He's an overall nice guy, and you should definitely take CHE 1405 if science is not your strong suit.

Fair teacher. Difficult tests but if you study and practice with the ones on file in the library, they aren't too bad. He uses an irritatingly nasal "ehhhh" instead of umm. If you don't study, don't take this class!
sounds like Vin Scully the Dodgers play by play announcer. great guy. just study and pay attention
Very nice man.Tests aren't so bad if you look at his test file in the library.

He can't really explains things very well... you're better off taking your own notes from the book! And if you ask a question in class, he makes you feel stupid. But if you read the book and study for tests, you should do ok.

3 Test mainly from lectures(20MC and Essay). 6 quizzes that are known about ahead of time. One presentation and short paper. Class is very straight forward and conceptional. Easy A if you do a little work and take decent notes. All power points are online as well.
HENDON IS AWESOME!
He is very interested in the material and is a good prof.

I really enjoyed his class. Like absolutely reccomend this prof for history. His tests are alright, the essays are graded kind of hard but he gives them to you before hand so honestly its not that bad. I'm gonna try and take him for every course i can. :)

Test are comprised of 40% MC, and 60% essay. Which is fine if you can write off the cuff very very quickly. I however cannot and subsequently was told that my test essay could have been better written if I never attended the class. After that burn I quit attending class.

Awesome! Incredibly intelligent. Speaking style is somewhat dry but his is very knowledgable and  has great depth. If you are able to listen to his content, it isn't dry at all. Also incredibly easy (especially for a 4000 level class). Great professor. Makes you think but not at the expense of your grade.

The man is a genious.  He starts from the very beginning and goes to the very end but his lectures are very detailed and you will learn a lot.  Tests can be kind of difficult since its mainly essay and the multiple choise questions can be tricky.  However, he does give you hte essay questions ahead of time so you can study prior to the exam.

The smartest man alive! Ask him anything during class. Get past his speaking voice, which is very shaky and distracting for some. A brilliant knack for making his history classes into storytime. If you like storytime, he's good.

Not that bad, just really boring. Tests are half MC, half essay, but he gives you the essay topics beforehand. MC is hard to prepare for, basically pay CLOSE attention to lecture. Only other assignments are two medium length papers. It seems kinda hard and a lot of material, but I'm doing well somehow.
This man loves history...but the class can get  boring at times, and is a little off the wall at some points, especially when he gets rushed.  But so far he seems pretty cool.
No Comments

Tests moderate if you listen in class.  Not the best at out of class help.  Seems embarressed when he doesnt know a certain answer or gets a date mistaken.  I tried to skip this class as much as possible.
He's really weird, but to the point that it makes you laugh.  His techniques are rather boring and you get lost easily.

very random man! he loves talking about blood and you can tell that he LOVES history. Tests are easy if you study and there is hardly any work other than three tests and two papers. It wasn't bad at all.

He is incredibly enthusiastic when discussing the Aztecs and their bloody rituals.  I would definitely recommend him, because he gives you a heads up on the essays for exams.  I learned a lot in his class, and he held my attention during lectures. :)
He's boring. And the tests are random. Don't sit in the front row.
No Comments

All you do in the class is sit and watch her work problems on the board, which can be helpful, but she goes kind of fast and it can be hard to catch up if you get behind.  The homework is online and easy, but study a lot for the tests, because she grades hard and they are usually a lot harder than the quizzes and homework.
Easy math class. Just do all homework online and study well for the test and an A is very obtainable.

VERY easy class. I use it to write letters in, as you don't have to really pay attention. She's definitely old school, but she will help if you ask nicely. Can be sort of brusque though. Just an easy A math.

Nice lady, but VERY confused.  She makes alot of mistakes.  I am not a math person at all and all of her mistakes were very hard to deal with.  Often times her answer key would be wrong.  I went to visit her several times in her office and she was not friendly or helpful.  She didn't want to help.  I would NOT recommend this lady...
Nice lady, explained things very thoroughly all the time. Her class was easy and made even the most difficult concepts(there aren't many in Ideas in Math anyway) easy to understand.

She gives out about 40 problems of homework due every Friday, but it is all for a completion grade. If you have already taken Calculus before this will definitely be a zone-out class. She is pretty nice and will help anyone understand the material.

Mrs. Brooks is a very thourough professor. She is very intelligent and capable of teaching a wide spectrum of mathematical principles. She may not be the most entertaining professor but if you need any help she will drop what she is doing to make sure you understand. Those who do not do well most likely dont have a solid math base.

A nice (rather confused) old lady, but not a great professor. All she does is write everything on the board. And she makes quite a few mistakes. MATH 1301 is hardly a real math class, so one can just teach themselves from the book.

she is a sweet old lady and very nice. this class is extremely easy if you have taken calculus in high school but if you haven't she is probably the best teacher for this class because she is very repetitive and goes over everything 2 or 3 times. the tests are fairly easy and she gives completion grades on the HW.

She's very monotone & sometimes her notes leave out some key info (I basically used my high school pre-calc notes to do the h/w & study for tests.) She does give SOME h/w points (at beginning of each unit)which boosts ur grade & has some take-home quizes which are easy. She just doesn't like it if u talk while she's talking or fall asleep though.C+
I really enjoy Brook's class. She is very clear on new material and helpful. I didnt do well in high school math but am doing great in her class

She is old school.  She won't talk unless everyone in the room is quiet and stuff like that.  Not clear when teaching.  Seems to not care about her students.  Classwork not hard but tests are a different story.

She is not a very good prof. I was constantly correcting her in class because she had no idea what she was talking about sometimes and would get herself all confused. I am so glad that I took Pre-Cal in high school or I would have SERIOUSLY been totally lo
fair, clear, and helpful
No Comments
No Comments

This woman flat out LIED to me.  I caught her in a LIE.  Not only that, she was horrible at explaining things and she suffers from a power trip because she tells you on the first day that if you're running late don't bother showing up at all.

Professor Gage was by far my favorite professor at Baylor. The readings were long and demanding, but I usually found our readings online, and he kept me interested throughout the entire course, even giving me the benefit of the doubt when warranted. Easily my best professor of this year.

Professor Gage is one of my favorite at Baylor. He  wants everyone to make a good grade and also learn the material. If anyone didn't understand the material or assignments he always went out of his way to help them by staying after class and even setting up study groups outside of class. Anyone would be lucky to have him!!

Professor Gage was one of my favorite professors I have had so far at Baylor! He truly cares about you as a student and as a person.  He will work with you to help you make a good grade and to make sure you understand the material. I recommend him for anyone!

Professor Gage was by far my favorite professor at Baylor. Not only was he an all round great person but he was such a great teacher with an immense passion for teaching his students. His class helped me so much with studying for the LSAT and have my a great background for formal logic. If you have the chance the take this professor YOU MUST!!

This Professor is quite superb. His interest in Philosophy is clearly evident and his passion for helping students improve in the class is what any student would want in a professor. He has good structure to the class and the homework really aims at preparing you for the exams. One of the best up and coming professors in the philosophy department.

The epitome of an excellent professor! He makes himself available and cares that his students (who put forth an effort) can understand the material. He's passionate about teaching and you have to literally do nothing in the class to fail. Amazing teacher!

He is by far one of, if not the best professor I've ever had at Baylor. He is always willing to help his students understand and grasp the material even outside of the classroom.
