He is charismatic and dynamic which makes him easy to relate to and converse with. He speaks with clarity and is better equipped for teaching than most profs with tenure.

Great professor. Learned a lot and he was willing to help me when I needed it no matter how confused I seemed to be. Overall the class is a good class and easy if you study and try. If you don't try then you won't get an A, simple enough. Great professor would take him agains if I could and highly reccomend him.

He is awesome! Really clear on every topic he taught us and made everything much easier than it seemed. He gave homework for almost every class, but nothing too long and terrible. His quizzes are easy if you listen in class and read what he assigns. Really nice man who seems to genuinely care about his students and their success. TAKE HIM!!!

He is a very clear and gifted instructor. He does not give work for the fun of it, but instead uses every assignment and test to help the student become more proficient at Logic. Best of all, he genuinely cares about his students. The man is genuine, highly intelligent, and much underappreciated in my opinion. It was a stellar class.

Worked though many examples in class, which was very helpful. He also pulled video clips that related to topics at hand that were entertaining but were very good at actually seeing certain types of arguments. Was always available to help both in and out of class and was open to many questions during class time. Overall, I really liked Gage's class.

Great teacher,if you pay attention you'll learn a lot. Really values the students opinion, if you're having trouble just talk to him and ninety nine times out of one hundred you'll be able to work something out.
Really great teacher who was very caring and insightful. I learned a lot and could tell that Dr. Gage really wanted us to do well and learn the material. Over all I really enjoyed the class.

One of the best teachers I have had at Baylor. They way he teaches makes it so easy to learn, understand, and apply all of the concepts. Always willing to help a student out if he/she asks and is always in a great mood.  If I did not love my current major as much as I do I would have seriously considered perusing logic because of this man.

Good professor. Always open to helping/answering questions both in and out of class. Very laid back in class. Knows his stuff and explains it clearly. Willing to go slow or repeat himself for students who are having problems.
Great prof. Uses relevant and interestimg topics for class discussion. don't let the homework assignments get away from you! they're just completion grades, but they're worth a lot.
Excellent class, and he uses relevant and interesting topics for discussion. But don't let homework assignments get away from you! They're only completion grades, but they're worth a lot.

Very kind guy, I enjoyed his scriptures so much I am also taking him for heritage next semester. Almost all lecture, but I find it interesting so it's not bad. He gives test reviews that are basically 70% of the test. Weekly quizzes which are easy. Extra credit essay that gives you 2 points onto your overall grade. HIGHLY recommend for scriptures.
Christian Scriptures with him was the easiest class I have taken at college. Super easy, great lectures, fun personality. Can't recommend him enough!

DON'T take any classes with him! He is very irresponsible and careless. We were left on our own with little instructions at the beginning of the semester to navigate throughout the class. I should have dropped the class when I realized things were going in a bad direction but thought I could manage to push through. BIG MISTAKE!!!

Don't take ANY of his classes!!! The way he presents the material makes it extremely difficult to comprehend. It was very inefficient and made it difficult to prepare for tests. I wish I could have gotten more out of this class and learned more about the Bible but I ended up just reading and trying to memorize short term to pass the exams!

I regret taking his class not because of the content/workload, but because of him personally. A letter on a transcript is permanent. A minor inconvenience such as demonstrating understanding towards your students is not! I am disappointed he is a teacher that represents not only the religion department, but Baylor University as a whole!

I didn't have a textbook and Emailed asking for a PDF for the first few assignments but he ignored my Email. An advisor had to reach out to him to get a response (less than 12 hours before the removal deadline)! He gave no instruction the rest of the month. I tried reaching out again at the end of the semester, he ignored my Email once more!
SAVE YOURSELF by not taking his class. His lectures are unengaging and don't prepare you for the exams. He doesn't care much about how you're doing in the class either!

one of the easiest religion professors - gets significantly easier the farther you get into the religion school. i've taken three semesters with him (not by choice.) and his lectures can feel boring and dry at times but genuinely his tests are easy if you put in some effort and he's a very generous grader. very gracious with late work and grading!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Coker cares about his students and is such a genuine person. I chose to take him since I live in North Russell and I'd find it easy to roll out of bed to get to lecture on time. The exams are difficult if you don't take good notes or attend class regularly. He provides notes, but it's up to you to annotate and study them.

Dr. Coker is great. You won't regret taking his class. I am currently enrolled in his Christian Heritage class and absolutely love the class! I look forward to going. He makes learning fun and gives exam review material. As far as quizzes go, read and you'll ace em. He gives extra credit and other easy, somewhat fun assignments!
He was very kind and a great professor. If you actually pay attention and take notes, you should do fine. Just be sure to follow his study guides and you will do just fine.

As a person, he's very nice, seems to care about his students, and makes the class somewhat interesting (especially on Friday classes). However, his lectures don't outline the material very clearly and he tends to test you on some things not covered in class. This can be annoying since each test is worth 25% of your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I understand that Christian scriptures is a difficult class but the way he teaches makes the informations makes it nearly impossible. The book itself is easy enough and the quizzes are more or less just straight out of the book, however the tests have information that was not mentioned in the lecture or book. I do not recommend taking this class.

Professor Coker teaches well, but his method of presentation is ineffective. He communicates to casually and tries to recount history in a colloquial and relaxed format which often leads him to generalize and misrepresent historical fact. I like the guy, but he ruined the class for me because I was often frustrated by his inaccuracies.

I thought he was hard at first until I started paying attention to his lectures. He may seem boring but if you listen he's actually really interesting and the tests are really easy if you take good notes. You have to do reading and there's a lot of quizes but the way he does the grades at the end ends up helping your grade a lot.
No Comments

Cannon is great. Quizzes come right off homework and his tests are fair..plus they are really heavily curved. If you have taken calc before, take him for SURE. If not, he might be slightly hard, but I would still recommend him. There is homework every night but it's not draining. If you are good at math, this class won't stress you out.
He's not too hard if you took calc in high school. If you didn't, don't worry, because the tests and hw quizzes are curved. It shouldn't be hard to pull of a low b.
Short man with a temper. I can tell he loves to teach and those with a Cal background find him easy.  Those of us like myself will find that his tests are ridiculously hard. Take Bryan instead.

Really great professor.  He does come across as confrontational but he is only trying to better answer questions and get you to follow.  Go to office hours. Such a nice guy. Tests are very fair. He give a good curve and ample amount of partial credit.  Take him if you can! I am taking him for another class in BIC I liked him so much!
No Comments
Cannon is one of the best teachers I have ever had.  He makes everything bvery clear and concise.  He is more than helpful
avoid taking him you only get to ask him one question during class and if you have more questions you have to go to his office, everytime you ask him a question he treats you like an idiot
I'll second the energy/confrontational comment.  He made a girl cry in my class.  Great professor though.
funny guy. very energetic, which could be interpreted as confrontational. but he is always available for extra help, which helped me get through this subject that's not my forte.
gives lots of partial credit, gives curves, do your homework
The departmental final is easy if you study the tests that he gives
Has a sharp tongue...has a tendency to think certain questions are "stupid" (I just observed this....luckily I never asked him a question).  Do the homework
wonderful, he is very clear and helpful
I did not like his teaching style, but Cal II is a difficult class in itself.
Do the homework, and study hard for tests.
You need to have a good background in Math.  do the homework and understand them
Dr. Cannon is an awesome, helpful teacher. Not the easiest, but not the hardest.

He is an extremely difficult professor. Class where students should study 3 hrs. outside of class for every hour in class. READING IS REQUIRED FOR SOCRATIC DAYS EVERY FRIDAY. Tests are very difficult but come from readings and class lectures. This class can be fun and hard at times which don't go together....If your wanting an EASY A....get lost
Great professor! Would probably be the worlds greatest grandpa. Loves to tell jokes and keeps you interested in his lectures. SI's are helpful. 5 extra points on the final for perfect attendance.

Dr. Gilbreath is a very good professor who made the very boring topic of Business History somehow fairly interesting. He knows his stuff and loves to answer just about any question, even if it has nothing to do with the class.

Dr. Gilbreath is honestly one of the kindest human beings you will ever come across.  I find him funny when he talks about the generation gaps and kind of rambles off.  He actually answers questions for you for any class you have at the start of class, not just his.  A helluva guy really, nothing but good things to say about him.
There is a lot of reading, but he is probably one of the nicest guys ever & very helpful. Tests are easy if you pay attention in class & do the assigned reading.
Great Class!  Econ has never been this much fun!  i would recomend if u are remotly interested in Econ.  Tests are challanging.  Just do you homework!
No Comments

I never took his classes, but on the Baylor in Great Britain trip, we had some awful travel experiences, and Dr. Gilbreath and his wife "adopted" us and took care of us. He even bought us food when we said we were too upset to eat, because he said we "needed to eat."  A very kind, caring man.
suck. tests are hard, but its fun being in that class.
Great great teacher. I really enjoy his class. He provides all of his lecture notes and tests are very manageable if you do the reading and study questions. Highly recommended.
The nicest guy!

Be prepared, read (not sit and stare at book!!!)For this coarse I suggest u have a few pages for each of the 20 main ppl you study, and keep notes on them individually so you dont get confused.  Great Prof, loves us, you will love going to the ranch w/him

This guy thinks he's the shizzle...the class is not all that interesting unless you are motivated to know the history of economics...i found socratic fridays to be unproductive because of how intimidating he was.
Don't be afraid to go meet him, it will help you more than you think.
Pretty Humorous
Pretty easy class, but be prepared for socratic Fridays!

He is the best Teacher at Baylor.  Has written a lot of books and worked for the Federal Reserve.  He is clear and humorous!  You will learn a lot.  He can answer almost any question you ask and will take the class out to his ranch at the end of the sem.
Would recommend
Dr. Moore is an amazing professor, he does assign homework and essays but they aren't too bad. His class is fun, he doesn't lecture much he uses more of a activity and discussion method.
Lots of guidence throughout the class and he really cares about growing you as a leader

really expands your knowledge. If you do you work and show up for class you will get an A. Don't be late and spend time on your presentations. Create good discussion questions and PARTICIPATE IN CLASS DISCUSSIONS!!!! There aren't any tests but do the online journal and spend time on your teaching philosophy because you will use it in the future.
Great teacher, makes you think about why you really want to be a teacher and what impact we can make on the world. Really enjoyed his thought provoking class!!

Professor Moore is an excellent instructor who is passionate about what he teaches. However, he teaches in a way that if you are expecting a direct answer you will not get one. He has weekly reflective journals due over the reading and you must talk in class. He expects you to and he loves socratic seminars. Do these things and you will do well.
Overall, very passionate about the subject
Great teacher, extremely helpful and concerned with student's comprehension of the material. Definitely recommend taking him! By far one of the best professors I've had at Baylor.
Great teacher!

He was very helpful and also probably the fairest teacher I have ever had.  I really enjoyed going to his class.  He is very passionate about his subject and really wants to get to know his students.  I am taking him for another class next semester.

Mr. Moore is very helpful!  He encourages us to ask questions and he really wants to get to know his students.  If anyone is struggling he takes time to talk with them and help them out.  He is very caring about what he does and I highly recommend taking his section!
cool teacher to have, very nice and easy to interact with him
I took him at MCC, and he is a great teacher! Use the website on book for studying!
I love him as a professor. He's very personable.This was my second time taking him and again, I feel like I've learned so much!!!
amazng teacher!! he made everything to down to earth, and easy to understand and apply to every day life. loved this class.

Professor Moore was the most amazing guy ever for this course!!! He made this topic soo much easier for me!! Don't get me wrong, you still have to work, but I promise you it is ALL WORTH IT!!! Great Guy! I would take him again!!! GREAT GUY! He really cares about his students and he handles his job with care!!! TAKE HIM!! ;-)
he is absolutely excellent! definitely take him!!
Great professor
very easy to talk to made class interesting
Tends to rant about off topic subjects. Hard tests. Annoying voice.
No Comments

If you actually study for this class and pay attention, you will pass. I like Prof. Holmes and even though he can occasionally go on tangents, he is very knowledgable and willing to help his students outside of class. He begins the semester telling you what you have to do to succeed in his class; pay attention to his suggestions and you'll do fine.

I actually like this guy, those most dont. He blantantly tells you what you need to know, offers a letter grade curve, and comprehensive tests so you can constantly improve your grade. I like it, because  with all this, I think he actually wants everyone to pass. Actually study, you'll do fine.

I had Holmes for 1305 and 1306.  I wish i had gotten out of the 1306 class while i still had a chance.  He has no structure, no reviews, you teach yourself EVERYTHING.. and no matter how much you study the tests are very tricky.

Very unhelpful.  Half the class will fail the tests, he likes to trick you multiple times on tests.  Worst professor I have had at Baylor...I can even say I respect him as a person.  He goes on and on about nothing while skipping test material...good luck
i think this man is a joke of a teacher. when you come to him for help, he blaintly says that you dont have a chance and he cant help you study. he is the worst ive ever had.
This guy has completely lost his marbles. Hands down has to be the craziest prof I ever met. Avoid this guy like the black plague. He can turn on you like a rabid dog!
funny, the tests are pretty hard but not completely impossible.  he likes to make tricky questions
What the Ph of chalk?  There is no Ph it has to be in a solution first...who does this guy think he is
Funny guy. Great sense of humor. Gives 1 letter grade curve.
He got cancer though, so maybe he'll lighten up!
the tests, the pain, the suffering, where will it end?
oh, there's a curve...at the end, on the final, if you make an A
Tests are really tough...Average test scores are 60..and there is no curve
Just stands at the front of the class and talks. The. Whole. Time. No change in voice inflection, no slides, nothing. If you can't learn with just vocal lectures, take someone else.

It's been 14 years since I graduated as a poli sci major. I had Dr Brown for many many classes and to this day, I can remember his lectures and our conversations. There are not many professors that left an impression on me, and even fewer that would motivate me to write more than a decade later.
Go. Read. Pay attention. Keep communication with him. Get an A.

Overall, Dr. Brown is a cool guy- very laid back, likes to have some fun once in a while. Lectures, however, can get a little boring. Sometimes, what he wants you to do for an assignment isn't exactly clear, so make sure to clarify. Quizzes and tests are sometimes verbatim from the book. Don't over-think them, or you'll mess up. Decent class.
Very easy course. Lectures are a bit boring, but the text is fine. Nice and personable guy, average teacher.
Dr. Brown is a nice guy and willing to help you out just can be incredibly boring at times
hes nice and if you are failing talk to him and you should be ok
No Comments
He's really nice, but be sure to ask questions to clarify his expectations.
No Comments

He's a nice guy, but his tests are completely random as hell. He can't spell correctly or let alone speak correctly. However ( or hayever in brownism) he is organized in class, although there is a good chance you will fall asleep. Do not take him. He's the professor who makes pple change majors.
Dr. Brown is a nice guy. I just wish his class wasnt as boring.
No Comments
This class is very difficult, it is hard to take notes and the tests are ridiculous. I wouldnt recommmend this class.
WORST teacher ever. Can't understand him, and really boring. DO NOT! Take this guy.
SO boring, prof is completely monotone and shows no interest in his lectures.  DO NOT take this prof
class is pointless and boring
Textbook is KEY. He speaks straight from it. But beware if you are searching for that A, he tests over what HE says, not the book. Listen closely.
Awesome teacher!

Professor Riley is one of my favorite professors here at Baylor. He does a good job at making the information meaningful and he really wants his students to excel. The tests aren't difficult if you study, but don't expect a blow off class.

The class isn't too hard as long as you take good notes and actually study for the tests! There are no daily grades or quizzes, just tests and 3 research hours. He always gives good examples to help you understand concepts.

Hugh Riley was an amazing instructor, very knowledgable, extremely interesting person, and takes an interest in the success of his students. He has a way of building rapport with his students and knowing just how to get the material across to them. Def take Riley!
Loved Riley! Makes things very clear and is incredibly helpful! Really cares about the students. Absolutely take him!
Excellent; helpful and knowledgeable
Riley rules.
No Comments
No Comments

prof. riley was so awesome in his lectures. he clearly knows how to get the material out to his students, and is always willing to help. he was available at all hours of the night to answer questions, and knew exactly what he was talking about.
fairly straightfoward and a nice guy

he is the kinedest professor I have ever dealt with. I had an emergency mid semester and without his encouragement and help I don't think I would've been able to finish the year out. He truly cares about his student as people.
Super easy and nice. Really cares. I didn't really have to read for the class but it helps. I thought it was an easy A.
interesting man. Very willing to help and you need it. Hard class...tons of info. READ READ READ. Sweet guy though.
No Comments

Test were straight forward but pretty easy if you study for them. Term and definition heavy type class and lecture every class. Lab portion was in person and online. In person lab was terrible but online was super easy.
Lots of lecture time and few tests. Would recommend him 100%
Funny guy. Do your work, study your notes, pay attention, and you will be fine. He is not very responsive with emails, so your best bet is to talk to him face to face. Great Prof.

Dr. Russell is an extremely kind and very helpful professor. He does the cutest little demonstrations and shows a lot of videos in class. His lectures are pretty dense, but they're also very interesting. All of the homework is done online and you'll only have homework like 5 times in a semester. The labs were super easy. There's no excuse to fail.

I loved Dr. Russell's astronomy class. There is no textbook which is great. He has everything on blackboard and sticks to the schedule. You do have to purchase a clicker for this class to get quiz grades, but I've really enjoyed this class and highly recommend it. Labs aren't too difficult, either.

He is such a nice guy!He is a tad mono-tone so make sure to keep yourself focussed so you don't fall asleep.He is funny and trys to make the subject as fun as possible.No textbook required and no H.W. except for Pre-Labs. Take this class!

Such a fun class! I learned so much and Dr. Russell is super funny. Learning about wormholes was the best =p He loves to pretend he's the solar system and will spin around as he's teaching. Take this class!
Absolutely loved this class. Homework is nonexistent except for the separate lab class. Attend class because you'll do better on the tests if you do. It's an interesting class. No math involved.

Prof is absolutely adorable! One of his jokes: What's the difference between a nova and a supernova? The supernova has a cape!!  Class can be kind of boring, but it really isn't that demanding. Labs are easy.

He is a very nice guy.  If you have any ?'s just ask, he's more than willing to help.  Do the hmwk and do well in the lab. His tests are really random and you wonder what your making until the last day.  Curves grades at the end.  I would take him if you get the chance.
He seems like a very nice man. The tests aren't too bad. good teacher overall!
soo cute!! adorable. tests are so-so. lets you know what its over though. very funny and helpful. definately take him.
he was the cutest man!  always cracking jokes and always had a smile on his face.  the material was easy to cover and the tests are all multiple choice.
He is the cutest man EVER.  And he's so nice.
This class was very easy...the test was the exact same material as the in-class quizzes that HE GAVE US THE ANSWERS TO! Plus, he made the class interesting.
good teacher, too much banter

I don't know why people consider Dr. Rushing as a tough professor, because her motive definitely isn't to ruin your grade. The class is fair, and as long as you READ THE BOOK attentively, you will surely make an A in the class. If you need help, don't wait till the last minute. Be mindful of the test questions. The pattern is always the same :)

This professor was probably the worst teacher I have ever had. She is SO unapproachable and favors kids right and left. She DOES NOT drop test grades NOR curves them... even though the entire rest of my teachers did... including my honors professors. Her tests were IMPOSSIBLY hard and she is SO very intimidating and unwilling to help. Such a jerk!

Dr Rushing is a really nice woman, but her tests are IMPOSSIBLE!  Unless you have a very good understanding of biology from AP Biology in high school, I would avoid taking her class.  She teaches very well, and her SI is amazing, I learned so much in this class, but still only pulled a high D. If you do take her, be prepared to study study study bi
At first she seems like this little sweet old woman, then she becomes the devil.
She seems to think that all honors students are stuck up and loves to yell at us for the most random things . . . and her tests are horrible!!!!

dr. rushing is nice but she isnt very approachable. she doesnt seem like she would be very nice. her tests are a killer if you dont do well in bio DONT TAKE HER. her tests require so much study time. but her si is very helpful.
This professor was very good at explaining material. She also provided extra credit and provided SI (supplemental instruction) for additional help.

very nice lady, but her tests are a killer!!! plus, your grade is only figured by your test scores, so if you dont do well on them you are out of luck. if you do take her study a ton for her tests, because she likes to try and trick you with test questions.
very silly, very liberal little woman. you can tell she wants to talk more on evolution, but some baylor kids would prolly throw a fit if she did. tests are hard, but doable if you study.
Great person...class requires alot of studying, but she's worth it!
Fun, quarky woman....but BEWARE her tests!!!
No Comments
No Comments
Her tests require quite a bit of studying.
Very perky lil woman, dont be fooled, her tests suck.
She loves bryophytes

Great professor.  He is very intelligent but doesn't require others in the class to adhere to his viewpoint.  At an ultra-conservative place like Baylor students often get angry that Dr. Riley is fair and not just a right winger.  That is unfortunate because he always respectful of all opinions.

Dr. Riley was the first polil sci teacher I had at Baylor.  I wasn't a poli sci major at the time but so enjoyed his class I switched majors.  I never got to take him again due to schedule problems.  However he is one teacher I will always remember.  He is better described as demanding, not hard. I'm a teacher because of him.

Honestly, I thought this was a horrible class. Professors should NEVER be allowed to teach from books they themselves wrote, and he did just that. He required you to know things that they don't even ask in law school (seriously). Only take if you absolutely must, or if you wish to test your ability to remember what Supreme Court Justice said what.

Very inteligant on the subject matter but dosent speak over your head.  Willing to accept all differnet view on politics and is very careful about exposing his side.  Great personality and keeps discussions very engaging.

A tough grader but a very interested teacher. Will take time to work with students outside of office hours and presents material very well. Politically honest about his views and willing to listen to differing opinions. Doesn't tolerate vapid comments/opinions from any point of political spectrum.

Riley is one of the worst professors I have ever had.  You must come into the class with an ideological outlook that is similar to his.  If you want to do okay in the class, you must either agree with him at the beginning or learn to agree with him by the end of the class.  Also, he only gives letter grades, making it hard to figure out your grade.
I like how he tries to get us involved and wants us to get to know the information.

A great teacher. Those who say he doesn't present "both sides" evenly are the same people who think Fox News is "fair and balanced". He is simply very honest about our failures and successes in areas of politics.
He comes across as gruff and kind of a sourpuss, but he really is a good teacher and he cares about his students (the ones who bother to come to class, anyway).
He may know his subjects well, but he does not always provide both sides of the argument.
He is very knowledgable, but his lectures will make you want to jump up and scream just to stay awake.  It is the same thing every class and has no variety.
Great man.  Makes class interesting.  He is extremely knowledgable and provides a challenge but isnt impossible.  Very passionate about poli sci.  you will learn alot if you want.
Made a C and still love the man - hilarious and leads great discussions.

tempting to skip b/c there are never quizzes or homework, but class notes are a must for tests. class is easy to understand, but a lot of info to remember. funny, friendly, laid back kind of guy. class discussion is important, keep up on current events.
wonderful professor w/ great sense of humor
Good teacher, very knowledgeable on topic.  Tests are quite hard but I enjoyed the class

Ms.Assink is a breath of fresh air, I went in thinking there was going to be loads of homework but she organizes the assignments really well. The only down side is that once you miss an assignment there is no late turn in and honestly I respect that policy because her assignments aren't hard to do as long as you put in effort you'll be sure to pass
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: This professor is very dry. She makes us write essays about every 2 weeks but makes you turn in step by step and only gives you about 2-3 days to do the assignment. I would definitely not take her again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Overall Professor Assink was not bad. She has the typical dry humor and personality of an English teacher. There was required reading for each class and weekly quizzes, but they were not difficult if you even read the sparknotes. It was not super hard to get an A! I would recommend taking her.

one of the worst classes I have taken at Baylor, and easily one of the worst professors I have had. She makes a class that should be easy and helpful very difficult and a huge headache. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. It is a huge mistake.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She is actually nice but class is very dry and it was way more difficult than any major class. I spent more time on this class than almost every class combined and I am taking hard classes. It is very hard to find drive in a class that feels pointless especially when it is so difficult.

The textbook is mandatory! She assigned reading for every class day, and there were quizzes every Friday that basically tested if you read the material or not. She did take attendance and graded participation (which was basically actually talking to those around you). A generic English class; do the work and you'll easily pass with a good grade!
Assink is a difficult professor who led a boring and incoherent class. Her personality lacks substance and so does her assignments. Tough grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Grades super tough and is unclear about assignments. Would not take her again. English is my best class and I bombed this class. If you miss class your grade suffers. Very unchill and has no mercy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Although you definitely have to work for your grade, I really liked her. Her dry sense of humor was the high point of each class, and she never hesitated to answer any questions about requirements or grading. There was quite a bit of group work, but nothing difficult. Just follow her requirements and you'll be good.

I am a STEM major who put in several hours for each class in order to get a C. It was frustrating having to spend so much time preparing for this class in order to receive mediocre grades on papers, considering that this was detracting from my focus on my major-specific classes. Many of my classmates also struggled with her difficult grading.
She looks like Ann Hathaway! Nice and formal. Sarcastic but doesn't force friendship.
Unclear about assignments. Hardest grader ever.
She is as boring as can be. Very monotone and blah. Writing essays is not something I will use in the future. Steer Clear!
She's pretty cute.
Really average, nobody to write home about.  Not trying to be mean, just honest.

She was extremely profession and sweet, very willing to help and always has something relevant to say. The way to make a bad grade is to not go to class at all, because she uses lots of in class materials. I took her for both semesters of freshman english, and I am very satisfied with her!

Ranks in the top tier of American history teachers of all time.  An incredible expert in all aspects of American political history but especially on the history of the American Presidency.  Funny.  Entertaining.  Full of amazing facts.  Tough grader.  But very clear about standards.  Intense student preparation makes the class easy.
I would not have enjoyed undergrad or graduate school without Dr. Armitstead's energy and enthusiasm!  One of a kind.
He called his students out and enjoyed watching them "squirm".
Loved him...very neat guy. Would have liked to take him for American Presidents, but didn't have time!
No Comments
Takes awhile to come around and enjoy the class, but you will learn alot. I made an A but i worked at it.

This guy is amazing!!  You will never find another prof who knows more about the Presidents of the US than this man!  His lectures are fascinating -- but the tests are tough, but pay attention and you'll do fine.  I made an A, and it wasn't easy, but it was fun.
He is a great professor---just so f-ing hard.  I had trouble with his class----both times I took it!
Sucks. stay away
He was one of my favorite professors!!  He knew so much and was fascinating to listen to.  He's not easy, but I loved the class (I took him twice American Presidents was great!!)
This man is amazing...loved his David Letterman mannerisms!

I was warned by a previous generation Baylorite that he tested tough. I took his course anyway and made a B. The next semester I made a C. He is a great lecturer, but don't count on the lecture and test having the same content.
We took a lot of notes and the class wasn't easy, but it was ALWAYS entertaining!  He always had some crazy story or point of view to share with us.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Good lecturer. Less than helpful in office hours. If you're a sorority girl and give him a T-shirt he'll be nice. Otherwise, he'll tell you to study your best rather than explain a question.

I don't think he's the problem but the set up between him teaching lectures and TA's teaching lab... many times, it doesn't over lap. We didn't even use the lab manuel in lab, and he wrote it! For a basic class, he needs to cover more groundwork.

I love the fact that he teaches and all that and just let's it ALL hang out. Totally awsome. I mean totally awsome. Take his class if you like profesers who do not hassle you with stuff and who just let you work and who don't care if you do or don't. He's totally awsome. Totally hot too.
They should put this in the bible: He wrote The Best Damn Lab Manual in the Nniverse. It's unbuckingfelievable.

This dude ROCKS! He's a wild guy who totally rocks the werld! Totally awsume! Take his class and you'll learn a lot of stuff about mitoses and disection and stuff like that. I'm going for medical school and he's totally awsome. Mister Vodopich ROCKS! HE"S AWOSOME!
at least it's only once a week! requires you to know information that is irrevelant and difficult to learn.
really smart man, he's helpful and very extensive in lecture.  too bad his voice puts me to sleep.
HIs lectures are tolerable.  If you cell phone rings, run from the class immediately, and withdraw!
Ecology with him is a blast. The test are tough, the lab is easy, he lectures well, you'll know a lot at the end of the semester. It's a fun class to take, even if you are pre-med!

Great lecturer!  He makes bio lab really interesting and conveys what you need to learn clearly and concisely.  But, definitely, - turn off your cell phones!!!!  I repeat - No cell phone.  Have some respect.

his lectures are very clear and to the point. they help supplement your BIO 1305/1306 class and answer some questions that your 1305/06 professor may not clarify.  he has a good sense of humor and really knows how to get his point across.
Intelligent man who knows how to get his points across.  He sometimes uses visual aids and examples in lectures.  The lab exams are not bad if you study the lab manual and take the online quiz.
Great guy to take. He's funny, smart, conveys his point well. You won't regret taking him if you keep up with reading assignments and turn your cell phone off!
Great professor.  Just remember to turn off cell phones.
Study hard. He is very nice though.
He talks cool. Has a sense of humor.

Lawson's classes were certainly unique. His lectures were great and the class was structured in groups to encourage peer learning. The material he lectures mostly isn't what is tested, rather how the ideas can be applied to other things. They were very difficult and hard to study for, but the homework wasn't too bad as long as you read the book.

I do not recommend Lawson at all. He is a lovely guy, so sweet I feel bad for even writing this review, but I am genuinely considering changing my major because of how hard this class was. His textbook is unlike any of the other books that biology teachers use, and every concept that is taught needs to be learned through experiments. don't take him
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: The class is difficult but the professor is really good. He explains everything clearly, provides examples, itâ€™s just on you to actually take the time and study. Itâ€™s a grind but Iâ€™ve managed to get As and Bs on all the tests so far. Itâ€™s possible u just have to try. The professor cares about his class, he wants his students to succeed.

Don't get me wrong, he is a nice guy and loved biology (and will tell you he is a microbiologist ALL THE TIME). But, his lectures are pointless to the class. Material being tested on was rarely gone over in class... Thank god I realized I had credit for this class so I could get out of it because he made it SO MUCH HARDER THAN IT NEEDED TO BE.

If you have Dr. Lawson, run away immediately. His whole entire BIO 1305 sections are compromised of weekly discussion posts, quizzes, one essay, and four exams. Although Dr. Lawson cracks Dad jokes here and there, he is a terrible professor. His lectures will be very confusing if you do not have a great foundation in Biology. He is very unhelpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take Dr. Lawson. BIO 1305 is one of the hardest classes I have taken because of him. His lectures are all over the place and they do not make sense. He makes students take exams on weekends (due Saturday's) and he has weekly quizzes due Saturday evenings. His office hours are not helpful and he does not care about his students' success.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Beware of the resentful freshman whove given Dr. Lawson very poor reviews. They alone are to blame for their demise. Hes a dedicated man who will take the time with you, and the whole class, if you dont understand the content. If you dont do the readings, you wont have much to ask and will be overwhelmed. Exams and quizzes not that bad, at all
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters

comment: Way too many tests, like every other week you have a test. Also a terrible man, very unhelpful in office hours and ridiculously sarcastic when I actually asked for help. An absolute atrocity to society and the Baylor learning department. Not only is he incredibly selfish, he also uses derogatory language when referring to specific diseases.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This was by far the most difficult class I have ever taken in my entire life. His class was not even about BIO1305, it was about charts and graphs that didnt make sense. His lectures were awful, and he made references that made no sense. If you want to feel stupid even though you arent, take this class. Be prepared to fail everything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Lawson is one of the worst professors I have ever taken. There is no way for me to explain my frustration with him and his class in these few characters. He is an incompetent man who shouldnt be a professor. He does not have the slightest clue on how to teach and help his students. If you want to save yourself and career, DONT TAKE HIS CLASS!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: This professor has possible ruined my chance in being a bio major on a pre-med track. he teaches from a new online textbook that fails to help me learn the information that i need in my future biology classes. He fails to properly explain and go over concepts in the book, and i spend 3 hrs a night for this class. you will learn MORE on youtube.

Do not take this course. If you want to study for hours on end and still receive a failing test/quiz grade do not take this course. I think half of my class dropped mid semester because of Lawson. When lecturing, he is extremely vague and never goes into complete detail on the material. I have never been so challenged/confused in my life.

Taking Lawsons Bio might be the biggest course mistake you could make at Baylor. Lawson hardly ever teaches any material in the textbook. Instead, he shows us his own play doh diagrams and his uses own separate lectures to guide class. Look to zone him out and take notes from the unorthodox textbook, and you might come away with a 50.

This is a class that teaches the history of experiments in biology. The tests are extremely hard to study for. No matter how hard you studied for the test in this class you arent even guaranteed a 70 on the test. I like Lawson but hate the class. Everyone wishes they would have taken regular 1305. Take the regular 1305 if you are reading this.
just the worst class i have ever taken
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The most vague professor I've ever had in my life. I have literally never had someone try to explain something to me before, only to leave me more confused then when I started. He uses an entirely different textbook than the other bio professors for 1305. I spent 2 hours going through an open textbook quiz for a 61 because the info is so unclear.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I have also heard mixed reviews on him but personally I loved this class. One of those negative reviews came from a friend who switched to Journalism and I think this fact hurts him since he will have a class of 200+ students and not all of them are cut out for Business. He also doesn't have time for cheaters and has a sarcastic sense of humor...

He gets mixed reviews a lot but personally I think he is one of the best teachers around. Doesn't seem to have a lot of time for cheaters or those who shouldn't be business majors and don't take his class seriously but if you put in time and are interested he will like that. He has a sarcastic personality.. but I don't care(and he is very helpfull)

He LOVES his job, and prepares each class period to be filled with different things. There is a guest every day which breaks up the class period well and he rarely just lectures but makes it fun with games and stuff. It sort of feels like you are on a game show sometimes. You'll have to do an online thing called foundation which is AWFUL though.

Blaine is a bright teacher. He probably thinks he knows more than he really knows but he teaches a very interesting class. FaceTime guests are awesome every day of class. Many CEOs and executives visit and make the real world connection to students. I learned so much.

You will hate him/foundation or love him/foundation. I loved it. He's got some dry humor but a good heart. WSJ questions get detailed so read carefully. Make notes on everything in class... he will ask about a facetime guests' socks if he wants to on a test. Foundation is a great game and get help early for it and you will be fine.

Pretty interesting class.  You have to read 6-8 WSJ articles between classes and you get quizzed over them every class.  Your Foundation grade will depend what your group is like, but the individual portion of it makes up for it if you get a bad grade there.  You read the whole Benjamin Franklin book in about 3 weeks but it's interesting.
Loves the honor code to the point where he'll test you over it. You won't learn much from this class. It's main use is to weed out the students who aren't really sure if they're business majors.

His class is quite interesting but I expected to learn much more about the basics of business. If you keep up with the Wall Street Journals and do well on Foundation, you'll do fine in the class. Regarding Dr. McCormick, he is very unapproachable. To be honest, I was scared to ask him even the smallest question. Ultimately, not a bad class.

This class is AMAZING! I have worked in the business world for 2 years then decided to finish my degree and his knowledge is very useful and insightful! The work in the class is not hard, but it is "busy" work. You will learn so much. If you do not like this class, then business is not fo you, because everything he teaches is real world.

He is a nice guy but don't expect to learn much about the basics of business. Very unapproachable, almost like a celebrity, the student helpers/guest speakers run the class. Most of the work is self taught. Don't expect him to know your name, it's a huge class with very little Professor/Student interaction.
Very sarcastic. Attend class everyday and keep up with the wall street journals and you'll do fine.
he is a horrible teacher and does not know anything about the business world...i have been working in the business world for years and he is the most unexperienced individual i have ever met...

Dr. McCormick is a great prof. His class is very structured and he stays on task. I learned a lot, I think this class was very beneficial to my education. Dr. McCormick has integrity and grades fairly. I highly recommend his class.
engaging, bright and creative
Great Teacher, read the wall streets they are very important...Easy A
The best professor I've ever had. Very creative. Very fun. Super nice guy. The class was easy if you were active in class. He makes you want to learn and participate.

William Virgil Davis' contribution to me as a professor was life altering. It is in his classroom that I learned critical thinking and gained the capacity to look beyond the surface of the material and coalesce new thought. I will be forever grateful to him for the effect he has had on my life

DrDavis Lectures-A Must* SimplyFantasticIfIMay.* ParticipateInClassEarnsTrust,* ofBestProfessorOfOurDay!*FromHisStoriesYouWillGather,*InfoFromOurPastPrizeWinners.* RedeemYourSweat-OftenLather.* ThisClassAin'tForTrueBeGinNers!* Much i learned and Proud I Am!*TisHiddenKnowledge,ThisWeLust,* Don't Let The Door Before You Slam!* DrDavisLectures-A Must!

He's a good writer and has many interesting stories, but he's self-absorbed in the extreme. He only teaches to show off his knowledge and see how closely students can emulate his writing style. He's hard to impress and even harder to read, and his feedback is all but useless. His writing courses might be bearable, but avoid his literature courses.

Davis is a great lecturer. He's a storyteller, and from his stories you learn intimate details of the people you're studying in class. His classes demand a lot of reading, but it is all worth it. He may be intimidating at first, but if you ask questions and engage yourself in the work, he'll be happy to help you. Be prepared to add to disscussion.

He took pleasure in the difficulty of the class and was impossible to please. Offered almost no feedback and gave a huge amount of work. He's brilliant, but I think his main object was to have students leave the class thinking he was brilliant--rather than to leave the class knowing a little more themselves.

Dr. Davis is definitely tough. His obsession is poetry, and you will need to read widely. He's not easy to impress, but he's a good listener. His creative writing class is excellent and will make you a much better poet. Davis himself is quite a good poet, and I recommend reading some of his work. His class and stories are worth the work involved.
Very difficult. Intimidating. Has interesting stories. Is brilliant.

The English Department is packed with great profs.  Davis is not among these.  He's not a bad prof. (he actually has some very interesting stories), but his people skills are lacking.  Also, his grading methods are questionable.  Life's too short to pay for Davis to teach you:  take Hanks, Garrett or Ferretter.

Very unprofessional.  For example, during the first week of class he railed against us because we had not read an assigned reading.  There was a valid reason on why the entire class had not read the book-no bookstore had the book.  A few days later he checked the Baylor Bookstore and the book still had not come in yet.  He never did apologise.
By far the most difficult class I took, ever. But I learned more from his pomposity than I thought I could. Impressive, formidable, endearing.

Yes, he is a pompous jerk, but he does know modern poetry well.  If you are willing to struggle with his abrasive style it could pay off but there are other profs at Baylor that can teach poetry well without the attitude.
Worst professor I have ever had! Never explains anything! Not helpful at all, never encourages, and only smiles when criticizing others! Do not take him!!

Extremely bright and often entertaining, but I know of 2 people who had to drop out of grad school because of his incompetence at directing a thesis. He's too enamored of his own cleverness to bother helping others.
Awful Awful AWFUL do NOT take!
Dr. Davis is too pompous for his own good.  Horrible professor
Great lecturer: "The Bill Davis Story Hour"

Took her for ACC 2304 online and failed the class. Material is pretty understandable however both the tests and the structure of the class in general are extremely difficult. She is very sassy and hard to work with. Would recommend anyone but her!
Worst professor I've ever taken. Do not take this professor at all costs. Will not work with you, assumes the worst about you with no previous interaction, and plays favorites.

I don't know why people dislike Betsy. I thought she was wonderful. I am a horrid accounting student and I was able to learn from her. She was amazing. Maybe the other students just need As to be handed out like candy? It's a university program people.

This is by far the worst learning experience Ive ever had. If I hadnt previously taken a course successfully in my online MBA program (to compare this one to), I likely would have withdrawn and/or transferred because of the lack of actual teaching,the repeated technological issues, and sporadic communication from this instructor.

Her teaching style is often times trying to make students feel dumb for asking questions or not knowing the answer. She is very sassy. And you pretty much have to teach yourself the material. Be prepared for lots of homework.

She didn't teach our class anything. SI and working on your own is the only way to learn anything in this class. Her homework is very helpful for tests but she doesn't teach. This class could pretty much be online except she probably wouldn't post the notes. If you have to take her, be prepared to work hard for your A.

There's a lot of work in this class but it's not particularly hard and there's extra credit for it as well.  I got 100% on my homework grade, not knowing accounting before this class.  Tests are somewhat difficult, but again there are extra credit points available for each test as well.  Go to SI..it was very helpful. I would recommend Ms. Willis.

It's accounting. You either get it or you don't. If you actually do the exercises BEFORE class, she will like you and you'll get extra points that really help. It's funny when she gets mad when no one does them. The tests are kinda hard, but if you go to the SIs and do the handouts, you'll make an A. AND she always wears cute outfits! Take Willis!!

I would highly recommend her.  Very very nice lady, keeps class varied and interesting, provides a million practice handouts, classwork sheets, lists, and SI handouts to help you learn.  Just be warned that daily class requirements are reading, classwork from book, classwork from her packets, and homework.  You will definately learn accounting!
No Comments

Mrs. Willis is always prepared, always has real life examples, and always gets the class involved wiht her teachings.  She is the most amazing teacher I have had in college and truely cares about the lives of her students.  She worked hard to get me a part time job in the field and really cares.

She was such an amazing teacher, all my friends are jealous because everyone in her class has an easy A with all the extra credit and handouts. Go to SI if you have trouble and you can't do poorly in this class.
Good teacher, but it is kind of funny when she gets frustrated with the class when nobody has done the class prep.
She loves to help you!  Very sweet lady that wants her students to learn the material.  You have do to ALL of the work to keep up but it's worth it!
This is by FAR the best teacher at Baylor.  I was blown away by her sincerity and she really cares for her students.  Baylor is better because of her.

THE BEST teacher at BU!  SO understanding, helpful, sweet, kind, a friend.  You learn much and enjoy it eventhough it is tough.  Must do homework to keep up.  Visit her in her office- she wants to help you learn it.  A+++++++!!!

This professor was an absolute waste of time. All of her classes were literally pointless since we basically taught ourselves all the material. The homework was done through Knewton, which is an online resource. There is no way to study for her tests because you can't even look back on the assignments. Find a different professor on my behalf...

She is very easy to get along with and a good person, but not that good of a teacher. I was so lost on the exam at the end of the year that I just gave up and left. It is a departmental exam and so it wasn't outlined the way she ever did for our tests. I was okay till the end of the year when we got into circles. Study online using my math lab.

Unbelievably long tests, leaving you unable to check your work (or even finish). Had to teach myself everything using the textbook and old notes from when I took Calculus I in high school. Her teaching style complicates everything, even when it is a simple concept. Completely unreasonable amount of "daily work" that she expects everyone to do.
Very nice lady and always willing to help you, but doesn't know how to teach.  I basically had to teach myself out of the book.  She makes her tests way too long.

Nice lady, but very boring in class. I spent every single day surfing the Internet and I'm still probably going to swing an A. She relies on the textbook, so it's easy to catch up on the days you drift off and stop paying attention (because these WILL happen.) Not a good teacher if you want to learn, but good for an easy grade.
Very nice teacher but does not know how to teach. Got an A b/c I had a great high school calc teacher!

Pre-Cal - ABOUT THE PROFESSOR: She is a nice woman, I'll give her that, she's very caring and if you go to her when you need help she won't hesitate to help you. She's equal to her students and really doesn't want to see you fail. ABOUT THE COURSE: I took the course in highschool (at that point, I was crazy about math and loved it) and thought it w

This is class is ridiculous! She knows what she is talking about but just does not know how to teach it or explain it. There is either homework due or a quiz every single class period. I pretty much had to teach myself everything and I barely pulled off a B. I would attempt to find another professor if at all possible!!

She does not make the course easy for you< but she will work with you as much as you want< she is very caring< and really is interested in seein you learn>  math is tough for me and this prof really helped me graduate!
It's rough, but she's the sweetest lady and knows what she's talking about.
im just terrible at math
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

If you want a "blow-off" prof this one is not for you!! She's known to be hard, but really it's the class that is hard and she has high standards but is fair, nice and funny. Spanish is definitely more enjoyable when you know that you learn the material well. She is a native speaker and bilingual  she is shows a lot about culture and the language.

Worst teacher ever.  And i really mean it, not just being mean.  I failed her, but made a high B with a different teacher.It wasnt easier and it SURE wasnt becaues I leaned anything from her.  It is just impossible to pass a foreign language class when the teacher can't even keep track of what is going on.
Probable the worst teacher I have taken at Baylor.  It is teacher's like her that keep Baylor from ever really being a top school.  She is mean, unorganized, unhelpful, and just plain a mess.
Very difficult to get a straight answer from. Tests often cover material not covered in class. Favoritism is a problem, especially with the native speakers in our class.

One of the most unappreciated professors at Baylor--a definitely intelligent woman who motivates the serious student. Not a class for slackers. She's dedicated, compassionate, caring, funny and very HOT! I love her class and look forward to going to it. She's cool, alright!

One of the best teachers at Baylor--if you want to learn. She's very caring, professional and compassio nate. Be prepared to work hard but it'll pay off with your advanced knowledge that you'll gain from her class which willhelp inm the other courses. I've taken her 3 times and loved her classes.

Prof. Erickson is one of the best & most inspirational teachers I've had.  If anyone says otherwise, it's probably b/c they slacked off.  She seems to really care about students and wants them to learn something.  If you want to actually get something out of this class, take it from her.  She is a wonderful teacher!!
She is nice. This is the first time I've actually had fun in Spanish class!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
confusing and always talking about how good puerto rico is
No Comments
very talkative
Expects you to learn on your own.

I graduated some years ago in the 2004-2008 time-frame and I can say with complete confidence that the folks who give the worst reviews are the ones who never got cast and refused to take that as a hint that it was time to pick another major.
Amazing teacher.
Best Theatre teacher I had.  Other comments are sour grapes because he didn't cast them in plays.  Expects a lot from students, but gives a lot in return.
No Comments
No Comments
Even without the moustache, Stan Denman is a mighty man. He carries a lot on those freakishly large shoulders. I loved having him as a professor.  Thank GOD he is running the ship in theatre.

Good, good, good professor of acting and directing. Blunt as hell? Yes! Hard on us especially in acting? Yes. But he taught me so much about myself, art, theatre, life. I may have griped when I didn't like something now and then, but now that I just graduated I am most gratefful for him.  Highly recommended to all future theatre majors.

This man made my fellow classmates and my life as well living hell. Not only does he play favorites but he will repeatedly tear people down to make himself look "better" Thank God i left that hell hole of a school and made a name for myself without his help. Thanks Stan! You still suck.
Difficult but informative.  If you want to learn, this guy will teach you.

Stan loves to play dad to his students, but watch out.  He's paranoid, suspicious, vindictive, and very childish if you get on his bad side (which you can do very easily--his paranoia leads him to jump to conclusions). He has created an atmosphere of tension and distrust. He takes far too great an i

Stan is one of the finest teachers that I have ever worked with.  In addition to his incredible scope of vision as an artist, he is one of the most genuinely caring people that I have aver known.  His care for all his students and the department is evident in everything that he does.

Stan can't objectively evaluate anything.If you want to stick it out as an actor here you haveto make yourself invaluable to him.Either get so popular in the dept. that he has to play nice or work inthe office&work your butt off.or buck the system&risk it

Stan's just incredibly self absorbed &that makes it hard for students to deal w/him because he has to pick his favorites in order to create a"clique" if you will that he can be a part of &be popular within,& if your not picked;wellgood luck,you'
He makes life quite difficult.  ie censoring your shows, casting HODGE ect.  he is now the chair of the department.  Im not sure he is still teaching any classes
Thinks a bit too much of himself -- well, he is a theatre major

Dr. Smith is by far one of the best professors at Baylor. If you want to take latin, take him. He is hilarious and always makes class interesting- usually the highlight of my day! Be prepared to study A LOT because Latin is just hard in general. The always have clear material straight out of the book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: A Saint of a man that gave me independent instruction in Latin I. Very quickly identified my learning style and is all about positive reinforcement. Truly a gem. Funny but respected and an experienced teacher since the 80s. Take him.
He was an amazing prof.
He is one of the best professors in the world.
He's really great. I am so taking him next year. Greek rocks and so does dr. smith. He's really helpful and he doesn't mind if you want to drop in his office!

Whoah. This guy is tough. I studied for hours each day and I'm going to have to take it again from another professor next semester. I guess his teaching style just doesn't match my learning style. Personally, I think the world of Dr. S, but I'd never consider another of his classes. He's hilarious with his childhood tales. Expect to work hard.
He is the best professor anyone could ever have
great
Hilarious! Constantly joking and makes the learning fun.
He's incredibly funny, and he's had such an interesting life. He makes latin very un-boring-- we laughed our heads off constantly and I learned a ton.
great man, cares about the students
He spends too much time trying to be funny instead of teaching.  Waste of time, stay with Davis.
He truly loves his students and is an excellent professor.
hilarious!! but must do the homework or he gets upset
He is very funny.
Class was difficult with lots of homeworks, but the lectures were good.

Theoretical computer science is tough topic. But Dr. Hamerly does his best to make them understandable. Assignments are tough and require significant time and effort. Same with exams. Programming assignments are very challenging.

Programming homework is very very hard. And it gets harder as you go along. He grades the class very harshly as well by reducing your final grade by a letter for each incomplete programming homework. He is very intelligent and explains concepts clearly. He is no help at all outside of class. Be prepared to spend most your free time on his projects.

This is a difficult class, but worth your while if CS is your major. Hamerly takes great pains to be as clear and precise as possible, and expects the same from his students. He's very open to helping students but will never solve a problem for you. There's a lot of work but if you do it you'll come out knowing a lot.

Hamerly's class is hard, no doubt. But I think that should be more attributed to the fact that there's a HUGE amount of important and advanced information that needs to be taught in a short period of time. His programming assignments will take up most of your life, so I suggest seeing him during office hours to get help on every assignment.
Huge workload, but you get out knowing tons.  This guy is definitely within my top 3 professors.

Very difficult professor. Programming assignments are ridiculously hard and time consuming and have "hidden" inputs and problems to complete. Would be okay if all you're taking is data structures and you're super-reclusive with enormous amounts of time. If another professor starts teaching 3334, take him/her!!
Very hard teacher.  Doesn't help out much at all.  He says he does but his help doesn't help out with the problem.

Great teacher. Very knowledgeable. The class is difficult and worklead is heavy. But if CS is your major, then you want these type of classes. Weekly quizzes, weekly homework, and bi-weekly projects ensure you know the material. I loved him. Be sure to stop by his office to learn some of his godly coding skillz using Vi!

Very challenging professor. Assignments tend to be very difficult- the trick is not to underestimate the assignment. Material can be complex and confusing very often, so additional studying is obviously required for this class. Good for people who seek to be challenged academically.

He did make this course hard, and you HAD to learn the material on your own or with his help, but because of that I actually learned it.  I would recommend him for those who are willing to work and who actually want to learn, because I definitely came out of this more knowledgeable than before.

This new professor is an excellent professor for data structures. He is very helpful and considerate of students and tries to adapt a good learning presentation for the students. As in all other difficult courses, you have to work hard to learn the material and complete the given projects.

This professor was challenging. He knows what he is doing but has very very very high expectations for his students. His policies are not fair compared to other teachers who encourage you to talk to students, in this class he is the only help. Good luck...would not recommend him for your next class.

Not an easy class, but whoever said it would be? I definitely learned more than I expected to learn. Suggestion: It might work better to cover some major topics more slowly rather than confuse all but the one or two people who understand the material immediately.
This is the most horrible teacher ever! Do not take him!!!! You and your grade will suffer because of him.

There are quizzes in almost every class for participation, but they do require studying and arent the easiest. She gives a huge workload for homework, but they help a LOT when it comes to those daily quizzes and tests. If you want an easy A do NOT take her, but if you want to learn spanish, which I think helps with an A, she is the best! LOVE HER!!

if you dont get on her good side, then forget about it. She gives a ton of homework, but is very knowlegeable, and will help if you have already done everything you can. Hard tests, to much homework (upwards of 3 hrs a night). Take her only if you REALLY want to learn spanish.

The tests aren't too difficult though the culture sections can be cumbersome. All in all an okay class but the homework load is ridiculous and it can really hurt your grade if you fall behind. I did great on all the tests but wound up with a B because my homework avg was terrible. Learn the vocab the night it's assigned bc the quizzes can be tough.

Norden is WONDERFUL! If you are looking for an easy class, do not take her. She expects 120% from her students but she does all she can to keep her classes interesting and fun! I was so burnt out on spanish after taking 4 years in high school but she gave me a new love for learning the language. I wish I could have her all 4 semesters. She's GREAT!

if you want to really learn the language, take norden. she gives a lot of work and is pretty strict but you learn the material well. if you don't care about speaking the language, i wouldn't take her. she can be very nice and helpful though, just get on her good side.

if you care about spanish i guess she would be alright, she gives a crap load of work and thinks her class is the most important thing ever, if you just want your credit and dont give a crap about spanish then dont take her...

Expect to learn every accent mark, conjugation, spelling, grammar rule etc. in her class.  It was hard and a lot of work, but definitely worth it as I got to the next classes.  I am grateful that I learned the basics of Spanish with Dra. Norden because she
Wow, what a waste of money, time, and dignity. I wish I would have known it was going to be that bad; I would have donated the money to ANY charity instead of paying for this WORTHLESS class.
If you want to learn Spanish, then take this class! I think she's a GREAT teacher. Plus you have fun in there!
She was the worst teacher I've had at Baylor.
good teaching style and she gets the class actively involved in everything
No Comments
Very hard and does not explain well.
Really good teacher if you want to LEARN the language.  Helpful and concerned.

He talks with this monotone but he knows his stuff and sometimes tells amusing tidbits and antidotes. Only offers two test and the final you get to drop one and he gives extra credit for attendance and for papers. Just need to read before test to do well.

Stay far far away!  I took this class because of his ratings on here and I wish I didn't listen.  Yah it sounds tempting with the fill in the blank and extra credit but the lectures are boring. He is a great guy but stay away.
talks a lot, schools students with an opinion pretty hard, but very intelligent, articulate, and informative.  also a nice guy

He needs aderol to stay on topic but once you get the hang of his fill in the blank tests it isn't that hard to do decent. Lets you get extra credit by turning in stuff for a whole grade change like B to a B+ if you do it.
He talks a lot and is very boring.  I slept in class every day. The tests are easy though.  Take him if you have patience...otherwise stay away.
Great professor.  EASY exams.  They're fill in the blank exams, and he gives you a word bank.  It can't get any better than that.  I have political science classes but his was a breeze.
a realy nice man, his tests are easy and he is fun to listen to
Class is very boring.  If you do all the reading, you will do well on his tests.  I slept through class, but read, made A.
sweet man, don't sleep in his class :)
such a sweet man

This was the worst class I took at Baylor- seriously.  He doesn't like to see people earn good grades- the tests are 3 essay tests and they are SOOOOO subjective.  He isn't even helpful if you are trying really hard- he is tired of teaching.
Likes to hear himself talk . . . A LOT!
2302 was tedious at times, but overall it was easy.
He has such a strenuous syllables, and then just yaps..pry eyelids open.

The only grades she has are tests and lab credits. Her class is interesting and enjoyable, but her tests are murder. YOU MUST BUY THE STUDY GUIDE AND ACTUALLY DO IT or you won't do very good in the class.

I found the amount of reading in this class overwhelming. You are expected to read the entire textbook. I highly recommend doing the extra credit and getting your research credits completed as soon as you can.

She is a wonderful professor. She loves her subject and she's very engaging. She even inspired me to change my major. She is definitely one of the best profs I've ever had, and probably the only one I'd recommend at Baylor.

ok teacher...kinda boring, has her days when she is more fun. tests are hard and there is a lot of subject matter. do as much extra credit as you can, it really helps. just dont take the class in the morning on Tues. Thurs....u will never wake up.
Also worked as a research assistant to her. Very smart and willing to help students. Picky on her tests
No Comments

Average teacher - shows slides mostly - acts like a dork when she tries to be cool - fairly easy though - not a bad prof but not great.  If this is for your only psy credit then she'll do fine but a psy major may want someone more dynamic.
Nice lady, good to listen to, tests are easy, quizzes are tough, just keep up with the reading and you'll do fine
She is a very good teacher and loves her subject. She will help you with anything if you just go and ask. She also give alot of extra credit.
cares whether students learn
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Oh Becky Jones, where do I even start.  If you can avoid taking this class in any way possible DO IT, but if you end up like me and get stuck in here may god have mercy on your soul. NEVER challenge her authority or you will feel her wrath for eternity. Don't skip class either she will automatically hate you. Show up, shutup, and you might survive

Ohhh where to begin with Becky. I've had her for financial and managerial. She was bad at teaching both! She is not helpful outside of class, her notes never really match the homework, and she literally just copies notes out of a binder when she teaches. Save yourself some serious teaching yourself time and do NOT take the captain of the dark world (I promoted her to queen for managerial) accounting!!!
She was good in 2303, but her teaching takes a nose-dive in 2304. I basically taught myself Managerial Accounting, so if you liked her in Financial, I'd suggest you find a new prof. for Managerial.

She is a great teacher.  Students that don't like her usually do not attend class very often.  If you don't go to class without telling her before, she will not cut you any slack.  She is very organized and clearly explains everything that you are tested on.  To get an A all you have to do is go to class and do the homework. Definately recommend he

I have no idea exactly why Jones is still teaching.  Her style is not effective.  She did not appreciate students asking each other for help with what was just said, nor will repeat her statement when asked.  The berating of students did not encourage respect.  Pacing of her classes is not planned well. Not acceptable conduct for real world.
Great teacher, gives great notes, understanding, helpful outside of class but doesn't put up with stupid people.  Not good for slacker students.  Poor attendance will hurt your grade.
very helpful; gives great notes

Good teacher if you keep up with your work. Not very helpful and never answers a question. She will just ask you questions until you come up with the answer.Study and don't fall behind and you'll be fine.
i thought jones was a good teacher inside the classroom but horrible outside.  She always talks to you like you are dumb and is impatient.  Do not recommend her.
Great teahcer for accounting, bad teacher for an A.

She is very understanding if you talk to her
Well-organized, clear expectations, well-taught, helpful; BUT ATTENDANCE IS IMPT
well-organized, clear expectations, well-taught, helpful; BUT ATTENDANCE IS IMPT

Took the math class for math haters in last semester before grad school (2003) and actually enjoyed some of the information. I learned how ISBN numbers are determined. Thank goodness for calculators and computers. Nice professor, but he is a mathematician..
He explains concepts in detail and encourages questions.
he's kinda hard to hear sometimes and has trouble explaining some stuff but overall a pretty good professor.

AWESOME guy. Ideas in Mathematics. I hate math, so I was in his office every other day for about an hour - he never once got tired of helping me, and he would even work through entire homework assignments if I needed it. He is amazing, and he LOVES math. He is extremely smart and a really nice person. Take advantage of his office hours, seriously.
I really enjoyed this class, although it was difficult for some to follow. However, he is very reachable during his office hours and loves to help his students.
If you have a chance not to take him, do it. Horrible and you will fail.
Is a decent teacher, but I thought he was a bit unclear. His tests were difficult. He's a good guy, though. I like him.
He's a really nice guy, very helpful.  Grades kinda tuff on the tests.  make sure to study proofs.

Oxford is a nice man that gets very excited about math.  The course is tough, but his test are direct and do-able. Just do the hmwk and keep up. It is a lot of studying though.  Sit near the front of the class because he is a quiet talker!!

I LOVE YOU MR OXFORD!!!!
went way too fast - too many quizzes and was very unclear.  the tests were ok - but not that great because people weren't caught up
nice guy, but class is somewhat difficult. he rushes thru things and makes it hard to keep up with. LOTS of homework, but not for a grade thank god. hard quizes and even harder tests.
No Comments
Very rude, insulting to students. Not helpful, poorly explained material. Tests you on his own personal opinions and irrelevant stories. Learned very, very little from his lectures.
Interesting subject matter, but goes off on ridiculous and quite insulting tangents for most of the time.

He not that bad. He sometimes give you take home tests or reviews that are identical to tha test, and always gives a curve. Get him started on politics and u can waste an intire class. or ask him about the book "fart poudly"

cancels many classes (several without notice), uses questions students for the final, never gave the scheduled midterm (did not explain why), doesn't tell you your grades until the final, locks the door so you're absent if you're late, the class is interesting and you can tell he likes the subject matter, but he doesn't really care about teaching

Do NOT TAKE HIM! I'm so serious. Incredibly smart, ridiculous testing.
Never says on topic during class.  He's very full of himself and an unfair grader.  I'd avoid his class!
He rarely ever stays on topic. You have to keep up with your reading because that's your best bet. He seems like a nice guy... but I'd try to get someone else.
