extremely difficult grader, very precise, very unfair, talks about himself alot, makes offensive comments, treats students like they are doctorate students, i would rather transfer schools than take him again
Ouch. Knows what he's talking about, but he belongs in a lab not the classroom. He grades really hard too. Find a better prof.
No Comments
I loved him. I wasn't looking forward to not having him as the lecturer. He made class fun and enjoyable.
Leader of a weak department and is different from what he appears. Be careful what you say and how you act with him.
very straightforward, nice, and funny.
Didn't like him. Thinks a lot of himself and is not very helpful.
No Comments
So accomplished!
Good lecturer, good style, clear presentations, likable.
this guys a clown
Liked DG best out of the trio. He's funny and spunky. He connects well with the students and makes you wanna learn.
Great teacher.  Makes the class fun and he is also hilarious.
Very funny and makes lectures fun. Take him.
he explains the topics well, and he's really funny
Great lecturer, very funny and helpful

Very interesting professor! I really enjoyed the class and her lectures, however it is an extremely hard class and she demands a lot from you.  Along with the text you have to read an entire novel and write a paper and her tests are very hard! If you miss class you will be lost and make sure you keep up with the reading.

I cannot say enough wonderful things about this woman as a person and a professor.  She sat on my thesis committee, counseled me during a personal crisis, and inspired me to become a professor.  I use her material in my lectures today.  Amazing individual!
One of the best professors I ever took a class from.

One of Baylor's finest. Finally someone willing to take up controversial issues and provoke thinking in class.  She is passionate and cares greatly for her students and baylor as a whole.  Take her if you want to challenge yourself!

Worst teacher I've ever had.  Eighteen years later I still recall just how poorly taught was my class, how fictional was her interpretation of biblical history, and how glib and "cute" was her method.  This is why Baylor is doomed to second tier

She's a good teacher. It's not an easy class and there is a lot of reading and writing involved. However, if you keep up with the notes and the readings you will do well in her class. Don't be afraid to ask her for help because she will help.
Great lectures; forces you to think
Pretty hard teacher but grades fairly.  Be prepared to keep up with the reading.
Very interesting lectures.
Hard but a GREAT teacher - she really cares!
Very energetic and helpful.
Tough but fair; excellent source of info
She's the greatest! I learned a lot

This class does require a textbook but the textbook is found free online. Class is pretty easy i guess but you have to read 2 chapters each week. His lectures are extremelyyyy boring too. He does offer extra credit though!

Dr. Owens is a very passionate and talented journalist. I took him in a 250 person class which does make it harder for the teacher and I could tell Dr. Owens does better in small classrooms. Only grades will be 4 exams so make sure you take great notes because there won't be any assignments to serve as checkpoints. Exams are 50/50 lecture and book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Rambles about off topic information. PowerPoints are loosely related to the lectures. If this class is not required, I recommend not taking it .

Dr. Owens is incredibly smart and the lectures are very interesting. However, they were sometimes off topic, which left it up to you learn some material for the tests. The tests are a bit difficult, but not too bad. He also gives a bunch of extra credit, so it is very possible to make an A even if you do bad on tests.

The class was very difficult and often was off topic. His lectures tended to ramble on about unrelated topics and very rarely related to the PowerPoint slides he had prepared. The only grades were 3 tests and each of which was very difficult. The material in the lecture rarely if ever related to the textbook assigned chapters.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: You really have to love journalism for this class. He's really, really tough, but with a good purpose. If you comply, he does an AMAZING job of moulding you as a journalist. He is VERY opinionated, so if you butt heads with teachers like that, maybe stay away. He is a brilliant prof., though. Thumbs up for sure!! The quizzes are BRUTAL, though.

Dr. Owens knows what he's talking about. He'll teach you more than you ever wanted to know about editing, but you HAVE to put in a big effort. Study for the quizzes, read the news, pay attention to every word he says. He'll mention something briefly once and expect you to remember it forever. He's great, but the class is very stressful.
If you're on his good side (meaning you're smart and interested in class) you'll do well. He's genuinely interested in seeing you succeed. I think he's great.

He's much too smart to be teaching at Baylor.  I took him in the summer, and our newsletter project was pretty easy because we didn't have much time to prepare it.  What he teaches you will really help in the job market.  This is the most practial class in the journalism department.
No Comments
great teacher, but he's hard and a tough grader.
No Comments
He is way cool.

MY MAN!!! Dr. Weaver is awesome!! He makes you work for it, but it's worth it. He explains things differently than the other profs (I took the team-taught course), and it actually kind of clicked in my brain. I'd definitely recommend him--if you read (and I mean really read), you'll be fine for the tests (which are your only grades)!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Whoever said he was an A... he is not! If you go to review your exams with him he is very helpful, you aren't allowed to take notes when you review your exam but none of the professors for 1306 allow you to anyhow. Neuroscience isn't easy, it is a tough course but as long as you read and attend lecture you will pass the class.

Terrible! I had him for both neurosci and cognitive. He seems all nice and easy going in neuro but when you actually go in to talk to him, he is a pretentious A! Granted, I did well in his class, it was no thanks to his retarded and often incorrect test questions. Oh and he makes you read is papers bc none of his collegues will!
I hated his section!!!  He is NOT clear and is very conceited!!!!
interesting class and good professor. good stories to keep it interesting. tests are hard but reasonable.
He is very smart! and funny, I enjoyed his class!
He is really funny, and he knows how to make things understandable.  There is some reading, but he only quizzes like 6 times over it!  He is a good professor to get.
I liked Weaver. He is good at keeping your attention and makes decent jokes.
He's an awesome teacher.  He explains things very well and makes it interesting.  The class takes work but you have to also consider that it is neuroscience.  Take him if you have a chance.
Say whatever you want about him.
He's very interesting and funny.
He's rude and arrogant and thinks he's better than others. He is intelligent
Very funny and makes lectures very interesting. Take him if you have the chance.

His online class was really straightforward, with lecture quizzes, two papers, four discussion posts.  Pass/fail quizzes were stressful, but you get more dropped than you need to pass for a perfect grade.  Recorded lectures are okay, some more interesting than others, on US, Russia, Britain. Make sure to watch the FAQ vids and check sample quizzes

Quizzes: four all announced, 15 Qs over 12-30 pages; either 2days in advance, sometimes 5; 3 question multiple choice (a/b/c), so better guessing odds
Papers: just one, 2 topic choice: a long review of a graphic novel source
Simulations: if these are hard, it's you
Exam: 10 short answer w/choice + study guide;
Discussion: show up and talk or lose

The whole class is based around simulations of different time periods. These simulations are generally hard These simulations are 40% of your grade. During lecture in my opinion Jug talked very fast making it hard to understand what he was saying. He gives the reading for the quizzes late 25-40 pages and the quiz is 2 days after you get the text
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Jug creates such a fun learning environment with his sense of humor and simulation weeks. I did not expect fun to be a big part of a course on Russia taught by a guy who looks like a former army ranger, but he mixed jokes, American comparisons, and pop culture references to what could have been pretty obscure medieval material.

Loved how he did class online.  Recorded-lecture-centered, but with an easy structure to the open book tests and set-by-step assignment prompt for the paper.  Feedback was short and to the point, whether praise or criticism.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Online class you can knock out in about 2 hours a day, 3 days a week.  Basically, you need to watch lectures start to finish to pass the open book tests.  Dry lectures but good organization.  Much of the answers just need to be from different segments.  Plus two papers: just skim the whole book.   Loved how you could work ahead and take days off.

Such a tough professor and never gave clear grading criteria.  He actively looks for ways to take points off your assignments and gives vague feedback that makes hardly any sense.  If possible, avoid him because he's one of those professors who looks to fail you in a class.

Normal for an online class, since there's a good amount of lectures to watch and write up but you can turn stuff in early and take time off. You have to watch the lecture though, or he will nail you for being vague or ignoring the part you didn't watch or being vague about what you did watch. Easy to get the hang of, and he drops 9 bad responses
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Jug was a tough grader with no clear grading criteria. His comments were also very generic and were not very helpful. However, he did give the opportunity for extra credit. As for homework, it was assigned for every day of the week and it was quite repetitive and boring. Overall, he wasn't the best teacher but not the worst either.
He wasnt very thorough in his explanations for assignments, he just gave them out without a real explanation sometimes. Hes also a very thought grader.

The most unreasonable and unfair grader I have ever had. Not at all clear about expectations and grades extremely harshly (taking points off for things like "weak verb usage" or "repeating verbs") and randomly comes up with policies that were never discussed in syllabus. Extremely unfair grader and tries to find reasons to take points away.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Class uses same textbook and workbook across all sections, and very similar tests/quizzes.  Jug can be long-winded, but that's because he tries to be really thorough in his explaining, and has great stories about Russia.  If you come to class and do the homework, the class is doable, but you're there to really learn Russian, so it's not a blow-off.

Not a bad teacher but not great either. He's very passionate about Russian but doesn't teach the material in an interesting or very clear way. If you ask him a question he will ramble for a VERY long time as an answer, and occasionally will be condescending if you get something wrong. Homework, quizzes & tests tend to be very simple though.
Very tough grader which is normally fine, but he isn't specific about test material. Seems to favor some students over others.
A class with Dr. Hunt is like a 90 minute TED talk.  He's also hilarious.

He's a strict grader, has strong opinions, and sometimes rambles, but his knowledge and passion are undeniable. He keeps up with the scholarship on Renaissance writers and can explain difficult concepts well. Grades are based on reports and a research paper. Great person to know if you're into Shakespeare or Spenser.

One of my favorite professors in the entire English department. The man has published more than 120 scholarly articles, written 4 books, and edited numerous translations of Shakespeare's works. If you're an English major, this is definitely a man to know, as it's not often you can claim to have been taught by a world-renown Shakespearian authority.
Liked him.  His class was interesting, and he was always very friendly.  Also, he had students read the plays aloud. He has a good attitude and is enthusiastic about his subject.
If you drive a Beemer and your mommie is an English teacher, you'll get a good grade for doing nothing.  Hunt has no integrity whatsoever.

Has his flaws, but I've never heard someone explain difficult concepts so well.  He can even talk about all the different levels of allegory in The Faerie Queene in a coherent way without being confusing.
If you're having a hard time, cite one or more of HIS books in your research.  He LOVES it!  In general, he does grade VERY hard, but he's a very enlightening teacher.
No Comments
No Comments
Knows a whole lot about Shakespeare.  A nice guy, but can be intimidating.  I recommend taking him.
She does not lecture very well and expects you to know everything on the test. She is not the best teacher but if you understand Spanish you'll be semi okay

If you can BS well, then you dont need to read anything until just before each test. If you cannot BS, then devote the 20-60 minutes a night to read each story. Almost every story has english translations online. Assignments are easy. She is very easy going, insightful, and interesting. Class is a breeze, just show up, do the work, and get an A!

I absolutely recommend taking her for spanish! Not only is she very fair with her grading techniques, but she has a genuine concern for her students and their success in her class. I have to admit that there is alot of work involved, but that is because of the departments policies...not hers. I wouldn't take spanish with anybody else. Great Prof!

As long as you do the assignments in class, you will be fine.  Go to class and pay attention and you won't have to do that much studying outside of class, either.  Her tests come straight from her lectures, and she makes sure you are aware of exactly what you need to know before the tests.  I recommend her!!
Awesome Teacher. Take her if at all possible. She's probably the best teacher I've ever had in anything. Also really nice and helpful.
Make sure you get to know her on a personal level.  Fascinating and fun person.  Knows her stuff, too.

She's awesome! She is an extremely helpful, knowledgable teacher who will get the best spanish out of ya! She offers lots of extra credit opportunities, and your grade will be fine if you just do the required work.
She is a great prof and person
Nice and helpful prof.  Homework are graded, and they prepare you well for tests.
Do assignments, and you will be fine; the assignments prepare you for the tests.
Good prof.  Have to do a lot of work but its pretty easy
She's so fun! I definitely recommend her.

Dr. S is definitely a tough professor. Her class was mostly easy because it was online. The essays were extremely hard to complete because of the broad questions she asks so it forces you to really think hard. But besides all of that, she was amazingly understanding and so passionate about Latin America that you couldn't help but be passionate also
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--So many papers

comment: I took her class 20 some years ago at ODU. Fabulous professor... the best I had in college, law school or grad school. Smart, funny, caring, and very fair. Yes, she is tough, but she makes learning enjoyable. Prepare to work hard, but its worth ever minute.

I had her 20yrs ago - she's awesome and taught me how to write. Totally non-judgmental, wanted her kids to do their best and not be slackers, and a tough teacher.  Always available to assist kids, too. She took a bright and conservative-minded guy, who looked like a dead-head hippy, and helped turn me into a spec ed teacher.

I had Dr. Supplee for 4 courses, if I remember correctly. She taught me to think and how to build an argument. You see History is all about perspective and finding yours and being able to argue what you believe in. I am a certified History teacher because of this professor.
She is truly awful and can't teach worth a flip.

Exams are primarily essay. She gives you a list of half a dozen or so possible topics based on the lectures and a couple of them will appear on the exam, plus one shorter surprise topic essay based on the readings.

All topics are presented from a feminist perspective - decides your grade early on according to personal agenda. Women do better than men in this class.  I was a graduate assistant a few years ago so I know.

she's really really knowledgeable on all of latin american history, very demanding and pretty intimidating.  she's nice though, and helpful and clear.  hard class, but worth it if you have the time and interest.
Absolutely fantastic professor - brilliant, funny, very challenging.  I learned a ton.  One of the most interesting and memorable classes I've taken.
Challenging but a wonderful professor

She knows everything about Latin America and will try to teach you the history of all of LA since the beginning of time--very difficult.  You have to read and study a lot.  It's interesting though, so if you have the time and ambition, may be worth it.

Oh Lord have mercy, this class is hard as crap. Take it if you're interested in LA studies. She's great if you are. If you're not, RUN AWAY QUICKLY AND NEVER LOOK BACK. This class will let you know if you're stupid or not.

She's the best professor! She's fun and encouraging, making me want to attend class. Her grading is fair; study the material, and you'll get an A. I struggled with chemistry, but going to office hours helped. Tests are on paper (multiple-choice/true/false). Quizzes are on paper and Aktiv (timed); homework only needs 70% to count as 100%.
She is one of THE best teachers at Baylor.. She is super helpful and such a sweet person!!!! She is the best teacher ever!!!!!!!!

Hands down, one of the very best teachers at Baylor.  She is a great teacher, she is very helpful in her office hours, and she really cares that you understand the material.  Do the book work as she pulls test questions from there.  My favorite teacher at Baylor! Get her is you can!

She is a lot harder than she used to be. She will start off with a really hard test and then give you two tests that are easy and then the fourth one will be the most insane test ever. Just be prepared for anything to be on her tests. Even stuff that isnt covered in the book or notes.
this woman is insane.
No Comments

Great teacher. You Learn the material. Gives you plenty of examples and old tests. No attendance except for quizzes and tests.  If you expect to do well, attend, take notes on top of her slides, and do the hmwk.

i absolutely LOVED her!  a very helpful, caring professor.  takes time to explain things in class.  tests are hard, but it's organic.  she makes the material fun and understandable.  if you can get anyone for organic, get HER!
She's a great person and she teaches well too.  O-chem is hard no matter what.  She at least makes it worth coming to class just to hear her talk.  Great personality highly recommended
Great teacher, subject matter is hard no matter who you have, she will bend over backwards to help you out. Tests are hard, but has a great curve. Take her if you can!
best o-chem teacher to have
easy to talk to and very helpful!

I took Hodson during fall of 2020 and spring of 2021, so his exams were online. The SI provided great practice exams that prepared me for the real exams. He doesn't curve or give extra credit. The exams were okay as long as you study. Alot of his exam problems come STRAIGHT from his practice examples that he works on in class.
He keeps the class entertained

Makes O-chem enjoyable.  His lecture notes are very clear cut.  If you work out his example problems, do Sapling, and have a firm grasp on the notes then you should get an A on the test.  Also by far the most helpful professor as far as office hours.  He'll take the time to sit down with you and re work any problems you missed on tests.

Dr. Hodson is the best! You don't need to buy the textbook as long as you review his in-class examples and pay attention during lectures, which are often filled with witty puns and hilarious "dad" jokes. Also, he's very approachable outside of class and genuinely cares about each of his students. By far one of my favorite professors at Baylor!
Dr Hodson is an awesome teacher. He manages to display both the conceptual and the analytical importance of the material. He is also pretty funny in his own special way.
He's awesome! Take his class. His power points are clear and concise. Look over the notes before the test and you'll be fine.Totally willing to help you pass his class. Neat accent.
He is so helpful and he wants all of his student to do well. He is very funny and very nice. I would definitely recommend Dr. Hodson to future students. Take his class! He's awesome.
Nice, funny and helful professor. Look over the practice questions before the tests and get an easy A. Take this guy!

He really knows what he's talking about and wants each of his students to be the same way. He puts extra effort into explaining things in detail and encourages question-asking. Very helpful and very funny. Great guy overall.
He is Great! He helps you understand the work and study for his test. Also his test are short and straight to the point. I  enjoy his class very much.
He is an awsome teacher.If you miss class he lets you make up your quizes and always willing to help.Plus he is scotish and funny.
Attendance is required like all Baylor classes but no one pays attention. As long as you look over the notes and do the vocab the tests are really easy. Fun Guy. Cool accent.
Kevin is amazing! If you need SOC 1305, take him! Attendance isn't apart of your grade, and there's no textbook! Jist a few quizzes, 3 exams, and 4 easy projects. Easy A!!

Kevin is the best. And yes, we call him Kevin. Super interesting course and he is very engaging during lectures. He makes an effort to learn everyone's names and he wants to help everyone succeed. There are occasional reading quizzes but they aren't difficult, and neither are the exams. I would definitely recommend taking this course.

Professor Dougherty (Kevin) is so caring and makes class a place where you want to be! He continuously cares for his students and makes his students and makes them feel like they belong in SOC1305. You never know what is going to happen when you come to his class. He even has note templates posted on canvas.

He's truly one of the most caring professors. He tries to make an effort to actually remember people in his class, and it's huge. He makes his lectures really fun and the tests are easy to follow. As long as you pay attention and study, you'll pass. He's great.

I absolutely loved Dr. Dougherty! He was by far one of my favorite professors ever taken because you learn material, but he makes it fun! Every class is interesting and never just a lecture. He's hilarious and involves students in what he is teaching. Slightly wanted to become a sociology major after this class lol
Hilarious. Loves kids.

I HIGHLY recommend this teacher. One of my favorites of my college career. Completely enthusiastic, kind, smart, and makes learning fun. You will do a few papers, but your grade is mostly based on multiple choice tests, which he prepares you for well. SOC 1305 ROCKS!
I LOVEEEE KEVIN! He was the best professor I have ever had! He teachers his lessons, but you laugh the entire time!! This is by far the best teacher has to offer!! Sic 'Em!! =)

Take this professor!!!! I will probably never forget him. He is so dynamic in class, that I never missed a day just to see what we'd be discussing. The class is very interesting and the tests are straight from his powerpoints. He is very fun and entertaining and really cares about the students and the subject he's teaching. The class is not hard.

Extremely enthusiastic, trys to get to know the students instead of being another number, keeps you awake and in each discussion, has note handouts to make it easier to take your notes. Watch the papers- there are about 6-7 but they are quick essays only 2 pages each, interesting discussion topics!
No Comments
Awesome lectures, very interesting and entertaining....keeps you on your toes! Friendly, interactive instructor...I highly recommend him!

he's an amazing teacher and will answer any question you have takes the time to get to know his students. I was a very quite person in his class but he engages you and makes you feel welcome in class everyday

One of the most entertaining professors I've had yet! Tests are hard unless you actually study the material. (learned this the hard way. :P) You'll never have multiple choice for a test, only quizzes. He's so chill that you might get lazy. DON'T. You'll get a lot out of the class if you work at it.
easy class. he's really hilarious. take jeff!! as long as you take notes and show up and get a good idea of the book, you're good.
if you dont like history sitting in that class for an hour is hell

Dr. Hamilton is amazing. I am not a history major by any means and still loved the class. He knows is stuff backwards and forwards. I would recommend him to anyone. He is fully engaged in class and if you are engaged you will do well.
The best Prof I had at BU- and he is entertaining
really easy as long as you go to class.
Best Prof I ever had at Baylor.  He goes to bat for his students.
I had Dr. Hamilton for Greek, Roman, and medieval history and he is top notch.  Is willing to serve as a mentor for undergraduates and give students the time of day.
Has a first rate command of course content.  One of the best professors I had in my entire college career.  A true deity of history.
Highly recommended

This guy is awesome. He explains the material clearly in class and even makes it funny from time to time. Tests are easy as long as you pay attention in class. He is also helpful and will gladly answer any questions you may have.

grades include:10 homeworks(really easy), 4 tests, and the final (she gives extra credit). She does NOT give test reviews (tests are worth 50% of your overall grade), and what she does tell you to study is not on the test. Other than that she is very nice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Great professor but you NEED to go to class to pass/do well. Find her outside of class and she is friendly but make sure you know your stuff. Know your terminology!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's tough, but you'll learn something.
Dr. Emerson is a great professor. She is a bit tough, but knows her stuff. If you go to class, you will be fine.
She's really difficult. Be prepared to work hard

She is the best lecturer I've seen so far. She did a great job explaining concepts in detail and have proved theory both mathematically and graphically. Excellent Econ Professor, strongly suggest you all to take her class!
very clear about expectations.
She doesn't help students at all.
No Comments
I thought the class wasnt that bad. you get to do experiments or execises which go toward extra credit
don't take her
she is very, very hard. Do not take her even if it screws your entire schedule up. Nice personality though not helpfull.
One of the best teachers I have ever had.

Dr. Baird was great!  His tests are quite difficult, but his teaching style is amazing-I had no interest in Philosophy before the class...but each class, Dr. Baird made the subject enjoyable.  I learned quite a bit, as well!
quite possibly the best professor at Baylor!
Great professor!  Not a tough class.  Great to take in a tough semester.  It's like a breath of fresh air in the middle of the day.
He is very clear, and goes over many examples in class, which is helpful at test time.  The concepts are new to most people, but he explains them very well.  Overall, I think he is a superb prof.

Not a bad class but watch out.  His final as per blackboard grading showed the class average to have dropped by 12 points.    The class itself was well taught and boring but when a professor drops the class average by 12 points on the final, something is up there.
he had his own way of thinking and wasn't very open to new ideas.
I now teach in a major university, and was able to fly through graduate school because of the incredible teaching of Baird.  He's simply the best teacher I've seen.
Not sure if he still teaches it, but there is no better instructor when it comes to Modern Philosophy. Clear, to the point, and easy-going. I did not miss his classes.
Simply the best!!! Enough said.
No Comments
Great professor, great lecturer

I was nervous to take this Research in Education class online because I typically struggle with note-taking for online courses. Luckily, she moved the class to in person and I am glad she did because she definitely brings so much energy and passion to class and there are no dumb questions. Her humor and teaching style make this class enjoyable!

Dr. Bagby is such a great professor! There is A LOT to read, but she gives you objectives to focus on while reading so you can skip parts in chapters. There are quizzes but they are open-note, so TAKE GOOD NOTES! Her tests are fair and straightforward! There is a lot of discussion so make sure you read and can talk about it! She's wonderful!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: AWESOME TEACHER!
She is rude and puts down students, especially minority students or obese students. But she does not even realize how rude she is.
Great professor and great class!

I don't know what ANY of these people who left rude comments are talking about!!  Dr. Bagby is one of the most tender hearted,lovable professors I have taken at Baylor. She has an obvious passion about what she is teaching and the tests were VEY fair. This is the type of woman you invite to your wedding later in life.I loved her! I will miss her!
Clueless, class was disorganized -"those who can... do Those who can't...teach  Those who can't do either become professors.

I LOVE having Janet.  She was very interested and knowledgable in the content.  She listened to everyone's ideas and comments.  She made the learning fun by including stories about her childhood or asking about ours.  I loved both of the classes I took with her.  And I use the information I learned, I now use all the time.  Janet Bagby was one of my favorite Baylor professors.
total ****. puts other people down in front of others to make herself feel better
I had this prof. for my G&T class. She was very helpful and patient.

She is incredibly rude and uncaring.  She only liked the football players in our class and is not very smart.  She plays favorites and I can honestly say that this was the worst class I ever took.  A total waste of time.
Dr. Bagby was one of the worst professors I had at Baylor.  She is condescending, plays favorites, and couldn't teach her way out of a bag.  Not to mention how abusive she was to her TA Wong Ying.
She was never prepared, and it was hard to follow. The class was easy though so I did fine, but I wouldn't take from her again.

Took this class during the fall 2020 semester so it was online and she had no idea how to use zoom so she dropped our class about a month in. We were not prepared for her replacement who assumed we knew what to do. Also, lots of my friends have said she's been rude to them and is pretty egocentric. Glad I won't have to take her again.

I've actually had her for three different classes. She is pretty chill but pretty ditzy at times. Not tons of homework, but more than Ford or Lai. She writes the departmental exams so her tests can be pretty rough sometimes. Theory, you may be okay. Musicianship, study for sight singing or die.

She is definitely quirky but she always makes everyone laugh. Very concise and great lectures. She is a tough grader and if you don't really pay attention to your homework, well, good luck. You WILL learn in her class.

Not very clear, we call her "killer millar" just because she is hard... she isn't impossible but very difficult. Hard to get questions answered during class time. Overall though it is possible to get an ok idea of the class and pass it but it is hard.
Great teacher, but tough, hard tests, and high expectations. Willing to help, allows corrections on homework.

Dr. Millar makes learning theory fun, but it is a difficult subject.  Her tests are hard because there is a lot of material to cover in a short amount of time.  Hoomework due nearly every class period, but she allows corrections of all homework under a 90.  Work hard and you will learn theory.
Nice lady. she'll help you but you must be willing to work. Explains things well, but can still be a hard class. you'll learn alot. be ready to have homework all the time.
She's super hard but when you get through you know your stuff.  Really nice lady.
I hate her...she is an awful, awful witch.
I hated her class...not helpful to those students that struggle or don't understand.  Also has a supersized ego about herself.  Plays favorites.
Dr. Millar is very hard, but very good, and she really made me a better musician!

I absolutely adore her! She makes the class low-stress and fun, but her teaching style makes it easy to pick up and understand the content. There's homework almost every night but its super quick and a quiz about once a week which isn't bad if you pay attention.
She's absolutely adorable. I would say take her is you are just starting off especially because she is very interactive and understanding!!! Love this class.
She's great! Super sweet and always willing to go the extra mile for her students. She's great to see - go talk to her in her office!

She was my absolute favorite professor of all time. She moves at a relatively slow pace as compared to most other language classes. She's really helpful and gets to know all of her students well. Her tests were fairly simple and she's very generous with grading.  I highly recommend her for anyone looking to take French.
Professor Pierce is WONDERFUL.  She is the best teacher of French that I've ever had.  Every other language professor should be required to visit her class and observe how a master works!

Madame Pierce is definitely anti-in class English usage. But she is nice and a fair teacher. She won't ask anything you haven't covered on tests. Great study guides for each test. A plus- she is a chic dresser.
Excellent prof, I learned French really well in her class. Challenging, but she's so nice and fun that it's not bad.

She is the nicest lady you will ever meet.  She is really funny and she kids around.  She doesnt like you to speak english in her class though... she's very helpful and she challanges you. Homework almost every night. A test a week, take home and in class
Good class. Regular predictable quizzes that can boost your grade. Pretty good overall.
I loved Madame Pierce's class. She is a fun lady who knows a lot about the french language. She is very helpful and likes to have fun!
She's really helpful and a very nice prof.
Great teacher, fun and not hard; about a test a week though, but not hard at all

Wonderful woman, impossible teacher. She focuses heavily on memorization and is not afraid to say so. If you have a photographic memory then you'll do great. If you work hard and do the homework you still may only get a D. Homework is reasonable in amount, but tests are really hard as is the grading.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Davis is a nice woman, but unless you want to spend hours daily for one class just to scrape a decent B or C, don't take this class. She moves extremely fast and isn't always helpful. She specifically told us if we did  bad on the first test not to even come talk to her about our grade. So, I would strongly advise you NOT to take this class.

If you're not majoring in Classics or haven't taken Latin in high school, you're pretty much screwed and she'll tell you that straight up. If you are an upper classman taking the class, she'll call you out in front of the class on the first day saying it's shameful you waited so long to take the class. Worst BU professor... should be fired!
Definitely helps if you're in a sorority or frat. But like any class, if you do your work, you'll be fine.
Sweetest lady ever, I wish she was my mother. One of the best classes. She is my new favorite person.
Without a doubt THE hardest class I've taken at Baylor.  I was surprised and lucky to get a D at the end of the semester...
very friendly, cares about students
A great teacher! Highly recommended!!!
If you're not Greek, don't even bother
very good; reviews allmaterial and will even bring treats
Good Professor.  You guys don't know anything.
Try not to cross her path

This is strate from the syllabus grades at based on Class Participation 10% (attendance, participation in discussions, and satisfactory accomplishment of in-class assignments?including responses to Guest Lecture presentations)Perspectives Essay 20%, Annotated Bibliography 15%, Source Assignment 20%, Journal Assignment, 15%, Historiography Essay 20%

Took her for Christian Heritage. She is a good teacher. Very passionate about her subject. Very nice and her tests and quizzes are not that hard compared to some of the other idiots that teach rel at Baylor.Would def rec her!!!

I took Barr for the required Christian Heritage class. I felt it was unnecessarily hard. Unless you have a strong interest in the history of Christianity (and not many do...), take someone else. The lectures are vague and cover a lot of material. I was so uninterested, I didn't learn anything.

She is an excellent lecturer. She really makes you interested in the material and I have never be bored in her class. She is very helpful also if you have any questions. But, she does expect you to learn so attendance is important and so is studying for her tests (which will be very difficult if you don't study). Overall I highly recomend her class
Dr. Barr is made of awesome. She is one of the best lecturers at Baylor. Too bad she left us for the religious department. Get to know her, it's worth it.

She is the best History Professor. She keeps you interested in her class, and I feel like I've missed out on something if I'm not there. Just make sure you read the reading assignments. The test aren't bad. Make sure you know dates and when and what happens where. Overall, pretty awesome lady.
she is an awsome professore that really keeps your interest.
No Comments

Probably the best teacher i've ever had. She is the one that made me want to Major in History. You should take her because you'll end up loving history, but don't take her if your looking for an easy A, she's tuff!

Barr was awesome. One of the best history prof at this god-forsaking schoool. I took her twice, back to back, and she was consistent with grading, helpful, and always gave u want u needed to get a good grade. I made an A both times, and I was bio-premed.
Very nice lady but grades really hard! Be prepared to read and write ALOT! Don't take her if you want an easy class. Much easier professors out there.
The best professor ever!!!

What a great professor! He really cares about his students and what he is teaching. He is really helpful and extremely engaging.Be prepared to work though, as he is demanding.Do the reading! However, you will become engaged in the subject since he is so knowledgable and lectures are interesting. One of the best profs. at Baylor!

He's a great professor and a really good guy. He is very articulate, so his lectures are easy to follow and pretty enjoyable. He really cares about his students. I would definitely take another class with him.
really cares about students, very articulate, a great guy, take him if you ever get the chance!

Great class, great professor.  He's very interesting and knowledgable.  He knows his stuff and is excited about it.  He expects a lot, but he's very clear and gives a lot in return.  Our entire class looked forward to class days.

Far and away the best professor I've had in 4 years.  He is so engaging, the class is challenging but absolutely worth it.  He is incredibly intelligent and interesting.The entire class loved him and was sad to see the semester end.

David Corey is far and above the best in-classroom prof that I have had at Baylor.  He has unknowingly directed much of my academic life and has provided outstanding extra-classroom support in every arena.  He will challenge you, but in an excellent way.

Very interested in subject, Expects participation from everyone and will call on you if you don't, Critical when he disagrees, Tells you exactly what he wants you to remember and get out of the discussions

First of all, he's a total fox.  A very engaging lecturer; has complete control of class discussion; loves his subject; truly cares about his students; if you like political science or the classics, you'll adore Dr. Corey.
No Comments

He is a very engaging prof that expects a lot of reading and writing to be done. He is not hard, but you must do the work. One of the best in the dept. He is always ready for class discussion and I would recommend him without reservation.

Dr. Zeiss is really nice but she is very unclear and inconsistent. Sometimes she'd slam us with work out of nowhere and other times there would be no homework at all. She also gets carried away very easily when someone asks an irrelevant question and it's a bit annoying because we never had enough time to cover all the material.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr Zeiss cares deeply about her students. The comments posted about running away or unfairness were clearly students who were not willing to get to know her. She spent countless hours helping me become a better writer and did not quit until I was one. I am so thankful for her generosity and graciousness.
Avoid if possible

Absolutely my least favorite professor I have had at Baylor. She always speaks as if she is about to burst into tears and lacks any sort of clarity in regards to her lectures and assignments. Half of the time you don't know what work is due and the other half of the time the work is elementary busy work.
Awesome teacher! She has high expectations and demands, but as a music major this type of hard work should be expected anyways.

I don't recommend her at all!!!! Her grading scale varies and none of the people in my class or myself knew what we would be graded on. She's socially awkward and doesn't give clear answers to student questions. Also difficult to work with.
She's a sweet lady. Her heart and mind are in the right place. However, I hope that I never take another class with her again!
Dr. Zeiss is great!  She makes the subject interesting, and her explanations are clear and engaging.  She's also fun and obviously excited about her work.
Awww I *heart* Dr. Zeiss! She's kinda nitpicky on tests, but if you read, you can get an A. She makes class interesting and her homework isn't that bad. I reccomend her!
I am taking her for a class now, and she seems like a real sweet lady. So far, I enjoy the class.
Run. Run away as fast as you can. If you're not up to dancing around on stage in the morning don't take her! Tests- asks a bunch of pointless and vague questions. I wouldn't recommend her...
A great professor. He is a little easily sidetracked, though!
Outstanding professor! He is one of my absolute favorites! He's really passionate about the material he teaches, but he also really cares about his students as individuals.
Favorite professor :) he is SO sweet, very interested and helpful to his students. I loved this class but it's super easy to fall behind. But he makes it tolerable by being wonderful!

He was definitely one of my best professors this year. We had some really interesting discussions in class because he wan't afraid to hear our random connections with the books. He's very intense and I had (and still have) a huge crush on him!! That, of course, is not the only reason I liked his class...
I had a slight crush on him! Very into his work.
Very passionate about the texts, very sweet personality.
Not only a great scholar and fine teacher but also a highly gifted tenor and guitarist.
Very passionate about his teaching - very entertaining and informative!
very nice, will really listen to you
READ A LOT!! good teacher, x-tra credit skits fun!!
classes haphazard, but willing to help
If this guy still pulls out old maps, that should be museums, you students need to pay attention.  You just got learnt!

If you have any other classes on the day you have this class, don't expect to finish the extensive amount of homework he assigns for this class.  The tests are complete bull because they are "based on the homework," and there are more than 200 questions total to study.He's super boring also.STAY AWAY if you don't want your GPA to drop substantially
Just do the homework which isn't tough.  tests are sweet cause you can get a 120 percent.  3 tests and the final isn't comprehensive.  this is for freshman classes

This class was really easy. All you have to do is complete the readings and answer the given questions.  All you do in class is talk about the questions! Very nice guy but talks soft.  stay awake long enough to answer when he calls on you or he calls you out.
No Comments
Throwback Commie.  Tries to spread the same garbage that Marx failed with.  He loves his disciples.  The guy's a sham and a disgrace.

This prof will bore you to tears. The tradeoff, its not hard to make an 'A.' Homework is assigned reading and answering questions from the reading. Make a friend or two and split the assignments, otherwise they are long. Lectures simply repeat what you read and quiz/tests are questions from the hw.
Dry wit, great guy
His tests were very straightfoward and all you really had to do is read to make an A for the class.  His strange comments always cracked me up but most of the times he was boring.
I
"Dull Hull" is easy, but sort of boring

Asked for help on multiple occasions, never helped. Goes over the easy material very well, but when it comes to the more difficult material, she expects you to know how to do it without teaching it. Extremely hard grader. Very nice person, but not a good teacher. If you've never taken a calc/pre-calc teacher, try to get a different professor.

She ignored me when I ask for her help( in person) and doesn't give thorough notes. Yes you have multiple tries on the homework but that's because she knows you don't know the material. Avoid at all costs

Professor Nichols was great. She was very understanding and willing to help whenever I had problems or late assignments. Her tests weren't hard if you were paying attention and did the homework.   It was hard for me because I missed some classes in the middle of the semester. But she was really cool and extended the deadlinea of HW for me.

I don't know why everyone seems to not like Mrs. Nichols, she is definitely one of the BEST professors that I have had at Baylor! She is extremely friendly, teaches well, and offers extra credit every week! (all you do is write a paragraph on what you thought of the material that you learned that week). Also, she offers UNLIMITED tries per problem!

She is very energetic and kept my interest most the time. I have had a very bad math background, and she was quite helpful to me. I honestly don't understand the bad reviews, I would definitely recommend her. Also, she is definitely easy on the eyes!

Ms. Nichols class is extremely easy. Everything in this class I learned my sophomore year in HS. If you are good in math, take her, because you still learn by going back over old stuff, but it's pretty much a blow off class. Nichols as a person is super sweet, and her office is always open, and is always on Skype if you want to video chat for help!
Doesnt care about her students. just her own personal life. No review, just tells us ther will be a test, study everything.

Awful. Just awful. I started out this class thinking it would be pretty easy since she seems really nice and all. But within a few weeks I was struggling. And it only got worse from there. If you have little or no calculus background at all, do whatever you can to avoid taking Nichols.

Most people that complain about her class just aren't willing to do the work.  If you are (and she is always available for extra help) then you should do fine.  She has high standards and if you do well you'll learn a lot.  Look in the mirror and be honest with yourself before you complain about her.

She writes out everything which wastes a bunch of time in class... expects you to work out all of your problems which becomes a pain. Don't get mymathlab. You won't understand the concepts on the tests and you won't finish them sometimes b/c there's so much work on them. It's much more worth it to just use the textbook. And get a tutor.

Really nice as a person, but I personally couldn't learn from her. I failed my first two tests after hardcore studying because she grades extremely hard and teaches very little. I had to get a tutor for this class.
ABSOLUTELY amazing professor

Dr. Curry is great! The only grades are 4 tests, including the cumulative final - all are multiple choice. He gives long, but great study guides about a week before each test so studying those will help get a good grade on the tests! Really nice guy!

he's super nice/helpful with your grade.  post study guides, powerpoints, and a test review online.  also has an extra assignment to replace a test grade.  exams are multiple choice.  class is pretty boring though since he just reads from powerpoint.  don't need to read.  if study the powerpoints well, you'll do well.

Class is not hard, and you don't even really need to go. He just reads off of the power points and adds little extra tid-bits that won't be on the tests. Just study the reviews really well and you'll do fine.
I didn't think this class was bad at all. He gives you reviews for every test. So if you know the review you will do well.
boring
read the book (very helpful hint since he co-authored it)
easy at first b/c of old tests, then he flipped out b/c too many good grades on test and changes all tests making them close to impossible. Take notes. You'll live.

Dr. D is awesome. He's a man's man. Anyone that doesn't like him probably wasn't a good participant in his class. He exlefts students to be thinkers and serious, only covers material once in class so pay attention.
Not helpful outside of the classroom AT ALL.
best prof ever!!!

My favorite B school class!  A little tough at times.  Hate the Argus.  Love his teaching style.
One of my favorite profs.

Mid professor and teaches way to fast.

Quizzes every week and introduced new content 3 days before the final exam. She tries to speed through chapters as if it's the last day of class so if you haven't taken AP Chem don't take her, she takes off points if you don't show small specific steps in your math. I put my math on the back page next to the problem and I lost points.

I hate writing this review because Dr. Stover is genuinely a very nice and caring professor. She is very available and willing to help students. Unfortunately, her quizzes and tests are awful. They're too long for the time she gives you and they are very hard. At least she gives drops. Her homework (at least on OWL) is very tedious and not helpful.

Dr. Stover is an amazing professor! She teaches with powerpoints and her canvas announcements tell you which OWL assignments you can do. A lot of it is learning and retaining without knowing it. Her tests are difficult, but she has five points of extra credit on every test and she awards plenty of partial credit.

Dr. Stover is amazing and does not know why she has such a low rating. She is very straight forward and her lectures are mainly all PowerPoint-based. She has plenty of forgiveness points you can earn on tests. Although her tests can be somewhat difficult, she is determined to let you leave the class running with an amazing chemistry foundation.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Extra credit on quizzes that are once a week, bonus points on tests (also drop lowest test and two quizzes). Do hw and listen in lecture and it will be easy. Come to class w printed powerpoints or pre written notes. I use quizlet to study and Its my easiest class

this is my easiest class. She gives extra credit (5 bonus points every test + drops one test) and extra credit for quizzes (quiz every week but if you pay attention in class and do hw its easy) PLEASE take her if you took AP in hs. It will be a breeze! And she uploads videos of lectures. Pay attention to what she says (not just slide info).
I walked in front of traffic praying i got hit omw to this class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Stover has a certain way of doing things, and if that doesnt work for you, youre screwed. The SI sucked. Chem group tutoring was fully booked within the first two weeks of school, so hop on that as quick as you can. I have never taken a class this hard before in my life! Theres probably a better chem prof out there tbh.

comment: Do not email me for help on final grades or test scores

comment: Had a terrible experience. If you have no prior knowledge of chem DO NOT TAKE HER.  Her test averages are either failing or close to failing every time. Quickly goes over lecture material like its a marathon and does not explain clearly. No communication with the SI. Her exams are absolutely nothing like what she covers in class. Save your GPA.

Intro to Psych might not be hard, but his intro to Psych honors is ridiculous. His classes rarely cover the material on the tests. He is so concerned with showing cool examples of everything that he forgets or runs out of time in covering the material we should be learning. A very nice guy, but not a great teacher.
Goog guy
GREAT professor...very cordial and approachable, very intelligent, intro to psych class is almost entirely based on grades/memorization/cramming.

Dr. Achor is a wonderful teacher and makes the classes interesting to listen to. I had him for intro to psychology and as long as YOU READ YOUR BOOK, the tests are easy as anything - but he covers topics at a pace where you could even cram the night before and still cover all the material.
He is a good teacher, and keeps class interesting.  But his tests are hard.  But he is a good teacher.  I got a C!

Super nice, Super Hard!
I took him for History of Psych and like him so much that I took him again for Psychology and Film...He reminds me of my dad.
I like this guy. He always reminded me of the father in The Graduate. Take his Sense and Perception class. Iw was one of my favorites.

He's a good teach but very, very hard.

This class is hard. Attendance is pretty much mandatory because you won't learn much if you don't go, unless you live stream. The tests are hard, and there are 4 tests and one paper in class. So if you're a bad test taker like me, you'll struggle.

comment: He did his best to make sure students actually learned concepts of logic and how to apply them. He is a good professor, and he is fair.
Insane amounts of busy work. Find another prof!
good teacher and helpful TA's.
I took Dr. Beaty's logic class 15 years ago.  He was great.  Encouraging.  I learned and retained lots of logical concepts, and still use them in my work today.  This is a man of real integrity.

One of the least helpful professors at Baylor-

this is supposed to be a 1000 level course. get ready to learn all of logic if u take this class. good thing tho is that tests get easier but man is it crazy
beaty is a dork but hes friendly and always smiling. lots of homework for logic and takes it up often. do the homework and pay attention in class.
great teacher, but impatient at times in class

Very knowledgeable, but scatterbrained. Likes to talk and rarely gives short answers to questions. Relaxed to the point of being apathetic. Easy grader. Lets the students do the bulk of the work, making him more of a facilitator than a professor. Not the best, but definitely not the worst. Worth taking for the class discussions and GPA boost.

My favorite professor - he makes the students do the work.  That doesn't mean he doesn't care, like I've read in other reviews.  It means he wants you to figure it out for yourself.  He's very open, approachable, and will allow you to explore your interests.  Don't be scared away by other comments.  He's very good, and you'll be better for it.
i suggest him if u want an easy class. read a lot of novels, though. quizzes were mostly open-book. really easy with grades

Well, he is an easy teacher so if you really don't want to do much then you should take him, but if you are in literature and you want to read good books then i wouldn't suggest it.  Also if people with weird habits such as holding their belt buckel while speaking annoys you, don't take him.

**Danger, Will Robinson, Danger** Without a doubt, the worst teacher I've ever had. Don't get me wrong; Thomas is a bright guy, and if he gave a rip, he could be pretty good. But his derision for Baylor and her students is pretty clear. Has a cozy tenure gig and knows it. Please, retire soon!

He's never very interested in the students, but he's easy on the grades. You kinda don't know what to expect all semester--and then it turns out well. I had a lot of anxiety about this class... but I really enjoyed what he taught and the ideas he discussed. He's better than a lot of other teachers!
HE's great, class is easy
Terrible, just an awful teacher.  Why he's here, I do not know.
weird,just weird
can't teach or won't teach
His lectures are excellent, and it's important you pay attention, because he really dislikes spelling things out. The content is really relevant and super useful for my other classes.

First and foremost: professor Van Helsing CARES. He answers emails instantly and you can show up at this office for extra help anytime. That being said, his viewpoints can be old-fashioned and once he starts talking, it's hard to stop him. Calls students 'child' sometimes? He also took us on the weirdest excursion ever but let's not get into that.
The Professor did not make sense to me at first but after several lectures, I finally understand. It is corn. It is all corn. It all seems so simple now.

Best professor. Long lectures but so worth except for that one time a student sucked from his wound so swiftly the poison of the gangrene from that knife that I, too nervous, let slip. 10/10, would break into crypts for extra credit again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Van Helsing, while very smart and knowledgeable, lectures in circles and expects his students to reach the conclusion on their own. This makes the class unnecessarily difficult at times though being forced to research material helps cement the lessons. Just be aware his style is bizarre, but that doesn't make the content frivilous.

A rigorous professor with an unusual teaching style, but truly inspiring.  He cares about his work and it shows in his lectures.  He loves to use metaphors and object lessons that don't always make sense right away, but it clicks in the end

The Dr. Himself is very intriguing and a fun teacher, however, what he teaches is quite odd. He has the power to make you believe what he is saying based on his attitude and demeanor, but its just common sense that what he lectures is not real or accurate.

Okay guys, here's the deal. Everything he says in this class is factual. VAMPIRES DO EXISTS! I went on his extra credit excursion to the grave yard because i missed a few classes due to an sickness that i had that the professor helped me recover from, and you must see it to believe it. Everything in this class is real and we must stop them.

Dr. Van Helsing is the greatest man on the planet. He is so genuine and caring. Though it is obvious that he is teaching fantasy, he really does go into such detail that you may even question your knowledge. I've taken both of his course and they are incredibly enjoyable and an easy A.

Taking his Identifying Vampires 1101 class, has really changed my life. In his class, he does the talking, and you just have to sit and listen. He is a well spoken man, and very clam. ALL THE TIME. He gives this extra credit opportunity to go to the local grave yard and "hunt", I suggest you do it. Recommended Next class: Killing Vampires 2302
Great prof! love his style.  funny.
a great class. luved his stuff

Keele is a great prof! His section was really interesting and the lectures were very clear (to me, at least). Made class really fun. The test is difficult, but straightforward. He doesn't throw in trick questions like some other professors like to.
great!

i have his class right now and i think he does good to take stuff thats not in the book (like the illusions) and show us how the book stuff really applies.  i havent had his test yet, but i hear its not too bad.  hes real helpful if you ask him something or email.

He was an awful professor.  He was very random, did not respond to my e-mails, and his test was difficult.  If you are taking this class, then you will have him for about a month because there are 4 professors teaching and that month will be horrible!!!!  Good Luck with him.....

Keele does a pretty good job showing cool examples.  I loved the illusions and the Alan Alda stuff.  He talks a little fast, but his test is OK.  Some people say to drop this one, but the first one was MUCH harder.  I liked him.
Keele's material in this class is just too wide spread. And he goes off on tangents during lecture. It's not super hard to learn, but very hard to care!
Great lectures, but could slow down some.  Makes class fun to go to.
The guy is a nice guy but his lectures are a bore and his tests are not easy.

a very challenging class, but one of my favorite teachers i've had at Baylor. really great teacher who is always willing to help if you don't understand something. doing the preclass problems is a MUST.
explains in detail. Lots of hints relating to actual clinical application. Makes you understand the basis behind the disease process. I recommend her class to everyone.
Very approachable, helpful, and fair professor. Wants everyone to do well. I would definitely want her to be my nurse because she really cares about students and her patients.
Took a while ago now--but remember that it was a tough class mostly because of so much new material. People complained alot but simply needed to study more. Excellent class if you put the time in.

I learned a lot in her simluation lab. She was a great teacher. She did make us do more work than the other instructors, but we learned more too. Make sure you come prepared and on time. She is very willing to help and loves questions.
Excellent teacher.  If you follow her instructions, it's great!!  She makes you think.  If you aren't prepared before class, it's your fault!!  One of the best teachers here at Baylor.

She is the worst teacher I?ve ever had. Her teaching method is just condescending and disrespectful. If you ask her a question, SHE NEVER ANSWERS it! She expects everyone to perform as a nurse with 30 yrs of experience. She never gives positive feedback and dwells on the negative parts of our performance. She needs an attitude adjustment!

She is the worst ever! Dont even think about asking her a questions...she just gives you extra homework on the topic without EVER ansswering the original question. she seems smart, but she just needs to learn a better way to communicate with students. Right now she sucks!!
wow very condescending and unclear
Ms. Gamblian is a little over the top.  She knows her information though.  Make sure you read!!!

His exams are so very very difficult. I wouldn't take him again because he is not as good as the reviews has said. He is not helpful at all nor willing to help. The exams consist of uncovered material which I believe it is ridiculous. If I was asked who to take, I would say not him.

Turn away from him! He isn't good. His classes are student lead which I don't like. Also the tests are tricky and only covers 60% of material that is covered in class. Like I said, don't take him if you have to!!!!!

I know he has some good ratings, but my take on him is he isn't as good as I thought. Personally his teaching method is not my favorite since he uses Moore teaching method. I think more analytical so I am struggling. His tests consists of information we covered and 40% not covered which I think it is stupid. I recommend not taking him at all!!

MTH 3300 has been challenging so far. The tests some of the material is covered but while some of the questions on the exam isn't covered. I do not like his teaching method for this class. His class is student lead which is not what I am used to. I wouldn't take him again based on his teaching method.
BUS CALC- all homework was optional and tests were the exact problems from the homework. DEFINITELY TAKE HIM. He's so nice and helpful too
Took his calculus for business class. He's awesome, always helpful and extremely intelligent. DEFINITELY PICK HIM!
best teacher I had, loves his subject and makes you love math, inspires you to learn math like no one else I know. wish I had taken more classes with him.

Honestly, the best math teacher I have ever had! I had him early in the morning and he definitely kept me awake.. he may go off on tangents, but they're funny... very concerned with whether or not everyone understands.. very willing ot help! and from the test that I have taken, they seem very easy!
No Comments
No Comments
Dr. Parsons is great!  Tests are hard, but they mostly come from his lectures-so take notes.  He does like to pick on students in the class on occasion.
Dr. Parsons was a nice guys but his teaching methods are horrible and lack clarity. If your looking for something easy then his class is an illusion!

Dr. Parsons is a very good professor. I would take him again if I could. While he is fairly tough, he will make you interested in the subject. This class was my lowest grade and yet my favorite class.

Funny guy and excellent lecturer. His tests are not too hard if you study (I got 2 As and a B), but they definitely can't be blown off. He gives daily open-book quizzes online that are great grade boosters, and never gives homework. If you want to learn and get a good grade, take him.

Dr. Parsons' scriptures class is the class for people who are actually interested in the topic.  Parsons has a great sense of humor, and has a way of making dull topics interesting.  If you want to learn, but also have a good time in class, this is the professor for you!

His tests are extremely hard and mostly from the lecture, so you definately need to take notes. I would recommend trying to find someone a little bit easier. But hey, D's equal degrees here at Baylor University!

He is hard... plain and simple.  I am retaking this class because there is no reason to have a C in Scriptures!!!  Tests are practically impossible.  BEWARE OF THIS TEACHER.... AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!! (The one good thing he does have is a since of humor...)

Dr. Parsons has the best sense of humor of any class I have had. I always leave class laughing at the most ridiculous things he says. Although his test prove to be difficult, he is mostly coherent and helpful in his lectures. Southern Baptist roots show through and I wish he was a bit more deconsructive and critical of the validity of text.
Funny man, but the class is pretty difficult. He is very helpful & compromises with the class.

Dr. Parsons is awesome! His class, with 250 people, still makes you feel like you're in a room of 10. When he gets bored waiting for students to copy down his powerpoints, he starts drawing on the slides. Since you have to take this class, take Dr.P!
Pretty much the best professor you could ever hope for.

Though I'm far from Baylor now...I STILL think about Col. Baker to this day! He was my absolute favorite prof at Baylor. How many people can really sa they MISS a professor!? I loved him....sooooo interesting to listen to. He does ramble alot but it shows how much he has to offer the class culturally. He's amazing. Total A+ in m book!!

Awesome teacher - he has a million stories. Lectures can be a little erratic, but on the whole, one of my absolute favorite classes at Baylor. Not that difficult if you study; tests can be kind of random, but they are not unreasonable.
improvises, does not prepare, half of the class time is wasted;

One of my favorite teachers at Bayloy. He makes learning Arabic easier than it should be. It's easy to get him off topic in class but that adds to the experience. I highly recommend him and his classes

Col. Baker is, by far, the best language professor on campus. He doesn't make you feel stupid for not knowing anything about the language, and he really makes it easy to learn. Plus he throws in pieces from Mid-Eastern Studies all the time, and it really makes the class more interesting, especially if you're an MES minor.

Col. Baker is probably my favorite professor thus far simply because he doesn't follow the syllabus. If he did, we'd have quizzes every day, but instead of teaching via rigid sermon, Baker makes you feel comfortable, postponing many quizzes and even tests if he thinks we're not ready for it.
Col. baker is the best teacher at baylor, nobody goes out of their way for students like him.  mid-east studies and arabic are easy if you study

He is a very good teacher because he teaches not only what is in the book but also what he has learned through life experiences. He also understands that students have other commitments and tries to work around them
middle eastern class is easy, but arabic is impossible, does not follow syllabus and he pulls his tests from nowhere, my least favorite professor

wouldn't recommend. He'll let class out early but doesn't really teach what'll be on the test. Take it if you're good at teaching yourself. Test straight from book but you'll have to guess about what's important enough to study from it.
Wouldnt take again! Sooooo boring!!! Going to class is pointless because he doesnt teach anything!! He counts off your grade if you are late to class or miss class!!
Honesty? Ok...BORING, HARD TESTS AND GOING TO CLASS IS POINTLESS!!! There!

Loved this class, he's not one of those who swear his class is the most important ever. Funny guy, stories in class, breeze through self explanatory power points. Class was often out early, dont do anything in class, just read the book its not that hard. tests are very easy if u read. i read 1xper chpt got B's on every test. Im a C student got a B.
Mainly lectures on what happened in his personal life and not completely on the subject.  Classes sometimes seem longer than expected.  Exams are pretty tough.
Great Prof.  Highly recommended.
doesnt lecture on anything relevent. Only 3 major tests and final. No extra credit. He loves sports and talks about them all the time. Laid back guy.....but teaching skills could be better.

I though dr. read was a horrible teacher.  just read the book you will do well.  I got really tired of his **** jokes all the times and how he likes blondes better than brunettes.  if you want an easy A go ahead, but you wont remember nothing special
He is so damn funny.  Love him to death.  Hates Texas Longhorns so give 'em hell! TAKE THIS GUY! Study for his tests though, you must read the book.

You have chapter assignments on BOTH Aktiv AND Top Hat. They take FOREVER. Top Hat is a great resource for teaching yourself the material, because his lectures are so boring and unhelpful. He was so intimidating and ridiculed students for not understanding things. Doesn't drop ANY grades. He does curve. Offers one very long extra credit assignment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: Somewhat controversial. I loved him, he knew what he was talking about and explained it in a very good way. Really cares about his students, go to his office hours, makes a huge difference!!!

Dr. Klausmeyer's lectures, though sometimes dull, are quite funny. Dr. Klausmeyer provides comprehensive notes over all the chapters so there is no need to read the textbook. There is quite a bit of homework in this class (45 minutes to an hour a night) but if you do all of it you should expect to perform well in his class.

Reading the textbook is pretty pointless because the lecture covers what you actually need to know from there for the tests. He assigns a lot of homework through a system called OWL however and you can expect to spend a lot of time doing them, so I recommend to not slack off. The tests & quizzes are difficult but you get extra credit at the end.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He condenses his notes a lot and really only included things from the textbook that he wants you to know (I started the semester out by reading along in the book and taking notes but found that to be pointless bc he only tests on the items in his notes/lecture) I say attendance is mandatory bc in order to take quizzes you have to be there, DO OWL!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Expect to be doing an hour of OWL homework every day, seven days a week. If you do not meet that, you will fall behind and have to spend 2 straight weeks like I have doing nothing but chemistry homework for up to 8 hours a day. First day of class, he said out of 130 students in the class, about 5 would get A's. You have been warned.
I love this guy! I feel like he's really prepared me for the next chemistry class I have to take. He loves teaching this class and it shows because he's so passionate.

He teaches right out of the book, so no need to read.  He can be kind of boring but it's not a hard class, and as long as you understand the concept you'll pass his tests.  Homework is on MasteringChemistry and is assigned on a regular basis but it's not bad.  Definitely a low maintenance class. He reminds me of Walter White before he broke bad
No Comments
He plays favorites, and I wasn't one of them. If you get on this mans bad side, WATCH OUT!
Really nice and it helps to do your homework.  Attend Class!

Numerous friends who took this class last year told me how good Dr. McGlashan was and how much they learned.  She was actually even better than I expected.  Her teaching method keeps students actively engaged throughout the class, and she is very helpful and sweet.  I learned so much!  One of the best language teachers I have ever had.

Dr. McGlashan's class was by far the best experience I have ever had learning a language. She is balanced and fair. She is also a ton of fun. If you are thinking of taking a class from her I highly recommend it.
Ugghh! She's a horrible teacher. Always picks a favorite student and they can do no wrong. She's sarcastic, anti-social, and pretentious. Avoid her if you can.
She teaches well and if you do your work you will get an a good grade
she was so freakin' good that it didn't even bother me that she's a flaming liberal.  seriously.
freakin easy
No Comments
Amazing German professor!
She's brilliant!
great professor, easy but you learn a lot of German

Dr. Brent Froberg goes above and beyond for any student willing to learn. I found him to be a professor of the highest quality, the kind worthy of awards, that teacher you only think exists in fiction. His love of the Ancient Greek language & culture is infectious. He is an honor to his profession & it was a genuine pleasure to attend his classes.

He was the best teacher I've ever had; he made me the teacher I am today.  He is passionate, caring, and not willing to lower his standards.  Thanks to him, I believe that my students deserve to push themselves and find a higher level of excellence within themselves.
Dr. Froberg is great!  He knows everything about Classics.  And everything else, too.  :)  Just remember to do your homework and keep up with the readings.

Dr. Froberg is a great prof!  Take him if you can.  He can be difficult, but if he knows you try he will help you any way he can.  He'll make you interested in Greek Mythology.  Work through the study guides and go to class and you'll do fine.
A funny likeable old man who's incredibly well-versed in this topic.  I enjoyed his classes, though he can sometimes go off on a tangent.
Don't take Mythology!  You will hate yourself if you do.  It is horrendously boring and a very difficult class.  Just take my advice and do not, under any circumstances, take this class.
Masterful, fascinating, always a joy to hear.

Dr. Froberg seems to have met everyone who ever studied classics and is very knowledgeable.  80 Min. classes may seem to drag a bit, but he's quite fair and is very good about keeping his office hours.
No Comments
Really nice guy.  Quizzez are pretty easy. Tests are not as easy.

She gives you assignments and homework at the beginning of the year which is all accessed through Cengage Mind Tap. From the first to the last day of the semester she will not contact you, try to help if you ask, nor will she make any lessons herself. In this course, you will use Cengage's textbook to teach and grade yourself. She does nothing.

Mrs. Sanchez is legitimately a better professor than other MIS 1305 professors. Why? Well, compared to others' assignments, our Excel and Access assignments were much easier and she explicitly told us what to put in arguments. Her tests are easy ONLY if you pay attention and study - and study well; her reviews are great. PLUS: she curves!
She's awesome! I'm not majoring in MIS and am not very good with computers. I learned a lot and still did really well in the class.
Ms. Sanchez i a great professor who honestly wants her students to do well. Her tests can be tricky but overall she is a great professor to take.

Ms. Sanchez is such a sweetheart! Her class really is easy if you just do your work and do the tutorials in the books. She provides reviews for all of her exams, and they are spot on when telling you what is going to be on the test. I was told the she "gave the hardest tests" but I'm passing her class easy, while learning A LOT that I didn't know!
Interesting class, but she makes it wayyyy to hard for those not majoring in MIS.  If you are not interested in MIS do NOT take her class.

Dr. Sanchez is a very nice person, but her class is way more involved than it needs to be.  For example, almost all the other ISY teachers let their students use a template to make their web pages, but we had to design ours from scratch.  We had a homework (more like a project) due every week.  A lot of work for an "easy" class.
Run, as fast as you can.
