very nice but thinks class is some sort of upper level course.  the tests are very hard!  my friend and i studied soooo hard for the 3rd one, which she said was the easiest, and we still made a C+.  go talk to her, i think it helps.
This lady is a great teacher. Printable Power Point lectures for every class. Very nice. Homework every class to boost your grade. Tests are not easy. Class ends early often.

Dr. DeMesa genuinely cares about your success and is willing to work with you as long as you put in the work. Go to SI! It genuinely helps and is extra credit. Chemistry is hard but if you take advantage of all accessible resources you can pass! Do not blow off this class, and do the exam replacements to drop your lowest grade.

Dr. DeMesa is an excellent professor. Chemistry is a difficult subject to teach and I did not understand it in high school, but Dr. DeMesa is amazing at teaching the material in a very simple way. You get one dropped exam and there are lots of extra credit opportunities. I would 100% recommend Dr. DeMesa.
Nice lady, obviously really passionate about chemistry. Hated the amount of online homework though, but the homework was more tedious than the tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. de Mesa is the most loving and caring professor I have had. She pushed me but also offered so much grace. If you complete all of your homework, you can replace one of your exams at the end of the semester with the grade you get on your homework and you're in complete control of the homework grade! Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I have never taken a Chem class before, but De Mesa is an amazing professor! She cares that you get a good grade for her class, and I really felt that I learned chemistry throughout the semester. The textbook is technically mandatory for the online homework access code, but I didn't use the actual textbook. She gives handouts for her lectures!

Dr. DeMesa was an amazing professor! She really caters her lectures towards nursing majors so if you're not in that major I still recommend taking her just be prepared. Textbook is NOT needed but she gives lots of quizzes and online mastery tests. Her class was difficult but she really cares to see each student succeed. I highly recommend her class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: She is a GREAT chem teacher, expecially if you have never taken the class before. Exams aren't too difficult as long as you are paying attention in class!

easy class, just show up & pay attention, she uses pow er points & prints them out for you, do all the online quizzes, in class quizzes & topic preparation, study for tests, they wont be super easy but i did receive a 100% on one so it is possible, very nice lady, wants everyone to succeed, highly recommend

I Love her. She is awesome. She will most definitely help you as long as you ask. It's easy to understand what she is teaching. Although her attendance is mandatory and you get a grade for coming to class...She is an AWESOME professor. Take her class!!!!!

Dr. de Mesa is an interesting lady. It is obvious that she wants her students to do well. Be sure to asks questions if you don't understand though. Attending the SI sessions and will help a lot. Pay attention in class though because it's important that you really understand the material because some of the questions on her tests are kind of tricky.
Wonderful, wonderful class.
She is a really good teacher.  You learn a lot about American history too.
Great teacher!
The best English teacher I've ever had.  She is really good at helping you learn to write without making it boring. Class was fun and she really cares about students.
She's awesome!
You get to do fun stuff like making the mythical beast.
She was my favorite professor my first semester at Baylor.  I tried to get her class for the second semester but it was full.
she's really nice, and funny!

I thought she was a great teacher.  She is very caring and compassionate.  She explains everything really well, and she doesn't mind going over things again and again for people.  You have to do a lot of assignments like proposals and outlines to work up to the major papers, but they ended up being helpful for knowing what to do.
Amazing professor! 10/10 would recommend:)

I've taken Barrera for 1402 and 2310 and am already signed up for 2320 this fall. She is a great professor. You always knows what to expect because she gives you a detailed syllabus at the beginning of the semester and sticks to it. I took 1401 at another college, so I had some difficulty in 1402, but thanks to her, I caught up and earned a B+

She is a wonderful teacher. Somewhat challenging, she teaches well. There is a lot of homework, but it really helps you learn the material. Lots of quizzes, but that holds you accountable so that you don't wait until the end of the unit to learn all the material for the test. She's really sweet and a good teacher.

As a freshman taking third semester Spanish, I thought I would be way in over my head. Although she is somewhat difficult and expects a bit in the way of homework, she is an excellent teacher, easy to get along with, and teaches the material thoroughly. Also, from what I hear, she is not nearly as difficult as some of the Spanish profs at Baylor.
does not realize that not her students have not memorized the Spanish Dictionary.  assumes too much from her students.  interesting class but she expects you to know any word she throws at you
She assumes that everyone is on the same level in the class and is very difficult.  Only class i've taken so far that has sent me into a near panic attack.
Avoid like the plague.
Very good teacher, especially compared to most of the Spanish teachers here, who are impossible.  Take her if you can, but don't steal my spot in her class!
Knows her stuff. Very good teacher and test are not very tough. She is enjoyable

Dr. Iverson truly was just there for us in any way we needed him. He made passing the class not only doable but enjoyable! If there is any other opportunity, I would definitely take another one of his classes. I had a great experience with him.

Dr. Iverson was amazing! I had a great experience in his class and he fostered an environment where we could build community through meaningful discussions. It's a pretty easy class as long as you do everything you're told.
The class can definitely be a lot of work, but Dr. Iverson was there to support us in any way we needed. He was very caring!
I was so blessed to have had Mr. Iverson. He is extremely understanding and is willing to help. 100% would recommend!

Great Professor! Dr. Iverson was extremely approachable and willing to help. He is incredibly understanding and cares about you as a person before a student. You will learn a lot from him. WOULD RECOMMEND.

Mr. Iverson had amazing lectures and his material taught me on how to use faith in my every day use. Also, he had seminar reading which will break down the class in three groups which was really helpful to caught up on other material and his readings. Midterms and essays are a piece of cake. Thank you so much Mr. Iverson

Had him my first semester of freshman year and he was my favorite class. All my friends had these horrible teachers with loads of homework; meanwhile my class had meaningful discussions, no quizzes, and was a lot of fun.
He gives an essay midterm and two papers. Not much reading. He also does 4 seminars in a semester and it is all about participation. Super easy class, especially since I am not religious.

Kelly is one of my favorite teachers ever! He legitimately cares about his students and wants students to learn material for the long term rather than short term memorization.  There were only 5 grades in the class, but no quizzes or busy work.

Use his worksheets as study guides while READING THE BOOK. Pay attention in class as he will hint at times what will be on tests and quizzes, if your lost just talk to him during his office hours he is supper approachable and will tell you what you should go over. Also his supplemental instructor was a good resource.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Very nice and very funny. But he has a habit of mumbling. If you are taking this class to fulfill requirements and you aren't interested in learning the material, by all means, take his class. But if you need to learn the material for the MCAT, do not take this class. While he is pleasant, I did not learn the material in his class.
Three words, DON'T BE STUPID. You can't understand him, because he mumbles. All semester we thought we were failing. EXAMS come from nowhere.

quit complaining. hes a good teacher, students just take advantage of the fact that he doesnt care whether or not YOU are responsible enough to do the work. but if you do- his tests are a piece of cake. and you can think you are failing and end up with a B. its true.

He's hard to understand.  The class is VERY boring but a good time to do the crossword.  We all thought we were failing all semester, but at the end pretty much everybody got a B.  Avoid if you want to learn, take him if you want a B.
Very hard to understand.  His tests are very tricky.  He makes a lot of mistakes on his tests.  Go over the test & make sure he did not accidentally mark something wrong.  Avoid him if you can.

He mumbles and you cannot even hear him in the front row.  Our final he said would not be cumulative and would only be tested over what was on the review sheet.  Went in to take the final, and not one question concerning the review sheet was on there.
Cannot explain anything that is at the student's level.  His test questions come out of nowhere, and he doesn't give a lot of A's.
Dr. Jones is very difficult to understand.  I had him for 2 chem. classes and it nearly killed me.  AVOID HIM!!!

Ugh I love Carol. Sweetest lady. She knows her anthro more than anyone, very passionate. I would so take her again! Anthropology did not interest me one bit, but now I can honestly say I would not mind pursuing a degree in it. Her lectures are very straightforward. Her exams can be very tricky so study study! Coursemate... better bookmark it.

She's an incredibly nice person, but there's little room for error. Your grade is based 100% on your test and weekly quiz scores. The class is not hard but there is a TON of information. Thankfully, she clarfies things and answers questions well.
When it comes to archaeology, she means business, no messing around, you make an A, D or an F
An archaeologist teaching anthopology, cool,probably tough in the field
An archaeologist teaching anthopology, cool
nice, not the most intellectual teacher
She is so nice and great, but she is so boring. I have no clue what the class is about, but I am making an a.
She is cool and nice, but sometimes confusing and vauge.  But if you take intro with her she is a very easy grader.
No Comments

Yes Dr Duran can be intimidating. He moves quickly and does not put up with distractions. It is his way of keeping control of the class and getting a lot done in a short period of time. Got to know him outside of Baylor, hes a good guy. Owe him my fluency in French. Warmer and more approachable in upper level classes.

Nice guy-knew everyone's name very quickly. After the first week or so you understand how class works every day. The tests/quizzes are exactly like what you practice in class so no surprises! Look over the text you'll be doing in class the next day. Take notes if you haven't had french before! I had french before so this class was especially easy.

Fascinating life if you get the change to talk with him. Very helpful anytime you need assistance. Loved speaking the language instead of vocabulary flashcards. It was nerve-wracking, but worth it. On a trip to France, was mistaken for a local. He's the best!
If you want to meet Hitler II, take his class. He is very mean and intimidating. He is extremely unfair when it comes to grades and does not really offer students much help.

He acts like a dictator in class. He is not a very approachable professor. Going to his class was very stressful since he buzzes at students who answer his questions incorrectly. I wouldn't take another class with him.
Helpful, clear and effective if you can take his maddeningly condescending attitude.  Otherwise, avoid him.
the best professor I ever had!!
He  buzzed  you every time you say something wrong.  Very annoying!
He emphasizes oral as opposed to grammer. You'll actually learn how to speak!
Awesome professor and so personable and kind.

I enjoy Dr. Harvill as a person but I'm not a fan of his professor vibe. His lectures are just boring readings from slides and he never plays the videos he has on the slides and just skips them. I had to do a lot of solo studying on my own. Overall BIO1305 is just a difficult course. He gave weekly quizzes and homework that were pretty difficult.

Dr. Harvill is one of the best biology professors at Baylor. His lectures are interesting and entertaining. He cares about his students' success - go to his office hours! If you complete the homework quizzes, attend SI, and study, you will do great in his class! I would recommend him to anyone.

Dr Harvill was one of my favorite Baylor professors! He is very funny and likes to make his lectures interesting. I took him for both bio 1305 and 1306 and loved the class both semesters. The exams can be tough, but go to SI and do the practice exams (this was the biggest help for me). Also take good notes and go over the presentation slides.

I'm not a science person by any measure, but I needed a life science for my degree, so I took Harvill at the recommendation of my siblings. His class is hard and you have to read the textbook and pay attention, but he's really nice and he's a good prof. He almost convinced me to take more science classes.
Harvill is a pretty nice guy and the tests aren't bad - but you have to read the book. His lectures and guided notes are mostly irrelevant which is unfortunate.

BIO 1406 (Research)-Dr. Harvill knows his stuff and cares about his students (at least the research students). His lectures are informative and hilarious. Going to the wetlands every Wednesday is much better than the 1306 lab, so if you ever get an email from the bio department about a meeting for Bio 1406, go to the meeting and apply for 1406!
Harvill is GREAT..Take him even if you have to get up at 8 in the morning. He is the best bio prof at Baylor!

He is a great teacher, but can get a little boring. He is very passionate about the subject and eagerly answers questions. His tests are very straght-forward. He really wants all his students to receive high marks in his class.
good guy
This guy spends more time trying to recriminalize abortion than he does teaching economics anymore. An embarrassment to the university, in my opinion.
This guy rots!  STAY AWAY!!!

This has to be one of the worst professors at Baylor University. He presses his political ideology on you, and teaches what he deems correct. ALL of his exams are short answer and essay while the other ECO 2306 exams are predominantly multiple choice.
tough tests. very interesting, great lecturer
No Comments
omg, i had this guy just when he subbed for my regular prof. one day and hes CRAZY! do NOT get this guy unless u have an affinity to being called at random to answer questions in class!
He is a really nice guy, but you have to work in this class
No Comments

Dr. Russell is the best professor I have taken at Baylor; I have had him for three classes and I've loved every one. He is very accessible outside of class for essay help or just chatting! He is a faithful Christian, and this makes his classes uniquely incredible. Get ready to read and write, but it's worth it.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Russell makes you read. It is interesting material, but focused on Irish Literature. He came in and took control of the classroom and never helped anyone learn. At many instances he was condescending and demeaning especially in how writing happens.
He is one of the nicest teachers I've ever had but he IS hard.

Dr. Russell is an AMAZING professor.  His class can be a little difficult, but it is equally as interesting, stimulating and fun.  He is a genuinely nice guy who loves his wife, his students, and literature.  He is one of those professors you try to fit in your schedule when at all possible.
amazing teacher, very open to discussion and alternate interpretations
He is a very caring, helpful person. I really enjoyed his class. He has an abundance of knowledge on what he teaches!
so cute! :)
Nice guy and is interested in works, but does not grade fairly at all (said clas
He is the sweetest man ever!

I put 2307, but the actual class I took is Econ 1380. Mencken is a solid teacher who cares about her students. She even can be persuaded to make exams easier. If you take notes and study for a few hours for her tests you'll do well. Some people thought her tests were a little too hard, and though they weren't the easiest, they're passable.
Really chill! Homework assignments are easy and tests were open note

I took Dr. Mencken's BUS 1201 class online and it was a good introductory course into the world of business. Homework is fairly easy and all exams were open note. She had very helpful powerpoint lectures that covered the main points of each chapter. As long as you read and take notes over the material, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: She's the only one who teaches this mandatory class, and she's awful. Spends 10 minutes each class talking about her son, but then can't get through all the material. Don't miss class. She tests on the speakers and does pop quizzes on videos watched one minute prior. The exams are unnecessarily hard. Good luck passing.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Really fun
Soooooo funny!!!!!! Her son turns into an inspirational figure for you!

Professor Mencken is a sweet teacher! I loved having her for 1201, because she made every class interesting. Do not miss class.... unless you have to. The clicker questions can make or break your grade. I made a "B" in the class because I missed too much. She is very understanding and cares about her students. LOTS of guest speakers... TAKE HER!
How exciting can macro be?  She makes it somewhat fun and tolerable.
Good teacher. Uses online assignments alot. Just study and do the assignments and the class will be fine.

Pr WardWallace was an exciting and clear lecturer on American Foreign Relations.  However, she permitted no questions or discussion in class or out, ever, unless you had been on her Baylor in Europe trip. Questioning the historical validity of anything from her lectures in an essay test would get you a D, no matter how much more valid your sources.

Dr. Wallace was an exciting and clear lecturer on American Foreign Relations.  However, she permitted no questions or discussion in class or out, ever, unless you had been on her Baylor in Europe trip. Questioning the historical validity of anything from her lectures in an essay test would get you a D, no matter how much more valid your sources.

The entire class grade is based on four essays. The essays are ridiculously easy because the most important factor is format first. The format is listed clearly in the syllabus and you get a practice essay. There is no reason not to get an easy A even in her advanced classes. I have taken her twice and recieved easy A's.

She is not a hard teacher as long as you go to class and do the essays according to her guidelines and turn all of them in ontime. We had 4 essays based on outside reading books, one of them is the final, assigned on the last day of class and turned in on the day of the final. She only allowed 4 absences even though the university would allow more.

She really knows her stuff. If you'd rather write essays than take tests, this is the class for you - because grades are based on ONLY essays. Start early on your essays so that you can ask questions as you go instead of doing it all the night before, for real.1 big extra credit oppurtunity - very nice. Be sure to take notes. She is reeeeally great

One of the strangest classes I have taken. Grades are entirely based on papers, graded by the TA. Very little work required, but you never know what grade you will end up with. Get to know the TA and his/her writing style.
Fabulous/Brilliant woman. History of the American Woman is fascinating. Dr. Wallace is super cool. I hope to look as good as she does when I'm her age!
Nice Lady, lots of easy essays. Just pay attention in class and take good notes- that's the final. She's not too demanding, but you'll know history when you leave her class. I liked it!
grade is based solely on four essays from books outside of class. essays aren't too bad if you follow directions closely. she lectures each day, but she's a great speaker.
The most wonderful teacher ever!  She is so caring and compassionate and helpful!  She does talk a lot and gets distracted, but she has brilliant insight and funny stories to share!
No Comments
Her class was helpful, interesting. She is truly interested in the lives of her students. Simply put: she changed my life.
She is really the nicest teacher ever. She loves to tell stories, but she also has a passion for what she teaches. She also really seems to care about her students. I think she's great!
No Comments
No Comments

she's sooo awesome! everyone needs to experience this old gal! she has a million stories to tell and is easily distracted. brilliant, bubbly, off the wall hyper lady you will love! she's anal about following simple directions but its just funny.

Not a very hard class-pretty much the only work is one research paper. Several classes were either cancelled or spent in the library; more like a history of slavery class than an english class. Very bubbly, but get on her good side-she has a strict side.

Not bad, she talks a LOT and never stays on topic. She should be on ritalin. Nice lady, though. Eager to help, cancels class quite often, delays due dates, and is easy to distract when you're trying to avoid being quizzed about something.

Hard to stay awake during his lectures, easy quizzes if you read, also open note quizes so very hard to not do well. Very knowledgable and passionate about what he teaches and is understanding of situations that can hinder your performance and will give you a break if needed.

Dr. Burnett is a super sweet guy who clearly really cares about this subject. However, we had very difficult tests that felt impossible to get an A on. The homework isn't too terrible, we had 10-question quizzes twice a week online but the questions were word for word out of the textbook. We had quite a few Socratic circles and rabbinic debates.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Unnecessary amount of work for class, talks quietly and makes it easy to fall asleep, powerpoint lecture heavy, lots of reading for tiny 10 question quizzes, socratic circles, rabbinic debates, etc. Nice person and very sweet but probably not the professor you want if you're taking the class just for the credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: All of my friends that had different professors for Christian Scriptures said it was their easiest class and very enjoyable. With this professor, I barely made a C-, and have to retake the class for my major. There is a ton of reading and the quizzes have barely any questions. As someone who normally does well in school, this class was a struggle.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: only 4 tests and then 1 final. all tests are short yet over a ton of material. hardest christian scriptures you can possibly take. no homework or quizzes to boost your grade
Professor Burnett is a great professor who obviously knows what he is talking about. Smart man. Do not expect an "Easy A" but do the work and you should be fine.

A lot of crazy hard quizzes over a CRAZY amount of reading. Once we had a 10 question quiz over 52 chapters of the Bible & 38 pages on the internet. Tests are freaking HARD. I studied forever, and only ever made the highest of an 84. Essays help to raise your grade. He is nice, but won't give you ANY slack. Avoid it if you can. I'm serious...

very intelligent guy. new to Baylor, younger. there is a good bit of reading for the class, but as far as class discussion goes, he's very fair and even-handed and provoking. i hope to take him again in an upper-level course.
Very nice, easy-going guy who just moved from one of the Carolinas

Dr. Jonklaas is amazing. On top of being very knowledgeable, he is just an amazing person. Be ready to drink from a firehose. You won't find another class with the workload and sheer amount of material that you will have to memorize and understand for this class. Exams are extremely fair, and he tells you clearly, everything that will be on them.

Dr. Jonklaas is an amazing teacher. Yes, he might be scatterbrained at times, but he knows his stuff and he tells what you need to know/do to do well in his class. You don't use the book, just study his slides. The class is tough, but an A is very attainable.

Great Christian professor.  Make sure to study his slides for tests, these are where he thoroughly consolidates all the material from the book.  Also, it's a bad idea to cram for tests in any of his classes-they're pretty massive-but it can be done if absolutely necessary (just expect to be up all night and up until the test begins in the evening).

It is true that he could try to improve his organizational skills, but he has every student's best interest in mind. He basically tells you what the test is going to cover, but it is easy to wait till the last minute and fail the test because of his laid-back style of teaching. Study ahead of time and you'll do well!

very nice man, but very scatterbrained. his notes are very difficult to follow; each slide is completely covered with information and he usually chooses the insignificant information to test over. he is never on time with returning paperwork or grades; he uses various excuses. he also does not help out with your grade if you're right on the edge.
good teacher but hard

Basically this guy is all over the place.  Yea he gives you the slides but the way he tests and quizzes is kind of ridiculous---def. not enough time+plus he gives countdowns which get really annoying. He really does help with grades at the end. C

Dr. Jonklaas is a great teacher and a good, friendly guy who is concerned that his students learn.  There are many times when you won't be able to follow his spastic powerpoint lectures, so be prepared to print everything off at the library, take your own notes, and learn much of the material on your own.  He's fair and usually adds a heavy curve.

Wonderful teacher!; criticized alot for organization, but teaching 150 students in one semester is too much for anyone to handle without any help.  He loves Jesus and is the nicest person you will meet.  He is definatley well informed of the material, a genius, makes you interested in the subject.
A Very difficult teacher to take due to her teaching style. She has a very unhelpful attitude.
Take another professor, trust me.
She is such a super nice lady.... but her tests are crazy hard... feel lucky if you get a c
She looks like an older Madonna.  Nice if you took the time to visit her after class during office hours.  Very thourough.  Hard tests!
Not very clear and too hard.  But she doesnt know what she is talking about sometimes.  Can be nice if you take time to know her.
No Comments
She doesn't explain concepts well, can be rude sometimes, and she always has to be right
Very challenging tests.  Labs were time-consuming and not helpful in taking tests.
HARD!!!!! study and pray
Best professor I have ever had. He is caring and passionate. Take him!
He's a great man...and a great professor.  He actually cares about each of his students.  His class was pretty easy.

Mr. Parrish is amazing!  I have never had a prof who cares so much about EVERYBODY.  He is really interesting, not too hard, and he's got some great stories!  Plus, if you need someone to help you network, he is really helpful and he knows LOTS of people, especially if you want to work in sports PR.
GREAT PROF! YOU WILL LEARN SOMETHING, AND STAY INTERESTED.
Loved him. He is so easy to talk to and will help you with anything!! You must take Parrish!
TAKE PARRISH!!!!!  He is an amazing teacher and person.
This guy is SO interesting; helpful; treats his students fairly and shows interest in them. He grabs your attention in this class. One of the top professors at Baylor. Take him!
Very interesting professor. Genuinly nice man; helpful; treats students with respect. Pretty easy pR class
This professor is great! He really cares about his students. Class is not too difficult. Lots of chances for extra credit. Easy if you have taken a writing course before.

Mis1305 was easy. One of the easiest classes I've taken at Baylor.. But I have a decent knowledge of computers. It's a basic Microsoft office class .. He's an ok prof and helps you if you need it. Just show him you care. I never had a problem with him and I thought the class was kind of fun, maybe cuz I'm a science major and my classes bore me. Take him if you're taking mis.
One of the worst teacher I ever have, never response email, exams are ready hard, lots of assignment, the assignment covers things that he NEVER teach in class. BAD BAD BAD

He is probably the most boring teacher I have ever had in my life. His voice is so monotone, I always wanted to fall asleep. However, he is helpful and will pretty much give you answers if you ask. His tests are HARDDD!

wow this man is boring! he only reads from powerpoints and gives homework that is impossible (especially from excel) and when he says to just do the review for his tests, dont' believe him! it's not enough. the tests aren't THAT hard but it was more than just the review.
reads straight from power points. boring. monotone voice. not very helpful. no extra credit opportunities i dont reccomend

Difficult to communicate with. He talks like a military officer. I used to work on a class project with a local company for FREE. He gave me a low grade, even he knew that it was company representative who were unreasonable. Afterwards, he did not want to talk with me when I went to his office. Not recommended.
He's very educated in his field and very willing to help you out.  He is nice...make sure you look over your notes and all.
Extremely nice guy. Not very interesting class unless you are a computer science major. I would highly recommend him for this class.
not a very interesting class but he is very accessible and helpful. nice man. Recommend for ISY 3305

Programming and Reading assignments every week. The programs can take upwards of 10 hrs to get right. The reading will take you 3 hrs to complete. The homework may take an additional 3 to 6 hrs. So on a typical week you are looking at 16+ hours of work not including the lectures. Tests are comprehensive and will cover material mentioned in class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I can only reiterate what's already been said. Programs are large, but interesting; tests are very difficult. As far as personality, he's an interesting guy, down to earth with a great sense of humor. Overall a great, helpful professor.

Great teacher. During lecture, he explains the material clearly and can answer all of your questions. He's very helpful during office hours and will make you understand what you have to do. However, the tests are pretty difficult as are the programming assignments. But an enjoyable class overall.
The programming assignments are big, but very interesting and fun. The tests will be what kill you though.
Learned a ton
Good class.
Class is very hard, but you will learn a LOT!  He is an excellent teacher, and his tests are a fair measure of your knowledge.  The programming assignments are fun, but pretty hard.
Class is pretty hard, very informative, and you'll go crazy by the end.
This man is EVIL!  If you take this class you better be an expert in C
One of the most amazing professors I've ever had

I really enjoyed the class and having him as a professor. He's funny, obnoxious and has a good heart. His class isn't easy, and it does require work, effort and verbal participation. He doesn't lay out the expectations of the paper he grades at the start of the semester, and it is ultimately up to the students to figure out how to get the A
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: My favority professor at Baylor. Excellent teacher, humble, inspiring. He is passionate about what he teaches and loves students. An all around gentleman. Needs to be designated a  Master Teacher. Turned down a very lucrative offer at the CIA to stay at Baylor to continue teaching. Awesome.
Great teacher, I enjoyed running with him.
Incredible guy, though a bit idealistic
Too emotional. like a preacher rather than a professor. Girls were crying...Dude, overdone.
Man of God
awesome and engaging -- highly enjoyable prof!!
incredible passion but almost too easy

She's horrible to talk to. She does not really care about the human experience. She does not care to hear your stories, or if youare having issues with keeping up with her class, because of personal circumstances. She is a tough professor, which is fine, but do not expect any sort of understadning like any normal professor would. She's bad.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. M is amazing. Her class allows you to gauge how ready you are for upper level science classes
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Worst professor I have ever taken in my life. If you want to pass and learn anything for your MCAT, take Dr. Danley. If you do not kiss her ___, do not expect to enjoy her course. Memorize the PowerPoint's and read the book. I would never take her again and truly wish a dean would confront her over her teaching methods.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Shes amazing. Those who dont like her are just crazy. Shes accessible and caring. Her tests are taken directly from the learning objectives THAT SHE GIVES YOU.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Worst teacher I have ever had in my life. Read the book and go to SI sessions because her power points are useless as to what she puts on the exams, which are extremely difficult. TAKE DANLEY! I am saying this with all the soul and prayer in me, DO NOT TAKE HER!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great teacher! Hard tests, but they go straight off the lecture outlines that she does in class. Has no problem explaining things in a different way. be sure to read the chapters in the book.

Take her over duhrkoph.. You fill in her outlines in class and the tests cover that. Make sure you do the problems in the book like she says. It's a tough class but if you study you'll do fine. Genetics is tough at bAylor.. Just do your work. Both genetics profs are tough and neither is the nicest person around. Just get through the class

dr. moehnke was awesome. she is very good at explaining everything in the chapters, and knows the answer to almost every question the class asks her. you have to attend class to get the notes, and you have to actually read each chapter to do well, but if you give yourself enough time to study, you will do well. i definitely recommend her class!!

MEAN!! do not take her! quizzes every fri that count as a test grade and they are not easy. doesnt believe in extra credit or curves, so when the class avg is 50- she says its the classes fault, not hers. tests are mult choice and HARD short answer and theres NEVER enough time to finish- but when the WHOLE class complains- its still our fault.
he will drop the lowest exam grade, and a bunch of low quizzes, and gives up to two extra credit points a week, take him!!!

Disclaimer! Dr. Bridge is a lecturer! When I had him, I read all these bad reviews about him, and I thought he was this horrible guy. He's actually really approachable, but because he is a lecturer, he's not going to be super sympathetic about your individual circumstances. He is really funny and makes his lectures engaging.

It's clear Bridge likes his subject and that he also wants students to enjoy it. However, even coming from someone who got an A, his grading is quite difficult. At some point during the semester he showed us a graph where between 6 and 10% of his students get an A. Some days I didn't care for the constant sarcasm. But I guess that's just who he is
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I took Dr. Bridge for 2302 American Constitutional Development. This class, taught by Bridge, is structured like most other college classes- 4 tests composing almost the entire grade. Bridge requires a level of thinking that surpasses most others, but only because his lectures invoke that. Take him if you love politics and a challenge.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Tough grader

comment: I really like him, but the class is very difficult. The first paper is graded very harshly and worth a ton of points, and he could've been much clearer and given better feedback on it. The exams are very difficult - all short answer. I enjoy his lectures and think he does a good job teaching, but I'll be lucky to get a B.

As someone who is now in law school and taking Con Law I constantly remember Bridge. Best professor I have ever had and in a class that most students dread. Professors like Bridge are hard to find and whether you have an interest in law or just an entertaining class that teaches the history of your country, there is no better than Bridge.

Not bad, but he spent sooo much time on his opinion and what he thinks that there is little fact. The first 15 minutes of every lecture is him going over the last lecture - which gets annoying really. Everything seems so dumbed down it gets boring - only five assignments, so you NEED to do well on each one. I wouldn't take his class again...
I love Dave Bridge more than I love Taylor Swift. Which is a lot. If I had a draft for best teachers, Bridge would be my number 1 pick. Dolphins fan, though.

BRidge is such a great teahcer! Every lecture was super entertaining and I never wanted to miss class because everything you needed to know for the tests were in the notes. All you had all semester are two papers a midterm and a final. It was very easy!

It's now two days before graduation and Hruska has not put in a SINGLE GRADE other than attendance, which she keeps RELIGIOUSLY. I have no clue what I have in the class, and neither do any of my classmates. No homework grades, no quiz grades, no test grades. Don't take her if you want to know what grade you have in the class before finals.
GREAT teacher - HARD class. Learn a lot of basics to be prepared for upper level RUS.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Really nice and decent professor but class is super difficult. Homework every night and a quiz almost every week. One of the hardest classes I've ever taken.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Don't do it man, you have to learn a ton of vocab, there's homework every night, quizzes at least once a week plus alot of tests. We struggling out here.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Hruska is amazing. She genuinely cares about her students and she makes learning fun and easy. She gives homework every day, but it's short and easy so it's a great way to boost your grade. Her tests and quizzes aren't hard and don't require a ton of studying if you just go to class everyday and participate in discussions.

Amazing teacher. She's incredibly helpful and makes the learning material very clear and easily understandable. Homework every night but are completion grades. Must participate & speak in class, but if you are shy don't worry, she makes the environment very comfortable. Very easy & enjoyable if you put out the effort. Always take Hruska if you can.
Great GREAT teacher! Very helpful, despite Russian being a hard language. She makes it not so intimidating and is extremely helpful. You'll feel your progress very quickly

Great professor. Always helpful in and out of class. Always open to set up tutoring times. Works well both with students who are quick to pick up languages and those who have more issues. Wants to see her students succeed. TAKE HER!!!

She is extremely nice! She will do absolutely everything to help you and try to get you to pass her class. Its an easy class but you have to do the homework. She will set up any tutorial times with you whenever you need. She is very entertaining and funny to listen to. She seems like a friend more than a professor! Shes great! Take her!
Literally the best professor I have ever had
He covers a lot of material in his lectures, so you need to go to class. Tests are not too hard if you study. There are some opportunities for extra credit. Overall, not a bad class.

he is AMAZING and offers a ridiculous amount of extra credit opportunities. He is obsessed with the yANKEEs and makes even the most boring subjects interesting. As long as you pay attention in class and do the readings in Mulins, you'll do WonDERFULLY in the class. His favorite number is 27 as of now bTW. Ask for extra credit before exams...trust
Good professor is pretty laid back and explains things well.

As a Catholic, I wasn't too excited about taking religion at Baylor.  I'm really glad that I took Dr. Weaver.  Although he will tell you what he thinks, he will also present lots of other viewpoints.  You are graded on if you know and understand the material, not on what you believe.  Good experience, if a little boring at times.

if you are not Christian and concerned about getting religion shoved down your throat, you should take Weaver.  he is really open minded and does not force any beliefs on you.  he has a pretty liberal interpretation on lots of biblical issues.  his tests are pretty hard (they're trivial questions and require lots of reading) but he's a cool prof.

Dr. Weaver knows what he is talking about, but his class is very boring, and his tests are quite difficult.  Very nice professor, but be prepared to do a lot of reading and take tests that are very difficult.  Would I take him again?  If I had a choice, no, but if had to, I wouldn't be too upset.
Really nice guy.  He is pretty easy as well.  I got a 95% in his class.  Make sure you know the study guide he provides.  The entire exams come from it.

This guy's tough, but really nice.  Don't feel too bummed out if you happen to be "stuck" with Weaver.  He's a nice guy, just makes things very difficult when it comes to taking tests. Read the assignments and you'll pass.

So I'm not a math person at all, and this class really isn't that bad. There's a quiz andor a test on the weekly. Homework isn't graded. FREE TEXTBOOK. She talks soooo fast but somehow I am still able to understand. It's kind of amazing, actually. This woman is fierce- she can work heels and example problems like no other.
OK
No Comments

She is a very fair and helpful teacher.  Get her if you can for QBA.  She held my attention for a not very interesting class.  If you need help, just go to her office and she will help you in any way that she can.  Take her if you can.
The nicest lady! Take her for QBA
No Comments
fall 03 she was hot... spring 04 even hotter with that boob job
No Comments
She explains everything, class is not bad at all.

I took Hinojosa for my Honors FYS and loved her and this class. The books are interesting and quizzes are easy. Besides the chapter quizzes and quote journals, there are only 3 easy papers and 1 super easy oral report. She gives extensions on the papers if needed and offers a lot of extra credit. Overall she is amazing cares about her students!

She's very welcoming in her classes and during her office hours. Never makes you feel like you are stupid. If I only I did the actual readings, I would have gotten an A. Her grading is fair and she gives tips on how to improve if you need to.
Really nice lady. she wants you to learn. I would recommend taking her.
EXTREMELY nice lady. should do alright if you do the assignments. quizzes are super easy.
nice prof
good

This lady is a wonderful teacher and a sweet heart of a person. For the freshman class she assigns 6 essays, but A's are within reach if you do the class assignments, do well on papers, and go to class. She grades very fairly. I would recommend her to anyone.
she's great! mostly essay on test, but she gives you "ideas" for what the essays will be so its easy to prepare. i would definitely take her again!
She's so nice! I've had her for one semester and I'm definitely getting her for the spring semester as well!  She's AWESOME!

Very different from a typical MIS class. We spent the first half learning to use the software and the second half applying it to business problems and processes. It can be intense (in a good way). If you keep up and don't slack off, it's not hard to earn a good grade. I'd recommend it to any grad student, not just MIS majors.

Great class. Different from the typical IS class. No text except the User's Guide and articles. Few exams but lots of projects to learn how to use the technology and properly communicate the results. Dr. Edgington made the class fun and useful.
Thought this would be boring, but it opened my eyes. Saw how business is actually run. She can relate this stuff to the real world because of her past experience. Adding it as a major as a result.
Very concerned about students learning some very challenging concepts. Projects were worthwhile, but you may need to go to her office for help. Exams OK if you don't blow off the reading.
Changed what I thought of information systems. Prof has alot of real world experience. Really good class.
Changed what I thought of information systems. Really good class.
The class is challenging, but study and you'll do OK. She's very helpful when you approach her. The info she uses for grading projects is posted ahead of time. I really liked the project at the end.
Worst teacher i've ever had
He seems more interested in telling you about things he has done rather than teaching the stuff you actually need to know for the tests. Nice Guy; however, I would not recommend him as a teacher...
Very down to earth (no pun intended) and fun. Difficult test. Would take him again.

Great guy. Study the handouts and take notes. Ask questions in class if you don't understand!  "now this is cocktail party stuff...." <= you will hear that alot, fun trivia. Overall an effective professor. Not easy but tries hard to make students understand (must ask questions!!). Will take his classes when I can
No Comments
No Comments
Nice guy, doesn't take attendence, tests are completely from his notes, but he goes too fast in class to copy all the diagrams...tests are very hard...not an easy A, but a managable B
He was really funny and nice.  His tests are another story.  I don't know where he got the material from!
Allen is too cool!  He cracked me up, but the tests were anything but funny.
If you get through Baylor without taking Dr. Jeffrey, you have missed out.
One of the best teachers that I have ever had. He is humble despite his profound brilliance and has a compassion for students that extends beyond the classroom.

Awesome teacher! The kind of man you think "now this is a real proffesor", unlike one teacher of mine. Tons of class discussion, makes our 3 hour class interesting. a brilliant thinker, well-read, knows at least parts of several languages.

Best lecturer at Baylor.  Classes are all lecture all the time - no class discussion.  Most brilliant prof in the dept.  Can get overwhelming at times though and can be harsh in grading.  I learned a great deal from him and he changed some of views 180.  If you don't like lecture avoid.

He knows so much about so much, from language and literature to theology, philosophy, and popular culture.  Ask him questions about anything and recieve a brilliant answer.  Even though he is a heady intellectual, he is friendly toward his students.  You must take him if you get the chance!
No Comments

Probably the most polyvalent teacher I've ever had--he's an expert in raising cattle and 60s music as well as Biblical exegesis and philology.  Lectures are amazing, though prone to lapses into French, German, and Latin.
one of the most incredible lecturers I have ever heard... he is truly a great thinker and a great teacher
Class is very easy. Pay attention get an A+, dont and get a B. Sweet old man, will help you if you ask.

Mr. Hulme is awesome!  I was dreading taking QBA, but I actually understand what he's been teaching and as a result I'm getting an A in the class.  You just need to show up, pay attention, and do a small amount of work outside of class.
He is a great guy and a wonderful teacher. I have been out of Baylor a number of years now but would like to say he has a major positive influence that has helped me over the years.
I have one word for this teacher and that word is AMAZING, take him if you get the chance, he is probably one of the best teachers in the business school.

He is amazing. He explains things in class through examples and even goes over assigments that he assigns you and then makes the test basically just like the examples and assignments only with different numbers and then a few like some of the problems in the book. If you can I would recommend you get him for the second QBA class!!!
Why he does not have all fives eludes me.  He is the best prof. i have had at baylor.  He practically give you a third of the tests and will help you out with anything.
He is a great teacher, helps with anything.  Very nice, knows all the students by name, interesting, defintely take Mr. Hulme.
Sweet, fun man! Will try to help with everything. THe class is not hard and he loves his students!
Kind, knowledgeable, helpful.

Frau Martin is the sweetest person ever, and very knowledgeable. She speaks German well and is extremely understanding. I wish the class were a little more challenging. We definitely talk a ton about German culture but do very little learning the language. If you already feel comfortable with German and are interested in learning culture, take her

I was very excited to learn German, but her class completely ruined it for me. She taught me absolutely nothing. I learned everything on my own, with no help. Frau Martin is the nicest lady on the face of the earth, but is hands-down the WORST teacher I have EVER had. Easy A if you meet expectations, but be willing to teach yourself EVERYTHING.
Having no experience in German before, I was lost basically throughout the entire class. The only thing she is remotely clear on is what will be on the test. I learned nothing.

I really enjoyed her class.  She expects you to do your homework, but is always willing to help.  She spells out what to study for tests.  Not the easiest prof to take, but very clear in her expectations, and kind to her students.  You'll definitely know your stuff by the end of the semester.

i had 3 yrs of german in highschool and spend time in germany. she has no idea how to teach this class. i was totally lost. she barely speaks any german untilt he oral exams and she is not very helpful at all. you basically have to teach yourself.

My grandparents are german.  She doesn't speak german, I'm not sure what she's teaching, but it's not german. It's some sort of american/german fusion language. She gave me an F.  I had 2 absences, got an average of B, and somehow she followed through on
She is very unclear in her teaching and unfair in her grading. Comes off as a witch most times. She barely spoke German up until our oral exams.

Data structures is by nature a hard course, so to say he is a hard professor is false. He understands the class is difficult and gives plenty of extra credit to make up for it, so if you do the extra credit quizzes and pay attention you won't be in a bad standing going into the final. Very easy tests.

Dr Pablo was an over all great teacher. He is very intelligent but does not make students feel less valued or "dumb." He can break the material down into a more understandable manner & will work with you if he sees your doing your part, but is fair.

Professor Rivas is one of my favorite teachers at Baylor. Data structures is a really tough course but he is always willing to help or explain further and you can tell he really cares about the students. The lectures were funny and the daily quizzes prepare you really well for the final. I would not take this class with any other teacher!

It's hard to rate on just a 5-point scale. The nature of the course (as well as computer science in general) seems to be based on a relatively hands-off approach -- letting students figure things out for themselves whenever possible. With that in mind,  Professor Rivas is as clear and as helpful as the material allows without handing it to students

Dr. Rivas is an incredible teacher. As with most computer science minded individuals he's a little cheesy, but this is a positive trait. Occasionally for an important concept Dr. Rivas will use a memorable method that will catch you off guard and grab your attention. It's clear that Dr. Rivas loves teaching and will be there to help you.

Dr. Rivas has been one of my favorite professors in Baylor's Computer Science department. He is very helpful, but with the nature of the class I took with him (Data Structures - CSI 3334), it was a very difficult class. Even though it was difficult, Dr. Rivas did everything he could to help his students, and he legitimately cared about the subject.
Dr. Rivas is one of the best professors I have had so far. Explains clearly and is generous. Highly recommended.

Dr. Rivas is  a great professor. I took him for Data Structures which is a hard class by design.   The best thing about Dr. Rivas is that he's always available and very willing to help you outside of class.   He's rather new to teaching Data Structures so he's still working out the kinks in his lecture style. He wants to see his students suceed.

He is a great lecturer and I have learned a lot from him, but his tests are very hard. Multiple times, I walk out of the testing room confident and end up getting a grade significantly lower than I thought. Even with this being the case, if you want to learn, he is a great choice. He is also a very nice man.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Nicest man ever but his tests are really hard. If you study ridiculously hard and have previous knowledge, you can pull off an A. Otherwise get ready for a B or C and maybe even a D.

He's a lecture prof, so take LOTS of notes and read the assignments, and you'll make at least a B. He's pretty generous with extra credit (for a school as tough as Baylor). Take this guy if you're more interested in learning the history of the Bible than in passing the class as a blow-off.
Not gonna lie... He's pretty cool but the reading will kick your butt! Tonight's homework: read Matthew! You really have to do the reading because you have pop quizzes all the time!
No Comments
is an ok prof. grades hard. didnt like him. didnt give me a chance. but still passed with a C.
No Comments
He's extremely fair and gives you a lot of nice grades; just study for the tests

Amazing teacher.... so helpful, wants to help you learn, and will adjust her schedule to meet with you, and work through your problems.   I met with her probably twice a week, and sometimes even more.
She is possibly the nicest woman ever, but also the worst teacher ever. I didn't learn one thing in this class.
very easy class.  She's a cool teacher too.  exams are a bit difficult if you dont study but she goes over everything in class before the exam. VERY helpful too
she is really nice. She really likes teaching and it is funny how she finds simple things so neat. her class is easy and she really works with you when you need help.

Very interested in subject, Tries to make the best out of a boring subject, Very easy class, Gives everything to study for exams, Reviews whole class the day before an exam, Assignments are easy if you listen in class
She is a very nice lady, gives a bit of hw but shows you how to do all of it---she tells you everything you need to know before the test. I'd recommend her.

Easy class. Alot of day assignments, but she does them all in class and if you have a laptop you can finish all your assynments in class. Also, if you have a laptop, when she is reviewing you can play gaames on your computer.
Extremely nice, boring class, but she tries to make it interesting...I would definitely take her class...tests are easy

Odegaard is both the reason that I changed my major to Economics and the person that first sparked an interest in Economics. He is amazing and so passionate. Take him. You will be challenged; however, you will learn a ton and you will enjoy it!!!

Truly passionate about teaching, best Economics course I've taken. The highlight of the course was when he burst out singing Simon & Garfunkel's 59th St. Bridge Song to slow himself down -- hilarious.
Great guy, neurotic and hilarious, helpful, and truly loves economics and teaching.  Tests are difficult, but he's always more than willing to help a student out.
Oderguard is an awesome teacher; he is patient and intelligent.  I could not have asked for a better Social World teacher.

His class was extremely difficult but he curves to where an 85 and above is an A. You don't have to pay any attention in class except when he talks about formula's because I never paid attention and just read the book and got an A

Odegaard is a great professor and a great man.  One of the few professors that actually cares and that is so passionately involved in teaching economics.  Hard class, but he is ALWAYS willng to help.  Truly memorable.
The best class I have ever taken at Baylor.  Probably the best professor as well.  Truly courteous and a marvelous lecturer.  Would marry the man if I got the chance. (and if I were 35 years older)

Dr. Odegaard is an amazing gentleman and professor.  Inter Micro is probably one of the hardest courses in the ECO department, and while the tests are difficult, Dr. O is VERY helpful and accomodating both inside and outside of class.  Highly recommended!
He had passion in his subject but the lectures were all over the place and it was difficult to really know what he wanted.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's a really nice guy, and he clearly cares a lot about the class and the subject matter. His lectures are often very hard to follow, but it definitely helps to do the reading beforehand. It's a little hard to figure out his grading style at first, but once you do it's not too difficult a class. All in all, not a bad choice.
A man that has accepted falsified and fabricated version of history to appease his benefactors

Loved Gawrych, if you even skim through the readings, you'll be a 100% more interested in the lecture (otherwise you might just space out during class). I definitely recommend reading from the text books and i'm sure you'll do way better than i did :p

Dr. G is amazing. His lectures are dry, but he tries to slip jokes in here and there. What makes him amazing is his compassion. He really likes his job and his students. The workload is moderate, but doable.

His class now consists of 2 test and 3 book essays. He is very passionate about history but couldn't keep the class's attention. He also assigns readings in the book but never asks you about them. Compared to other history department teachers, he isn't bad but not the best.
Hilarious. Excellent instructor, mixes unconventional material with the stuff everyone needs to know.

He's very passionate about history and that makes him a good teacher.  He keeps your attention during class and makes you want to listen.  No busy type homework required.  2 exams, 3 book quizzes, 1 paper.  Exams and quizzes are in essay format, but they aren't hard.  He tells you what is going to be asked. Just study lecture notes.
If you ask him questions he doesn't do a very good job explaining.

Dr. Robinson is the worst professor I had in college.  I went to his office for help numerous times and he was just as arrogant and uninterested as he was in class.  He truly does not care about his students or their grade.  His lectures are incomprehensible and he does minimal to no examples in class.  Horrible!
No Comments

He is the worst teacher. I made an A barely and I had no problem in financial accounting. He is condescending towards you and tells the class that they shoudln't make below a 90 on the tests. But he goes over problems on his overhead with no problems for the students to do themselves.
bark is worse than his bite. Go to his office for help....likes to intimidate in front of class. He will work with you though.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Bufton is a very knowledgeable teacher who really does want you to learn and pass! She is very helpful, and tells you whats on the test. I would most definitely take her again!
She is not good, she is perfect. Very helpful, very knowledgeable. Seems tough but has a very soft heart. She loves her job and make a good Nurse out of you.
She is tough, but fair. Beware the wrath of Bufton. She will chew you out in a heartbeat, but is still a sweet and very knowledgable women. We will all be better nurses because of her.
WONDERFUL!!! Can't say enough good things about her

Mrs. Bufton is a sweetheart! She is very helpful and encouraging. Her tests are not based on her lectures or powerpoints. Be sure to read the Book!!!!! She is fabulous and I loved having her as my professor.
she might seem mean at first but shes pretty cool
She's alot of fun! and very knowledgable.  I definately respected her!
No Comments
Don't take it late in the afternoon you will fall asleep, but you can tell he is really passionate about what he is teaching.
Reading intensive class.  Gives you a studyguide.  Pretty good teacher.
He is easy, he gives you a study guide before the exam, and the questions are similar; also, no essays!

His class was alright. Sometimes it was boring, I would avoid taking it late in the afternoon like I did. The class is pretty straightforward, if you study, you'll get a good grade. You can tell he really cares about the material and he'll help students if they ask for it.

Boring class, but he loves the material.  Some things aren't very clear, and he can be very boring at times, but his tests are straightforward...DO the study guide and pay attention to the class before the tests and you'll do fine!

I actually really like this professor--he has an awesome sense of humor and he's very straightforward. Unapproachable, though. I'm making an A pretty easily, but a lot of people complain about this class, so maybe it's just me

You will fall asleep in class!!! He is very boring.  There are weekly online timed quizzes over the reading assignments from the textbook.  Exams are difficult: they are all multiple choice however many of the questions will have more than one answer and he does not tell you which questions those are, so the exams become a lot more difficult
No Comments
He is like my INDIANA JONES!!!!!
He's a good guy, but he loves to talk, and he loves to impress you with all the obscure stuff he knows. You'll spend more time on tangents and gossip about the authors than the actual readings.
One of the best at Baylor. A kind-hearted shark.
Excellent prof . . . . the tangents help you stay focused (for those of us who are ADD). I actually learned from his class. He's also very hot ;-)
i agree ...likes the sound of his voice

knows his field more than any prof ive had. funny and enthusiastic. readings can be dull. keeps your attention in class, but hard to take structured notes. has a tendency to go off on random tangents. good prof overall.
likes the sound of his own voice
Pssionate but hard to take sequential notes in class

I am in graduate school now. I took this class last year. This class prepared me more for grad school than other classes I took. She makes you think, not just regurgitate facts back. Her final was the most difficult I had because it was all essay, but now I feel prepared for my exams in my classes. This class educated me in a fuller way.

If your a athelte lookin for a easy class this aint it!!! She does not take late work at all!! and takes attendence everyday and was obsessive about not letting you use your phone in class. i barely past.

Prof Tuel is one of those rare teachers who truly makes a positive difference in a college experience. She clearly loves to teach and she has that genuine interest in each one of her students that I have not seen in other professors. I wish she taught more classes. I would take them all.
Good class. would recommend to any major. Prof made material very relevant and interesting.

I enjoyed most of the assignments and they were helpful. It was not difficult if you came to class and paid attention. The homework was not hard, but you had to do it and turn it in. It was a life application class, not just filling your head with knowledge.

My view of things shifted by taking this class. Even tho it was about Dying, I now focus more on living quality each day. The class made me face some tough topics, but I know I will need this for graduate school, and I am glad I learned about these issues.

This class was not about memorizing facts, but about taking what we learned and challenging us to use it in life. We played some fun games to clarify what we learned. Had some good guest speakers. Teacher motivated us to want to learn the stuff.

Our teacher inspired me to think outside the box. I learned a lot from her as a person and as a teacher. The subject matter was depressing at times, but I understand now why I need to know more about this topic.

if you are taking gen chem, TAKE MCGRATH. He offers ALOT of resources for material such as practice questions, practice exams, review notes, and extra credit that will help you when preparing for tests. He makes the topics really understandable and his lectures are easy to follow. He is such a nice guy and actually made me really like chemistry.

Dr. McGrath is the best gen chem professor at Baylor. His lectures/slides are easy to understand, and he makes sure the class understands it. He is hilarious, caring, and his Scottish accent is my favorite. His exams are challenging, but if you go to class, do your homework, attend SI, and study - you will do great! GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS!
He was great! He's super clear and helpful. His reviews and practice tests will save your life. Be prepared for literally any topic  on the final.
He is one of my favorite teachers, made me actually enjoy chemistry! He always makes time for you if you need help.

Tests can be a little tricky on some problems, but it is mostly direct and fair. He gives you practice problems and exams. If you take the time to study well and work through practice problems, you should make an A in his class. Good teacher, likable accent, he's a little goofy sometimes.

Dr. McGrath is an amazing professor. His lectures can get kind of dull, but his slides are a great summary of the chapters. Also, the homework really helps to improve your grade, especially if you do the extrad credit problems. His tests are a decent measure of your knowledge, and he gives partial credit, so it helps boost your grade.

I loved Dr. McGrath! He's the best chemistry professor I've had. He has a great personality and likeable Scottish accent, and, most of all, he can teach. He gave us old tests to study by with a study guide. And I remember doing the online homework which helped. But the old tests were great. I can't say how much of a wonderful teacher he was.

I loved Dr. McGrath! He's the best chemistry professor I've had. He has a great personality and likeable Scottish accent, and, most of all, he can teach. He gave us old tests to study by with a study guide. And I remember doing the online homework which helped. But the old tests were great. I can't say how much of a wonderful teacher he was.

She's friendly in class but once you try to email her she would tell you to go read the directions instead of explaining. She's a very tough grader; she will literary take 5 points off if you use too much space.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Bad socializing skills and tough grader. Looks down on students and is extremely slow at grading and giving feedback on papers. Blames students for something that is the professor's fault. Should teach medieval literature instead of English.
Worst English professor I've witnessed.

Extremely tough grader & takes rough drafts for a grade and usually fails the student. Terrible teacher; she uses 1st grade level sentences despite this being a college course. Has no set curriculum & gives out useless activities in class. She does not believe in climate change & she once failed a student's paper because they argued for it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many

comment: She is very pleasant but grades rather hard. You can tell that she much prefers writing to teaching English. The worst thing about her was how unprepared she was, always running late. She can be a little rude sometimes, but overall she's a C-
She SEEMS nice, but she grades extremely hard and unfair, she picks favorites. She failed me because of one flaw in one paper. Boo you
No Comments
Laura is nice and fun. And she really knows alot about English. But don't write in the passive voice.

He gives out nicknames and they are not compliments. He doesn't call on you if he doesn't know how to pronounce your name (unless he's given you a nickname).  I learned the material and he made it hard not to.  But I was traumatized by his arrogant disrespect of fellow humans including me.

Truly a great lecturer and professor. He's not as harsh as everyone says. Do not miss class or come unprepared and you're good. He can be really intimidating because he yells but you will learn so much from his class. I haven't taken his final yet, but based on the Midterm question (non-graded) state the RULES.
Enter a boy, leave a man. Come prepared. Counseller is the gatekeeper of Baylor Law.

It's a crying shame that you can only select three of these pre-generated tags for a professor on this website. Jeremy Counseller told my Civil Procedure class in 2013 or 2014 that "5AM is the great undiscovered country." I am also privileged to know that his childhood dog was given an oreo as his last meal. Read Pennoyer v. Neff 5 times daily.

He is a wonderful professor. Very charismatic and funny. He will provide hypotheticals and work through your answers if you visit him during office hours. As with any law school class (but especially this one), do not be absent. He holds funerals for absent people.
Love him and his class

He is extremely charismatic, with very exciting lectures-especially for a subject such as Civil Procedure that is not innately exiting. Teaching skills like this are rare. Learning is fun in this class- but make sure you do your reading.

I retained a good amount of information after taking this class. He is very theatrical in his lectures and gives a review of the materials here and there. He is an effective instructor. He could be more accessible though and extend his office hours.

HE IS AMAZING. By far my favorite professor here. You will find yourself laughins so hard and actually retaining info by the way he lectures. An amazing guy. He is pretty much a really easy grader, except the midterm was harder to do well on. I am going to take another class of his. Offered extra credit during class to up the attendance. TAKE HIM

This was an easy class, and Mark trys to make class as enjoyable as possible. There are between 8 and 10 reaction papers that arent hard- you just have to share your thoughts with him. There is one group presentation, one indivial project, reaction papers, a midterm, and a final. He is very funny and makes lectures as relatable as possible.

I took Mark for Interpersonal Comm. & absolutely loved the class. He lectures everyday but relies on class discussion (it is a comm. course), but if you don't speak he never calls on anyone. Take good notes because they are extremely helpful on the midterm and final exams. The rest of your grades come from three other projects! Overall fairly easy!

I did not like him at all.  He wasn't a good professor at all.  He enjoyed hearing himself talk more than the actual subject material.  He can be funny, but you have to be in the right mood to listen to him.
HILARIOUS!!! and a very good teacher...he loves to talk...and is very understanding
Awesome teacher!

Not a super easy class.  It was a lot of work, but it was well worth it.  I loved Mark, and the class, and actually learned things, and took stuff from it that I won't soon forget.  Take it if you can.
No Comments

I like Cordon as a person but I really struggle in his class, which is frustrating because it's only 2 credits. You spend SO MUCH TIME writing the memos that you will probably hate him too. He's not a bad teacher and truly understands the material he's teaching but I can't say I'm learning a lot FROM him. Powerpoints are boring and assignments hard
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Class is required. Prof. Cordon offers several times outside of class to review papers and gives great feedback. There are weekly assignments, but the overall grade is mainly based on your final memo. As long as your work is in on time, you pay attention in class and try, you will do fine.

No clear grading criteria, or any at all for that matter. Students are left guessing on assignments. I received no meaningful feedback from Cordon on my drafts before the final memo was due. Students learn to write like Cordon (to adopt his idiosyncratic, sloppy writing style), and not like legal professionals.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I had him for LARC1. His class is dry. I recommend making use of him while writing memos. He may not be explicit but he will try to guide you down the correct path. He cannot give you the answer, though, because that would serve no educational purpose. (If you are told what to write, then how can he grade your analysis and tell you how to improve?)

He is very unclear about substance of his assignments and harps on the grammatical style and proper citations, but counts off on substance. When you ask for help , he's confusing and answers questions with questions. He doesn't provide examples of memos so you're shooting in the dark. His teaching style is boring and highly ineffective.

Cordon has the pleasure of teaching one of the hardest classes at Baylor. Many people despise this subject at first-but then you find out in the real world how vital his teaching is. Pay close attention. It is a dry subject, but he is always there to answer questions. People choose Baylor to improve their writing;  He is the reason for this.

Cordon is condescending and unhelpful; consider not attending Baylor Law simply because he is a required professor. His Legal Research class is a class on the idiosyncrasies of his style. He circled a word on a brief of mine claiming I misused it but a dictionary shows he's ignorant. Cordon attended Texas Wesleyan Law. It really shows.

He takes a very dull and often difficult subject (legal research) and makes it very bearable.  His advanced class is the primary reason why I did so well when I clerked last summer.  I appreciate his class more now than I did when I took it.
She just retired. rejoice. seriously.
Dr. Lusk was a very good professor who explained the subject matter well and was often helpful.

If you're not one of her little favorites, you will have a very hard time passing her classes.  I was not and she consistantly "lost my work"  and gave me failing grades for work I had turned in and work that was correct.  To put it plainly, she is a cold, snotty, ****!
I really liked her...She does pick favorite students but I think she really cares about her students learning and having oppourtunities when they graduate... Definately go to Europe!!

To pass these classes...well No. 1 have nothing else to do in your life. No.2 take down everything that comes out of her mouth, it will be on the test. (I mean EVERYTHING) and No. 3 as vauge and scary as she is, bed side manner is nowhere to be found in the fashion world so get use to rude people.  BTW go to New York and Europe if you have the chance, she really changes her attitude in other cities for some reason and actually becomes a bit fun. No lie. Good luck!

i had her for textiles 1 and 2, mass market, and fashion forcast and i bearly had a life. she tries to be all hard headed and snotty but walk in there like you own the place and you will be ok. also for the work dont do 100% do like 500% thats the only way
No Comments
If she likes you then you will do well in the class. she is so unclear and expects you to be able to read her mind.
Very nice, and helpful. He makes jokes and gets the class interested. Involves everone. his tests are hard, but as long as you come to class and study, you are fun. Overall a good teacher.
Nice man who is very helpful. His tests are difficult but if you pay attention and study you can do fine.
Pretty good professor, not always patient. Be prepared to speak as with any spanish class.
No Comments
Great professor! Very fair with grades.
helped me decide what career path to take.  Very nice looking also
very cool
OKAY
He made his class very engaging and worthwhile. his class periods were never boring or went on too long!

Class was fun.  No textbooks but does have two books (really cheap too) he uses in class.  Lots of quizes from the books but are really easy if you keep up with the readings.  He does tend to play favorites and doesn't allow students who want to leave their groups to leave simply based on what he believes.  Overall, its a fun class.

This guy is one of the most helpful teachers you will ever see.  I even had personal problems that he gave great advice on  during the term i took his class.  He is always upbeat, i have never seen him depressed or sad, maybe sometimes tired from going to football games or basketball games, but still.

Wonderful Professor!! You are crazy if you do not register for his classes! He is the most personal professor you will ever have. Loves teaching and Loves helping his students out. His class is fun and his test arent too bad if you just pay attention in class and read. Seriously! Take Him!!
Freaking tight guy.  Loved the class, get to know him.
