coolest teacher ever. plus he is a bronco fan. best teacher i have ever had at baylor!!
great guy! Really fun!
No Comments

Dr. Dell is a professor you need to take. She is such an intelligent women, and is passionate about what she teaches! If you dont like reading, this class isnt for you. You have a reading for every class, and must annotate all readings. It is highly possible to make an A in this class if you do good on her pop quizzes and tests. Get to know her!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dell is a pathetic excuse for a professor.
She makes the class easy with a copious amount of info, an excitement for her job and the subject, and sympathy for students.

This class really requires alot, so if you're expecitng to make an easy A... it's not happening! But, Dr. Dell is a really nice lady who likes to crack a few jokes every now and then. She's very very helpful as well!
tough tough tough tough grader, very difficult to pull an A on any essay or paper
tough tough tough tough grader, very difficult to pull an A on any essay or paper
She expects a lot out of the students, but you learn how to write well.
good teacher

Lectures are off topic and she is incredibly slow to respond to emails, generally taking around a day, which is a big deal when she often forgets to upload assignments. Class is easy so at least you have that.
class was boring.  Lectures were not on subject.

One of the best profs @ Baylor. She explains everything that you're required to do. She doesn't over-complicate classroom tasks & she is always willing to help you understand things better. The class is pretty easy-going & routine. You are required to do an evaulation test, 4 exams, a final project, chapter outlines, & a presentation.. Fun class!
Very helpful. Cares a lot. Well prepared.
She plays favorites.
Good teacher.  Cares a lot about her students and is very helpful.
Her Rhetoric class is fun and easy--she grades easy if your class does the work.  I highly recommend her class!
I am sorry but this teacher needs to quit teaching at baylor university... She is rude and unhelpful.

She is very strict about grades and will not work with you to raise them. However, throughout the semester she will contact you if she is concerned about your performance. Very fair about test grading. You must really know the material going into her tests or else you will fail.
She is a great teacher, no complaints.
GREAT TEACHER!  very fair test----if you study, you'll do well, if not, you won't.  essay exams.  makes boring classes fun!
Really bad about picking favorite students and ignoring the rest of us.
No Comments

Great lady who makes an otherwise boring class fun. You are expected to keep up with reading, but none of it is long. Tests are very fair and you should have no problem if you study. Totie-B is awesome and has a way of making you want to learn the material.
quite possibly the coolest woman to ever grace baylor with her presence-she makes a tough (and sometimes a little boring) class fun
Great teacher!  Class is so much fun.  Lots of work, but it's so worth it.  Awesome awesome!
Amazing class.  Amazing prof. Engaging, funny, and down to earth.

Divita is FANNNTASTIC. You cannot expect to not study or cram and get by. You have to do your homework and learn your designers. If you don't understand she is more than willing to explain something to you. She is extremely passionate about what she does.   She can seem hard if you don't take time to do each assignment. She just wants your best!
No Comments

Divita really wants you to know your stuff. At least when I was there, she would do anyting for a student. Dont get me wrong, she at times can also be very hard to understand and you might hav to ask her twice about what she wants, she will explain. --But I think the woman drinks six cups from common grounds before class, beware of the high energy level. She will def. wake you up in an 8am. class.
Horrible teacher, blame students for not understaing materials.
if you have an opportunity, take her over lusk... Divita actually helps you, and doesn't stare you down depending on what you're wearing.  she's very accepting, but challenges too.
No Comments
No Comments
She's nice. Accounting really was not for me.
Abbe was very clear in her instructions and teaching.
Had her 5 years ago and loved her as a prof....Very good and engaging
No Comments
No Comments
She was GREAT.  Said THIS WILL BE ON THE TEST, and it always was.  Made you pay attention in class, and all the homework was an effort grade.
Very concerned about the course material, but sometimes gets rather militant with the class participation
She's tough but wants you to learn the material.  Go to her office to ask questions.  She's a very nice lady!

easily my favorite professor!! I was never into science and only took this course to fulfill a lab science requirement, but this class became my favorite just a few weeks into the semester. He does a great job at explaining the material, he lets us take tests outside of class, and gives extra credit opportunities.
Only four test and 3-4 quizzes. YOU CAN USE NOTES ON ALL TESTS/QUIZZES. So, take good notes and your good.

Not impressed.  This site prevents honest discussion by mandating that "derogatory terms" or claims of "bias or favoritism" not be used.  So all that can be said is that a person like Steve Dworkin should not at all be teaching our youth.

One of my favorite teachers at Baylor, hes not only interested in what hes teaching but also wants to see you succeed in  your long term carrer. If you're an up and coming geologist hes a great resource to help you get started. Learned a lot in his class, but had to work hard for my grade bc lots of material. Also has fun shirts from the 70's

Dr. Dworkin is so passionate about what he teaches. It's so fun to see him get so excited about Geology! E&ND is a very easy class. If you're not an earth science lover, it can get boring at times. It's not all crash-boom-earthquake. There's tectonics and rocks and dust to learn about. Still, just read his Powerpoint notes and you should be fine.
Seriously the greatest professor I have ever had! So helpful and he really knows his stuff and makes lecture fun.

dworkin is an awesome professor and has a lot of charisma.  his tests come straight from the power points but you have to go to class to copy down the ppts becuase he doesn't use blackboard (irritating) and he takes random attendance but giving pop quizzes that are not able to be made up if you missed.  the tests are hard.
Had him for geochem. and field camp.  very cool, very helpful, very excited about what he is teaching.

Dr. Maddox is really fun during lectures but can come off as kind of cold or rude when you talk to her one on one, so just be aware of that. She says she "only grades when she's in a good mood" and the grades reflect that. She's a good professor!

She is absolutely amazing. So caring and wants you to succeed even though the material can be difficult! She extended a few deadlines. Gave really great reviews and always available and helpful during office hours. 11/10

Very welcoming and engaging professor, however it is a very fast paced class and workload. Textbook is required and is written by her, and attendance is mandatory to succeed. 
Would recommend taking stats over the summer instead, however if required it is still possible to succeed with Maddox.

Dr. Maddox is amazing, she also gives extra credit on her exams. Be prepared for homework quizzes every week. Only 3 tests in the whole semester, including 2 tests and 1 final exam. If you pay attention to the lectures and study for the class, an A+ is not hard to obtain. Good luck!
very smart but lacks qualities of a good teacher.

She is very smart and teaches based on her own textbook that she wrote. I love that she makes her online course engaging and is very clear about how to succeed in her class. It wasn't hard to do well by following her plan of study and doing the work! Open book exams were also very much appreciated.
Horrible professor. She's very smart but does not know how to explain very well. Her examples dont help for exams. Quizzes and homework every week.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Maddox is a great professor, this is just a hard class. She is very helpful during her lectures, and wants to see you be successful in her class. Make sure you get the textbook, it is required! If you do not participate in class you will not pass. She assigns a lot of homework but its pretty easy. Her tests arent bad if you prepare for them!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: This class was extremely hard for me because the class size was so large and her lectures were so long. Maddox definitely is smart and she knows what she is doing, but she does not know how to relay the information very well. Weekly online homework quizzes, but you will never know what you missed on these quizzes as she doesn't give out answers.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Sally is very respected in her field. If you are willing to listen than you will learn! Although, she is disorganized and a tad flaky...

Sally is super nice and helpful and will adapt the class to what each student needs, however it is very easy for her to get off subject and talk about other things. She is a very experienced person and loves to share her stories.
Class is so easy, just do your work.  Sally is not a good teacher, but find a peer who knows how to sew and you'll get by just fine.
I appreciate her willingness to work with  and for the students
Although she is nice, this class was a joke.  She should not be teaching.

I LOVE THIS LADY!!  She is one of the most talented people I have ever met.  She is very concerned that her students learn the material and will alter her curriculum to meet the needs of her students.  If you want to learn to design costumes and design them well, then there is no one better to study under.
I wish this had been  better class.

NOT a strong teacher. NOT very organized in class. But a nice person. Kind to students and tells them they are good designers even if they are not. Not recommended to any student serious about theatre design. Go somewhere else if you want to study design.

He's a kind and good-natured man who enjoys what he teaches. Prefers to let students lead the discussion while he points out key passages and ideas from the reading. Participation is part of the grade, so speaking up is necessary to get the most out of his class. Gives very helpful feedback on writing assignments. Definitely recommended.
Good professor. Is really into what he teaches but grades pretty hard though. Be prepared to talk in class and write many papers.
Excellent
No Comments

One of the last classes before I graduated. Learned much about a time period I thought I hated. He changed my mind single-handedly. Take it. Open your mind, explore your thoughts. Oh, and talk in class or fail.
Dr. Losey has a great intellect and pushes students to ask tough questions about their philosophical and literary positions.  His classes provide great opportunities for discussion.
Talk in class.
No Comments

Arguably the best professor I've ever had. He always keeps class lighthearted and fun and really cares to get to know his students. ALSO he taught a class on Harry Potter. I would have made that class my major if there was a way

This guy is awesome and very interesting. Quite possibly one of my favorite profs at Baylor. I truely enjoyed his class. The reading is painful but i didn't read hardly anything, just pay attention in class. Don;t let stuff pile up or it will be the bane of your existence.

Typical of most creative writing teachers - spends more time on feelings and emotions than on grammar and style.  He is agreeable and supportive - just don't expect your writing to improve under his direction.  Holds sparse, spare, Hemingwayesque style as the standard of good writing.
Passionate, supportive, and gifted professor.  And kinda sexy too, in an English prof sort of way!  :-)
he cracks me up.  he is so authentic and real about himself and with us.  he cares about you as a person.  he realizes that not everyone is into this but he comes to our level to get us thru it.
No Comments
Fun,passionate professor... doesn't mind tardies but class is too cool to miss anyway
Greg Garrett is very encouraging & humble about his publication success...
Hes good

Absolutely amazing!!! Claybrook is the best teacher you could ask for. The material is hard, but he explains it so well that it becomes easy. Plus you get to correct all homework assignments and turn them in for a second time to improve your original grade.
Claybrook is one of finest humans I have ever known.  His classes are great and his demeanor and caring are not to be believed.  Just awesome!

Dr. Claybrook is wonderful!  His classes are only easy because he explains everything so well.  It's like he tricks you into understanding and being interested.  :)  He is a great teacher and a great person.
GREAT teacher! He is amazing, and you will benefit majorly.
Amazing teacher. He LOVES to help students and is very concerned that people learn the material. Dont be afraid to go by his office. Makes theory a blast!
An amazing teacher that loves to interact with students! He is very helpful, but get ready for LOTS of hw!....Goodluck!
No Comments

Dr. Grigsby is a fantastic professor! I took him over the summer for pre-calculus and he made online learning a great experience. His lecture videos are engaging and he's very good with emails. His feedback is really helpful and his course is planned out well. Take him if you have the chance!
Dr. Grigsby is so far the best professor I have taken at Baylor. He's really sweet and helpful. 100% recommended taking!

Professor Grigsby is a wonderful professor. Attendance is not mandatory but highly recommended for you to pass the class. He is very helpful when you ask questions and gives feedback on homework and tests. This is a review for MTH1315 but it was not an option to click.

Professor Grigsby is an amazing professor. If you are having trouble he has his office hours and is very helpful. His feedback is amazing. He makes things easy to follow. As long as you pay attention, you will definitely pass.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Grigsby was great!

TAKE HIM. best math prof ever. study guides for exams are just like the test. 2 homework assignments are assigned at a time on math lab. Truly caring of his students and is always open to meeting for extra help.

Mr Grigsby was one of my favorite professors ever! He made me really enjoy math class, I took math 1320 and 1321 with him and always felt good about the class. He does great test reviews and likes to help out as much as possible. Don't be afraid to ask questions, he is great at explaining things. Would recommend him for any future math classes!!

Professor really cares about his students and does everything possible to help you pass, which includes ways to memorize equations and lets you know what criteria you will truly need for tests. Would use him for all my future math classes if possible.

Dr. P was really great. His lectures were very engaging and there were lots of class discussions. His quizzes are easy if you read the material and attend class. He gives lots of extra credit. Dr. P is very understanding and if you go to office hours he really values getting to know you. I 100% recommend Dr. P

Dr Pieper is the best professor at Baylor!! He cares about his students, is passionate about sociology, and inspires you to want to learn. Soc 1305 was a manageable workload, super interesting and literally made me want to change my major to Sociology. I wish all professors could be like Dr Pieper!! Take him for anything, you won't regret it!

Dr. Pieper is my favorite professor I've ever had. His lectures completely changed the way I view people and society for the better. Even if this isn't required for your major I still recommend taking this as an elective if you want a class thats going to change the way you think. Not to mention he's hilarious and he makes his class SO easy.
He is the best! Lots of extra credit opportunities. Lectures are very engaging and cares about your success in the class.
I still visit Dr. Piper and I'm not taking his class anymore! Use his office hours. Seriously just go talk to the guy. He's great
Best professor at Baylor.  He'll make you want to be a sociologist.  Very funny, articulate, go to class and you'll pass. Enjoyable class
Literally one the the best professors here at Baylor! He always keeps the class entertained with his humor and really knows what he's talking about. Would highly recommend him!
Love this Class! Highly Recommend taking it!

One of the worst experiences in my entire academic career. Bryan Maine is unfit to be a teacher, and does not have the best interest of his students at heart. Bryan is completely unaware that students do not have 2 hours every night to read and provides little explanation for the readings. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS MAN.

Weekly assignments are extremely long and difficult for a 10 question quiz. Think you can bypass the reading? You cant. The quizzes have a 10 minute timer and once you answer the question you cant go back. I just had an email fight with him about how he didnt explain grading expectations until the day of the FINAL so now I cant go back fix anything
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Way too much reading. The amount of reading and amount of course work in this class is ridiculous. It is very hard to balance with my other tough science classes I am taking. The two major grades are essays which I am not in favor of given I am not the best writer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: He gives too much reading. Not only do you have to read many chapters from the bible, you also have to read a ton of pages from a textbook. There are 2 quizzes each week, and he grades the exams hard. He legit does not answer his emails and he also graded an exam that was due in OCTOBER damn near the same time our final was graded...........

He gives you a ton of reading per week. Grading is inconsistent for he looks for literally what he would say and there is rarely a clear idea to what that is since the Bible can be interpreted in many different ways. He shows about 3 sets of slides per class, yet only puts up one of them online for you to follow along. Do not recommend taking him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This guy gives way too much reading. I would recommend that you try to find another professor if possible. He gives quizzes every week with only 5 questions. The questions can consist of the most obscure details. I wouldn't take again.

The reading load is tough, I'm talking 45-80 chapters of the Bible a week tough. He is an awesome dude and is super willing to help you out if you ask, but there's just so much material. Also, I end up taking about 8 pages of notes per lecture, so if you're into a ton of material and a ton of reading, go for it. If you're not, pick another prof.
If you like reading 40-60 chapters of the Bible a week this class is for you! Young professor that likes to move really fast, so not much is actually being learned, just crammed.

I had her for Media Writing at Elon University. Professor Sturgill is one of the best professors I've had to date. Hands down. Her class is extremely tough at first but as you begin to dive into the material you get a better understanding of what she's looking for. I saw my writing improve as the semester went on. She's hilarious. TAKE HER.

The material was presented in an interesting way.  However she can be rude and short with students. She gets annoyed with questions. I noticed she played favorites with news quizzes giving some students multiple tries to get questions right and other students would get one guess.  But over all she is okay.
i went from an A to a C also b/c the final exam was unclear... overall, fun class though
great teacher. dry sense of humor. kept me entertained. final exam was a little unclear on the directions and i went from an A to a C. be careful!

She's hard to read, but seems nice. She has a dry sense of humor that makes the class interesting, and she's willing to work with individual students to make sure they get the most benefit out of the class. I was glad I took her for editing.
She's really unique, and her teaching style makes it very interesting to go to class and see what she has in store for us. It's been really neat to see what she'll do next.
She's a really good teacher who goes over all the material clearly so everyone understands what she's doing.  Gives all the homework assignments in advance so you can do them all at once to turn in.
One of the hardest and best profs I had while at Baylor.
Very understanding, resonable, and helpful.

If you don't catch on extremely fast to start off with and stay in step with this class then this class is extremely frustrating. Miss one thing and he moves on with or without you. Study ALOT outside of class if you care to get above decent grades.

The class is good for those wanting to learn another language other than Spanish. For those that know Spanish, this class will be somewhat easy.  You just have to stick with it and show up to class. He's very fair and has a good sense of humor.

This class is the smart way to go if you need language credit.  It does seem hard at first, but just stick through it and you'll be glad you did. Stay up on current events happening in the BBC news, not CNN. Then talk about what you saw in the news in class. Trust me its the way to go.
coolest guy ever! knows what is going on in this world. able to step outside the box!
This class may seem hard at first, but after finishing the first two semesters youll be glad you stayed in it. Dr. T is a fare, jolly man.

I had him for two classes and he was great in both. He was very careful and concise with the language he used to explain thing and he answered any questions I had with great detail and care. He also was very helpful when I visited him during office hours. I thought he was one of the best professors I had throughout my college years.
Will count off if you don't follow the exact way of doing things taught in class, which he usually does a bad job explaining. Don't take unless you want a bad grade for more work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He was not the best the professor I ever had. In fact, he was one of the worst. He is not helpful rather my tutors were more helpful than he was. He doesn't explain the material well.

He was not clear on explaining the material. In fact, my math tutors were more helpful. He was constantly late by 5 to 10 minutes to class. I felt he was disrespecting me. I wouldn't take him unless he's your option on any math class! He took too long to grade exams which didn't help me at all because i want to know my exam grade right next class.

I am used to get A's and B's in classes but this is hard. My math tutors were more helpful than him. He is constantly late every class period. He takes forever to grade an exam like 2 weeks. I felt he was disrespecting me. He's the worst math professor I ever had. Don't take him unless there's no other option!

Good teacher, difficult class. Dr. Ryden was very quirky but definitely knows his stuff. Don't take if you want an easy A, but you will know your stuff by the end of the class. Fairly easy tests, multiple homework quizzes. Very nice guy, helpful if you ask for it. I would recommend him for calculus 1.

Had him for the Calculus series.  Hands down the best Math prof I've had.  He's very organized, gives lots of examples in class, and makes it a point to be available for questions.  He's not easy - but you'll know the stuff when you're done - which is good if you're in physics or engineering or statistics.
I dropped his class because he was super unavailable and we couldn't see our test results.

Hes insanely smart but if youre not a master in micro biology like he is... youll be left way in the dust with this entry level course. Also he is extremely hard to understand, no one in our class ever knew what he was saying through his thick accent and confusing grammar. The textbook is the only way I learned and I attended every lecture.

Dr. Lee is very sweet but his teaching just wasn't helpful at all. He is a bit hard to understand and only reads off the lectures. It's better to just study the lecture slides on your own than to show up to class.

Dr. Lee is a nice guy, but his lectures are very hard to understand, because his English is very rough. His tests are straight forward but his lectures don't help at all. The SI sessions help more than he does. I would recommend taking someone else if you could.

Dr. Lee seemed to be okay in the beginning but is very difficult to understand. He reads straight from the powerpoint and skips around a lot. In my opinion you either need to know biology already or have no other activities going on to do well in his class.
Dr. Lee is dank af. Get ready for a wild and entertaining ride into the world of biology.

Professor's accent is confusing. Skips around in the lectures e.g. doesn't finish ideas, poor clarity. Tests aren't too terrible but usually not enough time because you're trying to remember what he was trying to say in the lecture.
As long as you show up tp class and do all speeches this is an easy A class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: 100% recommended for your required speech credit. Friday lectures were cancelled to substitute for your smaller speech groups which you are only required to meet the week of your speech presentation. Very easy class with only 4 public speeches in smaller groups (12 or less people), and a few module quizzes that come from the book.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Very easy class. Can miss up to 10 classes. Not many assignments and speech groups are not too bad.
Dr. Edwards is amazing! Easy and clear grading criteria. The class is easy itself so an A+ is attainable. Should take him for your public communication classes.
Easy A. I exerted the bare minimum effort in this class and got a 99. All tests are open book, there's only 5 short speeches, and there's a lot of extra credit!
this was an overall great class, not too difficult at all. his syllabus is amazing and he constantly gives reminders over quizzes and opportunities for extra credit and make-up.
Dr. Edwards is very sweet and is a great teacher. There is not too much work and the speeches are pretty easy. Especially during COVID, he was very understanding.
Edwards is pretty sweet and chill about grading. He has a good sense of humor and will help you if you ask
Calc one. Great prof. You will learn calculus and he explains things well and will answer any questions and is super helpful
very helpful, really wants to see the students succeed.

GREAT GUY! get to know him if you have him becuz he ends up being your friend. I love talking to him outside of class becuz the guy just cares, yes his class is tough and tests are very well put together, but if you to him for help, he will help u out, great teacher and friend!
No Comments
Great teacher.  HE's good @ what he does.Make sure you study the material & do HMWK.  THe test problems are similar 2 HMWK problems.  HE cares that his students understand and succeed.
This guy is the sweetest old man, yea class may get a little boring from time to time but he cares about his students ! I loved him I want him to be a part of my family !
One of the worst teachers I have ever had at baylor. so unclear and babbles constintly. Test are hard and he tries to make them hard. Not good.

Dr. Befus definitely knows his stuff! He's extremely passionate about gems and he yearns to share that with his students. Get ready for professional guests, hands-on faceting, and the marriage of geoscience and art. That being said, the course dives into slightly more geology than you might like, but why go to college if you don't learn?

Dr. Befus provides very engaging and comedic lectures. Participation is essential, which should be expected anyways. TAs and faceting lab saved the rating.

However, steer clear. Lots of information on exams was only given vocally-- if you miss it, you won't know. This was an attention span and listening comprehension class, not a Gemology class.

What should've been a fun, interesting elective turned into pain and suffering. This guy makes this class much harder than it should, not uploading slides, not recording lectures, and a general apathy towards making students' lives easier. This is further reflected on exams where he goes into way too much detail for an introductory course. Avoid.

The best course I have taken during my collegiate career from the best professor. Reading selections during the semester are tailored to the interests of class members. Expectations are high, but fair.

Dr. Befus is an excellent professor and researcher. His classes are well planned and line of questioning encourages effective discussion. His research is thorough and well organized. He is a great motivator and values hard work. I have learned much from Dr. Befus and I encourage anyone to seek him out as a potential advisor or collaborator.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Be prepared to work hard for your grade. He has high expectations for his students, but they are not unrealistic and he is more than willing to provide guidance when asked. One of the best professors in the department. Places a high value on personal responsibility. Lectures are information heavy, but well communicated.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests are tough--Would take again

comment: He is very intense about everything he does. Class should be fun but he takes things way to seriously and has a hard time relating to students. He runs all of his classes like they are a grad class and is often unclear with his instruction in lecture. Labs rarely have clear instructions, let alone instructions beyond "calculate BLANK".
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Reid cares, do the work and come to class! The lectures are amazing. Ive taken him for Brit Lit and English Comp II. Nonetheless, the lectures for Brit Lit are of course more interesting especially if you enjoy history. This professor is one of a kind, he cares but definitely not a pushover.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Took his Comp I course at MCC, fantastic instructor who is very relatable and down to earth. His course makes you confident in your writing abilities and understanding of the essay-writing process. He's very respectful to his students and helpful in his feedback. He encouraged peer review and gives you more than enough time to prepare for the paper
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: British Lit. can be a horrendously boring class. Dr. Makowski's British Lit class is anything but boring. The class discussions over the works covered were great and the amount of information Dr. Makowski has about the works and the insight to relate it to the students is amazing. Went into the class dreading it. Came out with a love of Brit lit.

Dude, this teacher is so good. He is really laid-back, great at explaining the literature. I never wanted to miss a class. Definitely take him for Brit Lit. His class is one of the best that I've taken in two years.
Horrible, horrible professor. Absolutely useless at explaining things.  Avoid this guy at all costs.

he makes writing fun, pretty easy grading scale. as long as he can tell that you tried, you will do well. Uses the books, as well as the guidelines in them a lot. willing to help when needed by students.

He is a really good teacher. Don't be surprised by how young he looks. He is very wise and highly intelligent. He knows what he's talking about and he makes class a lot of fun. It is an extremely interesting class and I'm glad I took it with him.

I took the online course, which he revamped himself. He is very inconsistent and posts assignments sometimes less than 24hr before due date. Do not take this online course. A lot of reading and writing assignments due at noon. His clarifications often leave you more confused than before.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Morera makes success easy, and is ALWAYS willing to look over work before it's due. He makes his expectations very clear from the first day of class, and if you do what he expects of you, you will be very successful. There is a lot of reading, but he gives you outlines of the IDs and essays that will appear on tests, so it's easy to prepare.

Dr. Morera is hilarious and such a nerd which makes him absolutely adorable! His class really isn't that hard but you definitely do have to read. His lectures aren't boring at all he really clarifies things and he is passionate about his job. He loves to tell stories and i would personally take his class all over again. Excellent professor!

Morera's classes are classes you have to actively participate in. If you are looking for an easy A with little effort , avoid this class. However, if you are actually interested in the subject then I can not recommend his courses enough. Prepare to work, but its likely you'll learn more than in any other class as well as develop critical thinking.

Dr. Morera is amazing. Yes, this class is difficult if you aren't good at history and there's a lot of reading. But he gives you a study guide before the exams with the exact terms you'll have on the test, so he gives you plenty of time to prepare. He is always willing to help and truly wants to see you succeed.

There are map quizzes every single week. Each quiz has many many elements to memorize. Definitely one of the hardest history classes I have ever taken. If maps aren't your thing, avoid at all costs. I am a pretty good writer and I failed the first paper. He is quirky and entertaining but the class is very very difficult.

Dr. Morera is keen on ensuring that you learn history through the lens you find most interesting. At the beginning of class (HIS 1305 and 1307), he asks each student as part of the 'introductions' what he/she is passionate about and how that passion could be applied to the learning of history. His class is not a cake walk, but it's well worth it.

If you're in the ABSN program and this is your only choice for a professor, good luck. She is a genuinely nice individual but that doesn't make you a great professor. I highly recommend knowing every single little thing from first semester along with the current material. Prepare to not have a life.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Read the book. PPTs are useless, just uses the same formatting from previous years: screenshots book pages, reads them verbatim, and underlines. Illegible handwriting.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Read the book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prepare to self teach for this professor, and beware any exam review. It will not be the same material that is on the test.

She is a little awkward but really fun and sweet. She doesn't have a lot of time to meet outside of class. I studied entirely from powerpoints, her lectures are really good but there is just a lot of material to cover
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Mrs. Tucker reminds me of Rebel Wilson.. She is so funny and smart! She tells you exactly what is on the test. My suggestion: Highlight whatever she says on power points, then only go over that! Also, her lilley sheets are very helpful.
shes alright. she doesnt explain stuff well and i felt underprepared.

Dr. Johns is so sweet! And 1301 is an easy class. I never payed attention in class; I just did the practice problems online through the E-book before the test and I did just fine. He had a huge class and I sat at the very back, and he still knew my name when I went to his office. He'll help you one on one if you need it. Overall, great prof.
He is so nice and goofy. Really does love to tell math jokes. One of the best math teachers I have ever had.
He goes really slow and explains everything. And his name is Baxter!! How cute is that!?!?!

Very very neat writing on the chalkboard. Is nice and will give help on request.  Takes up Homework every class. Tests are difficult, but not impossable. Tries to make the class laugh. Has some really lame jokes, but they are refreshing in a math class.
very clear and willing to help.  great guy.  listen to get his jokes-some are pretty funny.  he really seems to care that students learn the material, especially if you show an interest and try
No Comments
No Comments

If you already know calculus or are great at teaching yourself, then you'll probably do great! The only teaching that is done is by yourself from a textbook, then you attempt the homework and go to class the next day where the only thing that is done is you discuss homework answers, that's it, no teaching is done in class. exams are 55% of grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: He is horrible, I recommend that you drop him immediately. It only took one class to realize that this was not the professor for me. He doesn't really teach/explain math. He refers you to the textbook and the pre-recorded videos he has made that are NOT interactive and hard to follow along with the textbook. His lectures don't reflect on the tests.

Not a good explainer. If you dont remember anything from high school precalculus, you wont do well in this. He piggybacks a lot from the assumption you already know the content rather than actually teaching it. Overall a very likeable teacher, very funny and easygoing, just not a very skilled explainer.

His grading scale is completely messed up! I could make a mistake on one question and get a point off, same mistake on another and get 5 points off. I understood the material, but my grades don't reflect. He tries to be fun and talks to the students before class. Gives hw, but not all answers are in book. Uses hw questions on quizzes sometimes.

Do not take Mr. Bowen. His lectures do not match his tests. I understand the lectures and do the homework, but I have failed every exam. He jokes around more than he should, and he jokes a lot about mental health. I took college precalculus as a dual credit in high school with the same textbook, and I cannot pass Mr. Bowen's class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: He is rarely available for office hours and its only via zoom. He doesnt tend to answer many questions during them either. His tests dont match his teaching and many people struggle in his class. Not because they dont know the material, its because his exams are set up to be tricky. He also makes quite a bit of self deprecating dad jokes.

Mr Bown is an excellent teacher! I have never been much of a math person but he was great. He made math my favourite class. He makes short videos instead of long lectures and you watch them on your own. His explanations are very clear and if you watch the videos and practice, you'll do great! He has quizzes and discussions to help your grade.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Cunningham has such a pure heart. Seriously wish I had an in-person class with him. I've taken two online courses with him and they both have been a breeze! So grateful to have a class that doesn't stress me the heck out. Take him!
Awesome Prof, I took him way back in 2004 and still remember his name and that I learned tons in his class.
amazing, amazing, amazing...very personable and will help you with anything...
He's adorable and the nicest profesor I've ever had--never mind the hottest too! You are lucky if you take him! Just don't be late for his class....unless you want him to pick on you ;)~
John is awesome! He's encouraging, helpful, and let's you watch "Friend's" in class.  He was never pushy nor did he put you on the spot.  He's not too bad to look at either ;)
Great Teacher!!  Intresting Subject
Good class with an interesting professor.  Study what he says for the tests and you'll do fine.

Dr. Wilson is one of the most consistently prepared and engaging professors on the Baylor campus. High expectations, clear instructions, and musically compelling. The best professor I had at Baylor - and there were a lot of outstanding ones.
He's just a great conductor, teacher, and person!

Nice  Person outside of rehearsal but not when it comes with music.  His conducting is all over the place  and always rushes during performances. His Rehearsals are poorly managed and is not the best judge of potential in his students. He is also very judgmental and not willing to give students a second chance once he has made up his mind.

Dr. Wilson is a fantastic professor who pushes his students to reach their full potential and settle for nothing less than their best. He is great with words and is clear on what he expects out of each individual and the ensemble as a whole. By far one of the best band directors i have every had.

He is respected by many people, but I have significant issues with this guy. He comes across as judgmental, he said a few inappropriate things while I was there, and he was really not that helpful with conducting class. He was a great disappointment to me.

Excellent Director! Have been critiquing the Wind Ensemble for many years with multiple conductors and this is by far the best yet, no comparison. Very easy to work with, he just doesn't take babies/whiners and any of their excuses. Has very high expectations and the ones that don't like him are generally the ones who can't perform at that level.

I was VERY disappointed to be under his direction. He has completely destroyed the true potential of the Baylor Wind Ensemble. So much for taking the ensemble to a new level. Rehearsals were a waste of time, and the music selections didn't compliment the ensemble at all. He talked more than he conducted, and I hated every minute of being there!
He is nice.
awsomeeeeeeeee class
Easy going
No Comments

I think Dr. Loa is a great teacher.  He really cares about his students, dont hesitate to talk to him for extra help.  Hard class but doable if you put effort in.  Very interesting professor and very passionate.

very strange class. He forgets about assignments and quizzes. It's not a hard class, but it's definitely not a breeze. He spends class time rambling about the most random things. seems very hard at first, but once you get used to him, it's not that bad.

I was already a Classics major, but he inspired me to become a first-year composition instructor at a university, while still pursuing my artistic interests.  He rapped, played instruments, and stayed consistently goofy.  I only have a few characters left, so let me just emphasize this: He rapped.  In Greek AND English.
Super nice and really funny guy - makes class interesting and grades fairly. Definitely recommend this class.

Entertaining! He makes pop references all the time, which is fun. I would be shocked if you don't love Greek Mythology by the end of this class. He covers a lot more material in class than is assigned in the reading so if you want an A it is important to be at every class. I highly recommend taking his class!

He is a great guy-- off beat, but really funny and entertaining.  He has a good time with the content and doesn't take it too seriously. You will always laugh in class and learn something new. Its a fresh twist on the Classics

This guy is awesome and really funny. He sang songs about the plays we read, and let us watch Strongbad emails at the beginning of class. We had a quiz every day, which wasn't bad as long as you did the reading.
He raps about the plays that we have to read, which most teachers could not pull of but he ca and its hilarious!  There is alot of reading and a super easy quiz everyday.  Test aren't bad.
Really nice guy, funny, entertaining.

Fantastic professor she is amazing very frindly. she never be late for class. she answer any qoustion. I would like to take her agin. her calss is one of my favorite. if you take this class with her you will like it, and do very good in it. homework is not hard if you do it on time will be very easy. she will give you a whole week to complat it....
Mrs. Hitchcock is by far the best art professor I've had at Baylor. She's really helpful and knows what she is doing unlike allot of the art professors at Baylor. Take her if you can!! :)

I learned sooo much in this class! The projects seem a little bit tedious, but she's really helpful if you ask. Piece of advice... start you final (50 sketches) early... it's really time consuming. I'd take her again.

Well, her grading system sucks.  I failed on a portfolio because our early sketches weren't listed as being required, and that pulled me down to a C... but she is an excellent professor, and you can learn a lot from the class.  Definitely better than the alternatives for Drawing I.

She was great! a little out-there but very interesting. She did have her favorites but i really liked her and she was very helpful. She was harder on those who she knew had potential and if you suck i think she just felt sorry and gave you  a good critique.

She is a decent teacher.  She likes crazy art.  Its pretty obvious if she likes you and your work.  If your not her favorite youll have to tackle her to get her to comment about your work and your progress. Also, she scared the****out of me.
She has a very particular way of grading.  If you draw well, you might get a "B".  If you don't know how to draw, you'll get an A.  It really depends on if she likes you or not

Very interested in his subject. Willing to help students and very understanding. Read the material, the class is a lot of reading, because he will quiz you over it. If you read you should make a 10 out of 10, they aren't difficult. Essay format tests.
Excellent professor. Essay format tests. Truly interested in his students. Would suggest to any student.

Very nice. He seems like someone who'd be nice to just chat with. Class goes at a good pace. He made the class more interesting than I expected by choosing things you probably have never read before, instead of the typical Brit Lit stuff. Strictly essay tests, but they aren't bad.
really nice guy and he is VERY willing to help w/ your writing/papers.  i hate shakespeare but somehow he made it interesting.  he cancels class ALL THE TIME!
My favorite professor! He is open to new ideas on works and actively engages you in discussion.  Presents literature in interesting way!
OK teacher, class is mostly discussion, tests are all essay.
Nice guy, easy class

Dr. Boyd is great. As long as you have an open mind and act like an intelligent, degree-seeking human being rather than a reactionary philistine with no appreciation for art or human achievement, you will learn a lot from her class.

This class is awful. She does not teach many of the significant things in the time period from WWI to the present. She prefers only academic music. What she wants is academic papers that can be published and not be a good help in the process. She wrote a nasty email to our class after we submitted our papers telling us how bad they were.
Bad teacher.

If your interest is in American Music, this lady is for you. If you are studying Western Classical music, you are out of luck! I was astonished by the lack of information I received in her classes. More weight was given to Billings and Chadwick than Haydn and Mozart.  In 2002, she tried to convince me Elliot Carter was dead!!  At least she is nice.

Dr. Boyd is wonderful.  She insists that students treat music history like any other academic class, but the work she demands is well worth the effort.  She really cares, knows everything (or will work hard to understand what she doesn't know) and is so fun!
Great teacher, great lady.
Dr. Boyd is, without a doubt, the best!!!!  Her classes were fun and educational.  She knows EVERYTHING!!

Dr. Bonem is a gift to the world. She's such a cute old lady who's passionate about what shes teaching. I've had her for two classes  & it can be a hard to not zone out in lecture classes but overall shes good at explaining things in simple terms. She also give out every test question so go to class (especially if your CompSci, she will hate u)
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Bonem is a passionate professor about World Oceans.  She is a very compassionate person and gives all of her energy to assisting us students in earning a good grade for a science elective.

I was a graduate student taking a paleontology course with Dr. Bonem.  This professor knows her stuff.  I still remember a good portion of the material she covered.  Labs were a little dry, but overall, Dr. Bonem was an interesting person and had a lot of experience to share.

Most. boring. class. imaginable. If you're wanting to take this class for an easy A, be prepared to suffer through agonizingly dull lectures for an hour. Very sweet, helpful lady, bless her heart, but the class is agonizingly slow.

nice lady who knows tons about the ocean. the class is pretty boring but a very easy A. she tells you what will be on the test and gives lots of attendence quizzes, which boost your average if you go to class.
Someone else picked up on the Harry Caray thing too! Definitely a strange lady who loves the ocean a little too much, but for non-science majors it's SUCH an easy class!
Probably the most boring class ever. She reminds you of Harry Carey. But you learn alot of things you never would have wanted to learn. Easy A.
He is a very entertaining professor. He is very helpful and willing to work with you. Make sure you get assignments done on time, and you will get an easy A!
Professor Wood is a great teacher.  I really enjoyed his passion for the course material and you can tell he wanted you to succeed.

Professor Wood is the best professor. There's no stress in his class. The only thing to be aware of is the mid-term: you only get 60 minutes to do 40 multiple-choice questions and 2 short essays. I didn't get my 2nd essay of the mid-term done, but I think he curved the class to all above 90:))

Professor Wood is one of my favorite professors so far! I would not say his class is a blowoff course by any means; he is truly passionate! We have weekly reading responses and quizzes. Quizzes are open notes but you do need to study for midterm and final (lockdown browser used). His study guides and Kahoot reviews are super helpful for studying.

Prof Wood is genuinely one of the best professors I have ever had and made my experience at Baylor so good. He is so funny and caring and genuinely just wants you to succeed. Quizzes and little reading response assignments every week, super duper easy and they are all online so you can take them at your own time in your own space.

Christopher Wood is an amazing professor! I sat second row in his 75 person lecture class, and I looked forward to coming to class everyday and being able to engage with him. He is so caring and wants all of his students to succeed. I recommend staying after class/going to office hours cuz he really is a funny guy and a great professor.

Prof. Wood is, in my opinion, one of the best at Baylor. He is super passionate and knowledgeable ab his classes which makes for super informative and engaging lectures. He also gives really good feedback on assignments and ways to improve if you didnt do too well on one. All around a great professor!!

I learned so much in this course. Professor Wood is one of my favorite Professors. He is extremely knowledgable about art history. He engages is students in interesting conversations, and helps explain things clearl
I personally loved this class, I think she is really hilarious!! I suggest that you start studying a week in advance for her tests if you want to get an A .

Mar****seems to be an overall nice person, but she has no business teaching a class at Baylor. Her lectures usually just turn into her talking about her pet duck or her favorite donkey. ya. The last test we took was over 90 questions and we had about 40 minutes to complete it. If you have to take this course try to get another teacher.
She's amazing. Really passionate and committed. I love her and her class.
Very passionate about the subject.  Know the info well for tests, but class is pretty easy.
Long Class, interesting...usually. Tests are KILLERS--give yourself time to study, but if you do the extra credit, an A or high B isnt impossible.
good class...boring
No Comments
Dr.Hoffman is a very engaging professor as she is super into what she is teaching, which makes her students more eager to learn.

Dr. Hoffman is a simple grader, basically you read you pass. You will have a daily quiz over the reading assignments so if you miss class you miss the quiz and they add up so make sure you stay with the reading. Her tests are not too bad as long as you have read you should pass.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Nice teacher, tough class
she is a great teacher u just gotta write papers thats it
so the course itself is horrible. no reading - just writing. she requires journals and warm ups - apparantly we are in fourth grade again. and she is big on attendence.
Grades papers hard. never gives A's. However she is nice and gives days off.
No Comments

Proffessor Rory is very caring and understanding. All you have to do is be willing to listen, learn, and try. He does require readings and textbooks, but isn't a merciless grader. TAKE. HIM.
He's also very inspiring.

Professor Ryan is the best professor at Baylor Law. He's a genius. He explains complex concepts with a level of clarity that I didn't even think possible. I would take him for every single class if I could. Contracts is a tough course, but Ryan makes it enjoyable.
Challenging but respectful
Good Prof.
No Comments
No Comments
Best Professor Ever!!
He will really teach you how to think!
Dr. Miner was hard but great! If you want to learn the text take him but if your just trying to pass don't take him!
At first I wasn't sure what to think of Dr. Miner, but the more the class went on, the more I liked him. Pay close attention to the texts: make sure you know exactly what the author is saying.
I had him for PHI 2308 and GTX 2302. He's really funny and really nice. His class is challenging, but he really wants you to understand the material. One of my favorite professors.
No Comments

Very nice prof. Very helpful and encouraging but definitely not a pushover! Challenges students to think about the material. In the class I took, the grading standard was high but certainly not unreasonable.

Be sure to read the book for the tests or you will be screwed!!! PowerPoint slides and going to class is useless! Don't be late to class!! if you walk in 5 seconds late he will count it against you! He counts every tardy as an absence!! Be warned!!

I had him for Organizational Behavior, he goes exactly by the book, but I read every page in every chapter we went over and didn't miss any class,and actually studied, and I still ended up getting a C+ because of his impossible tests that either don't have the right answer or have two right answers.
No Comments
No Comments
i liked him at first but after a while his class gets really old. study tips-spend about an hour to an hour and a half on each chapter.
Edward Jones during summer? Impossible tests.

Dr. Rust is great!  His tests can be daunting, but the entire course is enjoyable. Very interesting, though has a few strange views on minor things. Dr. Rust teaches history as a story, not a drudge. (Great accent, too)

I really enjoyed his lectures, he is orginally from germany so the accent some how makes it more interesting for me. His hw quizzes are annoying because they are random, and the test are very hard. its all eassy, minimum 4 pages in a 50 min class!!! and he doesnt grade them easy either. i really liked him as a person and a teacher but his tests are
BIG project. your a captian and you have to navigate using cordinates and wind patterns. 3 test using 15 IDs you pic 10 and then 2-3 essays

He is so nice on that fact alone i would recommend him. The only complaint i have is that his class work was very time consuming and his test are exactly what he tells you to prepare for but its a lot to study for. I had to pull all nighters for all the exams.
His class is great. He is really lively and interested in what he is doing. He is very clear with his instruction and requirements.
Awesome teacher!!! his lectures are the best sign up for his class!!!

You think you've been educated in matters of the Bible by your church... until you meet Dr. Melvin. He will introduce you to a history of idea's that YOU DON'T GET TO LEARN IN CHURCH. I'm finally advancing in my understand of my religion. I appreciate this very much.

He is currently a visiting professor at malone university which is a private christian college. His old testament class is bs. We were suppose to learn about the bible but he spent 4 weeks explaining mythical gods. He is currently makin me loose my faith. Ge is one of the worst teachers ive ever had.
very hard but good teacher!

Professor Melvin was not easy but not too hard either. I studied the night before the tests and never read the books and I still got a B. His tests are multiple choice but require you to know the material pretty well. He is passionate about what he teaches and knows a lot. He offers bunches of extra credit too!

Depending how much class you miss he adds points to your grade. I never studied for this class and still received a B. His final was comprehensive and since it was it was super easy. If you go to Sunday School you will pass this class.

Mr. Melvin's class IS hard. But then again so is every Christian Scriptures class at Baylor. He's an extremely nice guy, and makes the class interesting. He provides extra credit opportunities, gives participation grades for coming to class, AND adds an extra 4% to your final if you never miss class. He's very helpful, especially if talk to him!
First of all, she never takes late homework for a grade, and she loves to embarrass you in class with wrong answers in the beginning of class if you aren't ready for class preparation.

Dr. Baldwin's class is not at all easy, but she is a great teacher.  She's a stickler for the rules so she seems unfair at times, but it's worth that for the knowledge that you gain in her class.  She also has a great sense of humor and a good heart.  Watch out for the tests though - they sometimes deviate drastically from class examples.

Baldwin is an amazing professor.  She presents that material in such a way that makes it easy to understand.  Just make sure you do your student teaching assignments for every class bc she will call on you.  Her test are from what she teaches so study your class notes and handouts.  Try not to miss any classes because you get so many 0's if you do.
No Comments
This class isn't easy, but Doc Baldwin is an AMAZING teacher!
Explains things very clearly and has a great sense of humor!
Dr. Long is a fantastic professor. He is willing to help you if you need help. He can be difficult to reach sometimes, but he responds to email. I highly recommend Dr. Long in any class he teaches.

Dr. Long is awesome! Easily the best professor on campus!  He teaches russian so well, it would be hard for anyone not to grasp the russian language with his teachign method!  This guy is awesome, definitely take russian as your foreign language!
An excellent professor in a difficult subject.
Business in the front, party in the back!  Dr. Mullet Long Rocks.
one of the best teachers you coul ever ask for!!
Intro to Slavic Studies is very interesting and fun.  If you get a chance, take!

Professor Duncan uses excellent slides and, despite covering difficult material, makes it easy to follow and even enjoyable. He thoroughly covers the topics without shoving religion down the throats of anyone who does not believe, which is part of the reason why his classroom feels very welcoming. He also speaks clearly and uses a microphone.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: His grading is pretty easy and you do have to complete a response question before every class, but you get 6 skips for those. His tests are pretty hard but as long as you prepare you should be fine, he uploads all his slides on canvas. Overall I would say I had a good experience in the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Duncan is amazing compared to the other scriptures professors at Baylor. Everyone I know seems to be struggling way more, sure his class is at 8 am and there's a lot of reading, but he is a very kind professor that is easy to work with. He uploads all the slides onto canvas and whatever you need to know for the test is underlined in red.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a tough professor. Lots of reading. Discussion boards are manageable. Text analysis are graded very tough. Three tests and one final; tests are hard. Everyone I know in this class had to work very hard for a decent grade. I wish I had taken a different professor because the subject matter could've been so much more enjoyable.

This professor was extremely hard. All the reading assignments took me several hours to complete. His tests come straight from the PowerPoints, which seems easy, but its basically verbatim regurgitation of info. I studied for several days for all three main exams and still ended up with a low B on them.

There's nightly reading that takes approximately an hour or two. There are 4 tests that are all multiple choice, and he does a good job of telling you what to expect on them. You are graded on participation as well as attendance, but he understands how some people are too shy to speak up in class, so he offers other opportunities.

Occasional pop quizzes. Two multiple choice exams and final. 2-3 group projects. Lots of extra credit available. The class is fast-paced and lectures can be difficult to follow at times but if you take good notes and do the assigned readings you'll be fine. Professor Moreira is funny and does a good job of engaging the class given its large size.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: Professor Moreira is a decent professor for political science. She has a lot of readings that take forever, and you have to do them for the pop quizzes. However, I still did them and it did not help much on the overly difficult quizzes. However she is a pretty good teacher at teaching something you will forget right after the class ends.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Morera's class is different from most classes I've taken, but she really cares about what she's doing and is fun and funny. She moves fast in the lectures, but in her office hours she will go back over stuff if you didn't understand. Kind of hard for a required class, but I feel like I actually learned so thats good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Lectures every class without PowerPoint so you will need to be able to take notes fast Her lectures are v informative and she will prepare you for your tests She gives random pop quizzes throughout I enjoyed her lectures I just don't really care about the stuff this class is about but if I did I know would've liked her a lot and felt very educated
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This professor for 1387 is not hard at all, if you pay attention. She is super nice, if you go to office hours a couple times she will really like you. I would take her again.

DO NOT TAKE. This class is HARD. You need to go in for office hours every week, the readings are excessive but necessary, and there quiz/test questions are unrelated. She grades subjectively and only does letter grades (A,B, etc) so you have to be perfect for an A. Extra credit is offered.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I like her style she's really passionate and she helps a lot during office hours

Dr. Van Cura is one of the most well-educated, nurturing and supportive voice teachers in the industry. His singers consistantly maintain impeccable vocal health which sustains a great number of them in major international careers spanning several decades.
Great professor. Great attitude. Great voice. Make you work hard, but that's what learning is about

This man is probably one of the best voice teachers alive. His students sing all over the world, and are consistently the best singers wherever they go.  They also sing well into their fifties, like his oldest student, who is still singing at major opera houses (La Scala, the MET, Covent Garden) all over the world.
No Comments

This man built my voice from the ground up.  His track record of students out having professional careers is remarkable.  The only downside is that studying with him may alienate you from the rest of the faculty, in large part because they are jealous of his success.

Van Cura makes his students sing loud, and that's about it.  If you want to learn to sing loud (and probably not be able to sing at all in a few years) then take from VC.  Otherwise, use someone else.

If you participate in class she'll like you and grade your essays easier. She gives extra credit for going to the writing lab but not for anything else. She has a really particular way she wants your to write essays and if you write them any other way you won't score as high so really pay attention to her lectures because they actually help.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: At first, Mrs. Kearney may seem to talk too much, but as you get further into her class you begin to appreciate just ho much she cares about you succeeding. She does give a lot of bookwork (answering questions). She grades fairly easy on all of her exams. She will even find sources for you if you can't find them! Over all, I would recommend her!!!
shes a funny lady. she really helped me write better, she tends to go off subject sometimes though.
No Comments
No Comments
She is a great teacher. She will help you write better papers! Grades fairly easy, fun class. 6 total papers due in semester, not hard...

Dr. Wu is a great professor for physics, but you have to be willing to learn and put the time in. Some people have said that she is hard to understand, but that isn't the case at all after getting used to her speaking. Compared to other physics professors in 1420, the curves are not too much. Still, Dr. Wu is a great professor and choice for this.

Dr. Wu can be difficult to understand at times, but she will always find time to help you and clarify material. She is a very fair grader, and curves most of her tests. Best way to do well on her tests is to redo the homework and in-class examples. Most of the time she will tell you exactly what is on the test.

She was pretty difficult to understand most of the time.  She obviously understood what she was talking about but didn't explain it thuroughly enough for me to understand well.  Make sure you know how to do every homework problem and you won't have any problems.
No Comments
I would have to agree, and I would also like to add that she is also very nice. Also, the quizzes were set up for you to get a 100 on.

She's new to Baylor during 2006. She's very straightfoward; however, coming from China, her English needs some work. She gives an honest effort in learning how to pronounce her words. She gives quizzes and homework that are done online. The test are just copies of the quizzes and homework. All in all, nothing tricky.

Dr. Newman is a great professor when it comes to knowing what he is talking about, and tells personal stories which honestly helped me remember. He is full of energy and loves all things Baylor, and Ms Mei's cookies. If you take him in the fall, pray for a good football season. Just do the assignments they balance out the tests, and ASK QUESTIONS!

Very hard class, but he is my FAVORITE professor. Religion was just a course I had to take, and I did not do well, so the fact that I still appreciate, respect and talk with this professor says a lot. He hilarious! He's a big fan of Kim Mulkey, the Lady Bears and the BRH choir. Take lots of notes, voice record lectures and ORGANIZE EVERYTHING!

Dr. Newman is by far the best professor I have ever had. He loves what he teaches and gets into his lessons, however his tests are difficult, so you will need to study if you take him, but this is not necessarily a downside, as you will learn all you need to in his class. 10/10; would take again if I needed to.

Honeslty do not take Dr. Newman, he is super nice and goofy but his tests are extremely hard. The pop quizzes most of the time are just for showing up so they are easy A's. But when it comes to the tests they are super hard as he gets excited from his hard tests.
Dr. Newman is a scholar.

He's a funny guy, and tells a lot of stories. But the class itself is kind of hard. You have to take really detailed notes every class, as well as the daily bible and textbook readings. Most of the pop quizzes are questions like "Will the bears beat UT?"

Didnt realize how useful his GTX Leadership class was until around 4 years after graduating. Glad I kept the notes. Remarkable ability to explain philosophical ideas in leadership to a non philosophy major. Every lecture was fun and it changed the way I lead my employees today.
Truly one of the best profs I've ever had. Took several classes from him. He is a tremendous asset to  Baylor and has a gift for teaching. I miss his classes!

I had Dr. Moore for both GTX 20th century and GTX in leadership.  He is an amazing professor!  Very kind and knowledgeable, and he cares a lot for his students.  His classes are never boring.  I highly recommend him!

Obsessed with his rigid understanding of philosophy (Foucalt and Christianity--c'mon!), he is not open minded and tolerant of dissenting opinions. He expects so much from his students but does not give much in return.

Moore is excited about what he does, which always makes for a lively environment. However, his presentation of philosophical figures and arguments are shaped by his personal interests and beliefs. This sometimes leads knowing students to think he is not fully informed on the subject.

Enthusiastic and knowledgeable.  A good lecturer though he can go off on tangents and fails to recover.  Sometimes goes too far with lectures and leaves students behind.  Is obsessed with post-modern philosophy as it relates to Christianity and neglects some other areas in Philo because of this.

Professor Rickabaugh is a genius. He cares more about you learning the content than your grade. If you really go for it and try, you will succeed in this class. He wants his students to thrive more than anything. He cares. rare in a professor to take so much time to make sure his students are doing okay in every aspect of life-- dude's funny too.

Professor Rickabaugh is so awesome! I am so glad I decided to sign up for this class! This class has deepened my faith in a profound way and Professor Rickabaugh truly teaches you and makes sure you understand the material. He is also always super available for office hours and truly cares about you succeeding. Take this class!

Professor Rickabaugh is a brilliant professor and a caring person. Your understanding of the material comes first & he is selfless in his commitment to his students. He is an inspiring person, and I highly recommend.

Professor Rickabaugh is brilliant. He is insightful, well-read, knowledgeable about all aspects of his course, and intent on relaying his genius on to his students. He truly, truly cares about the wellness of his students, not so much the grade they receive, but that they grasp and retain the material he presents. I would recommend him 100%!

Professor Rickabaugh is amazing! He truly cares about you and wants you to be successful in the class. The topics we discuss are very challenging, but he is very good at making them easier to understand. He is very available to take time to meet with you whether you just want to talk to him as a friend or discuss concerns about the class.

Professor Rickabaugh is a fantastic teacher. Philosophy is a confusing subject at times, but he is there to help and answer all questions in class or in office hours. His major concern is that we are learning in his class and not just remembering the info. While he is a teacher, he still cares for us on a personal and spiritual level. 10 out of 10

A very engaging teacher whose class you would never fall asleep in, who would have thought given that it's Brit Lit? She is passionate about her teachings and ensures everyone is on the same page with the knowledge of the content of the readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She rates among the best. Approachable, lively with topics, and flexible with class participation and testing. I have an appreciation for what others call vague assignments. This allows a student to be creative with critiques of the assigned readings.

Friendly, approachable professor with a quirky sense of humor and a strong desire to help her students. Gives very vague assignments, so keep asking for details until you know exactly what she wants from you. Slow grader, but easy to work with if you stay involved in class and meet her expectations. Good person to talk to about medieval literature.

A fantastic teacher. Quirky and often dry sense of humor. She expects the class to provide the majority of the insight on the material during class discussion, which I liked. You must talk, however, so read all of the material. Firm on paper deadlines once they're set, so keep up!
The class was not bad. But it was very engaging. She likes your imput ALOT in the discussion so if u dont liek to talk allt he time not a good class for you

She has a quirky funny personality, she wants you to do well and is very open about helping you. I HATE literature and I still managed to do just fine. only one paper, one midterm and a final. all the rest of your points is participation and weekly very short journals. lots of reading overall a pretty easy class. I recommend her.
So nice and intelligent! definitely recommenced!
Mork work then you will ever do in your life

His workload is ridiculous, he makes me want to cry whenever I go to class. The only two tests are a midterm and a final, and the two papers we're required to write have outrageous requirements. I've never been more miserable in a class in my life. On top of that, he's pretentious, unpleasant and I don't know why anyone would take him on purpose.

With this teacher you will be guaranteed to read 25-40pages per day (not class).Can imagine every single day reading that much for one class, then being quizzed every other class on the little details? Yes, he knows what he is talking about, but the work load is ridiculously heavy. Don't take him.

I love Prof. Wilmington! He is incredibly intelligent, approachable, and has opened up my eyes to world of Biblical scholarship. Fascinating class! Anyone who doesn't like his class is not engaging with the material and obviously shouldn't be at Baylor. You will be challenged by this class and be a better person for it.

Let me be honest for a second, I have never been more miserable for an hour and fifteen minutes a day in my whole entire life. Let me be straight forward also, he is the worst teacher I have ever had from Kindergarden to my freshman year in college. I do not like Wilmington, I do not like his teaching style.

I liked Dr. Werner because she told us about upcoming due dates and changes to the syllabus. Whenever her instructions were unclear, she was bombarded with questions that she always answered. She gives a flood of feedback on essays and gave us chances to improve our grades, such as correcting or re-writing essays. Overall, good teacher.

The writing aspect of the class requires a lot of work. She is unclear on directions but she also wants the paper in a specific format. She is also very unforgiving when it comes to tardiness. Bathroom breaks are not accepted either, unless an emergency. She will treat you like you're in middle school. I had to work really hard to get an A.
this class is seriously so hard and is no help what so ever.

Don't expect much help in class or any help if you miss it. Missed class and attempted at setting up a meeting on what I missed. She was uninterested in making an appointment and told me to read a certain chapter in the textbook. That resulted in missing directions for an online assignment that was discussed in class and getting a 0 for it.

Is good the first week but after that she expects you to know how to do the rest of the work yourself. Gives lots of outside work, never emails back, very strict with tardies, no help if you miss class,only gives B's, and would rater go around your questions than actually answer them. Disappointed, I actually enjoy English.
Don't take her class, i felt like i was back in high school englsih by the way she took tardies and told me she would actually count me tardy if i went to blow my nose. Steer Clear
I absolutely loved going to her class. She is an inspirational person and a kind soul. She's a great teacher and wants all of her students to succeed! Not a hard class, just study for the tests!

best teacher ever! is class is so easy just need to know how to manage your grade points. do the work you will do great. gives out extra credit and extra pints on the exams. she is a must take for any class she teaches.
Best teacher. Easy class just do your work. Took women in society. Easy grader, take home test , one in class test, gives out reviews. Half my class got an A. Will be taking her again in fall 2013

Mueller is a really really really sweet and cute lady. Her stories are so interesting and she seems wonderful...outside of class. In class I feel like the material we were going over was NOT what was on the test. I made a B in this class but I was sure I'd have gotten an A..

Even though she is very cute, funny, and tells some interesting stories; her class is ridiculous. When studying from the tests you have to study from her lectures, the powerpoints, a workbook, and a textbook. I would literally study for hours and then see things on the test that did not even look familiar. Each test is over way too much material.
