she took attendance every day for a grade so i had to go. it was pretty boring but bearable. just pay attention in class and do the notes and youll be fine
Dont take his class. Little feedback. He cares very little about student success and gives NO CURVES and little to no partial credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Do not take him, he is awful, calls on students randomly, which makes them look stupid. I took him awhile back and still remember his bad attitude to this day.

Not a good teacher, too difficult, and calls randomly on students. He barely curves and seems uncaring about his students. Awful teacher, I think the only reason he's staying is because of his research. I had many friends who had to retake his cal 2 class with another professor. DON'T TAKE HIM

His class requries A LOT of time, but he makes sure you do well in it if you put in that time. His classes are easy to understand, but the homework can be very difficult. If you have the option of getting an answer book with your text, do it.

I would highly recommend this man!  His teaching style is very clear and methodic.  The material can be hard, but he breaks it down and takes you through every step.  He'll stop to answer any questions you have if you get confused.  He's also very personable and tried to learn everyone's name in our class.

Not a good teacher. Gives very little partial credit- that goes to the 3-4 people who have an A. I had a high A in Calc I, am doing excellent in Calc III, but Calc II with Hag. was NOT good. He told the class only the A students were worth his time.
Not so great
I disagree on both the sane and the hot comments!! I absolutely loved Dr. A though! Had him for Baylor in Italy and for Intermediate Latin. A fantastic teacher and a quirky man. Take him!

Professor Augoustakis makes it very clear in his undergraduate courses what he expects: mastery of the assigned texts. If you are diligent to translate the texts and review before tests, it is difficult for you to go wrong in his classes. Also, he gives a 2 point bonus on your final grade for perfect attendance; very nice. Kind man, loves  subject.

Great professor. He's a really nice guy, and he kept me laughing the entire time, because of the awesome greek accent. You have to work for the grade some, but he adds 2 pts at the end if you have perfect attendance. I highly recommend him.

Dr. A is great!  He's not the best at lecturing, but his translation classes are very fun and rewarding.  I don't necessarily agree with the previous poster about his being sane, but that's okay.  Slightly insane can be good.  :)

Dr. augoustakis is simply the best professor in our department, period! He is scholarly yet approachable and fun, a wonderful teacher and thesis mentor. I don't know where this department would be without him, he is really the only sane one in that bunch!
Great professor. I highly recommend. Canceled a class period so that we could have a day play paintball and had a kickball/review session as a class period. He is also hilarious.

He's an amazing professor! All his notes are very clear, and he's always working to make the class as good as possible. Right after our second test he handed out a class evaluation, and asked us about changes we would like for the class (this included how we did HW, Test format, and lecture format).

Dr. Jonatan gave detailed examples of very specific problems at classes. Besides, he made a very interesting activity, kayaking at campus for extra credits.also, he usually had homework quiz every week.

Awesome Professor!! He has an accent, but he is very clear in explaining problems. He is always willing to go back in order for students to understand concepts. His midterms and final are straightforward and fair. He is the best math professor I've ever had. I highly recommend him!!

The class is pretty easy and the breakdown of the grade was really in favor of the students! Each midterm was 25% of the final grade, homework was 25%, and the final was 25%.You can basically not go to class and study by yourself and still do well!

Really sweet guy.  He explains concepts in terms easy to understand and at a reasonable pace. Plus he's always willing to go back and go over stuff you don't get. Midterms basic and pretty easy. Not to mention he's cute and has a good sense of humor :)

All tests are free response you only have 4 tests, 4 homeworks, and 4 quizzes. Super super math heavy class was not easy. Super nice professor though he is always available and will put anything down to help a student SI as well very useful
HE is amazing but very hard tests!

Prof Bellert is great! He is one of the best teachers I've had throughout high school, college, and grad school!  I just recently started teaching myself, and I try to emulate his style and care about student success.  Take him for anything he teaches, especially if you are already scientifically minded.
He is a very good teacher.  He explains things very well and even if you do not understand he is very easy to talk to outside of class to get help.

Dr. Bellert is a young professor (he has been teaching for 4 years by now..I think)who is very passionate about teaching chemistry. He really wants students to understand the material and he is doing a very good job of it. Be prepared to study hard in his class. He doesn't use scantron, and will get horrible grade if you don't study.
He is awsome, and very very helpful. Take him for anything he teaches!!

He is probably the sweetest professor on campus. He is so funny and loves to tell stories. His drawing class is definitely challenging if you have not drawn before, but not impossible and he is very helpful if you ask him. He wants you to succeed in his class, and you will as long as you try. Highly recommend professor Lewallen!

Professor Lewallen is one of the sweetest professors I've ever had. Any art class at Baylor is really difficult, and I struggled a lot in my last art class, especially cause I'm not good at art but 2 art classes is required for my major. He made the class enjoyable and wasn't super harsh with grading, don't expect A's, but you won't get a C.

Lewallen is by far the best Prof ive ever had. His feedback is phenomenal & helpful. He is also the biggest adventurer Ive ever known. Hes beyond proud of his recent bug-collecting career & his stories are always captivating. Although it may seem like another one of his tangents, listen in. He is God fearing & is always willing to pray for you.

Greg Lewallen is the best professor ever. He explains exactly what he expects and will help you achieve it. He always asks if anyone needs help and always provides good feedback. He genuinely cares about his students. If youre having a rough time he is so encouraging and will lift your spirits. He also has so many funny stories to tell youTAKE HIM!

Favorite teacher, so caring and nice. Has great stories, he tells his testimony at the beginning. Altogether, loved the class solely because he is such a Godly man, but very hard grader and class is a little boring but relaxing. And he brought donuts(:

Awesome person with tons of cool stories to tell. His finals are pretty easy. He respects artistic talent and doesnt have sympathy if you don't have any. I would surely recommend him if you have any drawing skills.
great person and is good at making the class enjoyable.  explains things well enough to be able to do anything he asks you do do without much trouble at all
THOMAS IS AMAZING!!! he extremely funny, makes class fun, get him if you can!! very easy going!

Dr Thomas is the BOMB!  If you are planning on taking any engineering class, and he teaches it, do ANYTHING to get in!  He teaches so well and you will learn so much as well as get a good grade in the class!
This is the best EGR 1301 teacher. He is a great guy and he is very funny. Class is extremely basic and pretty easy.
Had Thomas for this class and 1301.  Extremely helpful and nice, concerned for his students.  Fantastic teacher with a sense of humor!  You will enjoy his classes
He is very easy and nice. Not the best at teaching but you should get a good grade. Great person.

Discloses personal information to entire class. Doesn't keep his promises to  class. Grades don't matter much in class. Insults you indirectly. At the beginning of the semester, I really loved Chinese, but after his class, I truly just wanted out. I hate how he teaches and I hate how he treats the class bad. There isn't enough room to say it all.
Most boring class ever. Stay away from this moron.

Dr. Yang is a brilliant man that really wants his students to learn chinese well, additionally, he wants everyone to leave with a better understanding of China and it's culture, history and politics. You will need to study hard, but he is very understanding and will help you with anything if you ask.

I had no background on the language. The class gets tougher with each semester. He's a nice guy, but can be rather unclear when explaining things and the book he uses is useless. Follow advice above and get a study group together. You can learn the language, but it will be all on your own.
Slooooooowwwww goes it
Befriend a classmate that speaks the language.

Dr. Heckenlively is, by far, my favorite professor at Baylor. I took Greek to fulfill the language requirement for my major, but now I am considering taking it for the entirety of my college career. Class consists of doing translations from the assigned readings, so if you do the homework, you will succeed in his class. He is there to help you!
Good, helpful professor. Class tends to be rather easy.

Greek is very hard for me. It's one of those classes that you CANNOT get behind or be lazy in. You will never catch up. His tests aren't easy; you have to memorize a billion little things. Weekly Friday quizzes are annoying, but a grade booster. STUDY!

Dr. Heckenlively is an excellent teacher.  I am wholeheartedly convinced that he wouldn't want to be doing any other than teaching classics.  This class was very hard though.  Just make sure that you see him during office hours and ask for help.  He wants to help you.  Work hard and you'll succeed.  He made Greek enjoyable.

A goofy guy that gets sidetracked really easily. Lots of reading in the class, but u really dont have to do it all. Exams are a pain. And he seems to take it personally if u dont come to class. He really loves his work though
A very funny man, albeit mostly unintentionally so. A weird Classics guy, but he keeps the class interesting.
She is approachable and she is clear in her lectures. Expect to read many cases but many of them are short and relatively easy to understand.
She has a friendly personality, the cases are easy to read, and the class is enjoyable.
Good planner
Good professor who encourages discussion.

Her class is well planned out in her syllabus. You are assigned a few cases a day, but they are not too complex. When she calls on you, she will often lead you to the answer if you struggle. Her accessibility is generally good if you want to talk in private.

Generally, she seems nice when talking to a student one on one. She does like to assign four cases to read for each class period. Luckily, they are a little easier to read than most other cases in other courses. She may decide to give bonus points either from voluntarily speaking or doing pop quizzes.

Her lectures are very fun and thorough, but her method of grading is very difficult and heavy. She greatly pushes details and even when you think you have enough, you don't. Be prepared to get no better than a B on everything if you don't have extensive knowledge on the course subject.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This is my 2nd review because I took two of her classes, but what I said in the previous one applies to this class too. But this one is even better because it's a 4000 level credit with interested, intellectually curious students. As such, the classroom discussions, debates, etc. are superb. Dr. Sweet is, BY FAR, Baylor University's best professor.

She is the greatest, smartest, funniest, most interesting, most creative, & most caring teacher I have ever had. She has a beautiful mind and a beautiful personalityand I am so honored to call her my friend. Get ready to watch her shoot blow darts across the room, dress up as a Redcoat (she always wore something crazy), and inspire your learning.
Dr. Sweet is an amazingly nice and smart professor. She really cares about Baylor and her students. She will go out of her way to help you. However, she grades very, very harshly.

I've had two classes with Dr. Jules, and she is one of the best professors I have had.  I happen to love American history, but even if history isn't your cup of tea, she will make the subject interesting.  She adds a lot of fun activities to the class.  She absolutely loves history, her students, and life in general...and students' opinions.

If you EVER get a chance to take a history class with Julie Sweet, JUMP ON IT!! She is quite possibly one of the best teachers I've ever had. She's spastic, but she's super cool. We'd sing songs, dance, march outside, eat food, and she'd come to class dressed up in American Revolution gear, complete with a musket. She's a riot! I loved her :)

Sarge is great! He speaks a lot about his cases from working as a Texas ranger. Be ready to take lots of notes in class. Grades are based on three tests and the final. Just study for them and you'll be fine! He often adds points to the exams if people struggled. Be prepared to go over some tough subjects and see some photos!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: In this course it was interesting to see actual photos from Professor Huggins previous cases as a ranger. You will LOVE this course if you want to know more about forensic science. BE ready to write A LOT! as long as you study you will pass easily! He even drops test questions mostly missed the class to improve grades.

Sarge is a former Texas Ranger, so be prepared to see actual pictures from his former cases in class. The tests are mostly based off of the lecture, however he does throw in some questions from the text. He'll drop questions that most people miss on tests, and he offers a lot of extra credit. Have fun in his class, I know I did!

Huggins is a former Texas Ranger and understands the material very well. He's fun and interesting to listen to and if you just pay attention in class, you will get an A. He does ramble some, but he's great about explaining stuff. He drops questions if most of the class misses it. Take this class and you won't regret it. He was awesome.

He is really funny. Gives lots of good detail and stories from his own experience to give meaning to the slides. He is more interested in your understanding over the topics rather than hounding you on the minutia. Also, he has a ton of funny videos that he loves to show before, during, and after class. Very helpful teacher and he loves to talk!
Good Teacher. Former Texas Ranger, so very versed in the subject matter. Attend the lectures and do the assigned reading and you will do well.

Dr. Rosenbaum is intellectually reserved. He knows & loves his Logic & expects you to take your textbook to the Football games or any sporting event. His TA was not very helpful when I took him though. Only about five exams, no homework but it helps you A LOT if you actually work through the assignments. With Logic, you either know it or you don't.
Very easy professor.  Tests are not bad and he curves the grade of every test a little.  Sometimes can get a little boring, but overall, it's an easy A and def. worth taking!

Definitely had a teacher crush on this guy. He's not always clear (may have something to do with being a philosophy teacher) but he is helpful and the course is easy. If you can't follow the lectures, just read the book. Most of the course is self-explanatory anyway. Fairly easy A.
This dude is one hot tamale!  He knows his stuff and makes class fun.  Too bad he's married.
he never answers our questions. but, i'm learning to think a little more

Okay she's cute as a button, and you can't help but love her because she's so nice, but she is veery old, and naive of the world, she's always very happy, but the class is difficult!! you think things are going great until you bomb the first test, me and my friends would study for hours in groups and it was still not enough. Much work, but doable
I think she is one of the best professors in the Economics department. She is extremely fair and wants her students to do well. Her tests are not easy, but certainly not that difficult if you study.
i don't know why anyone would be averse to mrs. bowman. she's perfectly congenial. a bit naive, but very helpful.

NO,NO,NO!  This woman lost her soul a long time ago.  I'll give her some credit that she seems to want everyone to study and do well. Very clear how she wants students to study in order to get an A in her class, but those expectations are much too high.
very helpful. wants everyone to do good. a bit boring but its pretty easy.

The class is very fast paced, but if you take good notes and actually listen, the tests aren't that hard. Powerpoints are on blackboard, but you have to take notes about them to understand them. Also, read the book as a follow-up. Not a blowoff class like I'd hoped.

She becomes excited talking about Art History and wants you to get everything out of it as you can! I found it fascinating! Open note/neighbor quizzes, midterm, comprehensive final, and two projects. She provides study guides and study sessions. Responds quickly to e-mails and is all around helpful. Put in the effort and you'll do fine!

GREAT PROFESSOR!!! I was borderline with my grade, and she helped me out.  She was great about responding to e-mails and explaining assignments.  Art appreciation is not an easy class, so don't go in thinking it will be a breeze.  You do have to put in effort.  But she is great and will help you in everyway.
She is a very good teacher. Im glad that I have her because she makes art more interesting for me.

she is a very good teacher, some of the assignments are a little over the top, like going to all of the museums, but it is mostly a very easy class. very willing to help and explains things very clearly, if you can get her you should take this class.
I love her!

If you are serious about attending class and doing your work, you will excel in her classes. She makes her classes interesting and spices up her units with fun activities. She is also just a great overall person. The one bit of advice I will stress is to seriously read whatever she assigns; it will help on the quizzes and it will enrich your mind.
Go to her for help with your essays! She is super nice and helpful but kind of a hard grader. Also lots of little mini quizes, but they really are not worth much.

She has us do rough drafts for all papers. However, all drafts are edited by our peers, not her. She doesn't actually give you any feedback until after you've submitted the paper. You could always ask her to review it, but it would be nice to receive her input before you turned your final paper in.
Many quizzes, they are easy, but annoying. ALWAYS do the readings.

Dr. Boerm's teaching style is very interactive. He tries to have everyone speaking and responding to questions in french, and tries to make it fun when he can. He's very funny, often teasing and making jokes. The test grades are the majority of the final grade, but he's great with giving extra credit and easy points with homework. Très bon!
Teach yourself because he is a terrible professor! There are way better French professors to choose from at Baylor.
Il est formidable!
Good teacher and helps to explain things when you go to his office hours
Dr. Boerm is an awesome teacher. He is a lot of fun and you really learn in his class. He likes to joke with the students. Overall a great teacher.

Mrs. Kabre is a very sweet lady but her accent is so thick that the class cannot understand her lectures at times. Sometimes she struggles to think of the words she wants to use. This can get really difficult when trying to learn new concepts. But she does want her students to succeed and she is happy to help whenever you need it.

Professor Kabre's class was very easy, and she provided good feedback. However, sometimes if you asked a question in class, she would explain the answer in the most difficult way possible. She is a sweet person, but her teaching skills aren't that good. If possible, I would avoid her class but at the same time she isn't a bad teacher.
Can't speak English

Her accent can be a communication barrier, and she is sometimes not prepared for class(typos/incorrect formulas in the presentation, she is still a new prof). Following along in the book helps during the lecture. Do the homework, as it will show up on the weekly quiz(sometimes word for word). Asking questions outside class helped my understanding.

For every question asked in class, she answered "It's very simple, I'm sure you'll get it." If you don't already know the course, stay away. Homework load is ridiculous and typically isn't tested over since the problems she assigns have programming problems.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Hardest course I've ever taken. Tests cover material that we never covered in class.

Dr. Dunn gives us a quiz every class period, even though he said in the syllabus they were every Thursday. The workload is intense, the lectures are often too fast and hard to understand, and the tests do not reflect the material or difficulty in questions in class (class average for the first test was a 58). Youre better off taking calc online.
Tests are way harder than anything he teaches spent more time studying for math than all other classes combined

This class wasn't easy, but it's college math and not my favorite subject. Mr. Dunn was fair and always answered my questions. Figuring out that completing the homework and also reviewing the material everyday (well, almost everyday :) helped out alot. I'd recommend this teacher.

The only reason I was able to even manage a B in this class was because I already took Calc in highschool. I already knew the material... If this is your first time taking calc you're better off choosing a better prof, he's a bad teacher, doesn't drop grades, or give extra credit :)

Graded by only 2 exams and 4 written papers. Class was often cancelled, and lectures were quite knowledgeable. Dr. Kye wants you to succeed and it is not difficult at all to pass this class with an A if you put forth good effort. I highly encourage you to take his class!

While his class is sometimes a bit boring, there is not a whole load of work, and the test are open-note open-book which is extremely nice. You have to write 3 short papers and one longer paper. Overall pretty easy class. Cancelled class a couple times which was nice!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Take him - trust.

Samuel Kye started at Baylor this year (Fall 2021), but presented a level of professionalism that you wouldnt find in many other professors. His lectures are very clear, concise, and fun to learn. He is easily accessible, cares for his students immensely, and is willing to work with you on any of your struggles. TAKE. THIS. PROFESSOR.

I was nervous to take Dr. Kye because he was new, and nobody had ever taken him before, but wow. He is a GREAT professor. He kept class super interesting and I never once dreaded going to this class. It isn't even apart of my major, but he made it so fun. He was so lenient on work and grading. He never made anyone stressed and was so kind. TAKE HIM

1315 wasn't an option on here but i'm in her 1315 currently. quite literally the worst math prof ive ever encountered in my entire life. she marked my entire homework wrong because i labeled my fractions and she said they weren't labeled (???.) language barrier is difficult to get around. you're better off switching majors tbh
Super nice, go to her office hours! She truly cares about her students success. Some of the material is went over very quickly just read the textbook and watch her videos before class.

Honestly the language barrier is not bad at all and the people complaining about it should grow up lmao. You need to Ask questions! Shes a very dedicated and helpful teacher and ive never had someone more invested in my success. She has like 10 office hours and encourages everyone to talk to her and meet with her and is very helpful during them.

Super nice lady but extremely difficult to understand. The language barrier between the class and her is the biggest obstacle you will face. Right behind that will be how she explains the material in a scientific manner than a mathematical manner. If you don't know what I mean take the class and find out but hold on to dear life. Great lady though.
Quizzes every day at the beginning of class. She's very difficult to understand. I wouldn't recommend taking her class if you struggle with math.

Do not take him. He cannot hear. He doesn't know how to check email, let alone use BB. He does not relay his knowledge well/ his teaching format is awful. If you ask him a question, he gets mad that you asked (even after class). If it weren't for SI sessions you would fail.

So.. Dr. Dyson is very helpful and a very nice man. FIN is hard whomever you take it with. You must speak up in his class to get the proper answer otherwise he will not hear you. Also, you must go to his office a lot to find grades as he does not use BB well. Take him tho! hes the best option..
He is smart, he just doesn't care to share his knowledge. Horrible professor, he does not have teaching ability. If you ask him a question, he?ll treat you like Idiot.

I took his RE Investments and RE finance in the same semster. WORST DECISION OF MY LIFE. He is very unorganized....his tests are challenging and do not cover what we learn in class. The classes cover 70% of the same material and I have an a in investments (luck) and a D in Finance. How does that work? He wont help you if you have questions and no o
No Comments
very easy class. if you do your work you'll probably get an A.

She is a very nice teacher and is willing to help all of her students.  I found the class to be pretty easy.  As long as you put a good effort into your essays and show up to classes, it isn't too difficult to get an A or B.

I absolutley love Ms. Bedwell. Although she grades papers rather tough (especially the grammar) I consistently pulled off As and B+. As long as you show up for class and follow the essay assignment sheet, there is no way you could do too bad in this class. Her discussions are very fun. However, don't expect to be let out early or for her to cancel.

She's great in my opinion.  Her grading is kind of tough though I must agree; however, she's very helpful with your papers and answers any and all questions clearly.  You have to work, but I've got a B+ and possibly an A, and I almost failed sophomore english in high school.  You have to make an effort, but your writing skills will improve...
This lady is nuts!!  She's a perfectionist, essays are graded HEAVILY!!!  You almost have to be a professional writer!
She is late to class and keeps you late, but overall, she was a good prof.

She is all over the place, never really answers your questions. Makes students come up with exam questions that dont make sense. Expects way too much in such little time. DONT TAKE HER!!! nothing is ever good enough because she always feel you can add more. plus she comes to class late(like 10mins) and trys to hold you 10mins extra to make it up.
WORST PROFESSOR EVER!!! HAS DAILY QUIZZES...ONLY 2 EXAMS...of WHICH SOO MANY MISTAKES...HAS A T.A. DO ALL THE GRADING...HAVE TO READ LIKE 2 BOOKS IN A DAY>..JUST HORRIBLE.AVOID AT ALL MEANS.

This class isn't too bad. Her (almost) daily quizzes killed me cause I went to the minimum number of classes and sometimes did very poorly on them. If it weren't for the quizzes I probably would have made an A. Pretty much go to class, read sparknotes, and you'll be fine.
This lady ROCKS...
He is a very smart Professor and always knows what he is talking about, but is way too tough. His tests and quizzes are extremely hard. there is a large workload.

Wouldn't recommend him. His lectures are intense. Tests are essay and open ended questions. You have to read like 6 novels and take a quiz that consists of one essay question. Attendance is critical. But, at the end he will change the weight of your grades so you could end up with a better grade.

His name is actually James SoRelle. He is REALLY hard. wouldn't suggest taking him. His lectures are intense. All his tests are open ended and essay. you have to read like 6 novel and take a quiz which is one essay question. attendince is critical. but at the end he changes the weight of your grades so you can end up with a good grade.
Dr. Sorelle is tough but good. He wants his students to take an interest in history, not just memorize it.
No Comments
Dr. Baker is very kind and makes class laid back and fun. You need to have a knack for photography naturally to do super, super well in his class, but for the most part it's all pretty easy.

Great Professor.  Willing to work with you and has a variety of experience to draw upon.  The course requires a good load of work.  If you've never worked with a camera extensively, this course will teach you a lot, but it will require time.
No Comments
No Comments

Intro Photojournalism -- lots of work, lots of time shooting and in labs. I didn't feel like he was as hands-on and involved with my projects as I would have liked, but if you just want to do your own thing it's ok, and if you go see him he'll help you.
He's hands down the best professor i've ever had.  His Brit Lit class is discussion heavy, but if you love the course material and just talking about big ideas in general he's your man.
Dr. Ferretter is amazing. If you need lit credits, definitely take his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: he's hilarious and has a great way of helping you discover the text on your own. fair warning though: HE WILL CALL ON YOU IN CLASS--it's pretty obvious who hasn't done the reading. So long as you have one clear point or opinion, you're in the clear. He loves interacting with students and gets super into it when someone disagrees with him--so funny

I loved his class! He facilitates great discussion and cares about what you think. He gives very helpful feedback on papers and presentations. He's quirky, entertaining, and very very smart. Be prepared to talk in class! He's one of the best English profs at Baylor.
Great guy, love his british accent. I would highly recommend him. He is also very interesting when analyzing british literature. HIGHLY RECOMMEND TAKING HIM

This class opened my eyes to issues I had never thought about before. Dr. A had a number of exercises, especially the scenarios and the role play, that invite great discussions and make you really think about what's happening in our world today. This is my third class with Dr. A. Taking another next semester!

I have taken Dr. A for two other classes.  I like her classes because she really encourages critical thinking and discussions. Her powerpoints are available and highlight main points of the readings as well as other interesting case studies. I got a lot out of the role play and the debates. I plan to take her again if I can.

This was easily the most disorganized class and prof I have taken in college. She makes students teach the material after reading a chapter with little to no direction or expectations set out. She will also interrupt these student presentations with irrelevant anecdotes that drag on for half of class. Exams were unreasonably hard for no reason.

Up in the air: Weather, Climate Freshman Seminar with Dr. A was a nightmare! The class itself was boring!!!!! She doesn't explain things well and assigns a lot of work with little time to complete. Quizzes and tests are unbelievably hard! This class was just unnecessary! WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!! save yourself the stress and time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Dr. A is great. The class is sometimes demanding but you learn a lot and it is relevant information. I loved the class!

Prof. Lapes was one of my favorites this semester. He genuinely cares about all of his students, and is a great professor on top of it. This class has 4 exams, and he pretty much tells you what's going to be on all of them. Each exam has a written portion (which you do first) and then an excel portion on the computer. They aren't too if you study.

Fantastic professor she is amazing very frindly. she never be late for class. she answer any qoustion. I would like to take her agin. her calss is one of my favorite.
if you take this class with her you will like it, and do very good in it. homework is not hard if you do it on time will be very easy. she will give you a whole week to complat it....

Mr. Lapes is literally the best ever! He is so smart and is so willing to help on any assignment. He challenges his students to think in a "Microsoft Excel brain", and it helps so much. If you can, take his class!!!

Mr. Lapes was my favorite professor this semester. He only teaches one class each semester so he puts all his energy to helping you succeed. The respect he shows his students made me want to come to class and work hard. It's definitely not a blow off class but he offers to help in any way he can. There is also a review with everything for each test

He is very helpful: answers any questions in class as well as through email. He works with students to move deadlines or turn in things late if needed. He wants everyone to succeed in his class. Assignments aren't too difficult (there are tutorials). He posts exam reviews with everything you need to know! Great professor and one of my favorites!

I had him many years ago.  Yes, he was hard and his tests and grading were hard to understand.  However, his approach truly got his students ready for teaching.  I will never forget some of the things he made us do...but it all helped me to be a good teacher.  Thank you, Dr. Wiley

His classes are very hard and there is a lot of work, but you will learn a LOT!  These are subjects that you really need to grasp if you are teaching.  So it is good that he is so tough.  If you go in and talk to him he is very helpful and helps to explain things more.
No Comments

These were the most difficult two classes at Baylor.  And he has a very odd and confusing way to keep track of your grades, so it was hard to figure out where you were at.  I agree with the other comment though,  it is impossible to pass his tests.
He's old but watch out cuz hes out to get you.  Also dont even try to pass the tests cuz nobody in my class did but somehow we made b's and c's

A nice old man with a subdued sense of humor and extensive knowledge of Renaissance poetry. Gives lots of helpful background information and detailed feedback on class presentations. His class is great for developing close reading skills. His tests can be challenging; be sure to answer the objective questions as specifically as possible.

He is very knowledgeable and becomes excited talking about British Literature. He makes everything clear, understandable, and fascinating. He has pop quizzes every week on the readings for that day. Exams are two days; first, long essay and second, short answer and objective. He is very lenient and helpful! Highly recommend him!

Oh, wow.  Can you make literature any more boring than this man did?  He gets this weird little sing-songy voice when he reads and it's just aweful.  This is the first English class I've taken at Baylor.  I transferred in my other requirements for English.  AVOID!  AVOID!  AVOID!
If you've never heard Shakespeare as told by Ross Perot (but really want to!!) then take this class, otherwise, avoid at all costs.

A nice old man but a terrible teacher.  Boring.  Boring. Boring.  I was most bored in this class - an English prof really has to try to make Shakespeare boring - he just sucked all the life out of it - also a hard grader - demands all interpretaions match his notions.
great

I honestly didn't think he was that hard, just make sure you read and understand the chapters that he covers. He's most likely not going to cover the material in class. I made an A without attending SI, so it's not impossible.
This class is worse than the runs. This old bag is a smelly and horrible guy. Yech. Run from this course.

i spent my time in class reading the textbook.  he lectures for a solid 80 minutes but doesn't say anything.  if you don't have a good SI person, you're in trouble.  i made it out with a B+ and a stomach ulcer.

Worse than Baldridge.  Pointless going to class, his lectures has no relevance, you have to teach yourself, and he makes the tests as difficult and as tricky as possible.  No one makes As in the class, you're lucky if you make a C.  Has no contact numbers, never replies to email.

His lectures were OK, well organized and tried to clear things up from various angles. But other than that the class was a nightmare. His quizzes and tests contained many vague descriptions that sometimes it is not about understanding course material but understanding him. Deduct points for not capitalizing initials and many uncommon reasons.
I think he is smart. He knows everything. Class is hard but useful. I spent a lot of time studying this class. He forced me to learn.

Not a bad lecturer, but his tests and quizzes are very vague and extremely hard to prepare for. Especially since he is a very strict grader, and all his assignments are in essay format.  Seems to go out of his way to make the class more difficult than it needs to. Would not recommend.

I actually really liked Professor VanHoose.  Though he comes off as a bit intimidating at first, he is a wonderful man.  He does care if you show you care.  He has always been willing to help me when I ask him of it.  He's very organized  in his teaching and quite intelligent!

Paint drying is a more enjoyable activity than listening to this man speak. He is a bore. He rarely smiles and does not help those who request it of him. He doesn't explain material well. He is monotone, I was falling asleep in the front row.

Super nice lady! Don't worry about this class, as long as you stay on top of the work. Tips: 1- Do NOT wait until the last minute to do anything 2- Do not do anything less than what is required, she WILL take points off for small things! 3- Pay attention to what she is saying!! If you miss one thing it has a domino effect.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great

This class was just an average class.  The professor seemed to enjoy what she was teaching but didn't ever really get excited - so at times it was boring.  Nice enough to her students.  And she smiles a lot. :-)
SHES THE BEST. You'll definitley make an A. SHES TOOOO EASY.
Shares experiences about Africa and Europe to teach the course. Strong about experiential learning and study abroad.
The experiential aspect of the course, and group research has prepared me for graduate studies. Great teacher-scholar!!!

Dr. TJ made world history easy to understand and comprehend. His approach is not traditional, but I learned about other cultures and customs, and how convergence predates globalization in human history. Outstanding class. Highly recommended to all.
Well informed teacher; caring and passionate about students and content. Highly recommended.
Knowledge and student-centered.

There are pop quizzes (that are easy if you do the readings) and 3 tests that consist of short answer questions and an essay. You have to write 3 short papers based on the reading and there are a few other assignments, but overall they aren't too bad. The reading can be pretty heavy, but she does a good job of giving "reading breaks."
A great teacher who knows how to make literary theory applicable to literature. Respectful of other views as well. And I have to say it...she's definitely easy on the eyes. :)
Dr. Ford is a really good professor.  She makes class really fun.  She grades a little hard, but I think fairly.
No Comments

Dr. Ford is a great professor. She really explains the text well. Class is a great time to discuss views and opinions. The tests are well formatted. She gives pop quizes every once in a while but if you do the reading there is no reason not to get a 10.

Reisenauer was awful - I had her morning class and it was a terrible way to start my day. She would lecture and if you didn't read the textbook chapters before the lecture, you would be completely lost. Hard to keep up. She doesn't give homework except for study guides. Tests are basically your whole grade. If you fail tests, you fail class.

I really like Professor Reisenauer - I am able of staying focused in class as her lectures are not only her teaching the content and leaving you to it. I highly suggest having some bases of biology if you don't want to struggle though.

Forgets thoughts during lecture and ends up backtracking the next class. Test are usually all over the place and usually nothing over she emphasizes as important. Also made a tik toc calling her class idiots after a 45 average cumulative test score. Class is cool to learn but wish I had a different professor.

Only real grades are tests. Tries to remember topics while she's teaching and ends up telling students the wrong information. If you have her as a professor, make sure the class is in the afternoon because her lectures in the morning and afternoon are completely different.

Dr. R doesnt know the course material shes teaching. Dont take her am class. Only grades are tests. The last exam avg. was in the 40s. She was such a promising professor in the beginning of the semester. So disappointed. I would not recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Mean to students, very fast pace

I regret taking this professor for multiple reasons. Every online video on youtube, even videos on the Baylor tutoring website, make calculus seem so easy. Unfortunately, Trey is just not a good "professor," nor does he deserve to be named a professor. He's rude, constantly mentions his job, and you'll hate calculus by the end of the semester.

Prof. Carpenter is not a nice dude. He likes to let the class know how much smarter he is then all of his students. He also is not in his office hours sometimes, which isnt extremely frustrating when wanting to ask a question. On top of all that, he tests us on stuff that he barely goes over in lecture as opposed to the stuff he does.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Carpenter makes everything harder than it needs to be. I took precalculus in high school and found the class to be pretty easy. With professor Carpenter teaching it, he makes it 10x harder. On top of all that he is just not a very nice guy and makes you feel bad if you don't know something or didn't learn something well enough previously
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Trey's classes are for those with thick skin only. The lectures are good and things are well explained, but ask a question and you only might receive and answer. In the process of answering questions Trey will make you feel as though you are not smart for asking a question sometimes telling you to no be "moronic".

Professor Arbuckle is a really kind professor. His lectures can get off track sometimes but never in a way that detracts from the class. This course is mostly seminar based so you need to do the readings and assignments but there are no tests. He's a bit eccentric but he cares about his students a lot and made the class feel really welcoming.

Arbuckle is a super funny guy. He sometimes gets a little distracted with random stories, but that never interferes with the material. Study the powerpoints if you want to pass the tests, because they are not easy. I always look forward to that class!
Best teacher at BU and his tests aren't too bad.
No Comments

Very funny guy, makes the class interesting in various ways such as:When we were discussing accents in the lingusitics section he played a clip of a Matt Damon movie he found on youtube. He and anything he puts on the power points is straight out of the book. If you don't want to read you don't have to but it's handy.

You will work in Dr. Taylor's class, but you will also learn the material very well. He was by far the best music theory professor during my time at Baylor. He deserves the great ratings everyone has given him here. He knows is stuff well and he can teach it well. He'll be harder than the other theory professors, but it will be worth it.
I loved having Dr. Taylor for music theory 2. He gives great lectures and always gives helpful answers to any questions we have. He is very clear about homework and exams. He is also really nice!

Dr. Taylor is harder for musicianship than most of the other profs, but he makes sure you learn it well and are prepared for the next semester. Take him, it will be worth it. If you can't sing, this class is not for you. Take Ripley instead.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the bet teachers I have ever had.  He is incredibly helpful and he is amazingly nice.  He does not like the textbook, so you can get away without reading it.

One of my favorite profs of all time. He knows his stuff because he LIVES his stuff - composing, performing, etc. If you have the chance to take his class, DO IT. If you have trouble, ask him. He is very nice and friendly, and a friggin' awesome teacher.

easy class just show up & take notes, he uses power points so you wont need the book, he gives quizzes which are pretty easy, the tests are easy if you study, do the extra credit, funny & nice guy, highly recommended
Best prof I've had at Baylor so far. Makes class fun and interesting. If you listen in class you will make an A. Easy work yet I have learned a lot. This guy is awesome and hilarious.

Really good guy. I thought this class would be boring and useless, but it ended up being my favorite class of the semester. He's pretty funny and chill, and all you have to do is take notes and listen to his jokes. I highly recommend this class because it's easy and all you have to do is study your notes for tests.

Mencken is a really cool guy who likes to tell a lot of "back in my day" stories, even though he's not all that old. His lectures are often really interesting, and he never gives any busy work assignments or essays. The only hard part is that if you're not reading (which most people aren't because there's no quizzes either) the tests will probably be really hard. He gives 4 tests the whole semester, so you're better off just to read. I highly recommend this class!
He is a confusing man. Sometimes he is a good guy, sometimes a bit rude. I will never ever understand him, so will you.

Enjoys teaching American Lit. He moves information back and forth when discussing novels which can become frustrating when studying for an exam. Has a slight Canadian accent but just ask him to repeat something and he will. Quizzes on reading every day! No papers! He is funny and a good professor.

Pretty good teacher and seems to be real knowledgable of his stuff. Pretty friendly guy and very easy class if you do the reading. He has quizes almost every day but they're super easy. Tests are essay format but pretty easy as well. Lectures are kinda boring though. Would recomend.

mcdonald likes the students that speak up in class and present an opinion in class.  ask him one on one how to write an excellent paper and it gets his attention.  also---he considers the first paper you write to be the most important bc that is how he determines how you will do the entire semester.  he likes for students to use the writing center.
He is a bit unusual, but he's read EVERYTHING and is extremely smart and extremely devoted to motivated students.  A nice guy who will teach you a lot.

this man looks just like sean connery. he is from canada so he has a bit of an accent but you can still understand him, he just has some weird mannerisms. he only gives about 4 or 5 papers that count as grades and they only have to be 2 pages.

I was nervous taking this class last year, but she is a awesome teacher and explains in detail if you do not understand. I earned a B in Old Test., and I am glad she taught at UMHB because I have heard most who teach Old and New Test. are brutal. I learned so much in this class! She makes it fun and entertaining.
If you can take her do it! She's extremely kind and caring and she's not that hard. Do the readings, study a few hours for the tests and you'll get an A. I really enjoyed her class.

She's a wonderful professor and she really cares for her students. If you can take her, do it! She gives pop quizzes but other than that, she's exactly what you'd want in a passionate religion prof. Do the readings, study for the tests, and you'll make an A.

She is great.  She communicates well with her students and sincerely cares about our understanding of the material.  She will go out of her way to help us whenever we need it.  She is a great professor!

She is super easy. All the information you need is on the powerpoints & she puts them on blackboard. She gives review sheets before tests & if you go to the review session, she gives all the answers on the sheet. I've opened my book 5 times the entire semester. Shes really nice & makes the information interesting by using youtube and movie clips.
Truly an inspiration. He is one of the most profound musicians alive today. Few will ever reach half of his artistry and professionalism.
most amazing professor ever -  a great role model. Yeah for Baylor!
best teacher i've ever had!  most amazing musican
gifted and great conductor at all-state camp.  we've needed him for a long time!  Sic'em Bears!
he makes amazing music but is the most unprofessional educator i have ever seen

Dr. Evans is great! She has homework due every class period and it isn't a lot of work, but you always have something to do. I think she's one of the best 3302 teachers and I am taking her again for 3305!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Evans is a great professor if you fit into her demands of what a student should be. That is, you must be able to memorize 150+ vocab words a week. You can't have documented health conditions, & no taking time to work a job to support yourself. She's utterly inflexible & rude if you try to approach her for help. Her class gave me stress nightmares.

This was my 2nd semester to have Dra. Evans, and she is wonderful.  One of the very best Spanish teachers at Baylor.  She is fair, reasonable, and organized.  You know exactly what to expect, and if you study, you will be in great shape.  There is quite a bit of vocab to learn, and I think we wrote 6 papers during the semester.  Overall, great prof
Dra. Evans is a great professor and is very passionate about what she does.
No Comments
He is irritating. It's one thing to have a hard class and teach it well, it's another to have a hard class and teach it poorly.

I took Proffessor Macias' class this past semester and it completely changed my outlook on my finance career. I actually enjoyed going to his class and the amount of information and experience i got from it was incredible! He is a very cheerful man and great teacher and you will never be bored in his class. Definitely recommend taking his class

One of my favorite professors Ive ever had. Would take him again. So amazing and helped me land a great job with the finance field I was interested in and Im so grateful for his extremely helpful and instructive lectures.

Professor Macias has been one of the most helpful, inspiring and challenging professor Ive had at Baylor. His classes are immensely helpful for somebody interested in a finance career and want to be successful. He truly cares to help each student progress, even if youre struggling, which I appreciated. He is very witty and interesting too.

I have had many professors in my time in school, and Macias has been the worst I have ever had. He is very unclear about the material and teaches very poorly in a way that makes the class seems like an upper-level finance class rather than an intro class. He does not treat all students with the same respect, and wastes class time often.

DR. ENDL went through her classes way faster all the other professors. She make shallow explanation on the material. Her homeworks are extremely hard. Her exams are also very hard, even she offers retake and average the two exam grades, it does not help our grades at all as one tiny mistake is made in the retake she counts the whole question wrong.

Very poor teacher in many respects. Her lectures were shallow and example problems in class were nothing like the homework. She makes little time for students, is unempathetic towards student mental health issues, and never responds to email. I made an appointment (since I couldn't attend her very slim office hours) and she no-showed me.

Dr. Endl was one of the least engaging least inspiring professors I've ever had. Answered questions very poorly, went through lectures very poorly, never made time for students, and was only focused on her research. Made absolutely no effort to help students. Went far faster than other physics classes, which is ok, but allowed no buffer for catchup

For a class that you have to take to graduate she makes this way to hard. I have two different tutors through varsity and someone who took her class and they couldn't figure out some of my homework problems.

Terrible professor. She posts the lectures and study guides for the exams online. Helpful, right? Nope. Her study guides are very vague and no matter how much you study, you're still going to do terrible. She curves by like 40 points because everyone does terrible. You're still going to get a bad grade though. Its impossible to prepare.

Professor Rosalind's class is mind-opening. This class was a great chance to understand cultural differences. The class culminates in the autoethnography presentation where students share the context of their background. To be honest, there are many assignments. Still, hard work is honest in this class. Grab as many opportunities for a high score!

This teacher requires way too much for a general Ed. Also, she is difficult just to be difficult- it does not lead to learning more. You will not improve at all at public speaking! Do not take her unless youre ready to treat a general Ed like an upper division class for your major.

This professor has good intentions but makes everything unnecessarily difficult. I have more Speech notes than any other course. And 90% is useless information. Avoid if at all possible. This is not what you expect in a speech course.
Great teacher. One of the most helpful teachers I have ever had. Literally will go out of her way to help you with any problem you may have!

Prof Baty is such a great teacher! She went out of her way to spend over an hour working with me on preparing my resume and cover letter for an internship. She knows what she is talking about and is really funny.  We watched several movies and did fun stuff in class all the time. She won't just hand out an A but I learned SOO much from her!

Ok, she is not going to baby you, if that is what you want. She is very helpful and wants her students to learn. She will help you and give you a break if you go see her for help and you attend class.

i definitely do not think mrs. martin is qualified to teach college-level english.  the grades that she assigns are completely random and unfair.  she never gives A's and does not have any reason for assigning lower letters.  also, she is rude and crazy.

AWESOME. She can be tough at times (grading wise, quizzes are short answer and sometimes difficult,)but there aren't too many of them. Only 5 essays and a revision essay where you revise all the 5 previous essays. She is sooo funny and very fun in class. I highly recommend her whether you are an English fanatic or if you hate English. AWESOME.
very abrupt

It's really hard for me to take Mrs. Martin seriously and even respect her as an English teacher.  I guess her not being a professor should say something, but it seems as though she doesn't completely grasp the concept of English.  I don't understand how she got a job teaching it.  My high school teachers were more helpful.
He's a decent teacher, but is pretty tough. Go to his office hours because he will really explain anything you need help with. You'll never consider skipping class because he is quite the looker ;)
He is the best teacher ever. I got a D in his class but it was worth it seeing him everyday.

He is not extremely clear in his class lectures, and I found his tests to be extremely hard. He offers a lot of help in his office hour, and going to them saved my grade. He's not hard to look at, which is good, but he makes you work for your grade.
Best grad student I've had yet.  Those glasses though;) They get me every day in class.
Super Hott!  Super good teacher  Sometimes a bit distracting since he is pretty cute!

HARD CLASS, I'm not a biology person, but she was a very confusing teacher. She was just not gifted the ability to teach. If you could read the textbook and figure it out yourself you could pass the tests. Tests weren't that bad, but they we definitely hard. You had to work to do well. Also you had to read for quizzes, that's where my grade hit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: I am in her class right now, and it is tough to listen and maintain your concentration to what she is saying. I do not mean to be rude, nor do I want to hurt her feelings. However, the lectures are very dull and not very understandable whatsoever, which makes it much more difficult for you to receive a decent grade.

Her class was much harder than it should have been. The content isn't awful but she nitpicks the hardest, most insignificant details to test you on. She doesn't seem to care about her students and can be rude if she feels your question was insignificant. If you somehow end up in her class, I'd recommend looking back over ppts on your own time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Hartman has been a huge burden to me this semester. I love biology & am actually a biology major, but her class was ridiculous. She does not care about her students and is flat out rude. Don't go to office hours unless you want her to practically laugh at you. She gives clicker quizzes at the beginning and end of class, so don't ever miss.

pretty easy.. but you have to self-teach yourself.. she doesnt really help.. the only thing she does is read off the powerpoint.. you have to read the textbook yourself and write your own notes if you want an A.. if that class wasnt mandatory to attend i would just stay in my dorm and read the textbook

Awesome accounting professor. If you can get in to his class, do it. He's extremely good at taking abstract concepts and applying them to the real world. Tests aren't too hard but you definitely need to study.  HW is mostly My Accounting Lab and the occasional book problem.

Great guy, passionate about what he's talking about. Cuts through the irrelevant and only teaches what is either A). On the final or B).  Relevant to real world business, investing, real-estate, or general accounting. Learned a lot of things that I will undoubtedly use in the future.  Do the homework and engage in class and its an easy A.
the best for acc
No Comments
Young;starts out like he is your best bud. Lacks teaching experience and skills. When everyone starts making bad grades...his attitude changes.

Chapel Ryan is literally the greatest person ever! He's basically that cool uncle that you secretly prefer over all your other aunts and uncles. He is so passionate about this class and really made the entire semester actually mean something. If you ever have the chance to take his class, take it and if you don't the
He is a great man of God and treats everyone with respect. If you never have him in a class setting, just go meet him!
Sic'em Chapel Ryannnnn!!!! He's such a great teacher, he's really awkward but he's funny and it works! :) Also I gave him a chili pepper because I felt bad that he didn't have one.
He is so cool. He is the greatest professor that you can ever have. You should pick him as your professor if you ever take any classes in Leadership at Baylor

Great & funny guy who really cares about his students. Wants you to think about/apply concepts from the text book instead of memorizing them. Daily 1 page chapter summaries due over the reading.  1 biography paper & project (tedious, not hard). EASY final (free response). I highly recommend him.

AMAZING TEACHER. The whole class is like a big conversation. Doesn't make you feel like you're learning because it is so fun, but when you walk out of class, you walk out with a world full of knowledge! HIghly recommended. Such an amazing woman

CSD 1406, 2302, 3310, 4V30. Very willing to give extra personal help. Encouraging and friendly. She is passionate about what she teaches and makes the classes fun. Patient, understanding and an overall blessing. HIGHLY reccommended!
This class is so much fun.  She's a great teacher and willing to help if you just ask her.  Very good at what she does and enjoys it...that also makes class more fun!

I enjoyed taking this class.  Learning a new language is always difficult, but she was good about repeating if you needed.  She was interested in you learning to sign (not just that she was teaching it).  I enjoyed having her as a professor.

She's an excellent professor and really knows what she's talking (signing) about. Grades a bit tough, but she's easy to talk to if you have questions about a grade. She expects a lot from her students, but you will learn a lot. I would recommend her
He is good at doing the work in class and explaining it, however his ability to communicate with students outside of class or give clear instructions on HW or projects is awful.

I want to start by saying I failed calculus last semester with a different professor. Calculus is a subject that takes effort no matter the professor, but Marcus makes that effort a lot easier. His notes are great, there were comments on my homework, and he was always available in person over email. Truly the best, got an A this time around!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment:
Pros
- Chill dude (Could make u feel stupid sometimes, it is what it is)

Cons
- Lectures aren't usefull
- Doesn't grade homework (This is essential if u want to do good on his tests)
- TH quizzes are way too hard for trying to prepare for the departmental final
Loved this guy ��

If you show up to class, do your homework, review the lecture notes, and reach out if you need any help, you should fly right through this class. Hes willing to set up office hours outside of what has been established, and explains things really well! Great prof!
awful jokes, mid personality. passive aggressive and it gets old. keep up with the lectures and tests will be fine. his lectures are insufferable though so watch out.
I would recommend. He drops one of your four test grades and one of the two essays. There is a reading quiz every week but you get two attempts and you can see which questions you got wrong.

Online quizzes, open note open book. Tests are also open book. As long as u read the required stuff the lectures don't really matter. Passionate lecturer, really nice guy. Best poly sci professor for sure
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: So far he's pretty easy. Weekly quizzes with two attempts and you see which are wrong. 2 easy short essays where the lowest is dropped (the first was 600-800 words) so if you do well on the first you dont have to do the second. Tests are online and our first one we did outside of class. Open note/book for everything. Pretty easy, counts attendance.

AMAZING TAKE THIS CLASS! Open note/book reading quizzes and exams (never had to study and got 97-100). He truly cares about his students and offers extra credit. As long as you put in the work for projects and take good notes, this will be the easiest class. Didn't have any work the last two weeks since he drops the lowest, and ended with 100%.

I love that she provides extra credit! she doesn't give out reviews, but at a couple of days before the exams she goes over a review and you can re watch her zoom lectures. i have always made above a 100 on all her exams, because she provides me with what i need to succeed! most def would take again.
All she does is stand up and lecture for 3 hours straight. Do not interrupt her while she is giving her lecture or she will be mad. I do not recommend this professor at all. Horrible!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She works as a adjunct at MCC, which is where I took her class. I would recommend her 100%. If you study, and take notes on her class, you will make an A. Also, you'll be able to apply every single thing you learn in the class to real life. She offers extra credit, and bonuses in her tests. No hw. 2 tests, she reviews over both of them.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: She's an OK professor. I took her at MCC and the class is very interesting and if you really study you will pass. I would recommend studying from the book and taking notes during the lecture.  If you participate, do the little extra credit assignments she gives, and stay on her good side then you should be good.
AWESOME prof!!! She loves getting to know you and is very involved with organizations on campus.

Fantastic professor! His class format is simple. There are quizzes over the reading (complex material..READ IT!), and tests over the lectures. He provides extra credit at the end of the semester. He definitely knows his subject so don't mind the repetitive jokes and personal stories. He's an older man, give him a break. Great professor overall.

Daily mini quizzes that are 5 T/F over the assigned reading.  2 or 3 tests and a non-comprehensive final.  Exams are only over lectures; TAKE GOOD LECTURE NOTES. I liked his teaching style, but sometimes I did feel that some of the questions on the exam were about topics we didn't cover in class.  Xtra credit @ end of semester

He was always lost on what he had taught us. He'll put stuff on the test that he thinks he has covered. I recorded his lectures and noticed this so its not that i don't listen. just horrible class anyways

professor patterson is the most boring professor i had. he did not know how to present his material, and always confused the class. he was very repetitive, but it was all nonsense. if you want to fail religion, take him!
Helpful teacher, but grading system is too hard. Seemed too advanced to be "elementary" spanish.

First off, her name is really Irom...someone mispelled it. She is a great teacher. Much easier to work with and more understanding than other Baylor Spanish professors. Definitely take her if you can!
I had Irom for Spanish 2310 and loved it!  She is very clear about what she expects you to know for tests and quizzes.  She knows her stuff but is pretty laidback in class.

This professor's pretty demanding. The work is pretty easy, but there's so much that it'll feel tough at times. She hardly ever speaks in English, so psychologically your brain will comprehend Spanish very quickly because you're required to talk to her in Spanish. Her tests are hard, but if you can keep up, you'll be speaking in no time.

Reputed to be one of the hardest professors in his field.  Clear in lecture the amount of detail of tiny minutia needed to have depth and breadth on to do well on an exam for a course that could cover centuries and dozens of civilizations and cultures was just ridiculous.  He should focus on critical thought of content not regurgitation.
Knowledgeable, interesting, and good teacher.  LOTS of reading, and you MUST read all the books, or you will fail! Essay tests.  However, if you read carefully and pay attention, you should be fine.

Knowledgeable and good teacher.  Interesting class. LOTS of reading. MUST READ the assigned books or you will fail!! Essay only tests.  Enjoyed class overall - if you read carefully and pay attention you should be fine.
Very difficult, not willing to help students.

He is horrible. He failed OCHEM when he went to school. He tells everyone in class that he failed. This would make you think that he would understand and make the class better. But no, his lectures are worse than almost all other lectures. He really doesn't make class fun at all. Take klausmeyer, do whatever you have to, to take her

I like Bob. His class isn't easy though. But no organic chem class is. You're better of taking his class and getting ready for Organic 2 than taking aneasy class. The material is just hard. Get used to it out change majors.

Tests are ridiculous. Everything he tells you will be on it is not. Doesn't take things out of the book, uses questions out of who knows where. Lectures consist of him rewriting the book in his own words. You'd be better off to stay at home. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

He gives extra credit, and some free/easy quizzes. Go to the weekly Review Sessions.  Do the practice exam.  There are some surprising questions on the exams.  Read the book.  He gives weekly quizzes. Exams include fill in the blanks, drawings, sometimes mulitiple choice. Guessing will NOT work.
Worst professor!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: great guy
Best professor ever!
Really easy, gave us friday's off...take this professor but don't slack off completely otherwise you will get screwed because he doesn't give extra credit at all!
She's fine.

This class was pretty difficult.  Students said she is for the most part the one accounting teacher you want to avoid for financial accounting.  She makes you take pretests, which actually do a pretty good job of making sure you know the material prior to the exam but is still time consuming.  Pretty attractive for an accounting prof.
Shes thorough and makes sure you know the material. Her tests are not too hard because they are multiple choice. Cutest accounting teacher you'll ever see.
She is a little disorganized, but she really does care about her students.  Her tests are not hard at all, as long as you keep up with the homework.  I would take her again.
Great
The guy teaches with passion.  Baylor needs more profs like Dr. B.  He is the best I have had!  I learned a ton.
He might be the best professor at Baylor.  Take his class!
Easy class. He is a good Christian man. He makes class fun because he's not too serious like all of my business professors that have their panties in a wad.

In one period he talked about different laws and then showed some police videos to explain it. In another we went over dwi laws and punishment and he brought like drunk goggles to show us the tests to see if people are drunk. It was AWESOME. He always brings props and stories to prove his point. Changed my major cause of his class. Must take

His class was at 8a but I signed up for it cause some of my friends took him and said i had to. I started waking up just to come to his classes. Ties the whole lesson together with videos and awesome stories from his job as a cop and really really funny. Would take this class for no credit if I could.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Good Teacher, really funny and frank. Has experience in what hes teaching which makes it cool. classes fillup real qucik
Attendance was a big part of my grade, really cool class, professor made the subject matter fun and easy to understand. My favorite class at Baylor thus far!

I was super scared of Dr. Osteen the first time I met her and even after the first class. After talking with her, she'll make time for you if you need help, she is super sweet and understanding, she will work with you to understand the material. Workbooks are helpful, but in all honesty I never had time to finish them so study the powerpoints
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Very informative, relates well to students, lots of real-life examples, accommodating for questions in class.  Top notch instructor, high recommend.
Be prepared to do your work, but try your best and have a good attitude and she will totally be on your side and help.  Just be strong, don't let yourself appear weak.  I loved her.
i think shes nice, but some people are scared of her. shes really pretty cool if you talk to her. make friends with this one.
Unclear. Unfair. Never available. Cant answer questions.
She was great! A great baylor teacher. I loved her class.
Once you mess up once... you fail
she can be a little hard on you at times but shes also nice. shes def there to teach and not to make friends.
While the class is a little difficult if you arent a business-minded person, the Dr. B is amazing and hilarious!
She's caring, understanding, and easy going but tough enough to make you really lean the material. Very fun class.

Dr. Brunson is by far the best professor I have ever had at Baylor. Her classes are helpful and applicable to the real world. Not only is she an amazing professor but an great human being. She will stay up until midnight with you just helping you through scheduling issues, class problems, or personal ones. With out a doubt take this professor!!

She is new to Baylor but was an AMAZING PROFESSOR at University of Houston-Clear Lake. Very clear expectations. Assignments are not difficult. She has a passion for the subject and a sincere hope for her students to do well. She is very inspiring. DEFINITELY take her!!!

He was a great professor I would 100% take the class over again. If you follow the plan, he has this class will be a breeze. The homework's are fairly easy. You can do the homework over and over until you get a 100%. He answers every question you asked him.

Prof. Rebrovich definitely knows his stuff, as he has high level degrees in lot's of different math classes. Lots of homework online. He is a good lecturer and he loves to answer questions. He is awesome too because he grades partial credit on tests and wants to get you as many points as you can get. Definitely take Prof. Rebrovich!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: An amazing professor that teaches well. Highly recommend attending class even if he doesn't take attendance (the course work will be more understandable). Tells you what to study for tests; tests are simplified and he grades gently and fairly. Provides opportunities to raise grades through test corrections. Txtbook is recommended, not necessary.

Professor Rebrovich was amazing! He made time outside of class to meet with us to review for every test! I recommend going to the review sessions as they made the tests very approachable and doable. He even said those that went did significantly better on tests than those that didn't! He gives out candy for participation and makes the lectures fun!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Rousseau was by far the best professor I have ever had. He is a very easy grader and is such a kind professor. I wish every professor was like him because I would take his class over and over if I could.
He was one of my favorite teachers across the board.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Jordan is awesome! The hardest part about his class was learning how to tie the variety of knots.... WHICH YOU WILL HAVE TO LEARN TO PASS A TEST!  knots suck, but everything else in the class was fun.
He's awesome

He is funny and engaging but very tricky in his quizzes and tests. Requires a lot of studying but you can tell he enjoys teaching. I would not recommend taking him simply because there are A LOT of other teacher that are better.

He is a great teacher. Very excited about what he does which makes it interesting. Always pay attention because he is into everyone participating. His tests and quizzes are the tough part but just study. Study vocab for quizzes.
He's a big dork, but you'll learn a lot and enjoy going to his class. Gets everyone invovled

This professor is so much fun and helpful. Tests are pretty hard and there is a lot of homework, but you learn a lot. He is always willing to answer any questions. You can tell that he loves teaching.

I took him for both U.S. history classes and he is by far my favorite teacher. He loves what he does and wants to make it interesting for others. He is fair and very helpful if your grades are suffering

Dr Riley is a great teacher. I took him for both U.S. history's. He let me write an extra credit paper because I was borderline C--B, it brought me up to B. He is fun & no homework. Quizzes are easy. Tests are fair. Plus he gives off before an extra day for easter & thanksgiving. He is very knowledgable, I definatly recommend taking him.

I had him for 2 semesters and made a B each time. He gives 3 quizze and theyre over general concepts from readings.(EASY!) Tests aren't hard, just study the notes from class. Not a big time consumer. Dr. Riley really cares about his students and is so willing to help. He's not straight-edge either so he keeps life interesting. TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!!!
really nice guy - doesn't make you memorize any dates/obscure details, he just wants you to understand the concept - pretty easy if you take good notes in class
This class is a great intro class for gen ed. I have really enjoyed Dr. Edwards. She's fun and you can tell she really enjoys teaching this class.

She was very nice and willing to help, but I sometimes found her to be very .. weird? She has her own thought about things, but she does tell you what will be on the test, and if you study that, you will do well. Very nice... I heard she was nicer than the other teacher..

She is completely amazing. I would take any of her classes anytime. She will read your essays or anything before you turn them in to edit them and help you out. TONS of extra credit. She is soo funny and unique. She made me extremely interested in art history because she gets so excited about it every day. DEFINITELY TAKE HER... SHE IS AWESOME!!!!
very nice lady and makes the class interesting. willing to help.

I love this class. I laugh so hard in every session, I wish I had this class more than twice a week! He does mock many beliefs, but its yet to bother me. Every day you need be looking up news stories and KNOW WHY THEY ARE RELEVANT. Don't come to class unprepared. Its lecture and discussion-based, with books to reinforce topics.
