Dr. Jewett is FABULOUS. Don't take his class if you aren't prepared to be VERY challenged in your beliefs, but he is VERY KNOWLEDGEABLE, and the most fun prof. I've ever had. I looked forward to his class every day and usually wish I had it more than twice a week. I was actually sad the two days he had to cancel class.

Prepare to be shocked. If you are easily offended, don't take this class. He is one of the craziest profs you will ever have, but he is very entertaining. I looked forward to attending his class every day. Fun/funny lectures. Only warning - his tests are hard and you have to do one hard project. Other than that his class is a blast!

Prepare to be shocked. If you are easily offended, don't take this class. He is one of the craziest teachers you will ever have but he is very entertaining. I looked forward to attending his class every day. Only warning - his tests are hard and you have to do one hard project. Other than that his class is a blast!
Very good lecturer. This class was actually at UNLV. Only issue is you never know your overall grade. Other than that fun class to take. Lots of participation.

Took this class with Prof Lee at UNLV. There are reading quizzes every week, 2 midterms (passage ID's, short answer), and a final essay. Overall, very straightforward and simple. Do the work, and you'll do fine. Lowest quiz grade is dropped. Setina is very knowledgeable and keeps class light-hearted. Would recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: For her Modern American Poetry class, Professor Setina made the work fun, meaningful, and not overwhelming. Structured with 2 major papers, a presentation and 2 tests, if you read and come to class, her lectures are enough to help you succeed. Still, she gives you a ton of handouts; she wants you to do well; couldn't say enough.

Highly effective and approachable professor. Treats all students' contributions as valuable, can connect material to pop culture, and has a good sense of humor. Would be fun to talk with over coffee. Grades are based on attendance, weekly discussion board postings, magazine reports, and a symposium paper. Recommended to anyone studying modernism.
Had the technical issue using an online submission canvas. But he refused to help. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLAS
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Fantastic teacher, interesting class material, some of the most useful business management / negotiation skill building I've ever used or learned. Would enthusiastically recommend ( and wish I had the time to visit and tell him in person ).
This professor is heartless when it comes to understanding student's situation. He had no empathy. He would not share in-class notes or publish. It's very strange.

I had a technical issue using on online submission program he required so I emailed him the assignment instead. He REFUSED to accept the assignment, giving me a zero. This meant my grade for the course was a D. When I asked him to accept the assignment he was so rude and apathetic. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.
I had some clues before I took the course, but Professor Clinton really blew the subject wide open. In one word: groundbreaking!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Clinton is incredibly knowledgeable on the subject. Lectures are never dull and truly engages his students in discussion. Would definitely take again!
It was one of the most interesting classes that I ever had.

One of the smartest Political Science Professors I've met.  His knowledge on the subject is limitless, you can't stump him! (I tried!)  Listen carefully, and ask well thought out questions, because he will bounce it back at you.  Even if you give a somewhat inaccurate answer, he is good about finding some way to tie it into the accurate answer.
Amazing, inspiring lecturer. Very warm person, helpful and understanding pedagogue. Has great wisdom about piano literature and great taste.
Fantastic pianist and professor, very warm and good person .

He can be rather ambiguous about assignments at times. He told us a quiz was going to be one day, and then moved it ahead one day to catch us off guard. He is the only piano prof with a lab requirement and it sucks. very nice and understanding though, and he obviously cares.
Good teacher but he tends to be a little too short/rude with the student when he feels they haven't practiced. Great emphasis on theory though.

Professor Dunn is the nicest dude I have ever met, he genuinely cares about the students in his class and wants to make sure everyone is good. I have nothing bad to say about this dude, if you get the chance take him. He has these little quizzes that aren't really hard and there's the final but just read a little and you'll be fine.

amazing prof always walked around class and said hi to students. We had a few lectures, but most of the classes were speakers that would come in and present what they do for a living. Based on the notes you take on the speaker you complete an assignment which is writing out 3 takeaways. Quizzes every so often over the textbook pages, online.

Mr. Dunn is a very disappointing professor for Baylor. He makes commitments that he doesn't follow through on. He does not know how to successfully teach Marketing nor does he have experience in Marketing. He is unorganized and provides feedback too late. Do not recommend taking his class.
The man was a god
Good professor, very sweet, and explained well. Slight accent but also did not give much homework and take-home tests!

Dr. Tim is a fairly good professor. His tests are fair and gives test reviews that definitely help; quizzes come directly from the book. In-class, he just goes over examples, which isn't necessarily a good or bad thing. I've never talked to him outside of class, so I can't say whether office hours help.
terrific professor

This teacher is very nice and helpful, but impossible to understand.  Accent was a big issue in my class and he gives you test reviews that never seem to help on the test.  Mostly, he just goes over the examples from the chapter in your book...that's it.  Tests very hard!

Professor Fletcher is one of the funniest professors I've had at Baylor and although his tests are extremely hard, he's extremely helpful if you ask questions in class or in office hours. You will need to work extremely hard since your test grade is based on how the rest of the class does, and 60% of the class drops after the first test.

Save yourself!! Just awful.It's BEG fin, you feel as though you are in fin an 3 or 4 bc he teaches & speaks like you know how to calc the probs prior to entering his class.class is pointless-get an amazing tutor everyday to teach you this course. test are not over hw/what you learn in class, but things you have never seen before. Take someone else!

Fletcher is by no means easy.  The class is very good but also keep in mind, very difficult.   He is an ex-regulator so you can imagine this makes him rather specific on...well everything.  I repeat not easy, but if you can memorize a lot of information you ought to do well.  Otherwise...have fun

This was the second time for me to take this class and what a much better time I had the second time around. Mr. Fletcher is an easy going, laugh out-loud teacher who will help you understand finance much better than any of the other teachers. Make sure to ask him to tell stories!

Professor Shoaf is one of the sweetest- granny-type individual. She has a great personality. That being said, her class is one of the hardest classes to sit through. She gets off topic VERY easily and expects the homework to give you all the help you need. Her tests are easy... and hard because you will feel like you haven't learned ANYTHING!

Very nice and appreciates the attention and interest of her students. If you need help, she is very approachable (even during a test!) She gets off topic easily but is one of the sweetest people I have ever known. I don't feel like I've learned very much in her class but only because it's Elementary Math and I already know most of it.

she is very strict and scatter-brained. if your phone accidentally rings she will kick you out of class. other than that watch out because she gets off topic really easily she is a nice enough person though.
Pretty nice. As long as you do the work you should be fine.

He could be worse. He is a funny person, and I like how he describes the steps for analyzing a problem. However, it would be nice if we could show him a writing sample and get advice on how to improve. The only writing that is done are two hypotheticals (not for a grade, no advice or comments on individual assignments) and the final exam.
Wonderful instructor.

He is disorganized and doesn't even bother to give a syllabus that is consistent with the course schedule. The cases are hard to read and his presentations are often unclear. He has cancelled almost 12 classes and only made up two. So it was hard to keep track of what cases you were supposed to read.
He knows his subject but he is egotistical and his lectures are ineffective.

He was super helpful whenever I had any questions. I really enjoyed the class and it opened my eyes up to how the world is for other races and ethnicities. I always thought I was knowledgable about other cultures but this class threw me a curve. It was awesome. Dr. Park is amazing and I really enjoyed him as a professor.
Jerry is the MAN!!!

Tests are ridiculously hard, and that's all you have. No homework, no essays, no quizzes, just tests ... three of them, and they are unbelievably hard - they're all about applying the concepts you learn. He does offer lots of extra credit, though. But man, those tests... you don't want to even attempt them ... seriously.
He's a great teacher who definitely knows what he is talking about and wants to have discussions with the students, not just lecture at them.  I highly recommend him.
Class good

Dr. Sanker is an extraordinary teacher with an unconventional sense of humor that makes his class a delight to participate in. He is very real with his students and does not appreciate overly flowery language or people who constantly suck up to him. I would recommend his class to just about anyone interested in medicine.

Although some students might not understand his humor (i.e. the student above me ^), Dr. Sanker is a great guy with a genuine interest in preparing Pre-med students for their possible futures. The class is close-knit (for the most part) and fun. You write a few essays but they aren't hard to get the hang of.

Dr. Sanker is a pompous, demeaning man who is self conscious about who is and spends a lot of time talking about how important he is and how unimportant you are as a student. The class is boring and useless, and he doesn't agree with the classical style of writing that has worked so well in the past for literary greats like C.S. Lewis.

Dr Brown assigned us something verbally at the start of March. He then penalized my classmate for doing her assignment, reported her for plagiarism bc she used an image that wasnt her own despite the image being secondary to her report. He isnt very disrespectful, I would not recommend this professor at all
Dr. Brown is a very smart man who cares immensely about his students. If you get the chance to take an internship with him highly would recommend doing so.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Brown was amazing.  Dr. Brown understands that most of us are not environmental science majors so he goes easy on us. His main goal is to educate us on relevant environmental issues. Gives tons of extra credit and lectures are mostly youtube videos. Take him if you can! He's so chill and he honestly cares about his students. Final exam is easy.
Super easy, very lively guy.  Teaches through videos. Light Reading

Dr. Foley is a brilliant man. I disagree with him on practically everything, but can't help to marvel at the intense depth he understands his material at, as well as his ability to synthesize our course materials into a more complete understanding of the medieval West.
Best prof ever. Changed my life.
Insightful man.
No Comments
He is a jerk.  Very sarcastic and makes you feel dumb.
Very sarcastic and unhelpful. Makes you feel stupid when you ask questions.
not helpful and very sarcastic

great guy. dry sense of humor.  moves very quickly.  kinda of intimidating but he really will like you if you speak up.  as soon as you don't understand...say something.  quizzes once a week that are tough but the problems are straight from the book.  doesn't check homework.  tests aren't too shabby. xtra credit at the end of the semester.
Some test questions were obscure, but all testing materials come from lectures, not the slides. Pay close attention, but he's really funny and wants you to do well.

He is the best professor I have had at Baylor thus far! Each class we get out early and assignments are very straight forward. For the one quiz we took, he gave us the answers after we took it and so it was an easy 100. Some questions on the test only had one answer choice, so he gave you that answer as well. He is very chill and teaches well!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Kevin Tankersley is my favorite professor I have taken at Baylor! responds to emails quickly as long as you send them at reasonable times he's not gonna respond at 3 am lectures all class every class but they are interesting and he is a great speaker so you are interested 9/10 times a super cool person and you enjoy learning about him and his craft
Tank was the best professor! I would take him again, he literally lets students make the answers for one of the tests. He is super easy and keeps the class engaged with his powerpoints and stories.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Henderson is an okay French professor. Only take her if you have taken French before. Come to class or you will struggle on her quizzes. READ THE BOOK. Light workload but you have to do a good amount of practice/self teaching to be successful. I took her online and she had attitude towards her students sometimes if our tech was being wonky.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Love her! The class is hard because it's full of people that have taken french before, so if you haven't be ready to play a little bit of catch up in class. However, Dr. Burnett-Henderson will literally do whatever it takes for you to get the grade you want. Just do your part and she'll go above and beyond hers. The homework really helps your grade
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Prof. Burnett-Henderson is not an easy prof. it's true.  But you will learn SO much in this class. There is little homework and if you actually study you will do fine.  I had never taken French before, and Henderson was very understanding when I struggled with the vocab.  She really wants her students to succeed and she's a fun professor to have.
Great Teacher, You learn alot, but be ready to work! Hard!

Gives the hardest exams you'll ever take in the B school-long questions with 5 answer choices. Claims to account for attendance & participation when calculating final grades. I attended each class, review sessions, spent lots of time crying in her office & still got a D in the course. Had horrible test anxiety. Should have taken a different class.

The Best at Baylor. She is thorough and intelligent. She can answer questions and is always willing to help. She gives personal review sessions before tests and has extensive office hrs. She makes it worth going to class and never bores. Granted, its not a blow off class and attendance is key. Work hard and youll get an A or B.
She such a great!!
I think she is the best teacher at Baylor!  She's hard and makes her tests too long but I learned so much.  She explains stuff clearly and will go over things with you again and again.

AWESOME AND EASY!!!!!!! Class is mandatory b/c you have easy&open note daily quizzes. Exams are easy! Just listen and take good notes!! Final is all of the exams again and he lets you review all of your old tests and offers EASY extra credit. TAKE HIM!!!!!!! :)

I gained a true respect and love for acting from Steven. College was my first time in any theatre related atmosphere. He always treated me as though I had just as much right to be on the stage as he did (A veteran actor - a skilled actor). He was a large factor in why I stuck with it, why I learned to love it and why I found my place in the theatre
Love me some Pounders. Love raising my stakes. Great actor and great acting teacher.
No Comments
LOVE HER. I have taken every possible class with her and would continue if possible. very relatable and down-to-earth. Best yet!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Really takes an interest in her students and what she is teaching. Always there to listen to you, encourages questions and discussions, even debate. Passionate about children.

Dr. Mac is wonderful! I will pretty much take any FCS course from her because she genuinely cares and is knowledgeable about the material. She doesn't try to lead you astray in any assignment and is very approachable.

Professor McAninch is a fantastic professor! She makes class extremely interesting. Although class participation and attendance is a large part of your grade, it's fun to go to class. Tests are easy if you pay attention to the class discussion and participate in them.
Great prof! Cares a lot for his students!
Well organized, caring, and very fair. Always ready to help.
Very nice great experience..
No Comments
Had him freshman year.  He's a nice guy, even brought his daughter to class.  Three years later, he remembered everything about me and wrote an outstanding recommendation for grad school.
Why isn't he teaching anymore?  I see him on campus, but he's not on the schedule.  The best English I ever had.  We need to bring him back.

Great teacher, extremely helpful. All he requires is that you show up to class, participate and do all your work. He is pretty easy going, if he feels the weather could play a factor in your learning he will cancel class, but be prepared to work hard the next class.
The only Baylor professor that is the Baylor professor we were promised at Orientation.
Definitely take Nunnely courses. She's good
Terrible teacher. Cannot understand anything she is trying to say.
yeah, she's the only reason why i took blaw.

Dr. Nunley is wonderful. She explains everything clearly and her tests aren't too tough. She uses CPA exam questions, though, which I think helps the student get accustomed to what is asked on the real CPA exam. Besides being a great teacher, Dr. Nunley is an eye candy. She is HOT. She's FASHIONABLE and SEXY. She's the typical Texan hottie!!!

He's truly a caring professor. Very passionate about what he teaches, and really wants his students to understand the material and become better writers. Be ready to put forth effort both inside and outside of class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: i had a great time in his class it was very fun due to the people in my class but he joined in one the banter in the class often. No one really ever got an A on their papers so do not expect an easy A but if you are looking for a really easy B to a B+ then yeah take him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Benyousky wants you to do well, and with some effort, this class is an easy A. I'm an English major so of course I loved our readings and discussions, but it was enjoyable for non-majors too! Make sure you read or at least get a good summary, because knowing the material is important. Benyousky chooses amazing books and has great ideas! Take him!
Sometimes kind of nervous in class but otherwise a great professor. Enjoyed his class quite a bit

I've have Dr. Crenshaw twice. (ENG 1302, ENG 1304). I earned an A the first time and a B the second. The second part of English is harder, and I missed some classes/work. Dr. Crenshaw is great. SHe's not easy, but I don't think and of the English professors/classes are.

Took Prof. Crenshaw 3 times, partly b/c she's the only one who teaches some of the classes I needed but also b/c she's great. What I liked most about her is how much she loves her students. She prayed with me when my dad was diagnosed with cancer, took me to coffee, wrote me letter of rec, and came to my wedding. She moved to CA but still teaches.

Took her at CBU. not hard, but definitely a heavy workload for me.  I'm normally a straight A student, but many items got points taken off.  Very sweet but never ask for extra credit!  Coming from community college where extra credit was normal, I was surprised when she said it was inappropriate and unprofessional when a couple of people asked.

I had Mrs. Crenshaw for two classes: this one and American Thought. I enjoyed taking both with her. She's fun, funny, and really cares about her students. She wants us to learn and think for ourselves. She kind of gives a lot of work but if you do it u should make an A. (I know someone who got a B but he missed class and assignments.)And she's hot.

Very difficult class to comprehend due to her teaching method. The testing is filled with trick questions and confusing scenarios. Poor communication from prof and the only interaction is to watch her read from Powerpoint slides. Textbook reading on your own time, as only a fraction of the material is actually covered in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This Professor lets you know up front the percentages of who will succeed in the class. The material is interesting but she puts trick questions on the tests that has you second guessing yourself. With all the studying and going to every SI, I felt confident that I knew the material. I ended up with a D. I do not recommend her for Psych.
There is only tests in this class. If that's not what you are looking for do not take her class. If you put effort into the class you will be able to get the grade you want.

She's a good person, but I absolutely hated this class. She was really organized, I'll give her that, like she always had her lecture planned to the last minute, but they were so boring. Her tests were hella hard. I studied so hard, read the chapters, did extra credit, did practice tests and never passed. She is so much harder than other professors
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took Dr. Lai for Analysis Seminar; we did Schenkerian Analysis. He's quiet and mildly awkward, but he's nice, really knowledgable, and cares about his students' success. He's got an accent, but I personally didn't have any trouble understanding him; he makes sure to pronounce his consonants clearly. Good guy, would recommend.
He is hard to understand and could be a little condescending if I didn't get something basic.  Don't take this class if you don't already understand theory well.

If given the choice, take his afternoon class. Sit near the front. He mumbles more in the morning which makes his accent harder to understand. His English is perfect, but his accent is thick and hard to understand in the morning while his voice is still low. Good guy who really wants his students to succeed. He'll work hard for you if you work hard

Dr.Lai is a great teacher. The material is not the easiest, but he gives you as many chances to improve your grade. Ex. if you get below a 80% on a homework assignment. You can make corrections for a 100%. I defiantly recommend.
Dr. Vagts is super sweet and a good teacher. Highly recommend.

I absolutely adore Dr. Vagts!! He is extremely knowledgeable about all things theory and is such a wonderful professor! He deeply cares about his students and is incredibly understanding. Don't be afraid to ask him questions if you don't understand. He is very willing to work with you and help you learn so you can be successful! Highly recommend!
Dr. Vagts is a fun and quirky teacher. He is very passionate about teaching and loves and cares about each one of his students. He is always helpful and sympathetic when grading. Take his classes!

Dr. Vagts is such a great professor. He is very into his teaching, making every day exciting to learn. He clearly understands what he is teaching and is VERY open to questions, making you feel very welcomed and comfortable. Take a class with him!!! You won't regret it! Can't wait to be in another one of his classes!
really sparked my interest in both facilities and event management...has good experience and teaches like she enjoys it...takes a personal interest in students
she is one of the nicest people i know...very personable...the class is easy...you go to a ropes course--how fun is that!
No Comments
easy class!

If you pay attention, you should pass. Don't you dare take out your phone during class or he'll try to make some stupid math joke about you to call you out. He also makes you feel stupid when you ask questions because instead of explaining things in more detail, he repeats what he just said. His class is passable, but I don't recommend it.
Best math teacher I have had yet
WORST PROFESSOR EVER
No Comments

He's a really understanding professor and wants you to succeed. Read the book to do well on the homework and go to class to do well on quizzes. Has a really good sense of humor and knows so much about political science. Would take him again.
This man makes all of the lectures much more interesting than they should be.

Professor Capper is a very interesting fellow. He dresses beyond weird and is very eccentric but it makes class a bit more entertaining. Taking notes/coming to class is a must. There isn't much else to do except some SERIOUS STUDYING for the midterm/final which are all essay. If you study well for these (unlike me..), you will most likely do well.

He's just a graduate student, but you wouldn't be able to tell with the amount he knows about the cases.  We NEVER used the textbook (one less book you have to buy).   If poly sci isn't your major, you may be a bit bored at times, but he makes it super entertaining.  Not a ton of work, but some SERIOUS studying for his midterm/final is a MUST.
If you like unnecessary deconstructive criticism, then you're definitely fit for this class. Make sure to thicken your skin before signing up for this course.

He is very demanding.This is a rigorous course.You will learn a lot and make some really cool stuff.He must have a book of analogies that he studies before class because he uses them all the time.The analogies are interesting and kinda funny once you learn to laugh at them.He likes an interested, hard-working student.Not an easy A, but worth it.
He is really anal and he demands you to give your best at all times...I like to be pushed and have the professors making sure I give my best in class...

This is the hardest class/professor I have ever taken.  It's a requirement if you're an art major, so you may as well suck it up and get on with it, but I'd recommend making it your only studio class for the semester if at all possible.  Important, but extremely challenging.
Extremely difficult class.

Tests are very difficult, material is a bit unclear, and she doesn't seem super helpful when you ask her for help. It's biology for non majors but she lectures over a TON of different/random topics; almost doesn't seem like a BIO class. But if you have to take a science, this might be an OK option because all the science classes are hard at BU.

If you don't need science for your major, TAKE THIS CLASS! She doesn't make you purchase a book. The class is everything you've learned in ecology your whole education but a little more in depth . If you turn in all the discussions and attend every lab/class then she gives your extra credit. She is super enthusiastic and makes the class fun.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Duke was very knowledgable about the subject, but the tests were completely unreasonable. Half the material on them was not included in the lectures, and there was no book, so there was no way of learning the stuff. Very tough class, especially if you do not already know the ins and outs of biology. Pop quizzes all the time, as well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Green was nice and knew what she was talking about. The class itself was very easy and you are given multiple attempts to get a 100% on the assignments. The tests and quizzes are also straightforward as long as you understand the material. Maybe it was just the class but I had not issued with Gina Green.
Not fun, this class is Hard, she is so difficult to deal with, don't buy the book(she will never use it)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Green has a very long list of requirements for every project that are hard to follow or even pointless and penalizes you heavily if you miss any of them. On top of that, she tells students almost every class about different scenarios, in which she would take off points(ex. if you used material from her own textbook which wasn't on her PPoints)

This course was the worst course that I ever had to do in my education life. at the first day of class, I realized that Dr Green doesn't like the book she picked for the course, she said it in the class I know this book is not an easy read, and it contains errors, my question to her, why did you pick this book then?
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment:
One pop quiz; rest are take home. 
1/4 exams dropped. Final cumulative. Tricky with his questions; heavy curve and partial credit.
Lecture covers most of what you need.
Lectures are posted, but uploaded ~week after the current lecture so don't get behind. It moves fast. Slides not filled out.
SI can help especially showing the format of the exam.

Plunk is the best o-chem professor. His exams are super hard, BUT he gives GREAT curves. Some exams were all marked up with red pen, but I still got an "A" bc of his curve. He's super nice. Be aware of pop-quizzes (we had 2). The rest of the quizzes were take-home assignments. If I had to take ochem again, I would definitely sign up for his class.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: The kindest man in the BSB who I took for both semesters because I love how he grades so much. His exams seem hard but the curves are different than normal professors and multiple people can get above a 100. There is always a dropped test and quiz and extra credit throughout the course. Ochem is hard, but Plunk makes it so worth it, take him!!
He is a really nice professor , if you listen in class you will learn. Plus he curves his exams and he makes sure the class isn't boring . He made me actually enjoy ochem.

Took this class online as a wintermester course, very straightforward coursework. 4 discussion boards, and 11 quizzes only top 10 scores were taken and a midterm and final exam. There was a daily online lecture but if you watched it you will be successful. Would highly recommend to take for scriptures!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: She's such a sweet lady but her teaching skills are just okay. Pretty easy class if you just follow her powerpoints which she lectures in class EVERY day. She also posts them online to view later. She has an accent, but it's nothing you can't get used to. She has an absolutely no electronics policy in her classroom and her TA will take it from you.
Nice person but has an accent and is very difficult to understand

Pleasant, knowledgeable but pretty hard on tests and quizzes. Homework every week that is easy because she give you the exact passage in the bible to find the answer. Takes points off final average for absences, which should be illegal.

Dr. Henry is vivacious and entertaining. She demands verbal participation from everyone in class. I was dissapointed that this survey class ended up focusing only on women writers. We had to miss out on Keats, Shelley, and Eliot for Felicia Hemans and Florence Nightingale. Dr. Henry also got behind on our silabus--we never reached the 20th century.

Very funny teacher... keeps you interested just by her personality and attitude.  We got extra credit one class for making her laugh really hard.  Take good notes in class, write down what she points out, and you'll do fine.  Gives lots of extra credit opportunities.  Easy A.
Stay the bloody heck away. She might have been a good professor several power trips ago. I think she's more concerned that she's smarter than you than she is about teaching.

Math isn't my thing, so I found it a bit hard. I worked at it and he let me come to his office multiple times to re- teach the material. Great guy. Tells random jokes to keep things fun, and understands math isn't the most important thing in the world. Hard tests, but lets you know exactly what to study for. Departmental final at end of the year.

Pretty funny guy... a little on the weird side. Easy, easy class. You have like 5 problems of homework that aren't for a grade and the tests are straight off of that. Only problem is the departmental final which he makes effort to prepare you for the entire semester. Easy class but you probably learn won't learn anything.

Very interesting person...haha..A really nice guy whose very open with most everything that goes on in his life.  He goes great into detail even as to write every word he says on the board.  Tons of review in this class, which makes it easy (2/3 algebra review), but has the hardest tests and quizes in the department.  Just make sure you look over everything.
Wonderful teacher, very accessible, and helpful. Her love of philosophy is contagious. Someone should give her a teaching award.
No Comments

Excelent professor, she takes great interst in students' thoughts and ideas and is very respectful towards students, making recripocal respect a very easy matter. Her tests are demanding but doable your first test grade will be lower then your second because of this. Papers will recive good grades if you have a clear thesis and maintain your logic.

Really easy labs and projects that don't project grade. Very boring class lectures. I understood what was going on in the class perfectly, but still did poorly on test. Very hard and she doesn't drop any grades. She is very helpful and always in her office though!

Easy class assignments that don't really reflect the tests after test 1. Her tests use formulas that you would input but they use very basic deductive resoning. Make sure you read over the powerpoint slides and you will be fine. No reading necessary at all otherwise.

Very boring lecturer. She seems like she cares about her students, but she's not quite sure how to help them.  10 "labs" (excercises over the covered material) over the semester. 2 or 3 difficult tests and a comprehensive final. She's nice but not very clear on her instructions.  Take another prof if you can

Professor Cox is so sweet and motherly! She loves to recall tales of her sons and she loves literature. If you are willing to do the work, you will get a A easy! There are outlines due for every chapter, a few projects, and book reports. I highly recommend her class.

I am taking her this semester and have loved her class! There is a lot of reading and she loves making us do outlines for the chapter but for the most part if you are willing to read and give your opinion she is willing to give you the best grade possible. Also, personality wise she is very warm and friendly and motherly. Take this class!

Cox really cared about what you thought... as long as you agreed with her. She graded hard on the most random things and seemed really disinterested in her students. The class is pretty easy and the lectures aren't horrible (except when you disagree).

Dr. Stubenrauch is the best professor I've had at Baylor so far! He is so interested in what he teaches and he really makes the class enjoyable for the students. You do have to study, but his tests are very straight forward. He's a fairly young guy, so he is really understanding. Recommend him 10/10!!!

One of the best profs i've had here at Baylor. His class isn't necessarily easy, because you have to put in work. But if you do you can expect an A. He is extremely engaging and really does a lot to help bring history alive and keep you engaged. Awesome guy! Would recommend to anyone .

Dr. Stubenrauch is excellent. He grades like a maniac, but makes himself available to the point where if you don't understand or can't do the work, you probably don't need to be in his class. He doesn't teach straight from the book which is great since you can get by with an older edition. Basically a really entertaining, all around great guy.
James is loosely engaged teacher, that cares little about students. He has difficulty explaining things. He is kinda full of himself and has a huge ego. I regret taking this course with him.
do not take this class...

he has no time for students. nobody can participate in his class. too much information but no knowledge. shows too much attitude and body. very distracting while teaching. keep telling stories with no meaning.  i am very confused after taking this class. no clue what to do.  He himself was failed many times in explaining basic concepts.

Barr's class is an easy A. She graded on attendance, weekly homework with like 4 questions, and her open note cumulative multiple choice final exam. No exams due to covid, and everything was open note. She told us that she made her class easier due to covid. She always ended lectures early as well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: She is amazing highly recommend. Drops lowest test score. Swears everyone will pass
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Really really nice, 10/10 person

Dr. Maxile is a great professor because he is all about justice. Yes, I know that seems weird to say. He grades your homework without being too penalizing or too giving; he also clearly lists his expectations and is a fair grader. He is a fantastic teacher and is very helpful in and outside his class. Highly recommend!

Had Dr. Maxile for Theory I in an online format (not ideal--try to avoid that if possible!). I come into his class with no previous knowledge of music theory, and I really struggled because of it. However, he did his best to work with me and helped me multiple times outside of class. He's difficult, but you'll definitely learn! He's also really fun
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Very good teacher. He's very good at explaining the topics so it's very easy to understand the material that is being discussed. He's also pretty funny and likes to play some jazzy piano while we work on warm-ups and other exercises.

There is a quiz after every two chapters, some at-home quizzes. The test dates are given at the beginning of the semester, LockDown with no camera. The test questions are similar to the SI questions. Learning Catalytics are used for participation in almost every class. Additionally, the instructor typically offers a curve on nearly every test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: I enjoyed her class last semester.  Yes, it was though but it was to be expected since it's a science class and I want to go to Med school. As for the accent, I didn't mind it and since Spanish is my first language I found it useful to be able to ask for clarification at times.

Dr. Gil, while a sweet lady, is one of the worst lecturers I have ever experienced. I succeeded in her class because I am good at working on my own and reading the online textbook. Most of our class is entirely zoned out during her lectures. She has a thick accent and rambles the entire class. This course isn't hard if you can learn independently.

I took PSY100 online with Labouff, very easy class just keep up with the homework. I would just read the chapter as I did the homework and I always got full points. He will give extensions if you get in contact him ahead of the deadline. No weekly zoom meetings, relatively stress free class just try not to save assignments for the last minute.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He's tough, but he's a really good prof. Makes sure you attend and paid attention. He really wants you to learn, not just take he class and forget it.
Hes alright - If its above beginners psychology, best believe the class isn't a push over.
Get ready to read and study but she is always helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Amazing clinical instructor!!! So helpful! And not as harsh on you compared to other professors. Understands that you're new to this as a J1 and works with you.
Explains things well and makes it easy to learn.  Keeps things interesting
The best math teacher I ever had in my life

Dr Klentzman is so sweet. She cares about her students and is always excited to help. The tests are not extremely difficult and I actually felt like I learned so much in her class that I will be able to use in the future. 12/10 recommend!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Klentzman is a brilliant professor & lecturer who really cares strongly about educating students.  She'll go the extra mile & sitting in her class is easy on the eyes.  It is easy to see why she was the homecoming Queen at Mary Hardin Baylor.  She knows her stuff.  She is the whole package.  Thank you for being an inspiration & model of Christ.

this class slayed me ngl. she's an awesome woman and very easy to talk to her. definitely go to her office hours an get to know her as a person, it will make her like you. her tests are so hard, multiple choice is very confusing but the simulations online are not bad as long as you study.

Uhhh it wasn't really the prof itself but it was just the class in general. Softwares is pretty mind-filling itself. Out of the many many assignments she only drops 2 and overall was just a ...... average class idk.
Professor Leskoven is very knowledgeable and explains things really well. There isn't too much homework and only two tests a year. The tests are a bit difficult, but nothing too hard.

His grading criteria is not clear at all. You have to beg him for help. His tsets are literally just his lecture notes. He doesn't explain an essay till the day it's due and he gives you weekly quizzes. AVOID HIM PLEASE!

I am going to be as professional as possible! He was the absolute worst professor i have ever had! He does not sound interested in teaching his students! Do you like sleeping? He will surely put you to sleep! IF YOU HAVE THE CHOICE! Then DO NOT take him! If you don't have a choice. Then sit in the front and be ready to teach yourself. Good Luck!
Please avoid him. His lectures are confusing and his class is just dreadful.
He asks leading questions and is always looking for his solution.  There is no easy way to know beforehand what he is looking for.
DO NOT TAKE AT 8am! Good guy, Do the problems & pay attention in class.

Great guy!  He's really nice and fair, plus he seems really laid back and seems to know his stuff!  He can be funny and tries to make class interesting, which is tough to do in Blaw! He gives great study sheets and as long do what you're supposed to and pay attention in class you shouldn't have a problem making an A or B. I would def.reccommend him

Landed my first job because of him. He said that i am better than who i think i am. He gave me encouragement to held my head high and believe in myself.  On my 1st interview, i walked in telling myself remember what Mr. Klingman said.  By 3:30pm, same day, i received a phone call that i got the job offer.  Thanks to him making me feel confident.
Loved his class! He's an old man-- he has been teaching this class for many years and really knows what he is doing. Does tend to ramble, but makes up for it by giving good personal critique.
No Comments
I am confused on how those comments are true. This professor is very hard. He may give a "study guide" but be warned, remembering it will lead you to an easy f. Stay clear

I've gone to three different schools in my undergraduate career and Roy Millhouse is by far the best teacher I have ever had. I took him back in fall 2008 and I still think about how teachers should be more like him. Do the readings and memorize the reviews and you will do very well in his class.

Mr. Millhouse is an amazing teacher. He is very clear during his lectures and is always willing to help out his students. He gives quizzes over the readings he assigns but they are easy and usually include a bonus. Take him! He was awesome.

Dr. North is an amazing professor. His law and economics class requires time and preperation; however, you will learn a ton and the class  is very interesting.I had him back in 2004 and am coming back here to rate him because he was so good. Take him if you want to actually learn the material and earn your grade rather than have it given to you.
He does a great job.  He is kind of like a big teddy bear.  He grades hard, but he gives great curves.  Take him if you can!!
No Comments

One of the easier intro Computer Science professors. Has a decent sense of humor and is huge into video games. Overall, a decent teacher if you manage to finish all the projects and do well on the exams (which are quite easy). I would suggest a different professor if you really want to challenge yourself and learn the concepts.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Before the first test, I had a 95 in the course. However, during the practicum, the TA, who can't speak English well, didn't inform the class that it must be submitted online before 6:30 to get credit. I explained the situation to Dr. Fendt but got a 0 anyway. He said to me, smiling, "Now you know for next time." This affected 10/40 other students.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Capable teacher who is good at explaining new concepts to intro students and working through many examples. Fair grading that gives some credit for understanding concepts even with minor syntax errors. Very relaxed in lectures and has enough of a personality to avoid being boring.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: You know that professor that demands you call them "doctor" and takes points away from your final grade for going to the bathroom?  That's her.

She was a good teacher and went over the material step by step, however, she was a little bit passive aggressive and didn't count our final exam grade because she didn't like our class's attitude. The "final exam" was the easiest test you could ever take:25 questions and you had 50 tries. I made an A+ and it was going to bring my grade up.
No Comments
Excellent dive into cybersecurity! Very fair and knowledgeable professor. Very manageable workload. The more you put in the more you will get out. Looked forward to attending class every week.
Great professor, highly recommend for those with an interest in cyber security.
Lectures are very interesting. Definitely going use to knowledge and apply it
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great teacher! Very helpful and explains assignments well. I am not a good public speaker at all but I still got an A in the class.
Loved her class!!
Great class, great teacher. She is the most brilliant person you will ever meet. She is very helpful and straightforward. If you have to take a modern foreign language take CSS3305.
Great class, would highly recommend. Butler is very fun and his lectures are interesting. Also a very personable guy.

I had him for intro to linguistics and semantics and pragmatics. He's an excellent prof and personable. He enjoys teaching, and if you do the work he gives, good grades are easily attainable. In his semantics and pragmatics class we had a fun research project involving conversation analysis.

Dr. Butler is a great professor who can explain linguistics very well. While the subject matter can be somewhat boring, he makes it interesting. He is the sort of professor you can talk to outside of class. He requires a lot of reading but most of it is interesting anyway. I would recommend his class to anyone.
I'm working in his research lab now.... :)
So much more than just a professor! My fave bio prof ever!

BIO 1306--Favorite bio prof so far, made every lecture worth attending. Pretty damn funny guy and super creative lecturer. Best lecture I've ever had at Baylor he gave on science vs. faith.  Totally blew my mind--evolution is a beautiful thing! Exams are really conceptual and force you to know the material. Tough but fair.

I suggest taking his class. He is a nice guy and teaches with a sense of humor. He curves the tests so that helps ALOT. Lenient and will work with you. Keep up with lab, tutorials and mastering physics while studying for the tests like you would for any other class and you will do great.
Lectures are not really any help, he just reads off the slides most of the time. Also lectures aren't the most exciting but they aren't so boring that it's miserable

PHY-1405 for BA student. Conceptional idea in Physics. Class is very easy if you keep up with the work. HW is all online and can be taken multiple times to get 100s. All test have at least a quarter of the HW questions in them. Plus Dr. Vasut curves the grade on test. Do all HW and complete the labs and an A is very reachable.

I only got a B- because I was dealing with severe mental health issues (my other grades were lower), but I can assure you that Dr. Elkins is AWESOME. He is smart, hilarious, cunning, and knows how to make a class entertaining; you will learn a lot of interesting stuff about art; and you'll get an A if you show up and know your slide ID's. Take him.

Dr. Elkins is amazing. He has a deep understanding of ancient art and archaeology and really forces students to think and evaluate art and ideas about it very critically. He is masterful at connecting images with history and culture and using it as lens to study the past.

The class itself is not particularly easy, but he is a very good professor. He teaches the detailed material in a very clear, interesting and amusing way. The quizzes and tests require LOTS of studying though. Paying attention in class is the most important thing to do here. If you're looking for a good learning experience, take his class.

This man changed the way I saw the whole world. When I was a student, the diploma costs around 120k. It's much more than that now, but because of the wisdom, generosity, and care this fellow showed to a podunk kid like me from east texas, has left me with a whole new perspective on the world. If every prof at BU was like this homie, we'd see change

Dr. Tran is one of the very best professors at Baylor. I took a few courses with him actually, and he eventually directed my Honors thesis. He is incredibly smart and truly cares about his students and their views. Even after graduating three years ago, we still keep in touch, which goes to show how concerned he is with the success of his students.
He is such a great teacher, he is so energetic and class is soo much fun... he makes topics interesting!!!!!! I totally love his class!!!!!!!!!! All Baylor teachers should be like him!!!!

In my opinion, Senora Jones is great! She is very interactive and expressive, which makes class more fun. She is very helpful and proof reads my written work before I turn it in. I was nervous about taking college level Spanish, but if you put in the work and have a good attitude you will do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: She is very helpful and will tell you EVERYTHING that is required of you, no surprises. She is a very fun and interesting woman so it's easy to want to come to class. There is a bit of daily homework but it really just reaffirms what you go over in class. Her tests are straightforward enough to where if you pay attention in class you'll get an A.

I took Tracey R Jones in a Dual Credit Spanish 1 class at MCC. I do not recommend this class. Every day she just had us translate a paragraph and did not care if we used google. You don't learn anything and then the tests are totally in Spanish and insanely hard, they are nothing like you do in class every day.

Professor Varghese is very self-centered. He spent much of the class talking about his personal life and little information was conveyed. Beyond that, he is unwilling to accept any extenuating circumstances regarding assignments. Overall, he is an unpleasant person to interact with and his class was no better.
I took his online class this summer and I really enjoyed it. I thought he lectured well and made it easy to ace any quizzes. He also provided very simple weekly writing prompts that were easy As.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Do not take this professor what ever you do. I worked my butt off in his class and got a B. I was confused 99% of the time because his explanation of assignments was so broad and not helpful at all. His lectures jump around from time periods making it so confusing. I got an A on all assignments except one and it tanked my grade. no recovery.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He is nice

Prof. Swinney was probably my favorite professor this semester. I genuinely enjoyed going to his class every week. His exams are pretty dependent on how much you paid attention in class, and the notes that you took. He only posts his powerpoints in his canvas, and they don't say too much, so you have to take good notes in class and do the reading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He is so funny and a great teacher for chris scrip would take again! I learned so much about the Bible and his lectures were engaging. Get ready for a lot of quizzes and some of the questions on the tests are random like we didn't go over them in class. But if you study and read the assignments you will be good for an A or B.
I enjoyed having Dr. White as my professor. The amount of reading was reasonable and he gave great feedback on assignments. He was also very helpful when I found some of the readings confusing.

Very nice guy. Material is easy to learn and he makes class interesting. There is usally a quiz every week, he lets you drop two. Exams are easy and very similar to the quiz. He can be intimidating at first, but very helpful. Offers extra credit and requires you to visit him in his office as part of your grade. Overall great teacher.
He's a really likeable guy, and quite the opposite of intimidating in class.  He's not always clear on assignments and due dates, so be sure and confirm what you think you hear.

Professor Maurer was my prof for advaced algos, and he has been the worst professor I have ever had. Professor leaves his average on HW and tests beneath a passing Grade. He does not respond to emails. Professor Maurer will put meterial on the exam we have not gone over yet, with the expecatation we study for material that is due after the exam

Advanced Algorithm by Maurer was one of the worst class I have ever taken. He doesn't give any assignments. Grades are solely based on exams. There were many classes when you couldn't understand a single thing.

Best Discrete Structures professor. Does a nice review before each exam. The tests are exactly like the review sheets. Forget about a test and flunked it, but since I made good grades on the other exams, he let the final replace my lowest test grade after some emails. Homework most every day but usually only 2-3 easy problems.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Reyes is very helpful and is very knowledgeable about subject area. It was a seven week course and for most part, it was manageable. He is lenient if you are struggling. Reach out to him! He will support you as much as he can.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: He has an ineffective teaching method, and he lectures the whole time with no visual aids or engagement  and the material is ambiguous. He does not use Blackboard (or Canvas), and he requires a group project that has barely any direction (and you also have to buy his own book).

He is not a hard teacher, the material however is hard. It is very boring although he does try to make it interesting. His class relies heavily on the books, you have to read a lot and be able to understand material fast. DO NOT TAKE HIS EARLY CLASS!! I took his 8am class. bad idea. Tests are over at least 5 chapters so be prepared for that.

He's really good at teaching. You will truly understand every single thing because he takes his time going through the material. The reading was dense but not quantitative so make sure you understand every paragraph of what you read. He does a lot of on the spot hypos which can be tough and cold calls are OFTEN. Pay attention bc he moves quickly.

Had him for the appellate advocacy course. He is a "no frills" kind of prof. He tells you what you need to know with a logical progression that is easy to follow. He is the kind of prof that allows you to see where he is going before he gets there because he lays his premises so clearly that his conclusion is obvious. Great for confidence.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Great Prof. Clear and thorough.
The tests are a guess on whats going to be on them. He's not very helpful in telling you what to study either. He just tells you read the book. Would not recommend taking him
take a camera to class and take pics of his slides. He doesn't post them. Some of the pics are on the test. very easy. If you take notes and study.
Knows his hydro, beyond that... he's not too helpful.

Great Professor! Genuinely cares for students (well-being/health/adaptability while in NY) as well as internship experience in NY. Personable, approachable, knowledgeable, helpful, insightful, etc. Great contact even after graduation. BCNY would not be the same with out Joe!
Horrible. Doesn't care about his students. Run!

Greatest guy in the world. Loves his students and knows alot about the city, he really wants the students to learn about what they are experiencing in New York at the time. The semester is very well organized and the opportunities that he sets up are incredible. I can't imagine anyone else in charge of the NY program.

He's a funny guy who keeps you engaged in class even if it is a larger class. He really takes your interests and your conflicts into consideration when forming his course. He's also a great teacher. I learned more about religion from him in 3 weeks than I have from years of CCD.
Amazing teacher!

Mr. Moser is an amazing teacher. He is very down to earth, and a totally chill guy that still asks monumental and deep questions that really get you thinking about the fundamentals of religion. He is very easy to work with, and if you do the readings and participate in class, you will get a great grade. All in all an amazing teacher!

Really nice!!! If you go to her office and just talk she will actually listen!! She is very helpful if you ask for help! She is the sweetest ad easiest prof at Baylor!!!! I took her at 8am and well worth it!! However lectures are really boring!
Great lectures.  Quizes are easy.  Will help with anything related to the class.
Very nice and understanding.  Most helpful professor on campus.
Very nice and helpful.
Not much help.

If you're trying to fulfill distribs in social sci, TAKE DR.KELLY! She's passionate about the material but her class is very easy, so many students were making As she changed her rules so you have to have a 93 for an A. But that's easy since if you do extra credit she adds 3 pts to your average. If you don't plan on majoring in sociology, take her.

The class is "How to cite." and how not to plagiarize. He repeated the same bit of information for the entire semester. Vote for reading quizzes, not outlines! Never goes over the readings, just expects you to read. There is no creativity in this kind of class - no choice in topics until the final 8-10 page research paper. I wouldn't take his class
Professor Leatham genuinely cares about getting to know his students and is willing to help them succeed. He gives great feedback on essays while still being encouraging.
He is very nice and helpful; i just suck at english

His class can be kinda hard. He goes over everything in class so there's really no point of doing the readings. but the tests are super hard and unpredictable, there will be questions on stuff you've never seen or heard before
Pretty easy professor if you pay attention...I never studied an made a B+

Doesn't matter how hard you study, his tests still have questions pertaining to things you have never seen before. No daily grades, only test grades. Doesn't count tardies. If you're late you're absent.
I LOVED Dr. Duke. She was clear in her lectures and always welcomed discussion. Her exams did test your knowledge so you do have to study, but she will go over them afterwards. A+++
Wonderful lady.  Her class is fairly easy but your only grades are your tests. (She does drop the lowest though.)  Her tests can be a little tricky, so study hard.

I would take her again if i could.  she is very nice and she keeps her lectures very interesting.  Tests arent bad at all as long as you study! It isnt your normal bio class.  It goes over more about current bioloy such as stem cell research and cancer.  TAKE IT

Taking this class was like paying Baylor University for the privilege of teaching myself physics. Since I took this as an online course, Park's lectures consisted of powerpoints with his voiced over comments. He worked out no problems and I learned practically nothing from him. He was better than my physics 2 professor at least.
this class made me rethink my career path
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Power point useless, lecture way too fast to understand and no review sheet for test.

While her class wasnt particularly difficult for me (I grew up in the church) I absolutely hated her class. She treated the Bible as a myth, as an untrue document that people cherished. I know one student who gave up their faith because of her. If you want a prof who believes the Bible, dont take her.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Get ready to read

comment: Smith was my favorite religion professor at Baylor! She does make us read a lot! If you think you will make it without reading the book and you know the bible soo well... YOU ARE WRONG!!! If you show up to class, read the book, and take GOOD NOTES then you should make it through the class with little to no problems.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very knowledgeable about history behind the bible, but brings into account lots of controversial questions. If you want your faith to be challenged, this is the professor for you. Avoids questions about faith, prefers to talk about facts. Although my class learned a lot from her many lectures, she didn't seem to believe a lot of what she taught.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great Professor. I love and practice my hebrew all the time to this day because of her.

Forlini Burt is so fun. She SCREAMS millennial but in the best way. She always plays music before class which always cheered me up for the 8 am I spent with her. Super easy class. The tests, are another story. They are extremely specific so take really good notes. Assignments are easy 100s too. Dont get the bible she tells you, i opened mine once.

If you like the Bible, take Dr. Forlini. She will challenge your faith. Assignments are easy 100s if you write decently. Tests are more difficult and very specific, study hard for those. If you take her Honors section, be sure you are reading ahead on the syllabus so nothing sneaks up on you. She gives interesting book assignments.

Horrible professor and frankly not a nice person. He would randomly start yelling at the class for the smallest things and always made you feel stupid if you didnt know something. A lot of people failed his class and the highest grade was a B. I really think he takes pleasure out of scaring and belittling students. Avoid him at all costs.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: rude, controlling for no reason, there's a reason he doesn't teach a Physics discipline
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: 100% the worst professor I've had.

Force is a sweetheart. At first she might deem a little awkward, but by the end of the semester youll understand that she cares about her students so much. I must admit, this class was hard and Ive been making art all my life! Be ready for lots of mixing paint and straight edges. It can be stressful but also therapeutic. The projects are fun!

She is great. The assignments require a lot of work. It isn't that they are difficult - she is so personable that the assignments don't feel like work. I would take all my classes with her if I could!
I really liked her, she's easy to talk to and and becomes a best friend. A little eccentric, but that adds to her charm.
Dr. C made calc clear and engaging, and he's always available to help. Very caring and understanding especially in office hours!
Nice prof - he's really clear about exams and quizzes and got us ready. Also really understanding in office hours. Too much homework tho

This was a really hard class. Homework was endless and there was a ton of stuff on the final, but Dr Christopherson definitely got us through it. His lectures are really clear. He's pretty understanding about everything and teaches old-school.
Dr Christopherson is a genuinely nice guy. He gives a lot of homework and tough exams, but he basically gives you all the info beforehand. Fast/fair grading and occasionally funny.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He is smart and has a good way of relating the information, his tests are not hard but he expects you to know the information. He is a good teacher to prepare you for real world science
Very unhelpful and boring-take anybody else

He is super smart about biology, and funny in a science nerd way. He doesnt care so much about attendance and is pretty forgiving with grades, he doesnt want to see anyone fail. He puts his notes online so u can bring them to class and add on what he says. I would take a class with him again.

He was a good prof. but I just hated the class.  He tried to make it fun, but it was just very hard to get into.  You have to take this class if you are an education major.  Just try your hardest to stay awake.  Question cards everyday was pointlss, but they where and easy 100.
No Comments

Church State Separation/Religious Liberty. The course is challenging. There's a lot of information to cover, but it's really interesting. If you study hard, no problem. We had three exams, and they were extremely thorough. The class is small and so conversations can get heated and fun. He wants dialogue from his students. A good professor.
Unprofessional and discouraging. Would not recommend to any social work students.

This professor is biased and unfair in her grading. She is very close minded in regards to her social work practice. She is extremely rude and unprofessional. This professor is condescending and not understanding. She is also unavailable when needed for help with internship. I received an A in this class but would not recommend the professor.

This professor is excellent. She is fair, understanding and tough. She is available outside of class if help is needed. She returns work quickly and efficiently with comments. I would recommend her to anybody.

Mr. Noble is a great teacher. He is one of the few english teachers that I've had that actually teaches material that is useful. The downside is that he is by far one of the toughest graders I've ever had. In previous classes, I was an A student. In his class, first essay I got a 54. Second, a 71. I would definitely advise taking a different prof.
This professor is really dreamy and a great teacher. i really recommend him.

It's not that he is a bad guy or even a bad teacher... cuz he is not. He is actually very nice. He just grades pretty hard. He is also a big stickler for department standards. The truth is... if you are good at writing essays you will probably do just fine in his class. If you are a less than average writer I would recommend taking somebody else.

Expects students to understand everything he has to say. To get participation points, you MUST take notes to turn in. Changes projects many times before it is due and is not clear about guidelines unless you ask a lot. Does not bother to learn student's names if you are in his 100 level classes. IS NOT CONSISTENT.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His lectures are long. I am constantly looking at the clock trying to will the time to move faster as his lectures are incredibly boring.

He believes that you can't have a perfect paper so receiving a 100% on any of his papers is impossible. Be prepared to be bored out of your mind in class staring at the clock willing the time to move faster.
Best professor around

Roberto is the best! He always makes class fun and interesting.  You will have several "quizzes" throughout the semester which are really like tests but they are never very hard and you will know exactly what is on them.  Definitely take him if you can!
Loved his class! Very good teacher and will make you laugh a lot. Would recommend over and over again. Pay attention and you will do fine!

If you can TAKE HIM. There is a decent amount of work you'll have to do weekly but most answers are on Quizlet, praise the Lord haha. He gives A LOT of extra credit, if you can do the majority of them (which is very much possible) it will help your grade a lot.

Professor Aguilar is very sweet. But I learned zero Spanish, and was not at all prepared for any of the tests and quizzes. I think the only reason that I got an A was the fact that he liked me and I did all of extra credit work, so he knew I was trying. It was stressful but I got my A, and you probably will too if you are kind and try hard.

Juilo Aguilar is an excellent Spanish professor at Baylor University. I had the pleasure of taking him for the Spring semester of 2017, and I wish I had taken him previously! SeÃ±or Aguilar works hard to help his students not only learn the material, but also understand it. I would recommend this professor to anyone who takes Spanish!

Very likeable professor. Mostly a continuous class structure with quizzes at the end of the week (kinda annoying). Requires Lockdown Browser. All tests and exams are online. Offers extra credit. Powerpoints kinda confusing at times.

DO NOT TAKE! He is very nice, but his tests are impossible. The class test average was 67 and my test average was 60. It felt like the tests had nothing to do with the lectures. I would study at least a week before and still get horrible results. It was extremely frustrating and would never take this class again in a million years!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is an absolute BEAST

such an easy class. one quiz every week, online, which is based off a short study sheet she gives which provides you with all the answers. super easy class as it was once a week but you only get 3 absences. assignments for the week were posted day after class and you had the whole week to do them. for the most part they took almost no time at all!

I took Dr. Howell for a mandatory one hour course. Essentially as long as you show up to lectures and do the assignments, you will get an A. Worth mentioning there are bi-weekly quizzes but Dr. Howell will give you a sheet that has all the questions on it, just watch the supplied videos and you'll find the answers. SHOULD NOT make below an A.

I've never had a teacher with so much bulls hit as homework. Only 20% is actually relevant to the class description. Baylor needs to find a teacher that is actually understanding for a required course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Best professor I have had, and ever will have. Cares so much for our success, it's apparent in the way she teaches and provides us opportunities to really have a chance in her class. She is not the type of professor to try and play tricks on exams. What she says is going to be on the exam is always on the exam, straightforwardly so.

Dr. Flavin is by far the best instructor I have ever had in my life and I don't believe that anyone will be able to take that position. She is the most caring teacher that I have ever encountered and it is very evident that she cares so much for her students. While the work in her class isn't the easiest, I would recommend anyone to take her

Was in the SPOC for 1387. Her lectures were helpful and well organized. She frequently reached out to check in on my progress, and constantly offered help. Very easy to get in touch with, would get back to you within minutes sometimes. Course was not hard either, so it let you enjoy the subject more, and on your own pace. 100% would take again.

Lectures are super interesting, Dr. Lawrence tells lots of really captivating stories. Your grade is solely based off of 4 exams. Research participation required. Get ready to read a lot! The material is super captivating though, so the readings not too bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Lawrence is a great professor overall. She will take something off the test if majority does not understand and will even sometimes give a curve. The only thing I did not like was that she only gave tests. 4 tests and the lowest is dropped. At the end of the semester your experiment participation credits will be added.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: She is the best. She always tells fun stories and makes class super entertaining. We rely mostly on notes, but she gives us the slides to do at home which is super helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a great professor. I took him for both MTH 1309 AND 1308. I truly dont know why he gets hate for being a grad student. If you pay attention in class and do the homeworks your going to be fine. If you have any questions he is always willing to help. He also give partial credit on exams and quizes as long as you show your work.

Amazing professor, I know a lot of people complained in my class because he's a grad student, but if you're paying attention and attending class you should be good. He gives partial credit on quizzes and tests. Tests were easy if you did the hw and studied, never scored below a 88. He asks for feedback and tries to implement it during the semester.

He shouldn't be a teacher. He is a graduate student and is unapproachable. Shouldn't be teaching this class period. If you get him as a teacher drop the class before you start, it isn't even worth it!

Took Fier his first semester as a professor, which could possibly explain his very sub par teaching. Most of the class failed most of the exams, except the very first one. During the final a girl literally started crying, I think that says more than enough about the professor and the class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Physics itself is hard and therefore usually not much fun, but dr. Fier makes it a good class and is a likeable person in general. He is good at explaining things and being clear so I highly recommend.

DR. FIER IS AMAZING HANDS DOWN! Although I struggle with calculus in general, he is very open to students asking him questions. Even though this was his first time teaching and he has room for improvement. He is one of the best Math professors Baylor has hired in a while. His lectures can be a bit confusing with a lack of calculus foundation.
Really fun class, perfect intro to the sport and its history. Taught me how to golf.
Professor Lenz is amazing and is very knowledgeable with regards to golf. He is patient and gives great advice and isn't out to grade you poorly on your skills tests.
Great teacher, straightforward, and easy. no textbooks, just study the powerpoints

Dr. Whitenton is THE best teacher/professor I've ever had. He really cares about his students and places more importance on mental health than on grades. He's just genuinely a good person. There are no tests in this class, which I love. The readings are dense but you'll get through it.

This man is one of the greatest Professors at Baylor and in the BIC. He gets it: the homework, the hard work, personal and academic stress. I'm not saying he just cancels things because it's "too hard" or you're "too stressed," but you honestly just want to make him proud. If you don't mind random awkwardness and talking about kids for a couple of minutes in class, he's great. If you want a professor who genuinely cares about you, he's amazing.

Prof. Whitenton is a great guy! I had him for both rel. classes  my first year& I learned so much from him that he inspired me to add religion as a minor. His classes are not easy, but they're not impossible. Just get to know  him, keep up with the work,& DO NOT pass up the study guides he creates for you in Canvas. He really does notice hard work.

She won't be your favorite teacher, let me start with that. She's good at teaching the material, but her personality is rude and arrogant. She doesn't like you to use your phone or go to the bathroom, she will be calling you out mid-class. There's no homework, but the tests are huge. I have to take her again I can't escape her, hopefully, you can!
She's fine. Memorize the entire lecture slides, including the pictures on them, and you're good. Out of pocket sometimes, makes class entertaining when the content is super boring.

Nice lady, sometimes unhinged, but it makes the class more interesting. Loves participation. The whole class is lecture and notes. Her tests aren't awful, mainly multiple choice, a few matching, a few short answer, usually not too bad. She is very strict about her lockdown browser, so make sure you follow every instruction. Pretty mid class.
BORING LECTURE!
No Comments

Prof. Umlauf is one of the best artists and professors in the Baylor art department.  It's a shame he doesn't catch any of the figure I and II classes, because I didn't get much out of those... also, he'll cut a little slack on lateness/absence/forgetting due dates, as long as it's within reason.
