On the first day of the semester, she will come off as extremely stern and strict. I believe this is to weed out the students who are not willing to do the work. She's very clean on instructions, and punctual on due dates. She is also very, very oragnized. This is not a blow off course, it require a lot of planning, and be prepared to work!
GREAT professor but it was NOT easy!  Very helpful and interested in her students.
No Comments
Like exercise. It's hard but there's a good feeling when you finish.
Exams are take home. First exam took everyone in class 20+ hours of crunch time to actually complete.
Great Class and an inspired instructor

Dr. Allman is a VERY good professor, and he is also quite intelligent. If you are interested in political theory, you need to take him. He is also very friendly outside of classes. His essay prompts are challenging, but that is because he demands that you engage in the reading and think for yourself.
No Comments

Pretty much everyone I spoke to in class agreed that Dr. Allman was only interested in his own interpretations of things. He was also stuffy and boring. He said "in the final analysis" about 5 times a day, and he used the word "problematic" as a NOUN. Any difference between two writers was fundamental; any similarity was a coincidence.

While her class was a lot, (we had a reading quiz due almost every class), the in-person lectures and class discussions made it all worth it. It was a lot of hard work and time put into the class, but if you're looking for something engaging and rewarding, I would highly recommend Dr. Hargrave's class. She seemed to genuinely care about us!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Hargrave is a very sweet but very demanding professor. During office hours, she is super helpful and her feedback is awesome. She truly does want you to succeed. However, she does have very high expectations. Her course has many reading quizzes and written assignments. She is very passionate and her lectures are interesting
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: You will have 36 quizzes during your time in this class. Most of the time you have one day to read 75 pages, amongst the other homework you have. This professor is a very nice person, however if you need a good grade DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. There are several other professors who teach this course and do not require 36 quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: ICE is a really nice professor, however I would not recommend taking her class if you are not fluent in spanish. Her tests are extremely difficult, the class average for her tests are always around Ds and Cs. Her pop quizzes are also very frequent and tough. Overall, I would never take her class again. be warned haha
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: She was an amazing teacher! The more you participate, the more you'll get out of it. Just make sure you know the vocabulary and you'll be good! One of my favorite teachers I've ever taken.

She wants students who don't need help in Spanish, and as a result, doesn't teach at all. I had to teach myself a language I didn't know. She is condescending if you become confused on a concept and overall just rude. No matter how nice you are to her, if she thinks you aren't good enough for her class, she won't like you. This class was miserable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Had over 50 homework assignments the first week between VISTAS and Canvas. Did not seem to care about students. Would not recommend, dropped ASAP.
One of my favorite teachers ever! Loved his lectures and gave off a very caring vibe. A good bit of homework, but it really helps your understanding. I would suggest this teacher hands down.

Professor Reyna was one of the hardest instructors I have ever had. He gives around 30 assignments in Vistas a week and expects them all to be completed by the time you get to class. His tests are all short answer and are extremely hard, and so is his grading. He is one of the hardest graders I have ever seen.

Mrs. Almeida is my favorite teacher! Her class is long, but she always has a good and positive attitude and tries to be as helpful as she can. During the final project, she came at night and helped us with our project. Her red lines on our drawings are extremely helpful. Would 100% take again!

Love her as a person. She is very kind and caring. However, her graphics I class is difficult. Lots of homework and late nights. She provides good critiques, but it can take awhile to get them back. The lecture portion of the class can sometimes feel like wasted work time. Her exercises are based on completion grade which helps a lot.

Professor Almeida is super sweet and by far the nicest professor in the Interior Design department. She helped me out a lot when my grade was struggling and she can tell when her class is tired and struggling with something. We never had to stay the whole time (3 hour class) and she's always willing to help outside of class!
Great professor and she helped me.
She is a great professor, she is currently teaching at Simmons College in Boston MA
No Comments
His class cured my depression.

Born of fire and brimstone (hence the unfortunate loss of his hair), Dr. Varda brings to us a sense of joy and wonder in the everyday. He exists to rages against both the machine and silly questions. His office exists as a thought-provoking piece of performance art which asks us, "what are possessions?". Believes jet fuet can melt steel beams.

Awesome class. Really smart and funny, very political and obviously excited about teaching.  Sometimes says things to shock the class, and then explains why his shocking statement is actually relevant. Tests not that hard, but VERY long over a HUGE amount of material.  Take him.

ONLINE SPANISH 2310.
First week he was very nice and patient. Attitude switched up immediately next week, and for the rest of the weeks he was very impatient, took his frustrations out on his students, and called students out, making the room uncomfortable. Passionate for his work, but heavily lacks patience and understanding.

Had him for Conversation & Composition, and he was great! He does pay attention to whether or not you are participating. He loves his students and really wants to make sure you understand what he's talking about. Homework is rarely graded, but you will go over it in class to review.
He is really nice, but he treats this elementary spanish class as an advanced class.

Reading due every class. Quizzes on Friday to test you on the reading. The exams were all free-response with maybe 3-5 multiple choice. Some Q's required parapgraph answers ; other Q's you answer in a whole essay for the exam bc she wanted to "test your understanding." I got an A, but I wouldn't take her again. It was too much work for a gen-ed.
I really liked the class, but if you are looking for an Easy A this isn't the prof for you
Pretty hard.  Spent a lot of time on my research paper.

Dr. Carr is GREAT! He was always willing to help and answered e-mails so quickly. He went to Baylor and has kids who go here, so he knows how hard it is and that students do have other stuff going on. He's super understanding and his class is NOT hard. Take him if you can!

Great professor who really knows his stuff, and wants his students to learn. It is not always easy, but this is the prof to take if you really want to learn. He also helps you bring your grade up if you need to...but you have to do the work. I got more out of his class than several other professors combined. I am glad I took him.

She is very condescending and passive aggressive. She smiles at you while she berates you. I truly believe she is smiling because she enjoys seeing others suffer. There is nothing you can do to. She is evil. She does not belong in education. Period. I with enough negative evaluations, the truth about her will come out and others can be spared.

What can I say other than she's evil.  She's rude, unprepared, unfair, and unjust.  She has no graded method in mind.  The only positive thing I can think of to say about her is, she smiles at you when she insults you! If you have her, God help you!

I find her to have gratuitous assignments, often require a lot more work (and attention to detail) than necessary to learn or demonstrate learning. She is helpful, though, and a good professor. Her classes are just designed to be somewhat tedious. This is in stark contrast to Preston Dyer's class design. All in all, a fair professor, though.

This professor is a great professor. She is sometimes unclear on instructions regarding assignments and does not mark things wrong on assignments but overall she is a good professor and this is a useful class.
Awesome teacher. She can synthesize the material and make the concepts easily understandable to anyone.
Great teacher! I had her in Maastricht and for Clinical Decision Making. Her section is really helpful and she is an amazing woman!
Good

There's a lack of teaching ability but (imo) it's due to cultural and linguistic barriers. During lecture, sometimes it's hard for her to explain things and when questions are asked, sometimes she misses exactly what the student asked. Overall, the book told me everything I know and her quizzes, labs, and projects reinforced the info pretty well.

Professor Tom was definitely a wonderful professor to have! His lectures were very interesting and he was very open to suggestions to improving the class even more. I definitely took away a lot from his class. His readings are online which is great and his test are very straight forward!

I absolutely LOVED this class. The professor was easy going and super helpful. He is funny and really enjoys what he does and cares about each and every student.  I didn't think much of this class before I took it but it is by far my favorite class I have ever taken.

He is such a great professor. He is extremely knowledgeable and super nice. You can tell he really wants his students to do well. His teaching is very clear. Tests aren't tricky but I mean it's Latin, you have to work at it (a lot). He is just awesome. Take him!
Great professor, extremely nice and funny, describes everything well and tests are clear and straight forward. Classes can be boring, but then again, it is latin :P

She is a wonderful professor. She is funny, and keeps you on your toes. The class is easy, with minimal reading. I would have got a better grade if I had read for the quizzes.. but I had fun, there is a huge group project that is SO fun, but she gives a few extra credits is you need it (you wont tho) TAKE HER! you will love her.

TAKE HER!!!! She usually only teaches at Baylor during the Fall semester. She is very helpful and gives extra credit. Tests are not really hard if you "front load". A quiz is usually due before every class to avoid procrastination when its time for tests. I transferred so this was one of my 1st classes to take&I really enjoyed it!! You learn alot!!

Cooper is a great resource- you need to take this class! She is very helpful and will bend over backwards to give you ideas and all the help she can. Although attendance isn't mandatory she will rate your professional development grade based on this. But you should definitely go to class just because it's fun and really engaging.

If you do all the work and go to class, it's an easy A!  Dr. Cooper doesn't believe in tests, so your final exam is a project.  Everything you do in Dr. Cooper's class is fun!  She gives you great ideas for teaching math!  She's always willing to offer ideas for activities you can teach!  She's a great teacher!  I would recommend her!
He's hard to understand and the material's even worse. No free thinking or room for creativity. Skips steps to save time. I always walked in that room more confused than when I entered.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class is incredibly hard. His lectures are bland, and seemingly straight out of the book; not to mention understanding him is on another level of difficult. He is a "pretty cool" guy, but by no means is a professor I would ever want again. With averages in his class at about a 50, I say don't chance it with him.
Great teacher. Very knowledgeable and approachable if questions need to be asked. One of the best classes I took at Baylor.
Very knowledgeable, and an all around fun guy. I highly recommend taking his class if you want to learn something without having to waste your life studying
Dr. Baker's the sweetest! But don't let that fool you, her tests are insane.
No Comments

I found Lori to be very approachable and pleasant to interact with, and quite funny at times. She is clearly passionate and well versed in the topic, and she really made the course work relevant and meaningful. Though this course required a lot of work and was challenging, I would gladly take another class from her.
She is passionate about the subject, but not very approachable. Her responses to questions tend to be unhelpful and downright rude sometimes.
This guy knows his business. So practical and real.
This dude rocks take him if you go to Truett. I think you have to.

Take Crawford if you want to write a lot.  Don't take her if you want an easy A.  She'll go out of her way to help you if you need it but she won't baby you.  She likes to talk about science and current events, not just English stuff.

Take Crawford if you want to think hard and write a lot.  Don't take her if you want an easy A.  She'll go out of her way to help you if you need it, but she doesn't baby you. She talks about science and philosophy and current events, not just English stuff.
Dr. King is absolutely my favorite professor I have ever taken. He will help you any chance he gets, and he is extremely passionate about his work. If you can, please take his class!

A friendly, knowledgeable professor who hasn't let his success in academia go to his head. Gives very thorough and helpful feedback on assignments and is great at leading thought-provoking class discussions. Grades are based on class participation, a presentation, an annotated bibliography, and a seminar paper. Take his classes - they're worth it!
I love her so much. she is very sweet, patient, and she even canceled class before thanksgiving break and for homecoming.

Amazing ballet instructor. She even has her own studio. Very helpful, and patient. As long as you attend classes and put forth the effort, you're going to make a great grade. She reviews all the topics that will be on the tests and hands out reviews about a week prior to all quizzes and tests.

Dr. Aguilar is a great professor. I took him because I heard he was the best professor for Spanish 1 at Baylor. He explains the material very well and the assignments are reasonable. If you have the chance you should definitely take him!

Dr. A is a helpful professor. His style of teaching makes the class enjoyable for all students, those native like myself and those majoring. Beyond class he truly cares about his students & is always answers any questions sent via email in less than 5 mins. I would highly recommend!!

(I don't know if this is even the same teacher but they have the same name.) Man I had one class with her and her class seems scary, what she was going through in her syllabus seemed like so much work and seemed like too much stress, I don't know I really didn't get the chance to know the class but it just didn't feel right for me

Professor Chin is actually a really good professor. She did a really good job of transitioning to online learning. She is very fair and if there are ever any mistakes in an answer key, she will give back points. She gives lots of extra credit and if you do it, you should do fine in her class.

Dr. Johnson is AMAZING!!!! I've taken sociology in HS so I wasn't too excited about taking it again. But she made it soo much more interesting and is very understanding when listening to everyone's views. I'd take sociology again and again as long as she is teaching it! Show up, pay attention and you are GOLDEN! Truly an easy A!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She's super sweet and her class is super easy. You'll do great on tests as long as you show up and pay attention. I don't find the subject very interesting but she made sure her classes were somewhat interesting.

Profesor Moquin is not a bad professor, but this priciples of Information Class at NSU is not really about learning IS, it is learning about writing and being "professional." He makes jokes that are not funny and gets in your face to answer questions. If he wants participation, he should make it a grading point, not make it forced. Easy class overa
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you hate group work then you will hate this class. You do six group projects over the course of the semester with the same group. The class is an easy A but you have to work for it. Your main points come from the projects so you have to do good on those. Group evaluations at the end of the projects with heavily influence your grade.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Van brings nearly 40 years of consulting expertise to this course. It is heavy with content & reading - most of the quiz content is straight from the text. The exams & projects require you to think out of the box & work with a group just like we did in our careers before & after MBA. He hosts useful & lively discussions & I use his pointers today.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: This was one of the most assignment heavy classes I have taken in the MBA program. Most of the work wasn't difficult, but the volume made it hard to keep up at times. The quizzes are easy and straight out of the book. In my opinion, the group project for this class was way outside the scope of information we covered which made it quite stressful
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Quizzes every week. Exams weredifficult, but were fair game bc she only tests what's on the study guide. Sometimes she'll tell you what will be on the exam at office hours. Extra credit problems on every exam & EC if you go to recitations. Biochem is a hard subject, but Lahousse is a great teacher and her class is helping me prepare for the MCAT.

Dr. Lahousse is a great professor. Lec and tests in person. Her exams consisted of multiple choice, T/F, and free response. You had weekly quizzes and she also provided homework to practice on how she would question you on the exam. She also provides practice exams. She is amazing, and I wish I could take her for 4342.

Run away from this Professor, she is not good and barely taught our class anything. If I were you I would take any other professor because this lady only reads off of websites and is not remotely helpful.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ramon lectures a lot, her quizzes are WAY harder than her tests. She reads you the test word for word before you take it. She was absent a lot during my time w/ her. Extra credit is offered but if you miss the class when it is given out then your out of luck.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Super easy class if you pay attention to what he tells you to study for the exams. The final exam questions were literally the same exact questions from the first 2 exams. He's super nice. since we only met once a week, attendance was mandatory and a grade. Easy A

Lewis is super nice. He works full time at the bank so he understands that no one wants to spend alot of time studying for this class. He told us exactly what would be on the exams. As long as you study the list he tells you the night before, it should be an easy A.

Burris can be a challenge, but it is worth it. He is a hilarious professor who strengthens my love for learning. I recommend going to office hours because Burris likes knowing his students. Greek Intro was my fav class this semester!

Very good lecturer who deeply loves his craft. Heavy work load with quizzes or test each Friday. Test are 3 "midterms" and 1 final and 12 quizzes. I did not have the time to learn the material, but I really enjoyed the class.
I really enjoy taking this sociology by Professor Davignon! I have learned so much!

Great professor, cares about class and students. Did not have to buy a book. Class is straightforward and not hard. He does take attendance and makes you turn in a reflection notebook. Explains material clearly, offers extra credit, ppts posted online, gives a review before the exam. Exams were mult choice and short answer. Good class, great prof.

She is a very nice professor she just does not seem to relate well to students as a professor. She lacks understanding when talking with students and is unclear in directions on assignments. But she also has a lot of experience and should be gotten to know as a professional.
She is a fun and interesting teacher. She keeps things interactive. She is a little unclear on assignments, but overall I like her as a teacher.
shes too uptight
She is a great professor, she helps if help is needed, she is passionate about spanish which is great! She explains the material clearly and precisely so you do not get confused. I love this class!
Rude and not helpful. Treats questions like a waste of time and treats people like useless morons.

Duran is a terrible professor.  She is useless and you will not learn a thing in the class.  It's a three hour class, but we probably were there less than one hour a week.  It IS an easy A though.  If you want to learn how to NOT teach social studies, this is the class for you!

Dr Hoover is the history teacher I always wish had in high school. Instead of a list of names, dates, and religious dogma, his lectures are chapters in an engaging story. I went into the class expecting to be bored out of my mind, but I loved it.   The class is very easy if you pay attention, read, and take basic notes.   Quick responses on email.
Only makes you write a 6 page semester paper but overall very easy class. Just make sure to read before you take the quizzes in class.

She's such a sweet lady, but god awful boring, you basically go to a class of 500 ppl, with dim lights and powerpoints she goes over for and hour or so... Horrible for 8am class, hard if you don't have a good bio foundation, test are unpredictable, you basically teach yourself by reading the chapters, all in all ok quality.

Ms. Hill is really interested in the subject, and she tells a decent amount of interesting stories in class. I just studied the powerpoints and made an A. She drops lowest and you get a free 100 exam grade if you turn in the 4 worksheet assignments.
Extremely rude and condescending. Made me cry multiple times for things were not my fault. Has no idea how to treat students with respect.

He may come across angry or mean sometimes, but I'm pretty sure he doesn't mean it..... I think.  He wants you to learn the material so if you skip class or show up late he will feel disrespected and you will cause the class to take a timed pop quiz.  He gives great feedback, he will joke around to make the class more interesting.

An awesome teacher that honestly cares about her students. If you are not doing well she checks with you to find out why and how you can turn it around. I felt like I learned this stuff really well and I would remember it after the class was over. The speakers were great. She's quirky & fun. It was my favorite class this semester.

Mrs. George is really interesting and she's funny. She has worked in IS a long time and has great stories to tell. She has lots of speakers from industry talk to the class remotely, which is interesting. I heard how boring 3305 was but it ended up being my favorite class.
Love this professor! All other students love her as well. Lots of work, but worth it! Learned so much!

She doesn't tell you how to write. She says oh follow the inverted pyramid and you will be fine. She might give you an example. She grades harder as the semester goes. Like all writing professors they are highly subjective and even after getting help still gives me bad grades and I destroyed ap English courses in high school.

Great teacher! She knows everyone on a personal level and we can talk about anything in class. Not the best at explaining things, but the class is pretty easy. Lots of daily grades. No tests/quizzes, just essays.

I had lots of fun in this class. Some people complained that she graded hard on the essays, but as long as you thoroughly explain your points/evidence you should do fine. I got an A and i don't consider myself a good writer at all. She's also attractive and laid-back/fun.

Professor Klein is an amazing teacher. Her lectures are very easy to understand and she also provides online lectures that correlate to what we work on during class. She is so caring and will give you all the help you need if you ASK for it. Quizzes and exams are not too difficult if you take good notes during lectures. Side note: She is hilarious!

Dr. Klein's lectures do not correlate with questions asked on the test. During her lectures, she often goes off on tangents. She did not clarify questions on the tests. I went to meet with her multiple times to see how I could improve. She told me I had nothing to worry about in her class. I now have to retake the same course. Very disappointing.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Great. Homework is very similar to exams, meaning Exams were quite easy. However, like any math course much of it is figure it out yourself and reliant on mastery of homework problems
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Good teacher- nice and helpful, but is more work than some others. Also, he makes your final worth 40% of your grade, yet he doesn't even make that final because they are departmental. You take the same final as all the other business majors, yet yours is twice as crucial to your grade. Don't take him- your grade is determined by the final

Professor Goniprow is a great guy. His class is super easy and he doesn't give many assignments. You'll get a few quizzes over the assigned readings but he gives you key points after lectures and you can find all of the answers in those.
Absolute legend of a professor
She is not really accessible outside of class. She is a tough grader and not a great teacher in my opinion.

The subject matter was kinda boring but its a required research methods course so its not really her fault. As long as you show up to class and pay attention its pretty easy to do well. Would definitely take her again

If you have the option to take PSC 1387 as an Honors contract rather than an Honors section, do it. Dr. Corey assigns at least 1-2 hours of reading per class period. Tests are hard to study for because she asks such specific questions. Class is discussion-based, there will be quizzes almost every period. Tests include a timed essay, handwritten.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Corey is great!  Class discussions are stimulating for people on both sides of each issue.  I learned more in her class than any at Baylor so far.

If you want to get a good grade you need to read the textbook CONSISTENTLY. Also, take notes according to his learning objectives because that's what you'll be expected to know. There's no drop test which is kinda sad, but overall, Dr. Miles is a kind, and very interesting, human being (and his office is cool :)
p.s I had him for Bio 2306 not 1305
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Miles is a phenomenal teacher!!! He describes biological processes in a clear manner that is very easy to understand. I would like him to be my professor again in the future.
Very Nice Person. Somtimes gets into crazy derivations during lectures but test arnt to hard and homwork over prepares you.

Professor Julius was the most amazing professor I have ever had hands down. He is incredibly kind and knowledgeable about the subject. He is also extremely accommodating and understanding of any situation you may have. He does great review if you ask him and is open to suggestions on what to cover in lecture if you are ahead of schedule. TAKE HIM!!

Okay, things to know about Prof. Bailey. Super smart guy but he assigns a lot of busy work. He will either respond to your email within two minutes or not at all which is super annoying. I once had an assignment that was a day late due to internet and I emailed him to which he did not respond only to find out months later he gave me a 50.

Prof. Bailey was a heavy lecturer so if that is your learning style then you should do fine. His classes are rarely interactive. He gives pop quizzes on reading but usually tells you if there is one, or does something more fair if the reading is intense. You only grades are 2 tests and 10 quizzes and the option to write a 5 page paper for EC
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Drew Anderson can come off a little nerdy at first but he is a super nice guy truly wants everyone to do well. Super available and literally loves talking about math so he is helpful in office hours. I never took Calc in high school, and Calc is a tough class no matter what but if you put effort in you can succeed in his class.

I had him during his first year of teaching. He is a quirky guy and a little awkward, but I would totally take the class again. He seems intense at first, but it's just because he really does want all of his students to do well. He is very available for office hours and flexible review sessions for the final. He prepared our class well for final.
worthless... "i don't take questions, i only give them".

Overall a good professor.  He gives a good amount of partial credit on tests and has review sessions before all of them.  Has an italian accent but not hard to understand.  Fairly young and personable, we talked about call of duty in class a couple of times.  Probably the best math teacher I have ever had.

Beware of this, Professor- I had many issues just trying to attend his class because he was boring, his class brought no real value, in my opinion, and he was a harsh grader on two papers. For the majority of the class, he will talk about himself and how great he is because he is an author. If you are great at writing papers, you should be fine...
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Sharp is a great professor but also a great guy. I've never had actually good critiques on my papers before but he often wrote over a paragraph with really solid tips. He also sent out an individual email to me at the beginning of the semester to get to know me which was great to see. He really cares for his students and it shows.

Where to begin. He almost never lectures on anything relevant to the topic, and his tests are irrelevant, pulling questions that have little to do with anything learned from the book out of a test bank, which you can probably find online somewhere. He also is really bad about getting grades back and makes you stress over them till the last second.

Doesn't explain anything, curves downward,people actually making 90% on exams receive B's.  Only top 5 grades in the class receive A's.  No point in coming to class, he explains nothing, just read the book to get through the tests.  Brags way to much (ie about his tests being hard, about the cost of his house, his stock etc.)
do not take

He is VERY sarcastic.... REALLY rude at times as well. He is a hard grader when it comes to tests/quizzes... be sure to label the axes on a graph and plot your points to a T.. he's anal about numbering each point.
She will teach you Latin! She is an incredible teacher.

Dr. Dyson does not often grant favors or freebies.  By taking this class, you understand that you must already be a genius in Latin, or that you will work very hard for an A. Best thing I can say about her, she's fair.  Other than that, she is indeed a good rolemodel for a hardass :-D
No Comments

Boring class! I made a B in it, and never paid attention in class. Its an easy class, but if you actually want to learn, or be entertained while you are being taught at all, don't take her. I'm not sure how the other environmental science teachers are, so if you want to be safe, you can take her.
DD brought me from someone who was basically self taught to someone who can teach at any level.  She answered all my questions.  She encouraged me to ask questions and to learn.

DD has been like my mom.  I credit her for the musician I have become. I came in not really knowing anything about my instrument and left with a better understanding and knowledge than others attending other schools (big & small, public & private).
Substituted academic discourse with personal political opinion. Often ad hominem attacks on more accomplished professors and scholars who disagreed with him suggest professional jealousy.

He speaks at a much more elevated level than is necessary and is rather unclear with his assignment expectations, but is definitely a smart, kind, and personable guy. Read the assignments, pay attention in class, and make friends with your peers. Most of the students taking the course are like minded...enjoy the safety of expression.

If you keep up with the assigned readings and follow what he says in class, you should be fine. There is a quiz given and the beginning of class almost every day and his tests are a mix of M/C, short answer, and essay(s).
If you do the readings and keep up with the lectures you should be just fine. His tests are all multiple choice.

Dr. Brown was a great professor! Be sure to attend all SI sessions you can! He was very fair with his grading. The only reason I did not make an "A" is I traveled on a weekend before a test and made a "C" on it. Study for the tests and do the homework and you can make an "A". I ended with a mid B and I had a bad test calculated into that! TAKE HIM!

I love Owen! He's so cool! He's young. We're not quite sure how old he is exactly but he's young. He has real world experience. Loves college football and accounting puns.  I'm a marketing person and I'm still doing well in his class. I put in the hours, though.  Get to know this professor and you'll be sad when the class is over.

I love Dr. Willoughby. He is seriously the best. If you're pursuing a ex phys degree or something similar, he is the KING. I took his Anatomical Kinesiology class during summer and it was an easy A. Not to mention he's incredibly nice and cool and attendance or buying the book was NOT mandatory.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: He's not the greatest at explaining things, but he knows that. All of his tests are take home, and they aren't the extremely hard kind of take-home exams. If you need a couple of extra days after the due date for exams, he'll give them to you. He's an awesome guy, and he's definitely more of a mentor than a professor.

She is a good professor, but I feel that she uses too much Chinese for introductory level classes. It is great for upper level courses, but when 1401 and 1402 are spoken in almost all Chinese, many students have problems. A lot of people have said that they don't understand most of what she says. The students who already speak it are relied on.

I have taken every Chinese class with her! This professor is truly a caring, hardworking woman. She has a clear passion for the language, and tries her best to instill that passion onto her students. Attendance is somewhat mandatory. Basically you can skip based on university standards, but she grades attendance into "effort and participation."

Professor Bias is wonderful, definitely one of my favorite from at Baylor! He keeps things very interesting. Attendance is definitely mandatory. Lectures are straight from the book but do not rely solely on power-points,reading over the chapter helps. Test are straightforward.
Super nice guy with fair tests and quizzes. You have to go to class though, since his TA takes attendance every day.
His lectures are interesting and fun. He is available outside of class and is willing to work with students so they do well on the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Holznienkemper is a great teacher. He's pretty funny and wants everybody to do well. He grew up in Germany so he knows what he's talking about and he's younger so he relates well with the students. Yeah there's work, but its not stupid or unnecessary. There's lots of practice, and its totally doable. Definitely one of the best options for 1401.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took Lamb for Mountain Biking life fitness. He is super cool and caring and encouraging. Mountain biking book you had to read and fill out tests, but it only took 4-5 hours (best to do with a buddy) the final was just questions from the book and was a take home final. Out on the trails every week was a ton of fun. Best life fitness.

It is not at all necessary to have any golf skills before taking this class, and it is fun either way. He is awesome, and funny, and  just looking to have a good time. You mostly play golf games. Grades are a few worksheets from his book and the skills tests, which aren't bad and you can take them until you get an A. DEFINITELY take Ray Lamb
Very impressed with himself. Career academic lecturing on what businesses are doing wrong. Assigns busy work, is a rule-follower, and is petty.
Fun class

I had Prof Strecker when he taught at Baylor. He was one of my favorite professors freshman year! I took him for both of the required religion classes and enjoyed both! You did have to do the work and study but he was so helpful! He would meet with us at night and have study sessions with our class! He has 3 kids!! He was the best!

Strecker has quizzes at the beginning of each class that accounts for a good amount of grades. It's hard to learn from him b/c he often asks the class what they thought about the reading and doesn't always clarify. He has wonderful attitude toward the scriptures but this class requires a TON of reading and tests are extremely difficult.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: So nice!

This is not your typical college course. Starts class with the news, then teaches the material from powerpoints that show the main words you should know, as he talks through and explains the material. Attendance and note taking are key in order to capture the information. 3 tests total and 2 papers -->not difficult if you follow instructions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Spinks is the best Spanish teacher I've had! He's very knowledgeable and caring. He's an honest grader but will help you get better. He learns his students' names and really helps you improve your Spanish if you want to be fluent. The only downside is that he doesn't teach upper levels! :(

Dr. Spinks is a wonderful professor. He has an unmatched love of Spanish and it really shows. He truly wants you to advance in language learning and he explains the material very well. I 100% recommend him to anyone, especially for accelerated Spanish. He demands a lot of his students but it is completely manageable. Great guy!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: The class is easy itself so an A is really easy to obtain. You have to read the book before coming to class, a pop quiz might happen at any time. Lots of cooperation and group projects to encourage engagement and teamwork. Also, she will not allow taking photos of the lecture, and she goes through the slides really fast, so be ready to take notes!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Shes very outgoing and personable. Shes a little weird, but if you can get over that its an easy A if you show up

Kristi Humphreys is the sweetest. I've always hated English, but she actually made it a good. In the research writing class, there's a theme that you work on all semester. My semester was happiness. We wrote 3 total essays on the theme of happiness. All the class periods are solely to work on your essay. She gives you feedback so you can get A's.
Super easy grader.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very thorough course. Be prepared to read ALOT. Weekly attendance and participation are essential.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Super serious professor. She is a tough grader for the written assignments. She is very particular around language used in videos. You definitely learn a lot in her class but sometimes it can be a bit too much.

I cannot say enough good things about Dr.Garcia. Everyone at Baylor complains about Christian Heritage and how difficult it is, but she made it a breeze. You have weekly quizzes that are open note, and three exams. The final is not cumulative and her tests are super easy. She's also super fun in class and always lets you out early!

Crazy lectures, hard to pay attention to because shes always all over the place. Has a really great heart and definitely cares about student comprehension but shes just always bouncing from topic to topic. Genuinely really kind but just hard to listen to. Lots of readings but I've never actually read. Quizes are pretty simple, hard tests.

Theres a quiz before each lecture, make sure to do it! Theyre usually fairly easy. As someone whos not Christian, if you pay attention in class and take good notes you should be good. Not strict, drops like 5 quizzes at the end, exams are fairly easy. Nice guy. Would recommend.
No Comments
Dr. Gackle is such an inspiration and good spirit to be around. She makes learning music fun and performing it impactful!
She is great! She has such a passion for music and is so funny! Class is always fun!
Was a great professor

This class was one of my favorite classes my freshman year. Mr Milic is from Germany, but his accent is not difficult to understand. He is very accommodating and really cares about his students. This class was a pre-rec I had to take for business, and even though MIS is not the field of study I want to go into, he made it fun. He also is hilarious.
Mike Umble was probably the best professor I wish I has listened to. Amazing classes, respectable, honest, caring, tough... Wish I could go back and take better notes

Dr. Umble is an amazing professor. He make the class easy. His tests (25 multiple choice) are hard. Study your class notes you should do ok on the problem. You have to read/skim the Boring book too b/c he ask questions from there.  Oh, and there is a project which isn't too hard just make it interesting because your classmates grade you. Umble=Grea

Professor Holt is one of my all-time favorite professors! She is young and easily relatable. She makes class fun even for an English class. She's the kind of professor that tries to get to know her students personally and I found great comfort in that.  Ms. Holt is very knowledgeable and therefore grades hard. Not a blow-off but can achieve an A.
She's the best
Almost all the in class assignments are done as a group and the quiz is very similar to the assignment :) Super Nice Lady, Loved her!
Looks like a crazy old lady, but she's actually very sweet and even funny.  The material is super easy and she makes sure you understand. Great professor! HOMEWORK NOT MANDATORY
No Comments

Dr. Cassidy assigns lots of work!!!  If you put effort into everything, you'll get an A for sure.  She's a tough grader, but it's definitely worth it.  Her class will definitely prepare you for the future!  Take DC!  She's a great teacher and is always willing to help you out!!
She's a pretty great Japanese teacher. She's friendly, humorous, and a great resource to have when it comes to learning the culture.

Prefume Sensei is an extremely caring and wonderful teacher.  She really is concerned about her students learning, and is always more than willing to help them.  Overall, she's quite a fantastic teacher
Does not teach the material. She puts text from the book on slides, then reads from the slides. Does not answer student questions. Talks about her opinions more than any other professor.
Entertaining, obviously enthusiastic about the material, makes the material interesting, funny
No Comments
No Comments
She is very nice and she make 8am class bearable.
Professor Bahnsen is a wonderful professor who truly desires for all her students to succeed and to learn.  I highly recommend taking her for business calculus!  I wish I could take her again!

It was a tough class but definitely fair. He made the class enjoyable. If there was ever any discomfort at any time, it was self inflicted by my own inadequacy. Would take a class by him again if given the chance.

I'm not an artist at all, so I found his class EXTREMELY difficult and tedious. But for those of you that like art, you might find him interesting but don't expect an A. I think there was like  1 in my whole class.
Explains very well. Passionate.
He really cares that everyone learns econometrics. The class is very hard but rewarding. He is very knowledgeable about the subject.

DON'T take Winters. She doesn't reply to emails, grades exams 2-3 weeks later, and does not teach. You have to watch her videos and take notes before class. During class, she just answers questions. A LOT of homework and quizzes every week. The exams were SO HARD and nothing like her study guides. Be prepared to pay for a tutor and teach yourself.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Professor Winters is a terrible teacher. She is sarcastic and takes weeks to grade every single assignment. If you look on BUBooks she is rated pretty high, but don't listen to that. She gives unrealistic amounts of homework and does NOT curve tests at all, even though someone got a 4 on one. She never apologizes for her mistakes either.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Only interested in students who can help advance her agenda. Cancels class more often than she is present.
Ra! Ra!  Good at talking and doing.  Musical skills??????
Great professor!

Professor Cole is an amazing professor, do not miss out on taking her as a professor! She is incredibly understanding, gives real life examples of models, and encourages class participation in a caring way.

Dr. A was good. Has all readings on Canvas so no need to buy textbook. One weekly writing response, two vocab quizzes and two papers for the whole semester. His lectures were Amazing and he is a pretty easy grader. I recommend.
Dr. Alvarez is a good professor. 2 papers and  2 vocab quizzes throughout the semester, and a 250-300 words reading response every week. It's a history class so expect to read a lot!

His tests are unpredictable because he does not use the textbook to make them. He uses the tiniest, most minuscule details from his slides and also comes up with random application based questions. I only had to take him for half of a semester but it was definitely an awful beginning to freshman year considering how apathetic he was.
Tough but a great prof. You will learn a lot!

Hafertepe is clearly well versed in American decorative arts and architecture, but he hasn't worked in a museum in a very long time and it shows in how he covers content. He lectures using powerpoints that haven't been updated since the mid 2010s. He won't teach you anything practical.
He doesn't care about the students

Professor Zinke is incredibly kind and caring. I had him for the summer session of OChem II. He genuinely cared about our success enough to have test review sessions with us before each exam and worked to make himself available. The class wasn't easy and there was a lot of work involved, but he made it a lot less stressful than it could have been.
He is there to help you, but not a good professor. Doesn't explain concepts in detail. reads the notes and solves the problems.

Probably nice in person, but the worst online professor I have had. Didn't give much grace for how difficult it is to learn a foreign language online and made so many of the assignments due before any instruction, only causing confusion and frustration. Would not take again!

Professor Kisacky is very, very nice. The best way to keep up with the material is to do the homework, even though she usually won't collect it. Go to class, participate, and you should have no problem getting an A.
Classes are almost pointless. Takes all exam info from the book, very detailed
He's an amazing professor! you will remember him forever :)

Crews is a nice guy and he doesn't ask too much of his students. His quizzes are kinda hard and require that you read but there aren't that many throughout the semester... His class is pretty boring, however he does occasionally tell a joke or two. He does sometimes call students out during class if no one will answer the question. Not too hard
Loved him. The class is hard with any professor just because you have to write liek 6 papers. But he's an easy grader and isn't super picky about citing your sources and all that.
He showed me the american dream. I took it online. He post live videos from work.

Professor Mir is one of the hilarious man i ever encountered on campus. The man is a pure genius. Good class for international students because he does not know a thing or two about english. He makes up his own stories. His translations are epic! Take him if you want a easy grade. He works 2 jobs so does not grade papers. Just say " You lost it"

I took this guy for 1302 and liked him so I decided to taken him again for 1304. Biggest mistake of my life. His "lectures" are incredibly pointless, and he assigns grades carelessly. If you can, try to take someone else. You won't enjoy this class.

His grading was terrible and he was super vague. He didn't even grade fairly. His lectures has nothing to do with the essays and he gave out crappy participation grades to EVERYONE.  On our first essay, he failed everyone. The final research paper sounds for 50% of your grade, so if you don't pass it you fail the class. I won't take him again.

super smart guy so doesn't explain things very simply/well.  you can go ask for help/he's willing to help, but he'll repeat the same things over again.  doesn't do many/if any examples in class, so you have to kinda learn the homework problems on your own.  tests actually aren't too difficult though; you just have to know what you're doing.

Gives daily quizzes. Not good at explaining concepts. Gives no example problems in class, so you'll be lost during homework. Read the book if you wan't to pass or understand anything. Really nice guy though.

10 chapters w/ only 5 hrs of lecture, so you are expected to understand entire chapters based off of 30 min per chapter (some much less, some more).  Feedback from instructor is non-existent and if you ask questions you are directed back to the videos for solutions.  Expect self teaching, ask other students, God help you if you are not math savvy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. McElroy is great. Really nice guy. Good teacher.
short reading quizes every day but very easy
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: A very nice woman & a good teacher. She's passionate about the subject and explains the material fairly well. There's a lot of reading though and the tests are long due to the essays. However, often she will share the essay prompts days before the test so students can prepare. Do the reading & you will get good grades.

Boring, monotone lectures.  Too much emphasis on tests.  Could have been an interesting class, but she did her best to bore the heck out of us all.  Doesn't seem very interested in teaching.  Sometimes didn't remember what day it was on the syllabus.  Just glad I got this class over with.  Not worth the money I paid.

She is very nice and really knows her stuff. She has a lot of information and she makes sure to cover everything in her powerpoints. I didn't really read the book, I just went by her powerpoints and that got me through. The first test was really easy and the second test was really hard. If you ask for help she will help. Kind of monotone at times.
Dr. Scales cares about you.  She helps students find their callings.  Every grad student should take her before becoming a teacher of record. Her course will set you up for life after grad school.

Well thought out assignments, not just busy work.  Class time was spent covering materials related to reading and assignments.  Thoughtful lectures by instructor.  Enjoyed writing papers to apply theories instead in just memorizing theories for a test.  Also enjoyed group interview work.

This was my first French class at Baylor, and I absolutely loved it! I was out of class for a week since I was in the hospital, and he was so understanding. Also, he taught the material in a way that was easy to understand. Highly recommend!
No Comments
Great!
No Comments
She is the most down to earth prof I had at Baylor, Def one of my favs, the class itself isn't easy but she makes sure you know what to focus on and what to take away from the course in general.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--CARES ABOUT STUDENTS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved her. Her tests can be kind of difficult but if you go in during her office hours she will explain everything. She is very fun and quirky, kind of like a mad scientist (in a good way). The class is just basic chemistry, it felt like my high school chem class. I would definitely recommend taking her. The class isnt too hard to get an A in.

JoJo is an amazing professor who is able to balance teaching and mentoring her students extremely well. Her projects are very beneficial for the work you will be doing inside and outside of Baylor. All of her classes are worth taking, as they allow you to be artistic while challenging you at the same. She is very talented in her art form as well.

JoJo is great! You get a lot of hands on projects (which is the best way to learn), however paperwork projects can be stressful. She gives great feedback! and if you half ass something because of time she won't be little you for it, she'll  just say "Hey you need to work on this"
Carlos Manzanares is a truly caring and knowledgeable professor, class is hard but if you go to class every day and do homework you'll be fine
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: He's really nice and a good teacher. His class is difficult because it's chemistry, but if you keep up with the homework and lecture you'll be fine.
I loved this class and this professor. I 100% advise to take it.

Had him his first year at Baylor. Awesome Professor! Really chill! Only 2 essays a midterm and a final. Take him you wont regret it. This is a class where you actually learn instead of only focusing on grades.

Best Accounting Professor! I loved him! If you go to lectures and SI you should do overall well in the class. Also, if you get above a 90 on homework assignments for the chapter then you get 5 extra points on your tests. There is also redos for tests where he will average your test score if you don't do good. Tests are pretty much all of our grade.
Great teacher, very accessible

Lectures are awfully boring and long. Lots of discussion and not a lot of notes to take. Roughly 5 extra credit opportunities, lots of in-class quizzes, 2-3 textbook quizzes on Canvas, 2 partial exams, and 1 cumulative final exam. Only grade he drops is the lowest textbook quiz grade. Quiz questions are tricky and misleading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Loved professor block, very witty and lectures weren't to long
rating_tags: Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: I can barely retain anything he says because of how boring his lectures are. I basically had to reteach everything to myself before the tests. Plus, tests and quizzes are extremely tricky and unfair. I strongly do not recommend.
Intro to the Profession with Professor Amy is great. Super easy class for the most part. Great discussions and class work.
Professor Murphy was great and I really enjoyed the class. She engaged the class really well and is also very culturally aware and respectful of all students.

She is such a queen and literally knows all 60 students in her class. Class is super fun and discussions are hilarious and educational. We have about 1 hour of homework each class, but it is usually just reading or a podcast.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The most kind, caring, and fair professor I have ever met. She is always willing to work with you and really puts in the time to get to know you
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Definitely take his class if you need chemistry at all. He cares so much about every student and their success. Go to his office hours! You wont regret it. His tests can be difficult at times, but youll always have the motivation to work for this class.

Dr. Olademehin is an amazing professor. He cares about his students and his office hours are very helpful. He cares about his students' success. His exams are hard and he lectures at a fast pace, but if you show you want to learn and if you put effort in, he will see that and help you if needed. He makes chemistry fun to learn!

This is not for the MUS1301 class, but in general, it was a terrible class. She is a nice person and gives her best, but just awful at teaching. Much of class time is wasted and often, the homeworks do not help us study for exams. Proficiency tests are not prepared at all during class, so very few of us passed until the retakes.

Do. Your. Homework. Read the textbook. Ripley is new-ish to teaching theory and she most likely won't cover everything in class. You also need to go to class because she will put things on the test that are not in the textbook at all. Easy pass if you do the work.

She doesn't do any sort of quizzes (including pop) so grades are from online homeworks (which aren't bad at all) and tests. She would have extra credit for each unit, sometimes gimme questions on the tests. She is super caring and really wants her students to succeed and everything on the test was in lecture--> still read the book though!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had her for BIO 1306 and loved her. Her exams are difficult so you need to study well but she prepares you for upper level bio courses. She is very caring and wants her students to succeed. I would definitely recommend taking her if you can!

He is a great professor who is passionate about his knowledge. Though I wouldn't take the course again it was a great way to learn more about the bible and its origins in an interactive way that won't make you fall asleep. There is little to no busy work, everything he gives you is to help you with the tests and assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: He is a great professor. his lectures are interesting and you can tell that he is very passionate by what he does. He explains the books in the Bible in a way that is easy to understand, and is very focused on making sure the student does well in his class.
Great professor and guy. His tests are actually kind of hard and you actually have to read the textbook. Random quiz questions every day. However, the class was interesting and not bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: This class was easy because it was for my art credit and the class was a little bit hard but I got through it with an A. Dr. Kendrik is such a nice dude and I have no complaints about him I would take him again if I was a film student

Great prof, great person. Difficulty of exams is based on how much work you put into the homework. If you understand the assignments and practice exercises, you'll do fine! Projects take over at the end of the semester, but they are not bad, just all coding and analyzing! Make a doc with all your notes for the final so you can ctrl-F (it's allowed)

Prof. George was a great professor, only thing was that sometimes it was a little hard to understand him. You get used to it though! Not a traditional marketing class because it focuses a lot on coding and then applying it to data which is used to make marketing decisions. Highly recommend this class if you are interested in actually learning!!
Very kind and chill, but perhaps his French isn't perfect?
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Really nice guy, cares about his students.  not a hard class, just show up and participate and you'll be fine.  gives lots of extra credit and help outside of class.
Very helpful and kind! Can seem intimidating, but is completely the opposite.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: She's young and Canadian. The class is pretty easy as long as you actually write the papers. There's only 2 or 3 quizzes all semester, plus several papers and some daily work. She always tries to help, and each unit builds toward the final research paper, which is helpful.

If you take Heritage with Dr. Whitford, you will have a good time. Much easier class than what I've heard about other students' heritage teachers. A quiz a week, but you get unlimited attempts and can see answers. Other assignments and tests not too bad, doesn't do much attendance, and his lectures are super fun. Can't recommend enough.
Come and see.

I genuinely liked this professor as a person. I think he does care about his students but his teaching style did not feel organized nor effective.I would suggest that he discontinue group projects so students do not continue to have their grades affected by those who put in less effort when we are paying for our education.

Dr. Jones truly cares about his students & is very passionate about social work. He expects you to care if you are entering the field or he wont recommend you to the school, you must be competent. He is approachable, very genuine, &  just an all around great professor. If you are going into SW his intro class is the best available.#iHIGHLYrecommend
He's a super good professor and really does a good job explaining the material in a way that you can understand!!

Mr. Hall is a great teacher. He is active in his lectures, enjoys teaching, and is willing to help students. I have no complaints. The workload is not intense - Homework is due the day of tests and the tests are easy if you study. Mr. Hall is the professor who one wants.

Professor Wehbe is a great professor. I had him for both lecture and lab. He knows what he is talking about and will do his absolute best to help you if you are struggling. You don't need a notebook for this class unless you want to take personal notes since he has a google doc for the class. Please take him!!

She assigns ridiculous homework that is seemingly irrelevant to the class. She grades more harshly than anyone I've ever come across before. My paper's have always received A's and High B's yet she has yet to give me above a low C on a paper. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS

Her main interest is seeing students get something out of her class that they can use elsewhere. She's practical, personable, and more than willing to clarify vague or confusing instructions. Encourages everyone to participate in discussions. Grades are based on reading notes, in-class writing, and a conference paper. Definitely recommended.

Dr. Dyer is the easiest of the professors teaching this class, and by far the most knowledgable. He is in his 70s, I think, and has been practicing social work longer than most of us have been alive. He is a fantastic educator and practitioner. If you have the opportunity to take him, I would! He also cuts a lot of the "fat" from the course! Woohoo
Dr. Goatley truly teaches. You will absolutely learn from her. And she makes it interesting. You will want to hear more and more. But she is no nonsense, so pay attention to your work.

Amy's great. She's EXTREMELY chill, and often goes off on rabbit trails, but she knows and loves her subjects.  She is extremely nice and extremely feminist (I know, I didn't think that was possible either) but will listen to opposing points of view even if she doesn't agree with them. Definitely take Amy.

I love her. She's so sweet and actually interesting in class. It's a long lecture but she gives break, practice problems and worksheets for extra help. PathoPharm is not fun, so she really helps everything come together in her class! Definitely read read read the book (Lewis Med Surg) and practice w/ the chapter quizzes. Good luck!

To begin, Newberry is a phenomenal teacher. He is by far one of the most caring (invited our whole class to his house for dinner), informative, and clearest teachers I have ever had. I'm a Senior, and have taken four classes with him.  Newberrys classes aren't always easy, but they're well worth it. He'll challenge you and help you throughout.

Dr. Beauregard was such a refreshing teacher to have.  Always quick to respond to ask questions, willing to go the extra mile to help you understand the material.  He makes a point at making physical connections from the mathematics we are learning to the outside world.  Its the first time I have really had to think about things physically in math!
Most boring class ive ever been to, but he is very passionate about theatre.
HARD AS HELL!!!

He's a great anatomy professor. He lectures off of powerpoints so you don't have to buy the book. His class is easy, but you'll need to study some to get an A! The lab that goes with the class is pretty easy too.
Amazing teacher. Extremely helpful. Explains well.
He's amazing and so patient I absolutely love having his class! He's great at what he does and he knows how to clarify everything.

She is the sweetest lady if you try to get to know her even a little bit. Her area of expertise is organ, so she particularly loves using hymns as harmonic examples. She occasionally can be a bit ambiguous, but you can usually clear things up with a well placed question. She cares about you, and is very understanding of your situation.
This guy is what you want in a professor.

His lectures are always fascinating, and so chock-full of information that I am never bored. He doesn't use a real "textbook", but actual primary source literature, and historical writing from the time, which makes it way more interesting. Took his class as an honors section, but he holds all his students accountable for their work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Very nice lady but don't she's new to teaching and it shows.She is not very clear..she'll over explain things at a higher level than her students are at. Go to test reviews..they were very helpful and is very close to what the actual test is like. You have 'Experiments' worth extra points but it's based on chance if you get a good value to get them

He is my favourite professor I have had so far, by far the most easy accessible and he is very very willing to help you out with the hw's and projects that he has. The exams are not hard if you pay attention/go to his office hours for help not understanding things.
The BSB where dreams go to die, actually I meant BIO 1106 LAB where dreams are crushed, peoples' souls are devoured, and where we learn about angiosperm :) GPA? What is that?
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: The department's expert on Old English. Gives helpful feedback on assignments that looks at strengths and weaknesses alike. The course focuses more on linguistics than literature, so there are no papers. Grades come from online exercises, quizzes, presentations, a midterm, and a final. Be prepared to do a lot of translations and read them aloud.

You MUST take notes and study to do well, and even though it's a lecture class, attendance is a big deal. He gives a quiz every day and you have to be there for it. You need to do the readings -which I often didn't and made a B-. But overall, if you are responsible and keep up with the class, it's SUPER, SUPER easy.
Amazing professor and person! Absolute favorite! Baylor is so lucky to have you!

Professor Nao is an extremely difficult teacher. I barely passed the class thanks to her. I tried my hardest, but she was very particular about crescendos. If it was not forte or piannisimo enough, she would yell at you and call you names. Shes foreign, and kept saying "TOO MUCH JUICE"!!!! She bullied my duet partner as well. Might as well drop out
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: funny guy.

Mr. Prather might give more work than the usual religion class but it is not hard! As long as you study and put in effort, he will notice and it you can make a good grade. Extremely nice and really funny, kept me interested in the early morning.
Really funny and easy exams. He provides a study guide for the exams and goes over the material that is on the exams
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Kaul is super sweet! She does assign homework and reading for every class, but honestly it wasn't too much and didn't bother me. She responds quickly to emails and is always willing to help if you have questions. Her tests were also fairly easy as long as you did the reading.

I would recommend you not to take MTH 1308 with Peter Coogan as your teacher. Expect for there to be last minute posted quizzes, plenty of mathematical errors during lectures as well as slideshows, and removes points based on small and insignificant mistakes. Do not take him unless you want to use YouTube as your primary learning source.
ATTENDANCE IS VITAL! Lots of readings to do
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: An incredible teacher.

Dr. Chae was awesome! The class isn't too difficult just take good notes during his lectures and you'll be fine. Short online quizzes before every class, a couple in-class discussion sessions, and four multiple choice exams. Dr. Chae is very kind and accommodating and seems to genuinely care about his students.

Dr. Chae is great! This class is challenging for most (myself included), but if you pay attention during the lectures you'll be fine. Short quizzes online before every class + occasional in-class discussions. He does cold-call people to read verses from the Bible out loud. Overall Dr. Chae is so sweet and clearly cares about his students.

Ive taken him for both 1301 and 1302 and he is amazing!! His class can feel intimidating at first but the way he teaches is the only reason I feel I can somewhat speak in Spanish. He focuses on speaking in class so when you get to take the written test, it is a piece of cake. He really sets you up for success.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: An adult who honestly acts less mature than the students in his class, he's petty, passive-aggressive, and struggles to explain the concepts he expects us to learn. I genuinely never know what to expect grading-wise because he is very inconsistent when it comes to his standards and expectations. I would not recommend his class to anyone.

Dr. Bossaller is very supportive and cares about his students grades. He gives lots of opportunity for extra credit and several office hour options. His lectures are relatively easy to follow and he welcomes questions. Never shames anyone for not understanding and can teach at your pace. Take him he is amazing!
He is a sweet compassionate professor, and if you pay attention in this class it is easy! Stay patient with him though because he explains in great detail.

Professor Chittenden has become by favorite professor at Baylor so far. She is always ready to help and really cares about her students. She is very understanding and very good at teaching and explaining new concepts. Her feedback is very helpful and she is very clear about what she would like to see from her students.

Really knows math. He helped me do better in Calculus I than I did in high school Pre-calculus. Quite a bit of outside-of-class homework, but takes late assignments and has helpful office hours. He provides helpful guided notes that he uses to lecture in class. Really prepares you for the departmental final and gives you access to past exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Gripp was nice enough. Really tough grader and will actually take points off for things that she helped with. I wouldn't take her again, but she isn't terrible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Dr.Kerry is an amazing professor. Teaching is a part-time job for him so he will bring in a lot of interesting guest speakers from different areas of his work with Children's Advocacy. The only grades in this class are weekly quizzes about the guest speaker (which he gives you all the answers to) and the occasional journal article summary.

Prof. Hacker is one of the kindest people I have met in my time at Baylor. The class doesn't have a ton of homework outside of reading before classes (and yes, actually read) and taking quizzes which are online. Exams can be hard but if you read & study, you'll be fine! He prays for the class and is always there if you need it. Take him!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Cooper is a grad student who is teaching physics. He's chill. Our 1st exam was super easy. The 2nd exam was hard, but he is giving a generous curve. HW is worth 20% of your grade, but easy A. 5% of the grade are daily reading assignments (easy A). Out of all the other physics professors, he is the BEST option if you want to get a good grade in.

I love Dr. Holleyman! He is very knowledgeable and wise about Christian Scriptures and presents the material in a very interesting and understandable way. His class does require you to read about 7 - 10 chapters of the bible before class and take a quiz on the reading, but this was very manageable compared to other professors.
handsome man
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Pretty great teacher, wants you to do well but will make you work for your grade (don't expect an easy a)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: We had short multiple-choice quizzes each week, a discussion board each week, and two tests (the midterm and final). However, there was nightly reading which I ended up not doing, and probably could have earned a higher grade if I did. It's easy to pass as long as you mostly pay attention and take notes.

Honestly one of the best professors at Baylor. I HIGHLY recommend taking his class!! We would have a short reading like a poem and then just discuss it together in class. The readings throughout the semester were really interesting and not difficult at all!! He is also super caring and a bit of an odd one but he makes class super interesting.
Professor Toth is such an amazing professor. She cares so much about her students and their success. If you have the choice, please take her!!
Very easy class. Assignments are meant to get you to use school resources, so easy A.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: no communication. dont grade homework. Un-inspirational. no reading. no quiz. dont care participation. if you skip class she does not care. student dont care. unprepared. does not give feedback i was clueless in class. every student was helpless. very bossy in class. no commitment.

Dr. Burney is a hard grader, but an absolutely awesome professor. Slackers, get away. Not only is she an expert in her field, but she is very helpful, kind and accommodating. You will definitely be challenged but your writing will improve. Being her student was a privilege.
Absolute legend.  No better calculus teacher on campus.  This man is my hero.

Amanda is a good professor, she believes teaching is a two way street. After a unit is finished she asks for feedback on what could be improved, or what else did we want to learn. Her classes are really driven by the students who are passionate for the stage management field. If you're taking it "just for the credit" you may not enjoy it as much.

DaPonte was by far my favorite professor I had this semester. Her lectures were super interesting and she was always passionate about what she was talking about which was so awesome. She was strict about her attendance policy, but as long as you show up, you're golden. She was always willing to talk after class to discuss more too. Take her!

She offers a lot of buffer for your grade outside of tests, which helps a lot.  Tests are very hard, but practical.  Do the online homework! It will save your grade. She is a great person- always open to talk and teach. Admittedly didn't walk away feeling anymore confident in Physics.

Mrs. Price is a very nice person, who just seems to be mislead by other teachers on what is allowed to do. She really does want to help people understand material and make good grades. She's a little confusing with information and tells you "just read the power points, and if you understand them, your good!" however, You need to just read the book!

Dr. Nichols is SO great. Always gives reviews for tests, which are IDs and an essay or two. Grades very generously. Is a genius, so a lot is over my head, but as long as you grasp things on your own level you will do well, and learn a ton. May have quizzes, so read, and if you contribute to discussion he will love you. Super helpful, nice & funny.

I would not have passed Logic if it weren't for Mr. Spano. He's super patient, gives lots of extra credit, and is really funny to boot. If you fail his class, you really shouldn't even be in college, he makes it that easy for you. Great class, great guy.

Dr. Berg is the best teacher ever. The man is such a sweet person and an incredible teacher if you show him that you mean business and work hard. He will become like a father figure to you. He has a big heart and loves his students.
Excellent professor, class was fun and he tells some pretty good stories. Really willing and eager to work with his students.  You can tell he loves what he's doing. Always smiling.
She is not Knowledgeable and expects you to know everything.

The class is super easy. Make sure you go to the review days, because she gives you exactly what you need to know for the exams. She takes points off if you miss more than two days though, but it's not much.
