Personally a great class, lots of homework but as the class goes on you realize that problems done in class are HW questions, questions for the Quiz are from HW too. In the end this made me prepared for tests and the final. One of my favorite classes. Do the work and the class will be a breeze. Mrs. Illich does her best to make math fun too.
Assigns lots of busy work.  Very strict and sensitive.  Inexperienced.  Wastes a lot of paper. Requires unnecessary work

Professor Moss' class was not easy. He lectures only in Spanish, but he will speak English when explaining new or difficult concepts. He's a reasonable grader & tests aren't that hard if you study. He appreciates students who utilize the free tutoring available so don't take it for granted, it will pay off. He's moving schools, but I recommend him.
He's just awesome. Cool and talented guy. He makes you work harder than most other piano profs, but you'll thank him later when you kill that jury.

This guy knows his stuff.  He speaks enthusiastically on geomorphology and hydrology and kept my attention throughout.  He inspired me to continue in my studies of swamp forest draining.  Easy on the eyes too.   The frog thing is more endearing than distracting.

Thomasson is hands down the best Accounting professor at Baylor. He makes class interesting, and he is so helpful if you aren't understanding things. One of the best things about him is that he really wants you to understand the material and not just memorize it, so it makes the tests so much more manageable. Also, there's a lot of extra credit!!!

Professor Evans is a great man and an incredible philosopher! I am a philosophy major, so I'm predisposed to liking the material. However, I would love to take more classes from this man. He is incredibly kind and friendly. He also has a great sense of humor. One of the greatest professors I've ever had. I highly highly recommend him!

Professor Bhojwani was a great professor! Even though we had to speak a lot in this class, it really helped me with my communication skills. The grading criteria is very clear. Study thoroughly and you will surely make an A!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Super fun lady! She was so easy and so nice. Loved having her for a teacher!

Miles is incredible (I'm a student from the school he just transferred from) and I'm taking him every chance I get before he leaves. I highly recommend taking his courses. He used to be at the University of Cincinnati, so if you want to know more, check out his reviews there. He's genuinely the best professor I've ever had. 5.0 for 10 years at UC!

Professor Allison was a great professor for a tough subject. She provides so many opportunists for participation grades, online homework, projects, &test and quizzes. I struggled on the tests and hardly passed any of them but by participating I passed the class so I think she is an excellent teacher that provides you many opportunities to succeed
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Well spoken, fair grader, who seems honestly concerned with student comprehension. Essay only tests. 3 and a paper.

Mrs. Lancaster was great as far as professors go. Work load is average.  Make sure you do your reading in order to do well on the quizzes.  Semester project isn't terrible, just make sure you have a solid group.  Also, she is very well dressed and easy on the eyes.
Definitely a great professor, but you have to work in this class. The material is inherently difficult to understand but not impossible. Dr. Abel is always there to help when you have a question.
Would recommend for any class. Great lectures and fair grading, not difficult to get an A. Cares about students and offers extra credit. You learn a lot!

She is a very sweet lady but makes an easy class harder than it should be. I have always been decent at math and didn't think that her class would be a problem since I've never had many major math issues before. However, she speaks in a way that is hard to understand and she tries to sound sophisticated while lecturing. She makes easy things hard.
If you speak your ideas on the material at hand and she does not agree, she will definitely shoot down what you say in class. Read or you will not pass. Show up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Great professor, had him for a lab.

Terrible to listen too. Unfair frading. The last essay is a 9 page essay and if you fail this essay, regardless of other essay grades and homework grades you fail his class. Unpleasant and awkward. Very pretentious.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Worst teacher I've ever had at Baylor. She's a nice lady but would be a much better 2nd grade teacher. Didn't learn one thing in this class and then the departmental final railed everyone. Avoid her class at all cost

Professor Steveson is the best Professor I have had so far. He really cares about his students and gives them every opportunity to succeed in his class. He lets you know exactly how his quizzes and tests will be so you are more than prepared. He keeps the class interesting and usually lets you out early. Amazing teacher!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I studied with McAllister for my master's in composition. He's a fun, goofy guy, and knows a lot about composition and music in general. Despite this, I felt like I didn't learn much from him. He didn't have many specific suggestions, just generalities that I either already knew or weren't very helpful. You'll get a few laughs and that's about it.

Dr. Gwynn is a wonderful person that is just so energetic naturally. She is very good at coming up with ways to make sense of things whether it be a catchy phrase or a chart. Dr. Gwynn expressed to us that math came to her not so easily so she has a lot of understanding for people who can't understand things so easily and really helps a lot.

I liked him. He really wants to help and teach you and always tries to get feedback out of you. Some times he repeats over and over and gets boring. If you study his reviews you'll do good on tests. Wasn't too hard at all, very manageable. If you ask questions he'll help you
She is great!! So helpful and understanding with writing and will meet you where you are with it!

Professor DeDeyne is super helpful, caring, and funny. He genuinely wants to help his students pass and is more than happy to help you through any difficult concepts. He's very empathetic and understands students have other things going on so if any emergencies pop up he'll help you work around coursework. This man explains statistics very well.

Dr. Gaventaan accomplished academic with a notorious habit of condescending to students and sniping at colleagues. A classic line: "I expected more from a graduate student." Seeking a mentor? A recommendation? A yes person or sycophant might do well. Others should looks elsewhere. There are many scholars wise enough to be humble too.

Dr. Ritter cannot adjust her teaching when students are struggling. We had to meet as a group outside of class to try to teach each other the material. When anyone asked for clarification in class she would say things like, "If anyone truly needs that question answered, that is really concerning to me. Everyone should know that." Not helpful. 1.5/5

Professor Harp was so helpful and funny in class! If I was ever confused about any part of the lab, he would take the time to explain everything very clearly. Only one quiz due each week. Very minimal work load and one lab is dropped at the end of the semester. Highly recommend taking him for any Chem course!
Class structure is relatively stable (same thing every week). Midterm and Final exams are both given to you for you to work for well before the actual day of the Exams.

Professor Birmingham is super nice she's very soft spoken so that can be a little hard at 8 am. This class is super easy there are some take-home quizzes but she will give you a good grade if you actually put effort into it.

Dr. Spence is a really good professor and a nice person. If you are taking Intro to Engineering 1301 and the lab along with it, she's the better professor IMO. She also teaches many other EGR classes and mechanical engineering classes. She gives you good feedback and is very friendly and open to questions.

She is a wonderful professor! Great connection to have. Basically no homework, exams can be a bit difficult because you actually have to read in addition to paying attention to her lectures, but 100% doable! There's a couple group projects, one of which is a TedTalk where you teach the class (which was not my favorite tbh). Overall good class!

Professor Hathaway is an amazing professor for anatomy. It is speech-path focused and there's a lot of material, but he is patient and will answer any questions you have in class. He keeps you engaged and interested and while you will be asked to learn a lot of terms, he gives you a lot of resources in order to do so.

His lectures can be beneficial, but the textbook he uses really doesn't work in conjunction with the material. I recommend meeting him in his office hours if you're struggling in the class. Aside from that he's really forgiving in terms of extra credit and quiz elimination, but extremely difficult in exams.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: He makes the class harder than it is, be prepared to a textbook and 2-3 long research articles, then take a difficult quiz with little time. His lectures are below standards, with forcing students to use handwritten notes, while barely putting any text in his PowerPoints. Even his group project is hard, with usage of non-student participants.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Miguel makes the class very personal and fun. Attendance matters a lot still

LEAVE THIS CLASS! Horrible, self-important teacher. Commonly shreds/bleeds over student papers with over 250 edits in a 6 page paper. Nasty personality and she mandates you work on topics of her interest and competency area. Syllabus and Rubric do not match for grading parameters. Refuses to fix issues. No ability to escalate. AVOID!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: There were quizzes every single day. The lectures were ALWAYS non related. He talks about absolutely everything other than what we are supposed to be discussing. And he gets distracted every second of his lectures. The test has things that we did not discuss/read in our textbooks. You have to DIG and DIG to get every ounce of information.

The class is fairly easy, but he teaches very fast, sometimes to the point where it's impossible to keep up. The quizzes were easy and the homework wasn't too bad. He is pretty understanding, and will even give extensions on the homework if you ask.
Professor Patterson is awesome. You actually speak the language in his class and therefore you learn a lot more. Loved his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Garcia is a very nice person but his lectures are hard to follow and if you take any of his audio classes he will send you to do very menial exercises that take up a lot more time than they should. I did learn a lot about audio recording from this class but there was a lot that could have been summed up in the first few weeks.

Professor Garza is by far the best Spanish teacher I have ever had. I came into the class knowing that I would struggle since I don't do too well with languages, but he never gave up on me. He consistently met with me during office hours, worked with me on exams/quizzes, offered extra credit, and he is the definition of what a teacher should be.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: She's a great teacher! Managerial accounting is a tough class by design, but she does her best to get you through it if you put in the work. She is also really good at taking time to explain things that are unclear, and is very engaging. Would recommend.
She really cares!!! She will help you when you do not understand...
Great professor! Easy to follow. Quizzes every Friday, but they weren't too bad. He gives a study guide for every test, which helps A LOT!
She is sooo caring and fantastic. You will MISS OUT if you don't take her!
He's passionate about the material but quizzes are difficult
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: Professor Handel as a person isn't the worst. He is sort of funny and is nice in office hours. The issue with him though is that he grades on very few things and grades tough. He had us write an essay and I'm pretty sure none of the class got a 100 on it. If the class doesn't do well on quizzes, he complains about how disappointed he is. 4/10.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Her lectures are terribly boring and unhelpful, and a lot of dense reading material is assigned and discussed, but she's a pretty easy grader and cares a lot about her students. She pays attention to how the class is feeling and is happy to change the deadline for everyone if they're too stressed about an assignment. Overall, not fun but not hard.

Moore's class is very easy. There are only tests and extra credit assignments. the tests are easy if you read the book. you dont have to pay attention in class. he has lots of walks and lets you out at least 10 mins early everyday

She reads straight off of the power points, and lectures are extremely boring. She never knows the answer to any question, so don't bother asking. She's a nice person but honestly doesn't seem like she can say anything that isn't directly stated on the PowerPoint. She has mastering biology for every class and exams are alright. do book questions.

Melody is a good professor, but quite a subjective grader. I would say she is the hardest grader of all the professors who teach this course. It is as if she looks for any reason to take off points. She also grades based on her own brand of social work, not yours. So if you don't do it like she does, she may ding your grade for it. All in all: okay
He's a grad student who is a lab instructor. Not the nicest guy. He's really interested in chemistry. Sometimes he tries to teach things that we really don't need to know.

Professor Cornell cares about your success and gives lots of opportunities to make up points. Tests are fairly easy and you get three tries on her online quizzes. You are guaranteed a good grade if you do the work, but she will make time to help you if you aren't doing well. You will leave with a good understanding of statistics.
She's an awesome teacher with a great attitude. She really brought our class together and kept us interested. I HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend her.

A very nice man but a bad teacher. He only likes one particular writing style (active voice, choppy) and if you don't adapt to it, you will fail. Essays are especially frustrating if you were taught in high school to write detailed essays. In class he is very boring and rambles about things that don't relate to the course. Do NOT take him
Loved this class! She is super funny and so willing to help you with anything. The class isn't the easiest but I didn't study and still received a B in the class with ease.

This class was super easy. You do have to go to class because there is an attendance grade. For the final and midterm they gave us all the answers and for the midterm we could correct it for 1/2 points.

He's totally a cool guy, but the class is hard. He gives TONS of extra credit opportunities though. He'll also give take-home and open book tests sometimes, so it makes the class a little more bearable.

the course is a tad bit hard, however all the answers are in the book so i highly suggest you use it, it will be to the best of your advantage. the professor answers emails in a vary timely manner as well so any questions or concerns you have will be addressed.

The lectures were very boring, but the whole test was comprised of the power point material. If you study the ppt, you will make a good grade. Gave weekly quizzes also, but they weren't very difficult.

Prof Damron is a gem! I took Nonverbal Comm and loved this class! She had a lot of exercises u have to write papers on but they are really interesting. The midterm & final are online and not difficult if you study a little. The main projects she has is a reality TV paper. It's a little more difficult but not by any means hard. She's really helpful!

Mrs. Peek is really kind, and I did learn a lot, but this was one of the hardest classes I've taken. She talks SO fast, she flies through her powerpoint and I had to really really hustle to get the information into my notes because she tests off the material she talks about in class. There is a lot of reading, and the tests are very specific.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She teaches 100% off powerpoint and there is no reason to buy the textbook because everything she goes her is everything that is on the test. The class is really heavy on musical examples, make sure you listen to the ones she tells you to and know them by name, who composed it, and the form it was written in. She gives a review at the end of units.

Ms. Kilgore wants students to succeed and schedules time outside of class to meet students at Moody in order to help them improve their writing skills. However, she is a tough grader because she looks for specific things in essays and the only A I ever made in the class was on the final, but it is possible, and extra credit is a grade saver.
Great and fun teacher! Writing papers with his help is a breeze. There's no way you can't pass!

I took her in a Dual Credit class. There were about 5 essays to write but she was very clear on her grading criteria. She isn't the harshest grader but will help you become a better writer! I would recommend her to anyone.
Super nice and have an awesome review. Simply smart, sweet, and knows his stuff. Easy A, if you do homework and reviews.
The class is easy, and she's pretty chill. She makes the environment really relaxed so that going in front of people and giving speeches isn't bad. She gives written tests, but they aren't bad!
He is an awesome teacher that expects you to learn and will help you succeed

Gingles is an amazing teacher but mostly person. He really cares about art and his students that take this class seriously. He wont show empathy for those who half-ass. As long as you show him you are trying, he will do everything in his power to make sure you make a good grade.

Profesora Marmion truly cares about her students and is very passionate about Spanish. Fun, interactive, conversation based activities really bring class to life and help practice grammar and vocab. Fair grader and as long as you are in class, participate and do the assignments on time you should get a good grade. I highly recommend this course!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Life changing professor and very inspiring.

The best kind of professor. Does exam reviews, makes kahoots, gives fill in the blank note templates, accessible outside of class, plenty of extra credit opportunities, in class activities, meme assignments, always asks what he can do to be better. Reading and listening will get you an A. Study the notes. What a gem. My favorite professor so far :)

Professor Iluzada was great.  She took the time to give individualized feedback on all writing assignments.  The information in her course was interesting and helpful for learning the subject matter.  The grade distribution was well done because it allowed for earning an A in a straight forward manner with a reasonable amount of quality work.
Terrible. Horrible organization. Hard final and midterm. DO NOT TAKE!!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Unprepared for lectures, scrambles through his word doc that he reads off the entire class. Tests are nothing like homework and quizzes. Avoid at all costs.
The professor is a menace to society and should never teach in this town again. She is the epitome of corruption and an energy vampire.

Professor Russell is the sweetest teacher I've ever had. She truly wants to make sure her students understand the material and form connections. As for the class, it was very straightforward and the assignments were kept light. She gave helpful feedback and you are guaranteed a good grade if you follow the rubric.

Dr. Cockle is an amazing professor. His lectures/class discussion are very helpful. He makes sure everyone understands the topics. His reading quizzes are easy, and there are no exams besides the final exam. He grades with lenience. Dr. Cockle cares about his students in and out of class. 10/10 would take him again!

I did not pass the course (Pre-Calculus), but she was amazing. She wants her students to understand the concepts, teaches the material, and highly encourages students to participate in SI's, get help from tutors, and meet her during office hours. I highly recommend having her as your math professor.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I had him for Spanish 2320, which is Intermediate Spanish. I am by no means an intermediate Spanish speaker - I tested into this course. However, he made this class do-able for me and he made class fun. His grading is easier than other professors. He is understanding, hilarious, full of energy, and from Spain!
Lectures had nothing to do with quiz, long lectures, tough grading, never available to help.

His video lectures are of no use because he just goes over the assignments you're meant to do that week. As long as you do the zybooks completely, you will get a good grade. It'll be beneficial to you to take notes on the zybooks for subsequent classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Ms. Asiedua is nice, but her voice is too small to clearly understand what she is trying to say. An easy-A class, recommended for prehealth students.

she was great and she loves engaging with her class. She will learn your name + try to get you to participate in discussions. often cancels class but attendance is graded. always goes the full time + talks abt readings. lot of assigned readings that you dont have to do but should. The midterm and final exams were hard though so prepare.
What a guy
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Its not hard if you actually do the readings and study, but kinda difficult otherwise.

His teaching style is to with start the basic equation and then deriving it to the final equation. Also if you dont keep up with what the symbols stand for you'll be lost in class and the book will just confuse you(instead of saying inflation he says pie ALLWAYS) If you like to miss class or thats not your style of learning i wouldnt recommend him

A very good teacher. Thoroughly goes over the reading material in a very clear and easily understandable way & makes sure the students are involved. Clearly very knowledgeable & passionate about the subject. However his tests are long and hard & questions are worded to where they may be difficult to understand, but they're not impossible.
He's the best in the world ever!!
easy class, he cancels alot, just show up & participate, the final at the end is easy he gives you a study guide, highly recommended.

He is insanely smart. Pretty strict grader, though will occasionally give extra credit or scrap a quiz. He put my class in alphabetical order, so don't expect to be able to sit next to your friends. Very strict about electronics in class. He posted chapters of the book online, so was unnecessary to purchase the textbook. He's hard, but I liked him.
He is the best professor. Take him class!
Her class is pretty easy, all you need to do is do the minimum requirements for the papers then you'll be fine
A great course.
Best guy ever. Hard class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Danley is very diligent, and has a great sense of humor. However, almost everyone in my class failed the first exam, but after he sent out an e-mail on how to better prepare for the next exams, it got much better. We use clickers to answer questions in class, which helps boost your grade, and he drops the lowest exam grade.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Kayworth's content is very applicable in and the course was insightful.  He gives logical feedback and grades fairly.  His real-world industry experience & expertise reflect in his teaching style.  Would certainly recommend and take a course of his again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Unclear lectures and instructions for assignments. Would not take again EVER.

He has a good personality, however, his teaching methods kinda suck. His lectures are boring and useless for exams and he does random math problems on the board without explaining what he is doing. In addition, his exams are freakishly hard!!!
One of the hardest classes I've ever taken. The lectures have nothing to do with the tests and quizzes, there is so much information to cover. Avoid at all cost.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Johnson is a great professor, very clear spoken and great at lecturing. You do have 1 group project and 2 solo projects that are required, and tests are not too difficult as long as you study some you should do fine. She does give pop quizzes, but usually over what the lecture was last time and sometimes they are done in groups.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Harris is brilliant and passionate. If you take her Loss and Mourning class you will learn so much about how to care for those grieving. She is understanding, helpful in clear in directions. Anybody would be lucky to have her as a professor. Definitely recommend
very nice and helpful

Excellent moderator of class discussions and debates. Readings are closely tied in with each class discussion. Tests are very reasonable and the one essay was interesting, not difficult, and graded very generously. Matt Dinan is fantastic, take him.
She is so enthusiastic about the material that even if you aren't interested in sociology you find yourself paying attention and noticing sociology EVERYWHERE.
Mormonoc is awesome.  He has taken so much effort to create a learning environment that leverages the synergies between dialectic transience and introspective voluptiousness.
Hilarious

The class is a little confusing at first if you have never been exposed to statistics before. After you get the hang of it, the class is pretty easy. I changed my major to statistics after taking this class.

Professor Henry is WONDERFUL! I love her to pieces. She makes her class fun, cares, and whats better is she starts to prepare you for your career and how things will be then. There are several different projects but she is extremely helpful and willing to listen to ANY concerns you may have. I would take her again in a heartbeat! HIGHLY recommend!

SO sweet and bubbly. Made me not want to skip class just because her class brightened my day every day. Wonderful teacher. English is her second language so sometimes she needs a little help translating or pronouncing, but we had a lot of fun with it. Clearly defined what we needed to make an A. 100% would take another class from her.
The lab is the smallest portion of your grade but you learn everything for the test there.

Ms. Covill teaching style is very poor. She lacks the confidence in order to teach the class, as well as does not speak loud enough in the classroom for people to hear. She is very shaky and you can tell she is nervous. She just goes over a packet in class and expects you to know the material for tests and quizzes. Do not take her class.

Dr. Sheesley is not accessible outside of class. She does not seem to care much whether you pass or fail her class. She will ridicule you for seeming to be less intelligent than she is. She doesn't give much homework which is nice but gives you very few chances to adequately review the material form class and the readings. Avoid if at all possible
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Castleberry is super energetic during class, and her lectures are usually pretty interesting. Tests are directly off of lecture material, I never cracked my textbook. However, Mastering Chemistry is big if you want to do well, and is for a grade after each test.
Disorganized class, professor does not upgrade grades in a timely manner.

Had Dr. Parler for 20th century music seminar. Non-judgmental, always encouraged people to voice their own opinions while offering his own, often insightful take on things. Also a nice guy; really understanding with the COVID situation, and he shortened the length requirement on our paper! Cool dude, would recommend.

This woman assigns so much reading it's ridiculous, all for a 10 question quiz. And then on top of it, the reading quizzes are due on Wednesdays and she doesn't let her students know what they need to read until Monday morning at 6 a.m. Students are busy and have other classes to worry about. She's not always clear about the assignments.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Great guy and pretty laid back. Had him for 1302 and he was more than reasonable. Pretty young and went to Baylor so he gets what we are going through. I'm signed up to take him again for 1304 in the fall. Deff not an easy A but if you stay on top of your work you should be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The most fun professor to have in religion. Made me want to go to class because of how funny and engaging he was. Would highly recommend.
Professor just rants about his own views, strawmans everything he doesn't like, and virtue signals the whole time.
Nice

Best. Teacher. Ever. Seriously, this class was incredible.  Mr. Train is extremely down to earth-he teaches sitting in a desk with the rest of the students! The entire class revolves around discussion- he doesn't just stand and talk to students. Extremely personable. TAKE HIM!

Dr. Kirillova is very sweet and kind. She teaches primarily by lectures, so it is important to take notes. The pop quizzes will be based heavily off of a few readings but mainly lectures. There are minimal assignments, but the few assignments are weighted heavily. Overall easy class, with a few things to watch out for.

Really good lectures and very clear about what needs to be done in order to do well! Also tells you exactly what to know for midterm and final. Be aware of pop quizzes, but 2 get dropped at the end of the semester!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Mr. Mueller is by far one of the best Graduate Student Instructors out there. He makes this class slightly challenging but is there to help you along the way if you ask. 10/10 would recommend!
John-Michael is an awesome acting teacher and the in-class discussions were wonderful!! Acting in this class was freeing and he has an awesome way of giving feedback that is helpful while kind.

The professors cool but this class tests MEMORY not academic abilities. 5 tests(50 questions) and weekly chapter practice questions. You have to take a bunch of noted and read A LOT!! Take GEO 1401 with Dr. Steve Dworkin instead (Easy A, open note on everything)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Avoid. Lecturer with no ability to generate academic discussion at the doctoral level. Routinely keeps class long to continue lecture. Poor at providing feedback and rarely timely for next assignment. You will do most of your learning in outside reading. I will never take a class from this instructor again.

Dr. Hackler is one of the best professors I have had! She gives lots of work that is pretty tough however she helps you out sooooo much.She will do anything to have you understand the material. She is not the type of professor that prioritizes deadlines and is lenient as long as you participate and care about the course material.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Easy grader, and not a lot of work. Assignments are due every Sunday, and the quizzes are open note/lecture. She is easily accessible through email.
He is such an amazing professor my fav I have ever had at Baylor

This was for studying a legal career and the class was not hard but there was just a lot of hw for a 1 credit class. It was by no means bad it was just a lot. However it did help me decide what field of law I wanted to go into.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Brammer is the best professor I've ever had in my time at Baylor. I've taken him two semesters in a row and he's so caring and really wants his students to succeed. Easy readings, only assigns quizzes if no one read. One or two assignments a week AT MOST, tests are simple as long as you pay attention and take notes. Take Brammer if you can!

I've literally learned nothing from her. Just took an exam that she said was a quiz that I had 48 hours to study. Tells us we don't need to know the physiology of things and then only asks physiology questions. You also have to pay $100 for this website so she doesn't have to grade discussion posts. Adds assignments and EXAMS that arent on the syl.

Dr. Graham is a good professor, he's very enthusiastic with his teaching, but sadly, I don't understand anything from his lecture. Maybe because I'm an international student so it's harder to understand the material, but still, I wouldn't take him again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Best teacher I have ever had in all of my education. So passionate about his work, and just a great stand up guy. Makes the class super engaging, and the class is super easy.

Prof Blalock's ethics course is one of the worst I've taken. She doesn't provide rubrics for assignments, leaving you unsure of expectations. The course is reading-heavy, with 21+ pages of articles. While the subject has potential, her teaching made it unnecessarily difficult. I now have a strong dislike for medical ethics because of this course.

Tiricia is the kind of professor who could be replaced with a cardboard cutout and you would still get the same level of education. Her class was organized poorly and lacked any actually substance other than heavy handed religious zeal and a lack of care or consideration for sensitive topics. As an ethics course it was not very ethical.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Tough but great teacher
Great professor and knowledgeable able
Great professor! Knowledgeable with experience in leadership and organizational change
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He taught at residency. Most of us students were confused and had a hard time figuring out what he was even trying to say. Baylor University can do much better than this.

If you don't get an A, I literally don't know what to tell you. Pretty boring class, but there is virtually no homework (2 open everything quizzes a week) unless you do the extra credit that she gives excess opportunities for. Tests come straight from the articles and lecture. She's insanely accommodating and very nice, good teacher.

Professor Bennett is a very kind lady, although if you want to learn anything about biology you should never take this person. She rambles about pointless subjects unrelated to the class such as her past as a researcher. Her class tends to 8 chapters behind. 4 test make up majority of the grade, they are over the lectures which she does not do.

He makes this class really easy. There are quizzes every day that are very similar to the material presented in class. The tests are then very similar to the quizzes which makes studying easy. Everyone I know in the class is making an A.

Professor Holmes can be a bit confusing at times and may get off track, but he really will prepare you for the upper level Bio classes (hang in there!) He's always willing to help you out. I really enjoyed his class and office hours.

Dr. Poor is a fantastic teacher! He is clear about what is expected and makes himself available outside of class. He isn't as specific as some of the other professors but I think he teaches us what's most important while trimming some of the fat. I enjoyed learning from him.
Super nice... Easy Grader.... NO TESTS OR QUIZZES!!!!!!!!!!
She's a sweet lady and is helpful, just put a little effort and you'll go far in her class

Extremely straightforward. She never taught anything that was not on the PowerPoint she uploaded to Blackboard. Her tests were all multiple choice Scantrons, and were easy assuming you took some time to review the lecture PowerPoints. Should be an easy A. (I earned a B because I was stupid about completing the short online quizzes on time.)
His lectures cover hardly any information. Each test covers one or two chapters. It's boring, but super easy.
He grades papers really easily. He's also pretty funny and sarcastic. It is important to read the books and take good notes though.

Ms. Clark is SO awesome. I truly enjoyed having her class. She's extremely friendly, and is "easy" but still knows how to challenge you as a student. If you do all of your work, and keep up with the reading, you are sure to make an A in this class. Once again, awesome, awesome, awesome! Take her! :D
Business Law is a tough class, but don't hold it against her. She does a great job taking the awfully confusing world of law down to where you can understand it. Great teacher, would recommend.
Had him for Psalms and Wisdom lit. He's the best prof I've had in the religion dept. and I'd say the best prof I've had at Baylor. Great experience.

The course was designed with great intention. However, there were too many assignments to keep up with. In addition, there was no feedback given for the part of the discussion forum. The professor did not work out any problems, he only lecture based on definitions and the examples that he gave were not aligned to the work assigned.

Totally willing to help students out; very understanding of reasons for missing classestestsetc. Available outside of class very often. The semester I had him, he was experimenting with different assignment ideas, so I am unsure as to what he uses now, but I know it's not a lot or all that difficult.

Absolutely best teacher at Baylor. She will not spoon feed you information but understands that life gets complicated. She will always listen to your problems first and then decide the best course of action. Must turn in everything to pass. Overall incredibly sweet, smart, and devoted.  DON'T LET HER LETS GET TO IT ATTITUDE SCARE YOU!! She is good!

Professor Young is pretty good. She's really nice and teaches the material well. Her class is a little bit annoying because your whole grade is based on 4 exams. Psychology isn't a difficult subject but there's so much information to know for each test so you definitely have to study.
Dr. Geiger's OK.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: I had a great time in his class. He tells lots of stories and the work is meaningful.
He's super chill but engages the class in very thoughtful conversation. He is willing to debate constructively . He let us go to starbucks in the middle of class one time because we looked tired.

This professor seeks to get students to know more about philosophers and gain a better idea of philosophy. If you never took a philosophy class before, this one is a great beginning to gain more knowledge on what you should be looking for in philosophy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: There is reading for Dr. Hoy's class, however, the books are interesting to read. He encourages participation, especially when there are class speakers (which are often) and he will help you succeed in his class if you ask and go to his office hours.
Great and helpful teacher.  And if you have to look at someone for 1-3 hours a week, you couldn't do much better.

Do no take her unless you enjoy writing three papers a week and taking 24 question free response tests. Great when it comes to teaching, but she thinks everyone already has their degree in the field. Easy to deal with, but you will be buried in content when it comes to all her assignments.
Great professor. Would recommend that anyone take him if given the chance.
One of the best instructors at Baylor Nursing. She really cares for all her students and wants you to succeed. She is ex military and doesn't like lazy, but really appreciates hardwork!

He was pretty forward with his expectations for the class. He was always willing to keep contact with me or meet with me outside of class if I had difficulty understanding any of the material. I was able to get a great grasp on the material without the class being so hard that an A was impossible to get. All things considered it was a great class!
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Woody is a tough professor, but she is just wanting you to push yourself to learn more. Dr. Woody expects greatness. If you're not ready to be great do not take the class. One fo my favorite professors, she is the reason where I am at today.
Has a fun personality, and is a pretty cool teacher. At times confusing and instructions are unclear at times, but gives lots of examples and resources.

I took him for Christian Scriptures he was one of the easiest professors, therefore, spring semester I signed up to take Christian Heritage. So far it has been a failure. He admits to putting "ambiguous" questions on reading quizzes and has unorganized lectures making the entire history of Christianity immensely confusing. Do not recommend him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Bina, is a newer professor to the university, but her class was one of the best classes that I have ever taken in regards on how easily I was able to grasp the materials covered. There are a few homework assignments but doesnt take long, but long as you go to class and ask questions if you dont understand professor Bina will help you!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: If you want to be confused as to exactly what youre learning and just need the PoliSci credit, then by all means, you should take Lund because the workload is not difficult. However, please know that the class will not be engaging and youll leave with more questions that you get answers to.

Dr. Sepanski was not willing to meet more than the hour early morning he set aside His lectures would be 2-10 minutes and only cover the basics. By the time you get to the assignment, you will be lost because you are not given examples to solve more challenging questions. I asked a junior math major and he didnt even know how to do the problem.

I played as a grad student in the orchestra conducted by Heyde. He's completely uninspiring, basically just runs through the piece instead of rehearsing, and I can't reliably tell where the beat is. I honestly had more fun copying papers for my TA work. He should have retired by now; try to avoid the orchestra until he finally does.
Easy A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Accessible outside class--Gives good feedback

comment: I loved ANT 4371 with Dr. M. He started every class checking in with us students to see how we were doing. The course content was interesting and the workload manageable. Dr. M is always willing to meet with you and will help with anything from course content to career advice. I am grateful for the opportunity to have learned from him.

I took Dr. M twice and he was great both times. I learned a lot in both courses and never felt overwhelmed by his course material. He is a busy person, but he always made at least 20 minutes of time for us to talk when I wanted to meet with him. One of the best professors at Baylor. Couldn't recommend him more. Take him if you have the chance.

Dr. M is one of my favorite professors at Baylor. He truly cares about his students and is always there to help them succeed. I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Muehlenbein and how supportive he was of my career goals beyond his class. He is also such an interesting person that I learned so much from beyond practical class skills!

Dr. M is amazing! One of the best professors I've had at Baylor! He cares so much about all of his students, and his office has always been open to us (even as past students). Could not recommend him more!

I love Dr. M! His One Health class is amazing, and I would take it 20 times over. He's such a great guy and really cares about his students. The class itself is intriguing. I've never learned so much in one sitting going to his class. He is a genius! Take his class even if you aren't required to take it!

Dr. V is the best. She is so sweet and so caring. It is evident that she really cares for her students and wants all of them to be successful nurses. Dr. V's lectures were very helpful and she has a real passion for nursing. She is very reassuring and very understanding. I would 100% recommend Dr. V.
hard to understand what we were learning. i honestly couldnt even tell you what culture means in depth. he was a really nice guy though, not too bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Edwards is phenomenal. She genuinely cares for her students and understands and respects our mental and physical health (regarding absences especially). She gives clear feedback and is very accessible. Her readings for class are heavy BUT are honestly so informational and interesting. She models her class around mini-lectures and we talk!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: John is very chill. If you have a good attitude and put in the work, you will do well in the class. He also curved a few of the test grades.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Subjective grading without an adequate rationale for points deducted. Unclear guidance. Even after a zoom call to understand expectations, still unclear. Expects students to be completely proficient in epidemiology ( that is her background ). I'd drop a class before taking her again.

There are so many nitpicky details of which failure to follow will result in loss of points in this class, it is absolutely insane. the syllabus is literally 26 pages. Every 2 days, we have a test, and if you fall behind at all, it is so hard to catch up. A class should take into account that every student has other classes, which this doesnt.

Ms. Zhang is nice and always ready to help whenever needed. She replies to emails really fast and gives good feedback on your work. She also gives extra credit on every essay if you go to the University Writing Center.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Best 1350 Teacher.
Michael "GOAT" Wright.

Mr. Bowman often goes into tangents about his personal life. This includes anecdotes about his family and religious beliefs. None of this was relevant to the course material, which was environmental science. He also made flippant and disparaging remarks about his wife's Church Music major, which some students found offensive.
The class is fairly easy, however, her teaching is really just having us do the workbook for homework and then going over it in class afterward.
Professor A. is a fantastic professor. He truly is the kindest professor I've had at Baylor. He really cares about and trusts his students. He is an easy grader and very knowledgeable. Take him!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Her class is really easy, doing the assignments is going to be the hardest part of the class. For her essay's your writing style shouldn't be a problem as long as you answer the main point of the questions. Her essays are really just short response questions put into one page which I really like b/c it means it'll only take about an hour to write.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things
